title: Underground
summary: Six individuals from all around the globe, each the very best at what they do, have been chosen not only for their skill, but for a unique desire to delete their pasts to change the future.

reviews.review_title: The most Micheal Bay movie Micheal Bay ever Micheal Bayed
reviews.content: The title is just a quote from Ryan :D The movie is a chaos. And i mean in a good way. I think platforms like Netflix and so on is just a place for people like Micheal Bay so they can go do their thing so freely. There is so many to talk about actually. The great crazy action opening sequence right away, really weird song choices including the internet meme one(RUN) and so on... I liked the way the mood changes and kinda turns into a political fight. Also, the good about it is that it's not a stupid American provocative movie. Not the best time i had but definetely it was different and fun.

The film is just endless attention deficit scenes which jumps like crazy. There is no coherence or story development. I honestly don't know what I really watched. The visuals are good, and the film is obviously big budgeted. However, these don't make a good film.

reviews.review_title: This isn't Scorsese or Mann.... It's Bay! Just have fun.
reviews.content: These reviewers who watch a Michael Bay movie and review it as if they were expecting Shakespeare need to stop reviewing. Seriously. The only reason to watch his flicks are so you can leave your brain at the door, turn off the lights, turn up the surround sound to 100 and sit back and watch $hit blow up. You want a thinking person's movie? Go see something else. You want your brain mushed then watch this! Was awesome, funny, action filled, fast cars, explosions, I was blowing bubbles out of my ears. Such fun.

reviews.review_title: Awful and Messy Screenplay and Edition
reviews.content: A wealthy CEO fakes his death and uses his fortune to create a group of nameless ghost vigilantes, to become the One (Ryan Reynolds) and bring justice to the world. He recruits the spy Two (Mélanie Laurent); the hitman Three (Manuel Garcia-Rulfo); the thief Four (Ben Hardy); the doctor Five (Adria Arjona); and the pilot Six (Dave Franco) to compose his organization. When Six dies in a car accident in a mission in Europe, he invites the soldier Seven (Corey Hawkins) to join his team. Now One decides to promote a coup d'é·tat to overthrow the dictator Rovach Alimov (Lior Raz) and let his imprisoned brother Murat Alimov (Payman Maadi) assume the government of his country."6 Underground" is an action film directed by Michael Bay with a great cast with names such as Ryan Reynolds and Mélanie Laurent. The story is promising for fans of the genre but the awful and messy screenplay and associated to a terrible edition destroy the film. My vote is five.Title (Brazil): "Esquadrão 6" ("6 Squad")

reviews.review_title: Loud Noises, Bright Colors & Explosions: The Movie
reviews.content: This is a typical modern Michael Bay film, it's all style over substance. Leave your brain at the door and you might enjoy it, I wish I did but I didn't.I'll give you a quick example of what to expect while trying to explain why I couldn't bring myself to enjoy this film. Opening scene is a 15 minute car chase through a city. Firstly, the vehicle they choose to use as a getaway vehicle is a bright neon green Alfa Romeo that sticks out in the crowd like a sore thumb driving a bright neon green sports car would. Why would anyone choose this as a getaway vehicle instead of a car with a paint job a bit more inconspicuous I hear you ask? Because it's a Michael Bay film that's why, and it's all about style remember? Secondly, every car and bike that crashes during the chase produces enough sparks and fire to rival the opening ceremony of the Beijing Olympics, plus the sounds they make when they crash are the most ridiculous Transformers sounding noises I have ever heard outside of a Transformers movie. And lastly, the bright neon green sports car gets scratched up by another vehicle and the drivers side mirror gets knocked off, but the next shot it's back on again, then it's off, then it's on, and it switches between broken and not broken a dozen or so times before someone decided that for continuity sake we better just stick to one or the other and thankfully they chose to go with the broken one. Pretty sloppy filmmaking really, and this is all in the opening 15 - 20 minutes, and unfortunately I can't turn my brain off enough to enjoy a film like that.Other things that I didn't like about the film, the overall story is laughable and makes absolutely no sense at all, and when I say no sense I'm not being hyperbolic I mean it makes no sense, from the people he chooses to join his team to the way he recruits them to the missions they do it's all so ludicrous, if you allow yourself to question its logic for even one second then the entire thing falls apart. It's got your typical Michael Bay hit or miss humor along with other "Bayerisms" that we've come to expect from him, like the over use of quick cuts during action sequences, low angle shots of women in short skirts, so much slow motion that if the slow motion parts were at normal speed I reckon the film would be about half an hour shorter than it is, and scenes that are meant to be emotional and pull on your heart strings but because every character has no depth to them they end up having about as much emotional impact as a carpet cleaning commercial does.What I did like. CGI people getting hit by cars and caught in explosions and thrown around and stuff, it was completely overused but the first few times it happened it looked quite good, especially people getting side swiped by vehicles. Some of the bad guy kills were well done. I enjoyed most of the banter between Ryan Reynolds and the non Ryan Reynolds actors, it was funny and was just Ryan Reynolds being your typical Ryan Reynolds which is good if you like Ryan Reynolds and I like Ryan Reynolds. Who doesn't like Ryan Reynolds? Hugh Jackman that's who, the Canadian fraud.It really is just a film full of loud noises, bright colors, explosions and little of anything else.

It's a good mix of action and comedy.
the first 15 minutes will blow your mind - special effects like no other

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay on Steroids and HGH!!!
reviews.content: I'm not a huge bay guy, but this is him, unleashed. I'm sure Netflix just said do what ever you want we trust u. And u know what it's a really great ACTION movie. I like action movies that are really action movies. No holds barred.People that review this and want something more philosophical or with deeper meaning, go watch marriage story. Netflix is providing all types of content and I love it. Keep it coming. Hope there's a sequel! 9/10

I don't mind a brainless action flick occasionally, provided its well done. 6 Underground can generously be described as " a tossed salad of awfulness".From its inept visceral messiness, its unfunny black humour and its obsessive compulsive fixation with time jump cut scenes and acrobatic vehicle crashes, this thing just sucks. Not to mention its obnoxious, provokingly loud, sound track which grates on the nerves.Oh and add in yet more attempts to make immoral organisations, like the CIA, out to be the good guys and the result is the pile of unwatchable, intelligence insulting tripe, this thing represents.Is there any upside? If you sift through the general haze of awful there is a lot of well choreographed action scenes but for me, that's about it.2/10.

Michael Bay Deluxe, the BOOM, the POW and Ryan Reynolds. It's just about what I was expecting - mindless action, shallow story, (mostly) bland comedy, cliché characters & Reynolds doing his usual shtick. The explosions, gunfights and chases are a little less awesome on the streaming screen, but still deliver the manly blockbuster entertainment we came for in the first place.The generic nature of the trailers, all of them, lowered the expectations to levels that ultimately helped enjoy the actual movie more. Naturally, the most valued card in the deck of "6 Underground" is the action - it has it all, from gunfights, to explosions, to flying, diving, car chases, parkour and so on. Great stunt work, expensive and well done cgi - no doubt about these things. What helped all that even more was a pretty generous splash of blood and gore. Could've pushed out even more, given the R rating. You can probably guess that it is by no means a realistic action movie, and you're right. That, and also, while the action is consistent, the impact and enjoyment of it is not - therefore pacing stutters, at times. The story is familiar and quite generic, depthless and Hollywood-in-a-nutshell by all standards. Nothing much more to add, the good guys battle and take down the evil guy, the usual. Our team of heroes consist of cliché characters, portrayed by decent actors having to do only either stunts or humorous dialogue. Ryan Reynolds portrays a more watered down version of all his latest roles conjoined & the comedy in "6 Underground" is hit & miss, mostly just bland and uninspired. I imagine there'll be complaints about the cinematography - it can be head-spinning and some of the cuts are questionable, but as a sum it's more than alright, not the biggest of flaws.It is rather sad that I was expecting so little (I mean, slightly above average) and that it's exactly what I got. I believe that, even with all the bad etched-in-stone reputation, mr. Michael Bay can do better than this, has done better than this. That being said, "6 Underground" is by no means a 'bad' movie, it's your typical, loud, shiny action-packed blockbuster, with a good cast and big enough budget for you to get some kicks out of it. My rating: 6/10.

Has Michael Bay won an Academy award? No. Will he win an Academy Award? No. Is his movies pointless fun? Yes. That's the beauty of a Michael Bay movie, you know what you're getting and this was no exception, was it flawless? No. Was it 2 hours of fun? Hell Yes. So again if you want to see a near flawless movie, go watch Joker, if you want to watch a pure action adrenaline movie, this is the one.

So you have had a long tough week at work.
It's Friday, and you want to escape your work life.
You open a bottle of wine, pour a glass and put a movie on.
You have escaped the dire reality of 9-5.
This film is a perfect release, it has action, it has Ryan Reynolds based humour. It will never be an Oscar nominee for best picture, but hey, it's Friday night, you have a glass of wine in your hand and you want to release the week.
At times it felt like a film
By numbers but nowadays it is extremely rare not too.
So please, enjoy the film for what it is. It's action. It's fun. It's Friday night so enjoy.

Over two hours of fast action packed coordination, chaos, laughs and loved every moment of it.
Just sit back and enjoy the ride...as this is what entertainment is all about.
Over and out!

reviews.review_title: What's up with all the angry reviews?
reviews.content:
It's an action movie with action stuff in it its not a deep movie or a complicated one just watch it when you want to chill in the couch and don't want to focus that much.
I hope they do a second one because sometimes movies like this can be great

reviews.review_title: Disjointed n incoherent back n forth cuts, shaky cam, flickering lights, abysmal editing n screenplay, far fetched parkour n lack of hand to hand combat.
reviews.content:
The film starts with a nice picturesque settings, very soothing cinematography but then suddenly it turns into a mindless car chase,
of course with lots of bloody carnage n mayhem. The parkour scenes looked too far fetched n done in a very badly shaky cam stuff.
It has some bloody shootouts n awesome scenes of car getting sliced but the film got tedious after some time.
I had always liked Mélanie Laurent ( her topless scene in Enemy n her distinctive nose).
Had expectations with the film but Michael Bay has lost it.It has some good locations, hottie Laurent, bloody shootouts n a very gory flashbang head exploding scene.
Crowd chasing a running Murat (the dictator) n then suddenly Murat getting hit on his bald head n the sound of tock is hilarious.

Ignore the negative haters on here. I'm not a huge action guy, but I found this one quite enjoyable. Good combo of crazy action scenes, comedy and some good acting. I actually think it could have been a bit longer at the end, but overall a very enjoyable movie with great car chases and grandios action sequences that impressed me. 8/10! Enjoy!.... Also a cool message. :)

reviews.review_title: This should be buried deep underground
reviews.content: Michael Bay's 6 Underground has every single crash, bang and wallop any desensitised moviegoer could possibly ask for. Everything about this film is a vicious assault on the senses akin to the D-Day invasion of Normandy. I swear that every noise of the universe is in this 'movie'.An expensive advert for Alfa Romeo, 6 Underground is barely a movie; despite a strong opening sequence, the film is completely riddled with all the typical trademarks of a classically trashy Michael Bay picture, complete with gratuitous violence, loud explosions, choppy editing, disastrous dialogue and a threadbare story.Before you say anything, I know exactly what I expect of Bay and his brainless movies. His projects are not hard to enjoy if you leave your brain at the door before watching. However, there was something so off about this, something so deeply vulgar and crass, that I just couldn't enjoy it even when I did switch off.I can only just about bring myself to give 6 Underground a maximum of two stars for the flashy cars and the normally dependable Ryan Reynolds and Melanie Laurent. But it's still a deeply unpleasant experience with all the subtlety of a magnitude 9 earthquake; for that reason and the other reasons above, this film should be buried deep underground for all eternity.

Awesome car chase opening an all around good movie .
Nothing bad to say about this .
Remember this is a Netflix film .

reviews.review_title: Could have been so much more
reviews.content: "Cliches and poor editing" would be my brief summary. There's some great action pieces but then it's followed up by lots of quick shots from different angles that are of no use, or a slow motion sequence that is out of place. It's like the movie was made by AI, with a heap of tropes fed into a computer and this is what spits out. You could give it to a film school class and say "what would you fix and how?" and it would keep them busy for the whole semester, but I reckon they could come up with a great product by the end. Unfortunately, this is the 'before' photo.

reviews.review_title: Stupid.. Unfunny.. slowmotion.. Product placement extravaganza
reviews.content:
Why?
Some guys sat around af table..
"Let put all the stuff that needs to be in an action scene,.. in every scene!"
"What do we need?"
"Cars!, Guns!, helicopters!, Slowmotion!, Parkour for No reason!, Hot women!, Shaky cams!, stupid one liners!,Motorcycles!, Explosions!,..."
"And let's pay for it with a lot of product placement!"

6 UNDERGROUND is the latest from Hollywood blockbuster director Michael Bay, here working in collaboration with Netflix for the first time. You know, I thought Bay had matured since his BAD BOYS 2 days, what with producing quality fare such as the excellent BLACK SAILS. It seems not. This is a hark back to the TRANSFORMERS days of old, i.e. endless big-scale action sequences and not a lot else. The film suffers from having myriad annoying characters, all competing to be witty and edgy, led by Ryan Reynolds basically playing Deadpool without the costume. I could do without them. The action is typically overblown and bombastic, chock-full of explosions and mayhem, and I did appreciate the gratuitous violence throughout, although some of the FX are a little off. It's a lightweight and instantly forgettable movie but it does keep your attention throughout, so the definition of a popcorn flick.

It is not going to win awards! Bay makes things go boom and guns go bang. This movie is fun. Zero thinking power needed...and in my life...I appreciate zero thinking power moments when I can get them. Enjoy for what it is
Dear Netflix: All I want for Christmas is to cancel my subscription knowing you spent $150 million on one of the dumbest movies ever. I gave it a 3 for it's occasional dry humor

After Michael Bay's 13 Hours, I was hoping this would be another film of his that would be done well, yet instead, the film is riddled with annoying scene cuts that seem out of place and irrelevant, it feels like it's all over the place.
I can imagine alot of the positive reviews are strong fandoms for Ryan Reynolds but honestly, it was hard to watch. I get it, it's Michael Bay's typical car chase and car explosions, but I was hoping the story would at least have a coherent flow despite his attempted take on a form of Fast and Furious-esque film.

I haven't seen much of hollywood, so I think this movie is the full intense action movie that has qualitative action scenes non-stop right from the beginning. It is a joy ride of 2 Hours action. With that said, the performances of each of the 7 folks is outstanding. Each of them as unique skills that they are very good at. It has good comedy here and there, that would give you a breather from the non-stop action. Ryan Reynold's acting is a special mention. He leads the team right from the front.Few romantic scenes are very special. Wow, special effects man. Lot of good quality work is done for the special effects and the racing/dare devil scenes as if it looked real. No compromise in any scene for the budget.Highest quality movie I have ever seen.
Thought it was a good action movie. Fast action, like able dialogue and stylish cinematic. Not sure why there are so many low scores. Just turn off your brain and enjoy the ride.

Directed by Michael Bay. Starring Ryan Reynolds, Mélanie Laurent, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo, Corey Hawkins, Ben Hardy, Adria Arjona, Lior Raz, Payman Maadi, Dave Franco, Elena Rosconi. (R)Headache-inducing series of flashy, hyperactive action scenes in search of a compelling plot to reasonably tie them together (and a purpose to exist in the first place). Reynolds is a billionaire who decides to disappear off the grid and assemble a squad of fellow ghosts with special talents to take down unimaginatively evil dictator Raz. The team is a collective of snide ciphers, with flashback "origin stories" providing no depth or personality--they bicker, gripe, crack wise, shoot, run, drive, look good doing it, and that's about it. Opens with a visually chaotic car chase that has no sense of place, orientation or rhythm, and lasts way too long...yet still emerges as arguably the highlight of the movie (that, or the use of magnets during the climax). Like most Bay flicks, it's full of individual shots that would look great in coffee table books or wall calendars, but when it comes to basic techniques of motion, momentum, escalation and spatial relationship, utterly hopeless (plus, the editing is spastically choppy enough to make a Michelin star chef jealous). If there's a reference to the Sneaker Pimps, it got lost under all the explosions.28/100

Does the name Michael Bay tell you something? Do you feel like you know the movies he does and do you like them? If you answer yes to both, congratulations. To be honest more often than not I'm not down with movies that really do not give you much in the department of character development. But this is Bay and the action is terrific.My home entertainment system had a run for its money! The visuals were stunning too (as usual with Bay) and you had more one liners than actual text (might not be entirely correct on that, but it sure feels like it). So a lot bang for your buck and no substance. Does that sound like a movie that will entertain you, without you having to think too much? Then go ahead and enjoy. Do not snob the people who do though, the casting makes up for some of the flaws at least ...

reviews.review_title: WARNING: DO NOT LISTEN TO THE HATE, This film is great and has some of the best action sequences I've ever seen.
reviews.content: To say this film is super fast funny and witty from start to finish would be an understatement. What's so impressive about this film is that after watching 100 fast and furious films and carbon copys "6 UNDERGROUND" raises the bar to an entirely higher level. The camera angles combined with a radiant spectrum of colors that flash through each scene not only at times puts you directly in the driver's seat but the excitement of it all is incredibly enjoyable to watch. (Ryan Reynolds) leads this all star cast and plays his usual type of character, The adventurous, funny, slightly frightened but extremely likable guy, only this time he's a billionaire who leads a 5 persons elite secret team on a vendetta to right all the wrongs in the world. Expect to see Michael Bay make many more sequels under this franchise while it builds a cult following. If all the over the top hollywood action films could produce this quality there wouldn't be a lot to complain about.

reviews.review_title: stunning effects like we are used from Bay
reviews.content:
Came across the trailer on Netflix they stated this one is for you. Ryan Reynolds I could dig so i gave it a try. Starting it i didn't knew it was Michael Bay behind the wheel of this flick full of stunning effects.First 20 minutes it's nothing else than a giant pursuit in Florence. Unbelievable what we do see over there. Once the chase is over we move towards an action flick, again, typical Ryan with the stupid jokes and the typical action.Even as it clocked in over 2 hours i found it worth seeing. It got all elements, action, jokes, and even a bit gore here and there. You will love it i'm sure, and even the acting was above mediocre for such kind of flicks.Oh yeah, and the score....loved it.Gore 1/5
Nudity 0/5
Effects 5/5
Story 3/5
Comedy 0,5/5
Best movie i watched this year, yes everything blows up and yes its full of action but what do you expect from an action movie? I loved it and i do hope it will have a sequel

Not sure how a movie with so many actions scenes can be so boring...
Just a noisy, busy pointless mess with no real plot.

reviews.review_title: We're gonna kill the really bad guys!! Proceeds to kill hundreds of innocents in the crossfire. Not caring for any innocent lives as long as they get to kill one bad guy.
reviews.content: Now, I am quite able to leave my brain at the door and enjoy a daft action movie provided the one central premise of the film makes Sense. Meaning that with this particular Mess of a Film, the entire purpose of the protagonists e.g killing the really bad guys, HAS to be consistent. But when they then proceed to inadvertently kill dozens of innocents in the opening scene alone, no amount of switching off your brain can compensate for the absolute lack of any logic or story. And that's the whole point of this film. It's for people who truly don't need any sense of logic or a barely coherent plot to enjoy a film . Just plenty of action scenes, car chases, explosions, bad guys, naked hot women etc.. thrown together to form a collection of Micheal Bays wet daydreams. I won't attempt to further analyse or criticise this movie, as that would be without merit. If you're one of the aforementioned people, then you'll probably enjoy it. However if you need some semblance of logic or coherent storytelling, you'll have to try very hard to enjoy this film.

reviews.review_title: By looking IMDB scores surely director has a lot of friends
reviews.content: Just don't waste your time with this trash. Top 10 worst movies ever made. It is like usual American ethical nonsense with killing hundreds of innocents in the crossfire. but not caring for any innocent lives as long as they get to kill one bad guy. But the only bad guys are themselves as usual and pretending to be a God. They are the modern times pharaoh. Sadly they want to brainwash who ever they can by producing this trashes. Motto of it, if you are working for the worst guys, you can do it anything and you can get away with it.

Already 10mins in i had a hunch this movie would be style over substance and after i watched it till the end i was asured of it. dont get me wrong, this movie has the typical stylish michaelbay cinematography, visually very pleasing to the eye but story/plot-wise its just boring and i had to force myself to watch it till the end. i like ryan reynolds but plastering the same "comedic role" he always plays into all his movies didnt save this one. the action-sequenes are great but if you watch action-movies frequently you know its just recyled stuff all over again that you have already seen in previous films. bottom line: great actors & great cinematography wont cut it anymore if your storytelling is just bad, even transformers was more enjoyable. ;-)

OK, switch brain off, get popcorn and enjoy the ride. No, it's never going to win an oscar but if you want a fast paced action thriller which is very funny in parts then this is right up your street. I don't care if it's all CGI, it's impressive and entertaining. That first fifteen minutes will leave you breathless, every cliche in the book, but did I care? not a jot. Hokum at it's best. If this is your thing, you won't be disappointed, Loud, proud and colourful.

I don't know why this movie is having so low ratings, I know it's not perfect but it's entertaining and the visual effects are amazing. Ryan Reynolds comes back to give us a good movie with a lot of action and laughs. What shines in this movie are the effects and the use of color in the movie. Are perfect. The directing is meh but is Michael Bay. Melanie Laurent and Adria Arjona are amazing. Reynolds is a beast and amazing in this movie.I recommend this movie and is worth to watch a friday night.
Classic example Of how cash is burnt by big directors and how netflix is fooled

reviews.review_title: great action but what about the rest
reviews.content: A team of six ghosts are battling to change a dictatorship. One (Ryan Reynolds) is the billionaire. Two (Mélanie Laurent) is the CIA spook. Three (Manuel Garcia-Rulfo) is the Hitman. Four (Ben Hardy) is the Skywalker. Five (Adria Arjona) is the Doctor. Six (Dave Franco) is the Driver. During a car chase in Florence, Six is killed. One recruits American sniper Blaine (Corey Hawkins) as Seven.Michael Bay is doing Michael Bay. The story telling is messy and thin. There are problems with the simplistic premise. The action is explosive and hyper kinetic. The idiotic Bay humor is improved by the presence of Ryan Reynolds. It is too bad that Dave Franco dies so early since he is the second funniest actor in the cast. Ryan needs someone better to bounce off his quippy sarcasm. The best aspect is the great Michael Bay action. Even if the magnet idea makes little sense, it is still great action fun. The parkour is thrilling. This is a movie of great big action set pieces in between a lifeless unearned story with paper thin characters.It starts with the chase in Florence. It is wildly exciting and explosive but the plot has the most muddled introduction. For a second, I actually thought that they were literal ghosts. At the very least, One has to be introduced and the mission needs to be laid out. With such a paper thin intro, the action becomes meaningless. It's a bunch of quippy retorts from Ryan and some really cool car stunts in the narrow Italian streets. There's real value in that but it's just empty calories. This is a movie of empty calories. The mission itself is a nothing burger of simplistic politics. Why not have the dictator kill Ryan Reynolds' great love? Instead, it's a non-descript humanity project. As for the final shootout, it seems much more simpler to plant a few mines on the boat to drive the dictator off it. One thing is certain. Michael Bay does his action well. The rest is a nothing burger.
Blockbuster Cinema Quality from Netflix. It ain't perfect, but it delivers. Some of the best action scenes since Bourne and FF franchises. I only wish my home screen and sound quality were better!

I agree with people saying we shouldn't expect Shakespearean stories with a Michael Bay movie and I wasn't. But I was expecting a good action movie like he made some. But it's not the case for 6 Underground. It's just not a good movie. There is tons of action in 6 Underground and still I got so bored. It's the kind of action I'm just not a big fan of, the kind of action where imminent death is lurking but they still find the time to have a little chat and joke around, bad jokes then. That's just dumb action for a fifteen year old audience. Add on that an average story and Ryan Reynolds and this is the result, a mediocre action movie that's lasting way too long. Ryan Reynolds was good as Deadpool, for the rest I'm not a big fan of him, and probably never will be. The only happy moment I had with 6 Underground is when I saw the end credits, finally...

reviews.review_title: Just enjoy it for what it is
reviews.content: Ok, if this was released in theaters I'd be more critical of it to be honest, but I'm grading it on a curve, given all the terrible movies I've seen on Netflix. Is it a cinematic masterpiece? Not even close, it's basically what you'd expect from a Micheal Bay film, nonstop almost if not definitely over the top action. To be honest the first 10 minutes feel like just too much action, to the point you wonder if there is even a script? But if you just watch it for what it is and if you're a fan of car chases, explosions , shoot outs and just action , then as far as Netflix movies go you might enjoy it. So while I would normally give it maybe a 6, I'll give it a 9 compared to all the movies I regret watching from Netflix.

reviews.review_title: An action movie for popcorn lovers. This thing is nonstop.
reviews.content: Yeah, it's a Michael Bay movie but it even goes beyond him, you would think. This thing doesn't stop. Yeah, over the top blah blah blah but you want to watch it to see where it goes. It's a movie you watch when you just want to watch a movie and not think a lot. Action personified. It goes beyond normal action. It is really ugly, blood and guts stuff. Really glitzy, really a lot of money poured into production. High end look, locations, everybody looks great. Ryan is as you'd expect him. Stupid crazy editing and set pieces. Current soundtrack with tracks from the charts. I suspect a sequal

reviews.review_title: Can't really be classified as a movie
reviews.content:
There's got to be some standards for calling a bunch of moving pictures a movie. This jumbled mess of flashy explosions in slow motion is as far away from what you'd expect out of a movie as I've ever seen.
It's simply painful to watch. Other than a medical test for epilepsy, I can't imagine what possible use it could have.
Action up the ying-Yang!! Don't explain coherent story. Lots of superb action sequences. Turn your brain off and enjoy. It's a Michael Bay film. Don't expect to watch "The Lighthouse".

I shouldn't be giving this 8 stars. But what surprised me are all the funny and creative things Bay decided to do here, like when they fumble with an eyeorgan during a car chase, using "the world's strongest magnet" in another action setpiece and doing parkour scenes on top of an unfinished skyscraper.'6 Underground' is a tour-de-force of over the top R-rated action setpieces, and Michael Bay uses the whole world as his playground.After so many dead serious movies made this year, how nice it was to just sit back, turn the brain off, and enjoy the show.

I wade through so many awful movies that it is great when I find a good one.
As with most Bay movies, the story is nothing spectacular, however the cast obviously got along very well and it shows in the movie, with them convincingly playing well off each other.The action is awesome, taking the John Wick style of action to the next level with extremely graphic violence, and the comedy element was such that I found myself grinning through most of the movie.Kudos to the writers for although not having a very deep script, wrote the character interactions so well that you don't think too hard on the plot itself.Recommended for those who love graphic action and need a good laugh.
Ryan Reynolds at his finest. lots of quipping and great action scenes. great movie to watch. typical michael bay movie, lots of action sets and slow motion. 100% recommend.

Only Michael Bay can do a OTT comedy version of Mission Impossible.
Ryan Reynolds is the best comedy action actor around at the moment, he takes his band of dead specialists to depose a despot.
The effects in this film are something to marvel at, it whizzes along at a breaknecking pace. I'll say one thing Mission Impossible was never this violent or funny, the body count is very high and so are the one liners.
Overall the it's a very entertaining 2 hours, blink and you will miss something.

Relax your mind, rest your opinions and let Michael Bay take you for a ride with this Action Porn extravaganza , a LIVE action 2 hour video game type film featuring Ryan Reynolds doing what he does best, this is mission impossible on steroids plain simple and I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT! a good weekend flick ,go watch this and have some fun action lovers.

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay's best since The Rock
reviews.content:
Allow the row to take you along; fitting, because of the acrobatics and -
Repeat as mantra
\
Say this, so that Ryan Reynolds doesn't get Rammed

Made it 47 minutes in to this disjointed explosion fest. Don't get me wrong, I love a good Wow! and Pow! But at 47 minutes in I was still waiting for some coherency. Shot well? Maybe? Yes? Okay, yes. And I love Ryan! I was so looking forward to this. The idea underneath it all sounded cool and fun. But as a movie realized? As a story one is supposed to follow, get caught up in, and to begin to care for the characters? It just didn't work, sadly. Ryan's been on a winning streak and I continue to cheer him on. But this choppy mess was a mistake. From a fan and someone who went in open minded and ready to enjoy.

This film is truly awful. When I saw this was directed by Michael Bay as the credits rolled, I laughed. Awful music, tons of innocent death, firework explosions everywhere, and its trolling. I absolutely would not recommend this film.

1 more star because of Ryan Reynolds ... the only person that brings something in this ... student project ...
Also the only character who has most lines that really mean something.
The introduction is SOOOOOOO annoying ! Every character is meaningless, unfunny, and even ... annoying (that word again!!).
THE MOST ANNOYING (and sometimes infuriating) THING is the EDITING !!!!!!
I have never seen a movie so expensive having such an editing worth of a beginner ... Saying it is a Michael Bay movie doesn't excuse everything ...
(for info i didn't see it was a MB movie until the end ... i just saw "Action" movie, "Ryan Reynolds" ... ok! donwload! ... The advantage when watching with the computer, you can jump scenes and fast forward !! :D :D I would never pay for a MB movie !!!)

reviews.review_title: Glad I didn't go see this in the theater!
reviews.content: I haven't watched more than 20 minutes and it's clear there is no time for bathroom breaks or getting popcorn. This rating is not one I would give to any mainstream movies, just Netflix, because they offer their own stuff and some of it stinks, but a fair amount is decent. Once in a while a flick like this comes along that you can't walk away from, which is why I gave it the 10 rating. Were this produced by any other company I would have compared it to the entire history of cinema and waited for the ending. However I have yet to see something this action packed and littered with crazy graphics from Netflix. It tops any movie Netflix has done thus far.
Ignore those bad reviews when you like action movies. This one is just perfect.

This a fun movie with a fantastic carchase better than what you find in fast n furious movies.... there was only one problem and that is the camera guy... whats with the shaky camera? many scenes are ruined by shaky camera....

I thought I knew what I was getting into when I started this. Bay's movies involve non stop action, lots of explosions and lots of money spent in the production. I wasn't crazy about it, but it was absolutely tolerable. Not a 10 and not a 1. It was entertaining and kept me involved trying to figure it out. But, the redeeming factor for this movie is it kept me involved, and the pyrotechnics which are a staple of Bay films used the full capacity of my BOSE 3000 soundbar, sub woofer and surround speakers, much like "The Rock." Time to watch that again.

reviews.review_title: I am one, but not done.
reviews.content: Come on it's Ryan Reynolds, this is some fun stuff. Love the action and the silly comedy. What more do you want for entertainment? I think young kids should sit this one out, but that's just me.Beautiful cinematic scenes, gorgeous scenery from around the world. The beginning car chase is great, just what you want in an action film. Fast colorful cars, great funny commentary from Reynolds. It just works and I will watch it again just because it was entertaining.As a team, we can do some s^&t. I am one, but not done. Very well put.

reviews.review_title: Gun shots and wise cracks are not a story
reviews.content: Incredible waste of talent and action. There's no story at all. Zero. I kept hoping for one to appear but there isn't one. Ryan Reynolds is completely wasted here. The only character with any potential is Laurent's character. All of the metacritic reviews should be red. Anyone giving this a green or a yellow review needs to watch it again...if you even can! After 30 minutes I stopped watching. Good grief.

Everything your eye holes need. And everything your ear holes want.Gets your blood pumping, but in a good way.You should definitely watch and love this
Yours
Ryan

If you were looking for a movie with a deep story and incredible acting look elsewhere, but if you wanted a movie with way too much action and cheesy 80's lines then this is your film.Not a classic, but a fun film and the kind Netflix should be making.

Really bad movie - full of mistakes that makes it impossible to watch.First 10m a Green car that is destroyed several times and seconds later all fixed again... all in the same car pursuit. The driver with a hat that appears and disappears ...Its magic...
How hard is to make a movie without stupid mistakes and have story. Now is all CGI and no story.The only good thing is the soundtrack. Therefore 1 star.
Just another Michael bay movie : explode & slow motion......a lot of them. Again and again.
Lots of action, feel good ending, what more could you want?Def better than most of the crap out there now.

Continious action, laughs, some stomach turning moments, not to shanby actors. But if you expect deep intellectual converstations watch The Machinist or
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. Ryan is funny and his usual self and I dig it. Just enjoy it or turn it off or walk out. Stop complaining 😉

reviews.review_title: Have people never seen a Bay movie!
reviews.content: It's a Michael Bay film so you should roughly know what to expect. Lots of action and a massive production. The story isn't that bad, just take it for what it is. Most Hollywood movies are farfetched. Considering it's a Netflix original I'd say well done.

reviews.review_title: The worst from a man who was always at his worst
reviews.content: If I were a movie studio executive who was handed the budget of this movie ($150 million), I would use the money to make a number of 5 to 10 million dollar movies helmed by directors and writers who showed me originality and creativity. I certainly wouldn't blow it on one movie, especially one that would be directed by someone (in this case, Michael Bay) who has repeatedly in the past made overblown and near incoherent movies. With this movie, Bay proves sadly that he's not only not slowing down, he is actually getting worse at his craft. The story in this movie makes almost no sense, from it's ultra high speed unfolding to the fact that many plot details seem missing. The characters are cold and not the least bit sympathetic, from their lack of depth to the fact that they inflict their sadism on everybody (including innocent bystanders). And the action sequences make pretty much no sense, from their rapid editing to their poor direction and choreography. In short, this movie is an over two hour long headache. Though sadly it will probably get a lot of looks from curious Netflix users, and Netflix will subsequently look at the ratings and greenlight a sequel. No thanks, Netflix.

Just a mess of a film. The editing was confusing and abrupt and the story was often incomprehensible. Filled with explosions, car chases and gross deaths, with an attempt to buy credit with scenes of the people affected by this tyrant. Ryan Reynolds was the only reason I watched this movie, and he was not enough to redeem it.

reviews.review_title: A masterpiece by drug addicts for drug addicts.
reviews.content: The editing is fubar, someone just glued together pieces of filmed material while being clueless about the plot. Worst scene: the whole "movie". Best scene: initial car chase... epic, just epic... truck breaks green car left side mirror... green car keeps going... left side mirror restored... wow, such a masterpiece!

Does it have a good story? Not really, the premise is almost original though.
Good characters? No, not really. Shallow, predictable.But the action, one-liners and eyecandy still make this a good two hours of solid entertainment! 7/10.

reviews.review_title: More style than substance but WHAT style!
reviews.content: Dialogue that could be from any X-Force project and little in the way of a story but whip-smart funnies and excellent action.Pure popcorn fun.

This movie has barely any narrative. It is short bursts of imagery, music, and dialogue strung together into a 2-plus hour running time. There is no there there, just a concept movie that Netflix - in its ongoing massive thirst for cinema-respectability - keeps throwing at directors: even directors like Michael Bay.

In probably the highest rated Michael Bay film I've reviewed AND recommended, I HATED how it was filmed.This seizure-inducing, McG-type film on steroids with more CGI than two Avenger movies felt like an entire 12-episode TV season of an A-Team knockoff on 10x to fit within 2-hours. Mercifully, it had humor.And yet, I liked it. Could I watch a sequel? Probably not. My sensory overload and headache need a little recovery.A specialty misfit team of numbered individuals are banded together by a smart-smart aleck billionaire to hunt evil when no government will, or can't, due to red tape. After about 3-4 episodes of the aforementioned fake TV series in the first 15 minutes, the plot kicks in of overturning a ruthless dictator and the team tries to work together with each other's strengths and weaknesses.Despite an annoying and maddening amount of CGI scenes so overlapping in the car chase opening, I was still intrigued enough to continue. Luckily, I didn't know this was Bay directing, or I might not have made it to the finish, but, regardless, I'm glad I did.Number One (Ryan Reynolds) was the plot's glue, grounding and absolute source of laugh-out-loud humor. Ben Hardy's ("Number Four") amazing parkour and looks helped me long. And the remaining Numbers, while bland as all Hades, did their parts to round out the team.Again, I'm not up for the inevitable sequel, but if they'll hire a competent director and slow it down a bit, I'd love to see where they take these characters. Otherwise, this was ONE and DONE 4 me.***Final thoughts: WARNING: Forget strobe lights; this entire movie was an epileptic seizure waiting to happen. If you're remotely sensitive or prone, AVOID this movie at all costs. Or watch it and sue Netflix. Cut me in, if you do. I could use even a fraction of the dough Netflix has.

I started watching this with the hope that my "man crush" Ryan Reynolds would be enough to overcome my disdain for every Michael Bay film that has ever been made, thought of being made and ever will be made. Oh how I was wrong. This movie is, for lack of a better word, a "curd". I got 10 minutes into it, 7 minutes of which I spent wishing one of the baddies would crash through the screen into my living room and shoot me in the face. The one credit that I will give Mr Bay, he is consistent. Would give zero stars of allowed.

reviews.review_title: TV movie, avoid unless SUPER bored
reviews.content: You'd think M. Bay and R. Reynolds would be a combo of awesomeness..... but sadly it was trash. M. Bay has a history of random editing in his movies, this was worse. R.R. may be the only thing that made it worth watching at all. Avoid if you have other things to watch. If you are super super board with no options enjoy and don't put to much thought into it

reviews.review_title: The reviews here do not reflect the movie - the movie was great
reviews.content: Just sit back watch and enjoy ( don't forget to up the sound ) . This is not the best movie you will see in your life but it's so much fun, i give it a solid 8 !

Plot? nope
Story line? nope
Character development? They tried. But it moved so slowly and sporadically that it just fell a part.
Seriously for as fast paced as this movie is... it's slow as paint drying. Even the opening chase, I was stuck waiting for it to end.

I enjoyed this. Action from the start. some humor but action non stop.
The chicks are good eye candy. All the actors handled their parts really good.

No, not me. I am staying in the good old US, but Michael Bay should really move to North Korea, because little Kim needs "feel good" propaganda movies like this one more than we do.What a junk.I really shouldn't be writing a review for it because I fast forwarded through most boring parts (god, there were so many of them) while played Candy Crash through the rest.I am stunned it got such a high metascore with critics. I also feel sad that after Green Lantern fiasco Ryan Reynolds would agree to shoot this schlock.

reviews.review_title: ill give a good 9 for this
reviews.content: Entertainment, because it is entertainment.why not give 10, well the narrative and story are not very well spoken, and the jumping back and forth between past and present are so abrubt and inconsistent, so i stay with my niner.but i praise the higher powers that guides the brainflixes up in michael bay et co.heads when making films( cause more will come) like this.its just overwhelming and far too much for a grumpy old unotasking man like me to hang on to, and made utterly for the younger generations that can actually do the magic art of multitasking, being able to take in light sound and motion as well as emotions( which by the way is a great lack in this feature), so i might as well admit that ive got to see this a couple more times to break it up in small pieces for me easier to swallow.but , and i really mean this, its an orgasm of speed and action,and multiorgasmic on the explotions, so to all of you with surround sound systems, boost the bass channel and enjoy
It makes no sense... It's hard to watch, don't bother. Top 10 worst movies ever made.

I understand some of the bad reviews, some scenes have too many quick cuts and closeups but I think "chaos" is what they were going for here. Overall it was a fun watch, I definitely wasn't bored from start to finish!

The high contrast colourful scenes, the constant movement of the camera, the weird unnecessary camera angles and the never-ever-stopping slow motion action LITERALLY made me sick. It's like staring at a needle tip while on a high speed race boat.Found myself dizzy and always chasing the characters themselves instead of their actions. This is for sure what a millennial's on booze night at the disco must feel like.Be aware: all cars and bullets magically explote like fireworks. I know it is purposely done as trademark but that and the stupid cliché lines do take all seriousness off the film.

6 Underground starts off fast paced and fun, like playing the video game "Burnout," but then quickly becomes generic "Mission Impossible" stuff.The plot's uninteresting, relying way too much of Ryan Reynolds' humour, Laurent ain't bad. Each with silly specialties, nicknames and numbers. By the end, I wanted it to end.

reviews.review_title: I hope their next mission be Iran!
reviews.content:
A great action movie with breathtaking sequences and Bayhem in ultimate mode!
Thank you dear Michael Bay!
Wow chillax people! This movie going to win any academy awards, but it was a lot of fun and very funny in an over the top cheesy kinda of way. Reynolds humor at its best.

reviews.review_title: Exaggerated, perhaps. Fun, always. Each Michael movie is a 90 'video clip.
reviews.content: Exaggerated, perhaps. Fun, always. Each Michael movie is a 90 'video clip. Visually perfect. Emotionally it can involve if you leave rationality for the duration of the vision. For the omega generation it is the best! For the previous ones it's rubbish. Why warm up (or cool down) so much and give negative judgments. Much will continue to be appreciated as blamed! Relax and enjoy the show, popcorn is free!
Great action sequence scenes.....great thriller with ryan taste on it.. Fun to watch...but editing of some part looked dragged....overall it was a nice movie

Here is the Michael Bay movie i have waited for, an action packed movie with alot of explosion, drama, and nerve racking moments, an absolute brilliant movie, i had so much fun watching it! The humour was brilliant and very fitting, the story was meh but if you are looking for a entertaining movie to watch i definitely recommend this one.

Michael Bay has outdone himself with a movie that makes bad action movies look good as long they have some semblance of a plot and this comes from someone who loves watching action films.6 Underground which has a good cast and a big budget ended up being a badly edited, unfunny movie filled with enough noisy action to induce a headache and it is a complete and utter mess. It has Ryan Reynolds basically being himself and acting as Number 1, a billionaire who upon faking his own death recruits a misfit team in order to topple an evil dictator of a made up country. What follows is a shaky, loud and explosions filled 2 hours in which all the bad guys are killed and scores of bystanders too. Collateral damage seems to be acceptable as long as it is for some good cause which in this case is toppling a dictator and replacing him with his good brother. The good brother is in fact so good that the first thing he does is deliver his evil brother to a refugee camp where the villain is beaten to death by the people he has oppressed.This movie might appeal to 12 year olds who will enjoy looking at the good looking women and mindless adrenaline inducing over the top action but if you actually want something with a plot that makes sense and is grounded even a little bit in reality watch something else.

Fun action packed movie.
Visual and effects were pretty good.
Plot and acting was meh.

I enjoyed it, people moaning about confusing cut scenes and the films a mess.
Its Ryan Reynolds chirping off his one liners during gun fights and car chases. You may think its Deadpool without the mask, but I like Deadpool, so this film was a winner.Watch it and don't be over critical, it really is a film you can watch, not overthink and just enjoy.

6 Underground is the perfect film to watch if you want to turn your brain off for a bit. Although this film has many problems ( as with most Michael Bay films ) and although he follows his clichés to a dime. This film is so much fun to watch. Unlike most of his films, this film has a shorter runtime which is a blessing because I don't need a three hour long version of this film. Also Ryan Reynolds is a show stealer since he has all the jokes and action scenes that you will need. The first thirty minutes of this film were by far both the best and funniest scene of the film. It has all the absurdity you would expect and gets you ready for what you are about to watch. Overall, this was a fun film, not really a good film. But nevertheless, this is a solid Michael Bay film and it delivered everything I wanted.

Pointless movie with a weird story, shallow characters. Just some random action based on an ill-described premise.Good actors wasted and audience time destroyed. Two stars are for the efforts of the cast. Idea, script & direction deserve zero.

I really don't like Michael Bay's movies that much but I enjoyed this one because its fast, funny and have a story.. Maybe not a strong story and it could be better but i liked it and the acting is good.
Watch it and you will have some fun time.
It's everything fun you'd expect from a thrill ride! Michael Bay kept the action at 10. Enjoy! I hope the dull reviews doesn't keep you from tuning in. They just don't get it.

A group of six agents had leave their past behind, they are dead for mankind to change the world for good. Now they are planning to make a coup d'état that's going to be a wild ride full of explosions, action and jokes.If you're expecting a wonderful movie with deep characters with deep motivations to make something to change the world, then you shouldn't watch this movie. Underground 6 is a film about action; it doesn't pretend to be something that is not. Ryan Reynolds is a clear proof that this movie is simple fun; his character is funny but really strategical. Every actor does a decent job with the role they were assigned.There are three long action scenes that make the movie worthy. One at the beginning, then in the middle and one in the end, these three scenes are really well directed when it comes to this kind of movies.It's not a perfect film because is fun but that's it. There's nothing at risk. I mean, yeah, you could say that if they don't succeed then the world must be an awful place, but it's just a movie. The villain seems to be a cartoon villain with his over the top evilness. The main characters are all based on one personality trait or two.One (Ryan Reynolds) is the American leader. Two (Mélanie Laurent) is the cold and smart French. Three (Manuel Garcia-Rulfo) is the emotional hitman Latino. Four (Ben Hardy) is the funny parkour man. Five (Adria Arjona) is the Mexican nurse. Six (Dave Franco) the frat boy who dies. Seven (Corey Hawkins) is the black military man who is not going to leave anyone behind. Yes, this is a very diverse cast and group, points for representation but these characters are not so deep like they may seem. I would say that the only and deep character is Three but sometimes it's a little bit a stereotype of the emotional man.My conclusion is that if you want to watch a movie just because you want to see action and explosions and not think too much. Underground 6 is perfect for you.

The opening chase sequence in Florence is something. Tune it for that. There are some nice locations like Abu Dhabi and more. That's all that is good. It's downhill after that.MI it's not by any means. The story should have been clearly set out. Don't like the way the premise took so long to come together. Also after that it's still fragmented. The action is boring.
You can throw money at a movie but it doesn't make it good.Ryan Reynolds plays his role comically. Don't know the rest of the cast except Mélanie who is welcome. Her English is still hard to understand.Still considering what a big blockbuster it is and available on Netflix, might as well watch it. But be prepared it's bad.
Michael Bay at his worst.

This is, in short, the worst thing that you will find on Netflix. And that's quite the feat, giving the embarrassly low standard of a Netflix production.This is, for bad or worse, what happens when Bay gets free creative rein of a production. It's just not packed with loads unlogical action sequenses, it's also packed to the brink with so many product placements that it's gets... awkward.Not even a tired Ryan Reynolds doing his typical Ryan Reynolds thing can save this.No, you better scip this one.

I dont unterstand how a movie like this can be released without the propper editing. Worst cuts i've seen in a big picture like this. So many flaws and eye capturing mistakes it makes me wonder if there was a person with an actual vision on set. The whole movie felt like Michael
Bay's daydreams... just one explosion after another packed with bad jokes and zero effort in Story telling. If you appreciate decent movies with decent story telling i'd wonder if you can sit through this waste of money...
They must have loved the hell out of this script to pump 150 mil Into it. A movie needs to get me hooked in its story 20 to 30 mins. 5o minutes in now. I can't make sense of. I'm about to turn off,

reviews.review_title: Great Action movie for a lazy sunday!
reviews.content: If you are looking for deep conversationes and great plots this is not your kind of movie. If you just want to lay back and enjoy great action scenes mixed with classic Ryan Reynolds comedy inputs, you will love it. Perfect for just laying back and enjoying Action a la Michael Bay!

reviews.review_title: How'd this even get a 6 star average?
reviews.content: Is there a story? I couldn't figure it out. Chaos, in a bad way, despite what another reviewer said. I only made it through 38 minutes, and I'm pretty easy to please.

It's so funny to see all the dumb millennials on here leaving comments about how insulted they were, this is not a political movie, it's an action movie...you know a work of fiction!!! Lighten up people. Stop being offended on behalf of others and concentrate on getting out of your mommy basement before you turn 40! I would say this movie was a solid 7 or 8 but giving it a 10 just to annoy the naysayers! Keep up the great work Netflix!
It needed a tighter storyline which was more engaging.

reviews.review_title: Action movie with no storyline foundation.
reviews.content: Writers can't imagine anymore. Rather they place films into films. A-Team, Expendables, Mission Impossible all rolled into one film (In one scene they were even quoting movie lines). Usually storylines have a build up, this movie starts off in high octane action and the build up happens in the middle, becoming boring in places resulting in clock watching. Some of the action scenes you see in the trailers are flashbacks of persons previous life before they became a Ghost, and not part of the story.Also there were 7 who became 6, who were not underground, but above ground?? Also, the editing is poor. One scene shows a car being hit by a truck and the wing mirror of the car is snapped off, two minutes later it's miraculously back on, intact. That is just one of many bad edits throughout.There is no storyline. They decide to pursue one man "to make the world a better place" and it's all action to get to him. There is no understanding on why the car chase at the beginning of the movie is taken place, other than a foiled robbery??The movie did have potential, but it is spoiled by the severe over the top profanity (the first 15 minutes there were more F bombs than a Gordon Ramsay full series), obscene sexual content (both in role playing and conversations) and stomach wrenching gore which if you don't have a good stomach, then avoid.Not something you'd want to watch with your Granny, or parents for that matter.The action encompasses the storyline. I really do not recommend this movie. Had the profanity been toned down by 95% and the unnecessary sex scenes deleted, then maybe, just maybe I'd give it a 5/6.

reviews.review_title: Hey, It's a Michael Bay film... whattaya expect?!!!
reviews.content: If you love constant action in the form of car chases, explosions, fight scenes, and slow motion gun shots to the head, you're going to LOVE this film!I was thoroughly entertained by this mindless drivel, and I'm totally serious. Ryan Reynolds plays Deadpool without the costume or the makeup, along with every other character he's ever played, and everyone else comes along for the ride.You will not fall asleep during this film! You will also not see it up for an Oscar. But that's just fine by me.

reviews.review_title: Silly and far-fetched but a lot of fun
reviews.content: Okay the plot will not win any Oscars, the villain is the epitome of one-dimensional and there is a generous helping of pure cheese in much of the dialogue. However, this is a Michael Bay film and what you do get is non-stop action and craziness with genuine moments of humour. Somewhere in there is an ethical message too, about wanting the world to be a better place. Which is nice.

reviews.review_title: Bad reviews are an example of spoilt millennials.
reviews.content: Predictable but massively entertaining with a new twist on action scenes which I loved.

reviews.review_title: A very intensive action a violent movie to watch
reviews.content:
Great Action , so intensive violence in the movie with a few comedy funny scenes.
if you're addicted to strong great action scenes with exciting escape scenes then this movie is your type.
if you're looking for a plot and complete story then this is not your movie, the plot has so many holes and contradicting logic but sometimes you just want to see great action with great music in the background and that's what you find here.
The movies dazzles you from the very first beginning from the very first scene that takes very long time around 20 minutes telling you what you're about to watch.I really enjoyed the movie and found it very exciting .

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the negative reviews and watch this film
reviews.content: You can't go wrong with a Ryan Reynolds movie, its full of action, a great storyline, scenery and of course the fellow cast members carry this action film. I have no idea why anyone would rate it low, I was on the edge of my seat the entire time! Thoroughly enjoyed it and recommend it! Anyone who dislikes it was probably old or just plain boring!
The opening 18 minutes of the film in Italy is awesome, it drop a wee bit after the to give you a breather, but it pick up the action again in Hong Kong good movie from mr bay and the cast.
I don't turn off many movies without finishing them. But this was a serious chore had to turn it off after half an hour.
Move is fast paced setting way for a new team of heros

reviews.review_title: To be honest it is good.
reviews.content: For being an action movie it is a good choice, the story is good and the message of movie for dictatorship countries is obvious.

reviews.review_title: Takes what die hard did and creates a new kind of action
reviews.content: From start to finish this film is action packed. And in true Michael bay form. It takes what die hard did in the 80s and give us a whole new kind of action movie. And the future looks great. Cast was supurb action was off the charts and the humor spot on. I want more and I want it now. And side not hands down best car chase I've ever seen

I just could not figure out the point of this movie... who are these people? Why would they choose to be a ghost? Lots of action scenes where obviously money did not matter, typical Michael Bay cinematography - but unfortunately the plot is confusing. On the plus side, finally new faces in blockbuster movies but with these assets it could have been a much better movie.
Action wise it was amazing. Absolutely amazing. If you don't like action, may I suggest the Hallmark channel!

reviews.review_title: Finally a proper good action movie!
reviews.content: What is with the bad reviews people?? This movie is freaking awesome. Tons of action, humour, meaning and great message!

Ryan Reynolds is becoming the new Nicolas Cage. He takes any role in any crappy movie, and he could care less. Reynolds does a ton of movies every year, and most of them are losers. This is one of the losers.Just a half-baked team movie, like the Dollar Store Avengers. It is not very entertaining, and it does not make a lot of sense.
The way they start the storyline with and the movie direction not attractive also the acting is badI didn't finish it even

reviews.review_title: So I guess some people were expecting an Oscar worthy flick.... LOL
reviews.content: I very rarely ever write reviews but after seeing the waves of negative reviews on this film I figured it was necessary since way more people than I would've imagined just don't get it...Most of the <5 star reviews clearly never even watched the trailer since 90% percent of them were expecting something other than blood, explosions, gore, girls and non stop action. This is a MICHAEL BAY film! The trailers practically slap you across the face with that fact, it's meant to be nothing more than a fun, mindless thrill ride... there's no deep, thought provoking plot, no masterfully crafted dialogue, no deep dive into it's characters or villains. It's action for the sake of pure 150 million dollar action!What ever happened to enjoying movies for what they were instead of always trying to get something out of them? If you go into this movie as some self indulged movie snob then yes, you will be absolutely devastated... however, if you're expecting nothing more than Michael Bay movie off the leash with some "ha has" from Ryan Reynolds then be prepared to have your socks rocked!!
I like the movie for the cinematography. The plot was overkill. The action was great. Stunts outstanding. Entertaining. Women stunning as you would expect.

reviews.review_title: Stupid heist movie cloning Fast and Furious
reviews.content: Billionaire but person unknown to the public puts together a "team" in order to make the world a better place. He does it by driving Ferraris and other top notch cars through somehow empty touristic Italian cities, destroying art, shooting people, playing with magnets, changing regimes in poor countries and so on. If he sounds like a complete douche it's because he acts like one. And the occasional internal dialogue makes it worse.And yeah, a lot of special effects (Michael Bay) a lot of funny profanity (Ryan Reynolds), but at every moment of this film I was seeing the heist episode from Rick and Morty and thinking how damn stupid it all is.

reviews.review_title: Suddenly Green Lantern doesn't look so bad for Ryan Reynolds.
reviews.content: I generally like Ryan Reynolds movies so thought this would be a good one to watch, it was a bit reminiscent of dead pool in parts only not as funny. I can usually switch off and just enjoy the action but this was hard work even with all the special effects, gory deaths and action it didn't quite get for me. I'm disappointed really as it had potential. I've not got to the end of it yet, if it improves I'll gladly come back and edit this review, but I doubt it will.

I watched this movie 15 times trying to find out why i like it so much. I mean it can't worth a 10, right? It has so many flaws. The editing is all over the place, continuity errors galore, the jokes are good but lack the Deadpool magic, it's not deep enough in character development since the action takes most of the time etc...
After the 15nth time though the realisation came simply like a lightbulb above my head.If you watch something 15 times, go through it from start to finish 15 whole times it's just good for you, you enjoyed it not matter the flaws or what others are saying. I'm not going to watched it a 16nth time to find out why, I'll watch it because it's was fun for 15 times and it will be fun for 1 more.The only sad part is that they are not making a sequel. I really wanted to be informed on Amelia's origins and what the hell is the real name of One... Sad...

I loved Wayne, which was written by the same writers as this films, so was excited to give this a shot. It is unbearably bad. I shut it off after about 20 minutes and was mad at myself for lasting even that long. I come here to check out the other credits and see it's directed by Michael Bay. How am I not surprised. Don't waste your time. Watch (or re-watch) Wayne. Much better.

reviews.review_title: Did they use cambridge analytica for this ?
reviews.content:
I mean, did they target ADHD - 11 and below - short attention spaned - low IQ - with no prior knowledge of the world kind of audiance ? then for whom this film was made for ? and why ? who directed this film ? a schizophreniac on drugs ? 8 different directors ? why is this getting some good ratings ??EVERYTHING about this movie is wrong.
The scenario, dumb.
What I would I see jokes are not .
The dialogs complete clichés.
The chain of events, illogical.
The over acting unecessairly
The over dressing.. the continuous fast cutting between scenes.. the emotions .. all of it is utter garbage.

reviews.review_title: Non stop action and great watch
reviews.content: Enjoyed this so much... Great action, funny jokes and puns, lots of beautiful women. Ryan Reynolds before he became Deadpool. Brilliantly shot and a solid plot. Hoping for sequels. Fairly similar to fast and furious but with more action.

reviews.review_title: Must-see, great movie. Must like action, however.
reviews.content: This is one of the most well-made and best overall action movies that I've ever seen (Netflix or not).Chase in beginning is one of (if not) the best I've ever seen. Actually, most scenes are some of the best I've ever seen.Reynolds earned every penny paid for this as well as the other cast (Franco definitely included, for his smaller but great part). The other characters were also *perfect* choices and complimented Reynolds well. I loved all the characters equally.The star role is what Netflix seems to miss sometimes, but does hit it out of the park other times -- stop putting newcomers in star roles and leave that to the big boys (Franco and Reynolds both worked hard on their way up). This time they hit a home run.Michael Bay was also a great choice as director. That guy just seems to know good movies, even though years ago I doubted he would keep making high quality stuff. If Netflix can like, buy this guy, they should.There were so many cool things in this movie that it's almost hard to notice that a lot of things are fake and too over the top at times (to the point where it wasn't believable), like the laughing gas part. However, it still made for an awesome movie. Not everything extreme makes a good scene, but these extreme scenes we're good ones (overall, anyway). A lot of parts just made me think "Oh, wow!", which is what I mainly watch movies for, but some also made me cringe at times (even though none were to the point of being absurd).The other reason I like this movie is because it kept me wanting to watch it -- never once did I want to stop. I give a 10 to all movies that do this because it's hard to get me to sit through a whole movie. Also, I actually wanted to rewatch it -- something I hardly ever want to do.Netflix: Keep making movies like this, PLEASE. There were 9 bad guys -- what about the other 8? Hint: sequels! Also, maybe study the people who didn't like this because I feel there might be something wrong with them (just joking, but come on -- this movie rocks).Update: Heard this might be a TV show, possibly merging with Money Heist? Please don't. Just make a sequel with M. Bay, and go from there.

This film has all the fast action, graphic violence, hot eye-candy, slick humor, taut thrills, shoot-outs and car chases, etc. that can fit in one movie, and then some. Hardly any dull moments to catch your breath. Special effects, cinematography and screenplay are all top notch for the international ghost ops venue. Acting is adequate, and the storyline doesn't take itself too seriously. The clusterjunk factor frustrates a bit, and the long run time makes it almost too much to take in one sitting.
100 mph, not a boring moment, gross, goofy and a hell of a lot of fun!

Let me start by saying, all my expectations were met and then some. I knew exactly what I was getting into. Lots of expensive cars getting blown up, hot actors and actresses close ups with lens flare, high octane action and silly one lines.After Deadpool Ryan Reynolds has made a reputation of himself and he lives Upto that reputation by delivering comic one liners between action. While some of them land, some don't. The rest of characters are passable, that doesn't mean their acting is bad. Everyone has done a good job.The plot was interesting but nothing innovative. Editing was sometimes jarring but most of the time keeps you on edge. There are on your nose obvious song choices during some sequences.The first 20 minutes of the movie is perhaps one of the best car chase action sequence, definitely one of the top tens. The final action is just mindless bonkers and I really want to see it's making.So, grab a drink and lots of chips and watch this movie for solid entertaining, loud, action packed Ryan Reynolds movie that Michael Bay has made.I give this 7/10.
Original score is to even out scores by those who didn't know what they were getting into.

reviews.review_title: Put your brain in a box for 2 hours
reviews.content: It is exactly everything you think it is and it is the complete opposite to the Irishman, so kudos to Netflix.It's big, loud, makes little sense and doesn't care as it's too busy moving at the speed of sound for you to even notice. You will, but when you take your brain out of the box.It is unapologetically fun and also probably Bay's most violent film in which he is clearly having a lot of fun showing the many ways one can die.Reynolds and cast all work very well together and the script is purely there to get everyone from point A to point B.But if you're into this kinda thing, you're gonna dig it and if you're not, the Irishman is right there for you.

Some people take things too seriously.
This was a damn good, take your brain out action film.
Amazing action sequences and very funny in places.

OMG! Great movie, fantastic! Both action and funny at the same time! Scenes are insane!! So insane and so realistic at the same time! Characters are well written and portrayed. (Definitely age >16) it's at the same level as "mission impossible" or "skyscraper". High quality, out of the box and very innovative action scenes.
Honestly, what are people moaning about? Its an action movie. Some what cheesy but entertaining.

The action is great and Ryan's humor shines through. Although, the storyline (much like the action at times) is a bit wishful and hard to believe. But the premise is what we all need nowadays. Hopefully, there will be sequels.
Nothing really matters here, it is just stuff happening without any sense. The structure and editing is terrible. This movie should be fun, but it is just boring.

reviews.review_title: Jesus H. Tap-Dancing Christ in a Wheelbarrow!
reviews.content:
A-maze-ing!! Yes, spelled incorrectly for pronunciation purposes, but still!All I can say is WOW!Skeptical at first, as I didn't hear much media buzz about 6 Underground; but simply stunning, attention-grabbing and eye opening!I hate to compare these two films, but the first 20 minutes of 6 Underground reminded me of the first 20 minutes of Saving Private Ryan.No, not the actual relevance of real word events, hell, death and tragedy, but the cinematography created by the Master: Mr. Bey.Saving Private Ryan had audiences more than captivated. You could have driven a truck into the theater and not one person would have looked away from the movie screen with that piece of Film Perfection inthe first 20-45 minutes.Again, not trying to associate the two, but I was so enamored by just the first half hour of "6", that I actually ate a whole can of Chef Boyer-dee, and didn't even realize it!! I just couldn't look away! (Enter: beef-a-roni stomach ache)Sad that lil Davey Franco had such a short appearance, though I would love to see him as a prequel to the prequel of the prequel (?) if that makes sense... Don't think it would work with the fact he was dumped to "sleep with the fishes" here, but maybe if there is a "7" or even a "5 Underground" for a sequel, I think the Franco would shine!Ryan Reynolds is cinematic gold! Serious and heartwarming as such movies like School of Life, yet "smart-ass-ey" like a Deadpool pioneer! I would suggest a bit more combat scenes with Ryan (much like his Blade: Trinity scenes and Deadpool) as he can whoop some ass!Femme Fatales: O M G! Great choices with these vixens! Dangerous and hot! Excited to see them return!People, what Michael Bey did for Transformers, has returned for this film! Stunning aerial shots, car chases with KILLER CRASHES (pun intended) and just good ol' fashioned ACTION!!
Made my week!! ( Which was rather hellish, but that's another Talk Show)Anyway, this movie had all elements for a great time! Thank you for this, Mikey Bey and writers!Perhaps the ending will have them taking on those dangerous Norwegians in the next film????? Hey, a guy can dream right??Check this movie out folks, it won't dissappoint!

Typical of Michael Bay, the way this movie was shot, the color pallete employed, the soundtrack and scores...If you threw in a couple of robots... hey it's a Transformer novie, complete with lensflare, aerial sweeps, cars moving insync at highspeed and overuse of slow motion.The story? Couldn't really be bothered.
The acting? Typical Reynolds as you can never really take him for a serious guy no matter the genre.
In comparison with another rebel rogue merry band of misfits... I think LOSERS was Stars ahead

reviews.review_title: Fast and Furious...but it's Ryan Reynolds
reviews.content: 6.1 (as rated when this review was written) is fair probably but I was entertained and it was a 9 for me. One of those types of movies where the budget is good enough that the plot can be kind of generic and it still be good.

reviews.review_title: Another completely missable Michael Bay special
reviews.content:
Don't know how Netflix ever approved this. It seems like the product of a hyperactive teenage amateur filmmaker's mind. Bay doesn't even try to rein in his frenetic-paced product-laden vision to shoot sequences that make any sense.
Too many close-ups, beauty shots, shaky-cam, slo-mo, weird camera angles, architecture shots, confused colour correction, unnecessary and unbelievable explosions, upskirt shots, and the script is juvenile and barely holds the story together.
Not even Ryan's humour and quick wit can save this train-wreck.
I think the only way this adrenaline-fuelled , "The ADHD Team" story would've worked is it if had been written for a game tie-in like Just Cause. But as it is, it's a brainless, shallow and completely missable film.
Watch at your own risk.

I don't know where to begin. The movie was simply very bad. Watched an hr and gave up, I seriously doubt it got aby better in the remaining 1 hr. shaky camera, constant and confusing editing cuts.Plot is very thin. just skip it

After a long time, I liked a Michael Bay movie to some extent. Even though the initial chase sequence was too long and bit exaggerated, the movie in its overall runtime, was very fast paced. If the storyline could have been better maybe the movie could have been more of a pleasure.Nonetheless, Michael Bay does what he always do. Action with blasts everywhere, total chaos and rampage. It was a decent (not great though) watch.I will go with 6.5/10 for "6 Underground"
