The reason these movies log hours interesting how Netflix doesn't offer if subscriptions increased the month of that film.However it's simple if you search for "Jack Nicholson" you're lucky if you find more than two titles without Anger Management.Netflix has gone from replacing Blockbuster to its own Network. It rarely offers New Releases... The bulk of its content is reject and foreign. So if they stayed the course they could have the different plans based on viewing time or other metric as a streaming video store with a flat rate. Instead you rent from Amazon, Apple, Google, or your TV provider on PPV.Paying soon 25 a month to get bombs out of Michael Bay, and attempted salvation by a high paid cast will eventually be the demise in the US.

Why do I watch Michael Bay movies? There's more explosions than dialogue and characters that don't develop. Its just a long series of stupid gunfights, car chases, explosions, stupid hand to hand combat, more explosions, and zero attention to detail. Bullets that cause sparks? A good that out maneuvers all the bad guys but somehow gets caught? Terrible dialogue, "over and out"? Which is it, over or out, it's not both.
I get that is supposed to be fun, but I guess I would like a balance of plot, special effects, and characters that grow. We had two hours to learn something or see them develop, but nope, they inexplicably go from one extreme to the other with no real explanation of why.
Im just ranting cause I'm mad I watched this. Its a waste of talent, Ryan Reynolds and Melanie Laurent are better than this.
If you like things that go boom, gravity defying car chases, PG-13 sex scenes with zero set up, a pretty dumb plot, and more explosions, you will absolutely love this movie. If you want more than that, steer clear.

This is a high octane action grindhouse. Ryan Reynolds leads of team of ghosts to change the world. Literally, they are all dead people who are alive and can die again. So where do you go when you die and you're already dead? Cleveland?Each of the characters has a specialty. The film opens with a mission in Florence to obtain information on the four generals of fictional Turgistan . Their mission is to go to Vegas, kill the generals, then Hong Kong to free the good brother and then stage a coup to take out the evil dictator.The film has some light drama as filler. Good banter and chemistry between the characters. I want an Alfa Romeo Giulia. Green. Incredible car chase scene.Guide: F-word. Implied sex. No nudity.

reviews.review_title: Finally a Netflix movie worth watching
reviews.content: What can I say! Michael Bay knows exactly what I love. This guy just knows blockbusters. The cast played off against each other well. The action scenes spectacular. I hope there's a sequel planned😉

Judge for yourself. This film is not meant to be
some deeply plotted, mind blowing, thriller. It is a "great" action flick with some fun humor laced throughout. Just read the positive reviews to really
have an idea of what this flick is about! Yes, I did read both types of reviews. The positive reviews are so descriptive and filled with enthusiasm for this film!

reviews.review_title: You Have Got To Be Kidding!
reviews.content: How much did Ryan Reynolds get paid? That has to be the ONLY reason he is in this toilet of a movie!! The opening set piece has the worst continuity I have ever seen on film!!! Smashed up cars suddenly being unmarked, a driver wearing a baseball cap in one shot and not in the next then back again, etc. Plot makes no sense either. Typical Bay mess of a movie!!!!!

reviews.review_title: ACTION WITH A LOT OF HAHAHA 😆😆😆
reviews.content: My friends and i loved it! I wonder why it got a moderate rating..if they did not enjoy it, at least give it a 5, like A for effort..It was fun and action-packed! judge for yourself! I am on the positive side! 👍👍👍

reviews.review_title: This is the most Micheal Bay movie that has ever Micheal Bayed
reviews.content: This is a Micheal Bay movie. Hot Women, Fast Cars, and GO GO GO! If you are watching this movie for any other reason then you are watching the wrong movie. Its worth a watch.

Wow, Self repairing car's... gotta get me one of those!
One moment a truck trashes it, 2 seconds later the car is good as new, not to mention the motorcycle that crashes in the front.2 hours filled with bloopers :-)

Seriously, what a mess. It's as if Bay crawled through all the cutting room floors of his other awful movies and spliced the cut action scenes randomly and called it a movie.This is not a movie!Oh, and how can this review contain spoilers if there is zero plot?
Had it all action babes and comedy cracking movie hope there's 2-3 to come soon loved it

Where to begin. The effects & CGI are mostly good but the movie as a whole is poorly executed. Unnecessary shaky-cam, poor acting and cheesy forced one-liners. The story as a whole is very confusing and lazy written. The flashbacks appear at random and half of the information could be left out. The villains is boring and none of the characters have soul.A classic Michael Bay cash-grab.
This movie is entertaining, fun and a bit gruesome. For me and my husband, the movie is great for "date" night. Bring the popcorn and enjoy.
The stunts in this show make the Mission Impossible franchise look like a dull Sunday night in Budapest.

Baddies fight goodies. Story summary aside now, I'll comment on what actually matters in a Michael Bay movie--the noise, visual and otherwise. Since Bay seems to have wrapped up most of his commitments to the Transformers franchise, I suppose he's looking for a new series with this Netflix release, "6 Underground." Basically, this one is the same loud, adrenaline-junkie garbage he usually makes. Another rapidly-edited, stunt-laden car chase sequence occupies the opening act even before, as well as during, the narrative set-up regarding what the gang of heroes are and will be doing. After an especially blatant product-placement shot for Captain Morgan rum (and this after they make a guy a "pirate" by removing one of his eyes--get it?), there's some fighting, shooting and killing in a building, then some more of that on a yacht. They incite a coup in a fictional Asian state named "Turgistan." Anyways, I'd better tolerate the shots lasting one or two seconds before cutting to the next if it weren't for the obnoxious pop-music soundtrack, the sex scenes that are filmed the same way except with the addition of ass shots of women, the car commercials, listless parkour, hero posturing, and the gaudy slow-motion tableaus.It's peculiar that during the car chase sequence, this visual mess threatens to spill over into the destruction of historically-important pieces of art, including Michelangelo's "David," or as this movie has it, the statue of the guy with a small penis. Another scene has a brutal dictator admiring the artwork of the Louvre. These scenes aren't as perfect of a metaphor for what Bay does to art as was his destruction of Ancient Egyptian monuments in the second Transformers burger, but it offers a stark contrast nonetheless between art and exploding rubbish such as "6 Underground."The casting of Ryan Reynolds here makes sense. Besides putting a likable personality in front of the rest of the action-movie noise meant to disguise writing so lazy that it borrows its punchlines from other movies and media--and points that out, as if that's the joke--Reynolds has plenty of experience with (super)hero franchises. They even got his "Deadpool" writers to script this one. Again, Reynolds provides voiceover narration to directly address the audience, as he becomes something of a resurrected "ghost" who, then, assembles a team to fight baddies. Deadpool, Green Lantern, Blade, Deadpool again and, now, this. Given that he's an inventive billionaire in this one who, at one point, is accused of acting like Bruce Wayne, I guess this is Reynolds's Batman picture. Unfortunately, none of the other members of white savior's Justice League have the star charisma and fame of Reynolds, to compensate for a noisy movie and lousy script that do them no favors. This movie is trash.
This is Bay on crack and speed making the stuff you do in GTA come to life.
The filmmaker probably didn't care if there were any film mistakes or logic breaks every second as long as the action was right.

Shaky cam, extreme close ups, rapid cutting, dutch angles, overly saturated teal and orange which makes Trump's complexion seem pallid by comparison, moronic dialogue, lame jokes, Bay masturbating to anything military, the first scene a chase sequence lasting seemingly forever, and of course Bay's usual flag waving militarist American exceptionalism. Bay used to at least be able to tell a semi-coherent story. But those days are long gone. It's amazing I lasted as long as I did. 30 minutes.

I just watched 6 Underground with my son, whilst we had a takeaway and drank a couple of beers.Since the trailer is vague, here is a brief plot in a paragraphA team of 6 people (all assigned a code number) who are all thought to be dead, are living off the grid and taking out bad guys Governments can't or won't touch.It was a bit touch to follow during the first hour as it hops all over the place with lots of flashbacks... It was a lot more complicated than it needed to be, as I'm still not sure what happened when, in its timeline. The second hour is the most enjoyable as there are no flashbacks, you know what's happening and it flows better, despite the shaky cam.It's a very Michael Bay movie, with action sequence with explosions following action sequence with more explosions. There are some great deaths (including innocent bystanders) and laughed out loud two or three times.Ryan Reynolds is Ryan Reynolds, and since I like him, it worked for me. He brings the same energy he brings to Deadpool or Blade 3 (he saved that movie for me) here and he is fun. Mëlanie Laurant and Adria Arjona bring the glamour, but they are not just eye candy, one is a doctor and the other an ex cia agent. The stand out in the cast for me was Ben Hardy (last seen in Bohemian Rhapsody) who plays the parkour member of the team, he was great. Sadly the bad guy is a bit one dimensional, although he is played well.Whilst its script is not the best (it has an lame, surprise twist at the end) and Bay still thinking its 1995 it does have some stunning locations (especially in Italy) an excellent cast, a decent score and is more than watchable.Overall is it a good movie?? not really. But was I entertained?? Hell, yes I was. I'm not sure how much of that was down to the 4 bottles of beer I drank whilst watching it.

It's dominated by its director. If you know his direction, nothing new. Just stop thinking and enjoy mind numbing action with as less brain activity as possible. Negative thing is film's lenght, 1 hr 30-40mins would have been sufficient. But then again Bay is not the one to sacrifice on that. No sequels required though, this was enough.

Looks like Michael Bay can't get enough of being Michael Bay. 6 Underground is essentially a showcase of everything we've come to know about Bay's films, rolled into a single piece - underwritten (one-note) characters, blonde/brunette bombshells who can cock a gun and kick major butt, tonnes (I mean tonnes!) of explosions, slow-motion-filled set-pieces shot in locations around the globe, a storyline that doesn't make any sense, bad editing, and at times kick-ass soundtrack (I was really glad to hear tracks by The Score and Welshly Arms!).It almost looks like Bay stuffed all of these things into a mixer and 6 Underground was what the end product looked like. The cinematography by Bojan Bazelli boasts dazzling frames when the (shaky) camera isn't running behind someone during a bloated set-piece. The film also spends a good amount of time trying to explain the motive of its lead characters but you come to an early conclusion that there isn't any. Barring a few funny one-liners by Ryan Reynolds, the writing by Deadpool writers Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick is largely bland.P.S - The opening twenty-minute set-piece was the best of the lot!
Ridiculous movie. How can those men chase a jumper over steel buildings etc. and for the big guy to catch him bad directing.

There seems to be an expectation for films to be groundbreaking, fresh with life changing storytelling these days. It's really not necessary for all films. This was great fun to watch. I found it hilarious, Ryan does what Ryan does which I enjoy. Yes there was a lot going on but it's not a confusing film at all, it's very simple and easy to understand with great action scenes. Definitely something I'd watch again and I'd even like a second one. Negative reviewers need to just relax and stop taking everything so seriously.

reviews.review_title: I like action, but this is garbage
reviews.content: 10 minutes in, turned it off. This is one of those movies where we are supposed to believe that the characters are "important" and innocent bystanders are killed in droves so they can battle on for whatever the CIA considers freedom.

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay worked his Magic with this one
reviews.content: The storyline was a lil drawn out but still good & even if the storyline doesn't captivate you then the action will!!! I love the way his movies come out & he didn't disappoint with this one.

The opening sequence is ok because of Florence, but not great. The rest is boring. I was fast forwarding all the time. A really bad movie. Too much advertising, bad acting, weak story. First I was a little annoyed about the national composition of the actors (US, Mex, PR, France, UK). Later I was glad that my country was not involved in such a bad movie. Abu Dhabi for HKK was not very convincing either.

reviews.review_title: I really wanted to like this but.....
reviews.content: This wasn't the worse movie Ryan has done but definitely far from his best. Normally when he's acting like a ass on screen; it's usually pretty funny. He just comes off more of a regular ass.There were some pretty decent car chases and shoot outs but there was also a lot of pointless filler in this. The magnet thing was pretty cool.It did take me 3 days to finish it. Might have been better as a 6-8 episode show instead
I must say I haven't seen such good action scene in any movie before ... I just loved every part of this movie .. Michale Bay you rocked it again

reviews.review_title: If the 1st 20mins don't impress you nothing will
reviews.content:
Downside - If your not a fan of bays action then I can't say your be a fan of this.
Upside - I personally was blown away in the 1st 20 mins of the car chase scene, you seriously can't say that wasn't action packed and fun. Also taking a break from the Robots is truly welcome as this film makes a lot more sense.
Give it a watch leave your brain at the door and sit back and enjoy

I'm not talking about the timeline jumping back and forth, that was (imo) pretty easy to follow. I'm talking about all the confusing events that happen, for no reason, during the entire film. I'll cite just one example."4" is a Skywalker. He's been hired because he can traverse urban terrain faster than almost anyone else. As a parkour expert and urban explorer he has the skills and experience to move through, over, and around buildings in ways that normal people just cannot. So why is it that every bad guy can catch him up so easily? Every time he is in a location that is totally within his element where he is running from a group of bad guys we see him getting distance on them. Cut away and cut back and now they are right on top of him. It makes absolutely zero sense, and breaks immersion because now this guy is not even close to being an expert, he's actually below average.The whole film is like this. Desperate attempts to set up set pieces with no continuity, consistency, or drama.
But action packed fun from beginning to the end. You want entertainment, here it is. It was a blast. Take it for what it is meant to be.

reviews.review_title: 2 hours of my life I'll never get back
reviews.content: Don't waste your time!!! Normally a big fan of Ryan Reynolds, but what is he doing signing up to this.Terrible plot, terrible cliches, story jumps all over the place, I could go on and on. This really is a Michael bay movie of steroids, creating a grotesque version.I'll admit some of the action is spectacular, so if you must watch, the first 15min gives you enough...after that it's 1hr 45min of repeat.In all honesty I'd find something better on Netflix, it's not short of options.

reviews.review_title: Director: Michael Bay, and it says it all...
reviews.content: Very rare I leave a review, unless the movie was very close to 8-9 out of 10 (let's be honest, it must be a piece of art for an 10/10, followed by an Oscar, maybe).This one shapes many colors of the moments, from a political and social point of view. Very cool visual & sound effects. I enjoyed this one, and I do recommend it!It reminds me of "The Island (2005)"; not as script, but as the way it was directed; very nice!
I think watching paint dry is preferable. Inane stupid ridiculous nonsense. I don't mind bay at all but this is total rubbish.

reviews.review_title: Seems like a script that couldn't wait for X-Force.
reviews.content: Ryan Reynolds seems to be channeling Deadpool except in this movie he's a rich genius and everyone on his team are all supposed to be dead so they can do 'whatever they want'. And this is the type of movie when no one is keeping a leash on Michael Bay. It's a Netflix original, so the bar should be excepted to be low in general. It's just what Netflix does. At least it doesn't stink.

Guys its an action movie not a mello drama movie... U guys review like an cild who wanted an attention, plot mess up ? Flash back here and there? Is u brain that smart ? That u guys can't catch up with the movie plot? Lol
Too many shot guns , car chases , sarcasm and Ryan Reynolds ? What a mankind would want more than that ? I love it !
Director loves to move the camera 24/7 giving normal viewers a big headache. He needs to learn manners, or else will keep getting 1/10 ratings.

This sort of Michael Bay movie is just a straight up guilty pleasure. It's not a great movie. It isn't winning oscars. Stuff blows up, people die, women are sexy, and the cars are awesome.Put your brain on ice, lay back with whatever it is that you use to take the edge off, and turn on this movie to watch Michael Bay's signature off-the-wall action sequences in all of their unrestricted glory.Not quite as engrossing as Bad Boys 2 or The Rock, but it does what it sets out to do.6.8/10

As expected of a Michael Bay film, this movie is very stylish, fast-paced and thoroughly entertaining. Good cast and characters. Looking forward to a sequel. Netflix should not drop the ball on this one.

The story was pretty weak and lame.
The action was action-packed, but the "cool" sayings made everything ridiculous.
A movie that you see once and quickly forget.
Terribly directed, awful story, crappy dialogue, obnoxiously random music... it felt as if a 7 year old did everything for this film, and you could tell. What a snoozefest.

reviews.review_title: Its an action movie! Get over it!
reviews.content: It's an action movie. For all those critics who want to judge it low because it doesn't meet their qualifications...you're morons! Just watch the movie and enjoy it. That's what movies are meant for. Stop thinking that every movie has to be 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Why does Bay insult his audiences with lazy story telling?!?!?!
reviews.content:
Within three minutes of beginning to watch this film I knew that it was going to be painstakingly bad and contribute to my continued loss of faith in the millenial generation.
1. The opening car chase scene... What exactly is the purpose of this in regards to the story??? I mean, what causes it??? There is a vague explanation as #1 meets with some lawyer who refuses to give him information about a brutal dictator in fictional Tujikistan. However, the fallout that succeeds the meeting is given very little to no explanation. I guess he gets killed??? Apparently the guy was a mafioso lawyer as well so he he gets 100's of grunts, countless Alpha Romeros to speed through the narrow Florence streets, and military grade chopper to track and contain his killer, in Italy??? What??? Why would Italy protect a foreign dictator? And why would the dictator's lawyer have so much muscle guarding him??? Makes no sense!!!
2. If this crew is trying to keep a low profile, then why in the eff do they drive around in a hideous lime green Alpha Romero??? Yeah, not conspicous at all!! Effing ridiculous!
3. The writing and dialogue appeals to the unmotivated teenage flunkey with zero intelligence or sophistication that will undoubtedly get his fat unattractive high school girlfriend pregnant before graduation and then live a miserable existence unloading boxes from DHL trucks until he's 50 and OD's on meth. If you think any of these characters are admirable or any of the writing has one iota of humor in it, then you are a complete waste of effing space and your worthless family deserves to remain trapped and oppressed in the mobile home you all assuredly live in! Losers!
4. So a super rich renegade fakes his own death because it will be easier to track and kill the aforementioned dictator. Why? Because said dictator is bad and kills hundreds of innocent people, right? Surely you are morally uptight and want to do the right thing!! Hmmm, and what about the innocent people you ran over and who were needlessly killed on your get away through Florencein that completely gay looking Alpha Romero??? I guess killing them was OK, right?! What morally upright people you all are, right? Give me an effing break!I can go on and on but it's not worth it. This film is total garbage! Michael B. sucks a*s as do the minions that follow and admire his work!

reviews.review_title: I love car chases, guns and Ryan Reynolds. This movie ruins all of them for me.
reviews.content: This movie may have improved towards the end, but I'll never know as my teenage son and I could only sit through the first 30 minutes. We both love action films, from Fast & Furious to John Wick, but the whole point of action films is to provide uplifting and joyous escapism.We were so excited after seeing the trailer, but we sat through the opening chase scene in dumbstruck silence. Nothing makes any sense at all. Some of the visuals are stunning, but after every chasing car is destroyed a new one simply appears out of nowhere, like some kind of computer game. Pedestrians are mown down or shot without a second thought, meaning that it is impossible to relate to, or care about, the lead characters from the very start. As yet another car was destroyed in slow motion, and the chase went literally nowhere, my son turned to me and asked what on earth was going on. How is it possible to make such an action-packed scene so boring?!This is a movie by teenagers for teenagers. Atrocious plot, editing and continuity. Mindless action can, and should be, fun. This wasn't. I felt exhausted, and quite sad that anyone would ever imagine this sort of drivel was acceptable. Just no.
Deadpool finds his real x force and kills people without mask and mutation. Good film nice action movie for netflix.

We really enjoyed this. You have to KNOW going in that this is going to be a fun, nonsensical, over the top action filled sleigh ride. Like True Lies in 1990.
It's larger than life, insane, with long winded action sequences that are hilariously fun and filled with gore.
This is not the English Patient, or Saving Private Ryan or the Remains of the Day....nor is it trying to be. It's meant for a 'I've had a hard week at the office and just want a violent fun filled ride'.
And it delivers exactly that.
If you want deep and meaningful... this is not for you.
If you want action eye candy, it's still better than fast and furious.
So when you're in the mood for some raucous fun, this will definitely hit the spot. If you want emotionality or meaning, look elsewhere, this is simply a joyride at the carnival and great fun for the ride.
Tonight, this was exactly what we needed.

Netflix movies seem to have a tendency for unfocused, splintered, confusing structure. This mess is no exception.The Netflix formula is to film a bunch of scenes (script optional and not needed; the scenes do not need to connect), take all of these scenes, pass them through a shredder, paste everything back together in any random order, put on Netflix.Nothing in this movie made any narrative sense, nor did ANY scene have anything to do with the one that preceded it. From the mind of someone suffering from terminal ADHD.What a waste of actors and director.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable action film with mediocre writing and story
reviews.content: Overall the film is definitely an enjoyable action film. Not one I would be able to watch more than once but definitely a film I could recommend to action flick fans to at least watch once.The issue with the film is the story and writing is quite mediocre. Don't get me wrong, there are moments where the writing is quite brilliant and I had a small giggle but for the most part the lines fall flat and the dialogue all feels very forced and unnatural. The story itself is also nothing special and is just good enough to give the action context. But the focus point of this film is by far the action.I don't know how much CGI was used in this film as all the action comes across as authentic and feels very real. This is because they used a lot of practical effects to ground the action sequences so any CGI added to these is not distinguishable from what is real and what is fake.My only complaint about the action is that at times the cinematography and editing is all done too fast. Fast cuts, shaky cameras, fast pans, etc... When in actuality it was not needed as the stunts in this film are top class so I would have really enjoyed to have seen more of the stunts on film rather than to lose so much of the visuals to fast cuts/pans/shaky cam.Another complaint about this film is the first 50 minutes really felt very directionless the story kind of jumps around and you have story sequences tossed in the middle of hectic action sequences with some over the top gore added in and it was just an awkward mess but suddenly after the 50 minute mark it almost becomes an entirely different film. The plot is a lot more focused, the action sequences are more focused and the over the top gore is just gone for the rest of the film.In terms of the action sequences, one of the biggest issues with many modern day action flicks is that CGI is overused. There are some sequences in this film they easily could have saved money on and done fully in CGI but they didn't they did it in practical effect and added CGI layers on top and it just adds so much to the quality of these sequences. I can't even watch any new Fast Furious films as they are 100% over the top CGI - not here in this film. Everything while grandiose and visually amazing is all done in practical effects and the payoff is just so worth it.If the film had better story and writing I could easily have rated it higher but alas beyond the epic action sequences and top quality acting the story and writing just falls flat thus the 6/10 I have given it.

Ryan Reynolds' performance was fantastic: he enacted the same obnoxious sadistically humorous character as he played in Deadpool. The other five main characters where just as incredible in their part of this narrative. The annihilation and the hunt of the totalitarian ruler by the six-member special forces team was an action-packed pandemonium chaotic story of deadly violence in the name of freedom and justice for the citizens. Intriguing cinematic action scenes, wonderful writing and story, and captivating adventure. Netflix does it again with their fascinating entertainment! Brilliant! Loved It!

I'm really not.But there are some qualities to his work that apparently, when paired with some other qualities are very fun.This is by far the best movie that Michael Bay has ever made.I know that's not saying much on its own but I give it a serious aid as an action movie. Well done I had a really good time.

A few examples - using a neon coloured getaway car in a sea of bland colour.....15 minutes of opening CGI action...it gets tiring.....Bad guys who magically catch up to the character they are chasing even though the cut from scene shows them far behind....endless amounts of pursuers in cars...no idea where they all came from......rain on a window in the background while discussing something on the boat...cut to...a sunny day where the people are fleeing the deck.....maybe humour action should be more accurate? Case in point #1 says he didn't expect to get that far while raiding the boat...seriously? That was the whole purpose of the story..... If you want a no brainer movie with a lot of CGI action, simple drawn out plot story, no character development and near slapstick bad guys this is the movie for you. I tried to have fun...but the "humour" wasn't funny, the action not original and the characters undeveloped. 4/10 - there are worse films in this genre, but I cannot recommend this one.

... but it's not trying to. It's Michael Bay doing what Michael Bay is very, very good at. Compelling action, stunning cinematography and pyrotechnics galore. STAR RATING: ***** Saturday Night **** Friday Night *** Friday Morning ** Sunday Night * Monday MorningA tech billionaire (Ryan Reynolds) fakes his own death, in order to live anonymously and fight the forces of evil. Renaming himself One, he recruits various individuals from around the world, to join his organisation, and live as he does, with numerical numbers to each of their names, applying their various skills in his quest to rid the world of horrible people. Rovach Alimov (Lior Raz) is a brutal dictator in the Middle East, who has become the teams latest target. But everything is not as it seems.Michael Bay is a director with a style as distinctive as any established Hollywood hack. Slo mo action scenes, sweeping visuals and stylised, brutal violence have come to define his films. Truth be told, the man has always been better suited to directing video games than movies, which require more of a solid foundation to make them succeed, such as strong writing, good dialogue and effective characterisation. 6 Underground opens in the heat of a close up car chase, frenetically moving along while characters bark dialogue to the screen, and ending with the death of one of them. But since we've established as much of an emotional connection with them as the others, it's a bit moot.Bay's films have never been known for their L.A. Confidential style, labyrinth plots, but this is truly the flimsiest excuse for a plot I've ever known, further compounded by Bay engaging in some Bad Boys II style over indulgence, stretching at over two and a half hours, which the plot isn't strong enough to sustain. It wouldn't be so bad if there was an engaging story with characters you cared for, but it's just not the case. In the lead role, Reynolds applies his edgy, wise cracking style to the proceedings, but is not enough to lift it on his own, while a strong supporting cast including Melanie Laurent, Ben Hardy and Corey Hawkins is wasted.It thinks it's funny, it thinks it's slick, but, it's just crap. *

reviews.review_title: Wow the critics got this one wrong, it's the funnest movie of the year! 🙌
reviews.content: Firstly, the cinematography and directing was perfection! As one user stated, this is "the most Micheal Bay movie Micheal Bay ever Micheal Bayed", and IMO the funnest movie of the year, if not in the last 2+ years!I can't believe the low rating and the critics negative responses. David Fear of Rolling Stone called it "another lingerie catalogue sprinkled with carnage"... umm yaaaa, that's exactly what the viewers want! This film is meant to be adrenaline-inducing action, suspense, thrills, and entertainment all in one, and it delivered. It's not meant to be some psychological mind-bending thriller, just simple mindless entertainment. It was Bay at his best, with stunning visuals and amazing S/VFX. This film doesn't deserve anything less than a 7/10, strictly on production value and its visuals - even if you hated it.This film was made for Reynolds charisma and humor, and no one could've been cast better for his role. For that matter, casting overall was perfection - every single actor performed outstanding and looked and played their part.Even the score and soundtrack (I want it!) was outstanding. My only beef with this film, and the reason I didn't give it a 10, was the convoluted back and forth and all over the place timelines at the start. I'm not sure if editing/cutting length down is to blame, but I could've been presented much better. Nevertheless, the 127 min run-time was perfect and the pacing on point.I really hope Netflix doesn't get cold feet from the negative critics and not come out with a sequel, because this group of underground heroes need more stories to tell us! I will be watching this one again very soon, and it's a well deserving 9/10 from me!To see my 1000+ ratings and 700+ reviews, simply click on my user name. But go see this film first!

reviews.review_title: Just enjoy it, dont be an armchair critic.

It's just explosions after explosions, a hot hookup, and a plot to topple a dictator of an oppressive country (sounds familiar?). The ending was really, really bad and they didn't make an effort to make the death ring a bell in your memory.And one more thing. A plot of the movie is set in Turgistan. Why the hell was the brother speaking English? Couldn't the producers make an effort to use Arabic??Overall it's a huge, huge mess - typical Michael bay fashion. If this was shown in cinemas I would gladly give it a huge "F" cinemascore.
I really enjoyed it. I think a lot of negative reviewers are overthinking it. Sit back, relax and enjoy the fun.

reviews.review_title: It's a great action spectical. Period!
reviews.content: Don't care what other reviews say trying to be a cinema expert. This movie was fun Michael Bay action from start to finish. There are so many things wrong with this movie on so many levels I still don't think I've fully processed it.I quite enjoyed the opening car chase. It was really, really silly but there were a lot of cool stunts and the film seemed not to take itself too seriously. Plus it got bonus points for killing off Dave Franco early.But then it started getting really dumb, offensively dumb and it slowly started dawning on me that this film was not (despite attempts to be funny- at no point was it actually funny) as tongue in cheek as I assumed it had to be.The plot is basically 'Team America: World Police' played straight and oversimplified to the point where you can only assume it must be targeted at young, particularly stupid children. A billionaire with unexplained crazy special forces skills decides he wants to make the world a better place by replacing an evil dictator of a fictional country with someone else thereby making solving all the problems in said country (you know, like America did in Iraq/Libya/Afghanistan). He decides to replace the bad guy with the bad guy's brother (who definitely won't turn into a dictator later on) and chooses to do this with 6 people none of whom are credible and all of whom are unfunny.They kill a lot of people, some of them quite creatively (credit where credit's due) for 2 hours and then main bad guy is killed by his own people in scenes disturbingly reminiscent of Gaddafi in Libya. The day is saved, everyone is free and happy again, children smile, old people are hugged, Americans win, yay! Cut to team walking away in a line smiling, making obligatory wisecracks, the End.Note: that the movie also has some of the most out of place, unwarranted sex scenes in a movie I've ever seen. For the record I genuinely like sex scenes, seeing beautiful women in movies, etc.. But I also like football and would be surprised if different actors pulled out a football for a kick around apropos of nothing multiple times.Note 2: The film was also insulting from a race point of view. Seeing shots of crowds of local brown people reacting emotionally on mass like simple, clockwork idiots to the TV broadcasts was unpleasant.From a technical point of view there was also plenty wrong. Some of the stunts were amazing but many of them were filmed in very difficult to see ways. Some of the camera work was also very good, but was constantly cut with other amateurish and badly filmed shots. For some scenes I can only assume the professional filmmakers all went on a break and let the winner of a competition direct for a bit (see the whole killing the generals in a hotel bit).I assume someone had some highly choreographed action scenes they really wanted to film but could not be properly bothered to film the bits in between or write a reasonable story to link them together. This pretty much sums up the movie for me, I get the feeling that the people who made this move just really couldn't be bothered to do a proper job (I have to believe this, the alternative is that this represents someone deemed accomplished enough to be given $150 million to spend's best storytelling efforts and that is frightening) .And the fact that a film this bad will get more views and more love than a dozen other much better movies combined really makes me wonder how anyone can delude themselves that we are any more than stupid monkeys that like things that go bang and not in fact the pinnacle of a supreme being's plan for all of creation. This movie makes me despair at all of humanity.

reviews.review_title: Certainly more than Just a regular Michael Bay
reviews.content: You know when the movie was sold it seemed it was gonna be all speed chases and stuff... well it is not. This one is definetly a good time burner and, for those Who cannot live without some story and character development in a movie... you get some of that too. It is a well balanced achivied movie. Enjoy.

reviews.review_title: Strange for me, but I did enjoy this film.
reviews.content:
Here is how this movie's script was written.
Michael Bay gathered every one involved in this film, from the most of the cast, writers, extras, producers, to even the caterers.
Marched them on to a field in a large stadium, and on this field were school desks and chairs, on each desk was a notepad with exactly 374 pages, a dozen pens, and 4 grams of cocaine.
In front of each row of desks stood a medium sized elastic catapult facing a giant wooden screen, and a big bucket of water.
Everyone's job was to do a bunch of cocaine, and then some more cocaine, and then start writing the craziest stuff they could imagine, walk up to the catapult, roll the paper into a ball, wet it, and fire it at the screen.
A few days later, after the first few funerals, and the paper had dried, Bay collected all the paper balls that has stuck, and arranged them in order from the highest to the lowest.
He filled in the gaps with a few explosions, and some unnecessary slow-mows, as well as Ryan Reynolds, playing a Ryan Reynolds character.
That my friends, is how the script was written.
Still loved it.

The editing in the movies is a mess it confuses the viewer and some action scenes was good overall if you have patience watch this. Avoiding some of the action scenes and ryan reynolds comedies this movie is soo bad.

6 Underground is Michael Bay Netflix movie about a group of six highly skilled individuals that faked their deaths with the help of billionaire Ryan Reynolds. The group is out to be hero's for those in need or to bring dictators to justice much like the show Hunters. You could tell that Bay is at the helm of this flick from the endless massive amount car sequences and the number of bodies being thrown from the vehicles that it's a typical Bay film but being on Netflix it was rated R with all the blood, gore and body parts. In this first set, the group is out to bring the dictator of Turkmenistan to justice and have his brother step in his place. The script was good, action was loud and over the top but overall it was enjoyable. I am sure we will see multiple movies following these characters.

I chose this film at random on Netflix knowing absolutely nothing about it. Turns out it was a pretty decent movie, the initial seen her a few continuity errors but in my opinion that's OK if the story is kind of interesting. There were also a few story holes but if you think about it you can fill it In. There's also just the right amount of comedy compared to action and seriousness it was quite well balanced in my opinion. The soundtrack was amazing, as well as the editing it was very fast-paced in if you send it was a little bit too fast but I feel like that was done to hide stunt doubles.All in all I would recommend watching a movie if you're in the action in a little bit of comedy.
To much going on at the same time! The plot is confusing at times... Thank God it was a free movie to watch on Netflix

Probably there is 4 or 5,000 cuts in the movie. What to say? It's flawless. Amazing.

reviews.review_title: Great Action, fun cast, laugh out loud moments.
reviews.content: Ok if you want the acting experience of the year, Joker is it.If you want loads of action, plenty of laughs and cast that work well together and Ryan Reynolds delivering (per usual), then you will not be disappointed with this film at all.I watched The Irishman and then this on Netflix recently, I love watching film in all its form as does the whole household and we all preferred this one. A lot of fun, will leave you wanting more - and with a smile on your face.

The movie was good. It wasn't bad, and it wasn't great, but it was good. The editing was abrasive and slightly obnoxious in many occasions but the action and character interaction amongst the main actors was fun. The story could have been fleshed out and delivered a bit better to make us care a little more about the plot. I always enjoy getting situated in my seat in anticipation to watch another Michael Bay film, and that takes coming in with the right expectations. The same goes for a David Fincher film.
6 Underground. Where to start. It's so OTT it's amazing. Car chases, explosions, gun fights. And laughs. The film of 2019.

The movie is pretending to be action, but in fact it's a lame story which you have probably seen many times. The directing resembles a music video with flashing images and frequently changing frames. The storytelling is poor, but the chase in Florence was funny.
Ryan Raynolds cannot seem to step out of the Deadpool role.

Can't believe Bay left his name on this! Sucks is too kind, so is garbage, irritating, makes no sense. Really, throw the film away. Even Ryan Reynolds at his very worst deserves a 10 in anything compared to this film. How embarrassing for everyone involved.
Cars, actions and edited with style. It's a perfect popcorn flick . Chill out the weekend and watch it without any expectations, skip the reviews you will enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Fast & furious ft. Tracers on drugs meets selfless heroes
reviews.content: Early at the start of the movie, I was pulled in by the action-packed scene that made me want more. The fact Ryan is in it certainly didn't hurt. I like a good action movie once in a while and this one made it into my favorites. The low ratings I've seen are confusing, but I guess everyone has a different taste. If you like the fast & furious franchise, you'll definitely like this one. I've never written a review before, but this awesome movie deserved one to go up against the stack of ridiculous ratings. I'm glad I watched it before looking at the reviews. Give it a try and form your own opinion, you might be surprised. It's an 8 for me.

I too enjoy action movies with car chases and explosions. Heck, I even enjoy Michael Bay movies sometimes.
But. This. Was. Horrible.The plot is razor thin at best and the script + editing is like something from the mind of a 12 year old boy.Don't waste your time on this.

reviews.review_title: I feel less intelligent after watching this.
reviews.content: One of the worst films I've ever seen. Just don't bother.

reviews.review_title: A Fun Action Parody With Product Placement Galore
reviews.content: Combine multiple wise cracking performers, some of the best action scenes filmed this decade, blood blood body parts and blood, a preposterous story, unlimited access to film in some of the most beautiful areas of the globe along with an unlimited budget....all orchestrated by action director God Micheal Bay - and you have 6 Underground. The in-your-face and over-the-over-the-top filming and performances can only lead one to believe this film is a parody of the Fast & Furious along with the hundreds of no-way-that-can't-be-real films we have seen over the years. Is this film visually stunning...YES! Funny....YES! A Micheal Bay Masterpiece....DEFINITELY!
The action scenes were awesome. Ryan Reynolds adds just the right amount of comedy.

reviews.review_title: Unwatchable - too many camera angles and explosions
reviews.content: Typical action movie with a very simple plot.Unfortunately the cinematography of this movie by Michael Bay was overly done. An excessive amount of camera angles and constantly jump-cutting scenes, trying to impress the audience is very exhausting to watch. Hence unwatchable.There probably wasn't any budget left for developing the script, nor was the acting able to save this movie.

reviews.review_title: Go Go Go is often said
reviews.content: A perfect movie for Ryan. Lots of action around a very flimsy storyline.

This is without a doubt, the single worst movie I have ever seen in my life. Hands down. The fact that you have spent $150m to make this movie, everyone involved should be absolutely disgusted with themselves. 2 hours of non stop try hard. The dialogue made me physically sick. Shame. Shame on you.

If you didn't find this funny, something tells me you didn't like the movie.
So, honestly, I don't know what I just watched. It's definitely one of the craziest movies I've ever seen. I kind of understand why the critics are not liking this movie, but at the same time it's a piece of real action that you don't get to see these days.
1. It's like an amped up hybrid of 'Fast and Furious' and 'Mission Impossible'.
2. It's incredibly shot, with a lot of attention to detail, which is mindblowing given the fact that this isn't 'Transformers' and they couldn't CGI the hell out of it.
3. The locations are brilliantly chosen, they are stunning and utilized to the max.
4. The storyline isn't great but it's still pretty decent and it feels original so you don't feel like you've seen it all before. In fact, there's a lot I haven't seen before so I was surprised round every corner.
5. Action is the word driving the whole thing. It's nonstop action (with only short pauses to catch your breath) but it doesn't feel tiring, except maybe the opening chase scene, which does seem to go for a bit too long. This is the only bit of the movie that felt strained and overdone. (And we know how Michael Bay likes to do these too-long chase scenes in 'Transformers', don't we?)
6. Except Ryan Reynolds, the actors are relatively unknown, which should take away from the movie but it doesn't, because of the amazing chemistry that they have and the script that allows them to really embody their characters. So it's like you're watching something real (which, again, rarely happens in movies these days).
7. The movie's hilarious. There's a lot of funny situational stuff and funny banter, and Ryan Reynolds' character has his own thing going on on top of that.
8. Weirdly, all the crazy stunts that the 6 pull off seem quite real and doable so you're not watching some superheroes doing some stuff you only see in movies. This looks like a properly trained human being could do it.
9. The soundtrack rocks.
10. I have to mention again how well this movie is shot. Michael Bay has his style, and he likes to film helicopters, that for sure, but all in all, this is spectacular directorial work. If you just think of all the ideas and planning that must have gone into this movie to make it look the way it does, it truly is impressive.
Sign me up for the next instalment yesterday.
Very entertaining movie e but through some cruel action and blood. This movie is not for kids. It is like watching a Deadpool movie

reviews.review_title: it's very different than similar movies but is a good watch
reviews.content: So firstly I want to mention how different this movie is than than a traditional action movie where in this movie the first scene is them doing something challenging like most action movies but instead of them easily completing the task and then have no issue disappearing they spend about 15 minutes just trying to escape everyone following them and there are points where it looks like they might not escape and I actually think this is something that works well and needs to be done more often I also loved how they have to worry about getting somewhere without being detected and that sort of stuff that often isn't included because it's not action the only real criticism I have thought is that I think the movie should have been 2 and a half hours or even 3 hours since because how they actually including and spent more time on certain scenes that normally aren't done as well or at all this meant the movie was more like 1 hour + extended and extra scenes however the movie was still a great watch and I can't wait for the next one

reviews.review_title: An enjoyable mess of a film
reviews.content: Yes it was over the top mess of a film and yes the script kinda sucked but it's still pretty enjoyable and I would watch a sequel. 6.5/10
Some of the scenes were a little bit cheesy. But with a great cast and a interesting plot and some badass action keeps this movie at its high point. Including Ryan Reynolds at his best in this movie.

reviews.review_title: The return of the Hot Girls action movie
reviews.content: Hot girls. Thank god for this movie. I have forgotten a good action movie with hot girls. Yes. Sex. Lust. Cars. Guns. Heroes. Hot scenes. Action packed. Super funny. It's simple. Made for the people. Marvel movies were so asexual. This one is super hot. You will understand me when you watch it.

reviews.review_title: Switch ya brain off and enjoy
reviews.content:
A good rip roaring action movie from start to finish.
Ok the plot is all over the place along with a lot of the camera work and the story itself flits from present to past and back again very clunkily but all that said the action scenes are brilliant and the main characters are likeable and entertaining.
A lot of the movie is far fetched but if you watch it for what it is, which is a good put ya brain to one side action yarn then you won't be disappointed. A fun film with some great one liners and stunts
Lots of action but fell flat. It was watchable just not exciting. Didnt hold my attention no matter how much CGI they used and it was a lot...
Just turn your brain off and enjoy this 2 hours action movie with great cast and awesome action scenes I had so much with it but the concept is something that you've seen 100 times before

A truly awful picture without anything in the way of a plot and made worst by some crazy cutting and editing which made it difficult to follow. There were way too many CGI effects and even though they were mostly excellent it doesn't make up that the story was poor. It seemed to be a cross between Iron man and mission impossible.

reviews.review_title: Thought It would be good the way it started
reviews.content: Was really hoping this would be good because of the way it started but as the film went on i got more confused with the story (if there was one). Cgi is good but goes way overboard. The worst thing tho is the editing.. it is terrible. Mistakes all over the place.

I watched the trailer and I put it on my watchlist. Later I saw the same movie on Netflix and I gave a try. But jeez after 20 minutes I turned off this mess. I mean there was a chase with nice cars in the wonderful city of Florence but I couldn't follow from beginning what's really going on. Then there were nonstop disgusting bloody scenes. I am asking how such a disappointing story could be created without any red line. Perhaps from a complete unexperienced staff but then why Michael Bay for director? I am very disappointed and I give easily 1/10. Don't believe all the good critics here. Totally overrated movie that would even not merit the screening on Netflix. Stay away.
Totally disconnected. Like a bunch of somewhat related action scenes with a lame patchwork story.Actors probably could have done something good if the script had any substance or continuity.

As Bayhem as any Michael Bay film can get, 6 Underground is loud, bombastic & preposterous from the get go yet the execution is so unabashed that despite the glaring issues & shortcomings its premise exhibits, the film as a whole remains a riotously fun & ridiculously entertaining ride that does whatever it set out to do.Opening with a thrilling, if over-the-top, car chase sequence that conveys to the viewers what kind of extravaganza they signed up for, the film only goes more n more bonkers as its thinly layered story progresses yet the unrestrained passion, enthusiasm & energy it exudes at all times has an infectious quality that cannot be downplayed.Another element that stands out is that despite the absurdity of it all, there is a strong moral centre to it that keeps everything in proper perspective. Bay takes the most generic premise, fills it with characters that scream cliché, envelops all of it with his patented action mayhem and still he somehow manages to make it function smoothly.Overall, 6 Underground isn't a film for you if you are trying to make sense of it all even after the opening segment. It's fast, it's furious, it's nonsensical, it's brainless, but purely from entertainment standpoint, it is an endlessly enjoyable & gleefully violent popcorn extravaganza that presents Michael Bay getting the most mileage out of something that others would spectacularly fail at.Just sit back, relax & allow yourself to go with the flow, and you might come out more pleased, surprised & satisfied than usual. Delightfully recommended.

It's a Michael Bay film so you know what you're getting. It's not highbrow, it's shallow and good entertainment. Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds and the supporting cast look like they're having fun. Corey Hawkins adds what little emotional content there is but it's a fun action movie. Plus he finally gets an R rating so no holding back on the violence. It stutters in the middle a little but overall, a decent Saturday night movie.

All the other reviews are correct. This film is shallow, weird, disjointed, entertaining, funny, odd, violent, ridiculous, cool, cringy. I liked it though. Switch your brain off first and just go along for the ride.

I typically enjoy Michael Bay films and I'm well aware of the fact that he loves jump cuts and choppy editing.
That being said; I didn't get past the first ten minutes of this mess of a film. It starts off with a chase scene that is infantile at best and nauseating at worst.First the nausea; there were so many jump cuts, the editing was all over the place that it was really annoying and not at all fun to watch, not if you're older than twelve anyway.The infantile; so, we have Ryan Reynolds and some other actors who I didn't or couldn't recognize because the camera barely focused on them, in a chase scene that made no sense and looked more like a bad video game than an action movie. There was a guy running across roofs, not sure why except that it looked cool, and four people in a car running from the bad guys and engaging in witty repartee while scores of innocent bystanders are killed in terrible ways. I suppose it was supposed to be cool but in fact it was just infantile and pretty offensive. At one point you have the female doctor (we know she's a doctor because of the idiotic intro graphics for each character, sort of like a comic book for children) tell the driver angrily that if he hits one more person she's getting out of the car. They then proceed to hit about a dozen more people without a word from her. Maybe this movie would have worked as a cartoon?And of course it was made in 2019 so you just have to have the hard-ass but beautiful female agent who's a crack shot from a moving car even though she appears to be grievously wounded...please.I imagine this movie would be a teenagers wet dream but for adults....I bailed before the first chase scene even ended. The movie may have gotten better after that but I seriously doubt it and I had better things to do with my time then hang around to find out. While Michael Bay will never be confused with any of the great directors he usually makes fun movies, he needs to dial back a bit on the jump cuts and shaky camera nonsense, and possibly go back to making movies for adults.And as far as the high reviews for this movie, even though there aren't many, you're entitled to your opinion but there's no need to insult those who disagree with it. For those of us who hated this movie it's not that we don't "understand modern cinema", it's not that the movie industry has "passed us by", it's just that we didn't like the movie. if you need to denigrate, dismiss or insult others opinions while writing a movie review you seriously need to grow up.

Don't know why they spent so much money making this trash.
The storyline is senseless. The action is weird and unrealistic.
Six guys taking down everyone without even getting hurt. It makes no sense.
At least some effort should have put to make the action and plot look realistic.
This movie will give you a headache. Skip it to maintain sanity.

reviews.review_title: Easy to follow and enjoy Action flick
reviews.content: 6 Underground is easy and full of adventure and action from start to finish. If you like explosions, a lot of action and over the top effects then Michael Bay is your director. The story is easy enough to follow and if this is suitable for some easy and lazy viewing over the weekend. Just sit back and relax this action flick without worrying too much about dialogue or story.

reviews.review_title: A Michael Bay film that I would recommend to watch
reviews.content: A Michael Bay movie that I really wish came to theatres!! I thought this would be another mindless action film, but it's got a lot more going on than that.There's a lot of cool set pieces to watch out for as well. If you are an action movie fan, you are gonna love this movie!! Storyline is nothing too deep, but it's quite better than I expected.I would also say, this is an A rated Michael Bay movie 😀Watch the movie, you won't be disappointed.

Some guys are driving around Florence in a lime green Alfa Romeo. They are escaping countless other cars, SUVs, motorcycles and billions of bullets being shot. This is at the end of some type of mission which went very wrong. Inside are the driver who ends up dead after all this, the passenger called 1, a pretty Dr. 5, a CIA spook who has been shot and is being operated by 5. Elsewhere part of the team are an angry frustrated hitman, and a robber/parkour artist.When this is over we learn that 1 is a self-made tech billionaire who decided to improve the world so he decided to assemble this team and take out bad guys. They all have to fake their deaths and then live as "ghosts." Their base is an old plane out in the plane graveyard in the California desert. The next mission is to take out the dictator of Turgistan. 1 replaces the driver with...a sniper for some reason. The plan involves staging a coup, taking out the bad dictator, and installing his brother in power. The dictator has his brother basically prisoner in a mansion. So first they have to free the brother, then take over the airwaves with a message to get the people to revolt, and finally grab the dictator and turn him over to the people to face justice.All of this takes forever and is overly complicated and as with Bay movies, all the brain-frying action and noise eventually backfires and make you lose interest and track of whatever the main story is supposed to be. And as with most big budget action movies there's a dizzying amount of globe-trotting going on although here it seems they are going in circles around the same couple of countries often playing the unbelievable role of other countries.In terms of characters, we learn that the hitman has a mother in a convalescent hospital, he starts a relationship with the CIA spook. For a moment there it seemed like we would learn how 1 recruited everybody on the team, but we only learn that for the robber and of course for the sniper. Infuriatingly underused is 5 played by the gorgeous Adria Arjona. We learn noting about her and she doesn't get to do a whole lot in the movie. What makes this movie a bit different is that even though the members of the team are all pros at their respective jobs, the missions tend to go awfully wrong, so that's a bit refreshing here. This isn't the glamorous team that plans impossible jobs and has everything go its way while posing around like models. We are also spared some type of sermonizing which action movies like to do as well of late.I haven't seen Bay movies in decades, but I do enjoy the bright, colorful cinematography also used in 6 Underground. The action is cool, fun, violent, gory. But again somewhere 3/4 into the movie we needed a break from all the mayhem. The characters are ok, the story is alright. The script is "written-for-Reynolds" type stuff. Perhaps slightly less annoying than usual, but still, the bickering between 1 and the hitman could have been toned down. No surprise that it came from the same people behind Deadpool. Reynolds should distance himself from this stuff, it's starting to turn into a caricature of a caricature.Recommended as a fun wild ride of an action movie.

reviews.review_title: Possibly Michael Bay's worst movie ever.
reviews.content:
Still only topped by his Transfomers franchise.A movie about a billionaire leading a team of agents, that are more superheroes than agents. They kill evil men such as dicators and the likes to make the world a better place.The plot is as stupid as the over the top violence,f-bombs and braindead slo-mo action and the shameless world record in product placement in one movie. So much product placement, that the movie actually comes with a warning about it.
Now I don't mind braindead action or extreme violence in movies. Both can be fun. If the story works and the main characters are likeable. Like in the John Wick movies. This movie has neither going for it.So watching a guy drop dead to the ground with entrails coming out of his throat after having his head blown to bits with a flash grenade and then Ryan Reynolds character reacting to that, telling his team they should split up is disgusting and not funny. And I'm not offended by violence at all or oneliners attached to it. But that was too much, even for me. The same goes for the eyeball scene in the movies opening. Disgusting. Non-stop action for 20 or 30 minutes, with no clue about whats happening. Typical Bay.Ryan Reynolds plays the same character/action hero, or himself, if you will, in every movie he is in. Out of the 150 million dollar budget, Reynolds received a paycheck of 27 million dollars. For that money he did a lot of action, said some supposedly funny oneliners and dropped about 200 f-bombs. Not worth the paycheck, if you ask me.In my opinion moviestars and soccer players make way too much money.And don't even get me started on the soundtrack. There was no actual movie score here. Just a lot of the annoying crappy songs, that the stupid kids born in the new millennium, consider good.The worst acting in the movie comes from Payman Maadi, an actual American, whose phony accent made him sound foreign and was the only thing more annoying than his terrible acting.Avoid this unless youre a dimpled teeenbage-boy or some moron in your twenties that prefers violence and action over plot, because youre too stupid to get an intelligent plot. If youre one of those, you will love this crap. Anyone else: watch the John Wick movies instead.As for the moron who says this isnt Scorsese or Mann, but Bay and make it sound like a good thing. FYI buddy: Scorsese and Mann has made some ogf the best masterpieces ever as well as some bad movies. But to compare them to Bay is like comparing a big juicy steak with a beer on the side to a vegan meal with oatmilk on the side. Scorsese and Mann are genius filmmakers. Youre talking about men who made Cape Fear and Heat.

reviews.review_title: Oh, it was a Bay movie.
reviews.content:
Well, I'll be very honest here. I've stopped watching Micheal Bay movies because it's a Bay movie. No storytelling, no drama, shaky cams, bad editing, no continuity etc etc. The same thing happens over and over again in his movies. Transformers, Turtles, and now this.I watched only and solely because of Ryan Reynolds, and it didn't even come in the opening "Directed by: Micheal Bay".... Trust me, if I had seen it in the beginning, I'd have stopped watching it right there and saved my time. I'd rather watch End Game once again to satisfy my entertainment appetite of the weekend evening.Guys, save your time.
Netflix, save your money and have such scripts reviewed first.

Mission impossible on acid,sick of people on here downvoting just because the story fantastic! It is what it says on the tin,its a pure action movie and a fantastically choreographed one at that.If you do not like action movies then turn it off and go watch some arty farty black and white foreign film with subtitles,just so you can try and convince yourselves that you are intelligent!!The film is an adrenaline rush from start to finish,yes the story is not brilliant but it is about the action,also reynolds is on top form as usual

And, I loved it!! What a ride, this was so much fun we almost wanted to watch it again right after first view. This is a splash of every great action movie, great humor, outstanding stunts and cinematography- Don't expect to understand the story line right away, it will come in bits and pieces. I loved every character, the intricate dialog and references. I truly hope there is a second movie!

reviews.review_title: Wham, Bam, Snap, Crackle and Pop
reviews.content: More Michael Bay than a Bay fevered dream, this Netflix movie has action in spades. All the usual, like them or loathe them, Bay touches are here - gratuitous shots from low down of beautiful ladies, throw-away one-liners, his signature cinematography, and (for this 18 rated movie) over-the-top violence.It's not particularly original but the cast are solid and Ryan Reynolds is as likeable as ever as the billionaire who wants to save the world from the bad guys.8 out of 10.
Amazing Amazing Amazing and it's just the beginning

A millionaire decides to take down a dictator- in the most obtuse way possible.This film opens with probably the longest most action packed car chase I have ever seen. tyres screech, cars explode, people lean out of windows firing machine guns or somersault off roof tops.
It is a massive attack on the senses.
It is also very hard hitting and gory.
Bad guys are thrown through their windscreens to have their limbs crushed under wheel. Innocent bystanders are mowed down or catapulted through shop windows.This is a reoccurring theme.
The bad guys are slaughtered in the most gruesome and imaginative way.
And they just keep coming.The action is split up by lots of flash backs about how the team was assembled and a few glossy sex scenes.Ryan Reynolds quips his way through the carnage and it is all great.
The whole plan is as crazy as a bag of frogs and if that bothers you then you are probably looking at the wrong movie.The constant action and gore felt relentless and a little wearing.
If this is your thing though I think you will probably love it.

For a film I assumed would just be another cliche action film I really liked it. It felt really different to most of the modern action films released in the last few years. The storyline was good, the characters were all likeable & the actions scenes were shot in a way that were amazing to watch without being too tacky. Worth a watch especially for a Friday/Saturday night movie. (7.5/10)

I just watched a crap like Fast and Furious. It is obvious from the very first minutes, but I did it on purpose and suggest you not to do. It's just as impossible, naive and inadequate as Fast and Furious, but with the addition of few advertised brands. Even the effects are not top ones.

reviews.review_title: The good: Action. The bad: Editing. Ok, that makes it easy for you
reviews.content: My quick rating - 6,9/10. The good: Action. The bad: Editing. Ok, that makes it easy for you. Now if you are reading on IMDB, ignore any review stating a 1 or 2. That is simply haters of Reynolds or Bay in general. I can understand your dislike, but take off the blinders. This movie is just as much a 1 as it is a 10. Both are moronic ratings and can be disregarded. In reality this movie is exactly what you expect, wall to wall action. The opening car chase is excessively long, and highly entertaining. All of that just to lead you into the movie. For those who just want the action and no story, this movie isn't overly complex, just the method of storytelling will lose you if you aren't paying attention (hence the one ratings by the children on here). Reynolds is the main star, and delivers the usual deadpan one liners throughout, half of which don't seem to hit the mark quite as well as he normally does, but the material wasn't quite as spot on as "Deadpool" so can't blame him for it. Almost seems crazy that a movie of this magnitude and budget heads directly to netflix. I have to say this would've looked great on an IMAX screen. Thoroughly enjoyed this movie, and if you don't understand the quick editing technique, you apparently aren't aware Michael Bay started out making music videos and that is just the way they are shot. Using it in high action scenes is just a style, take it or leave it, but please leave the reviewing for people who have brains and don't allow bias to oversway logic. As I stated before seeing this, grab the popcorn, check reality at the door, kick back with a beer and enjoy 2 hours of nearly non-stop action.

REVIEW - 6 UNDERGROUNDIt seems there is a new A Team in town or should I say the desert, to take down the very bad guys that governments can't or won't.An original Netflix film and actually one of their better one's with......Let's break the film down shall we.Initially the film jumps into their first mission trying to persuade a baddie into giving up the location of 4 generals which will then lead the team to the brother of a dictator who Ryan Reynolds decides should go.Action is amazing and the stunts actually are in a different level, propelling this film way past Bond for stunts and I can only imagine all of the bodies bouncing around are CGI, anyway I digress, story is simple and easy to follow, the flash backs don't really serve any real purpose and could have been included in a sequel (which guaranteed there will be).Directed by Michael Bay the action and stunts are fast so I had to watch the film twice to see them all.Biggest problem for me was the acting, even Ryan Reynolds didn't seem to be him and as for some of the other members of the team, (CIA SPOOK and THE HIT MAN) were just terrible.THE SKYWALKER (no not Luke) was the surprise for me, starting his career in Eastenders!All in all worth a watch, turn your brain off and just enjoy the excuse to put some very good action and stunts together in a film.Rating 8 out of 10

reviews.review_title: Everything is just a bit off..
reviews.content:
I love Reynolds and Laurent, but had quite low expectations. I was still disaponted.
The premisse of the movie should work, but something went wrong somewhere (or everywhere).
Watch Deadpool instead!

I was hooked after 5 minutes. Almost everything about the opening scene is mind-blowing.. soundtrack, visual, craziness etc. The rest of the movie is also great entertainment.Don't get too philosophical about it - just lean back,crank up the surround and enjoy the ride.

Thank u.
Say about the story what u want.
It is fresh and exciting ng from the first until the last.
Amazing cast and Baytastic action.
Please continue maybe with one or two more like it.Please Mr Bay !
Merry Christmas and happy New year!Wfs

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay's "6 Underground" Drags Us Down With It
reviews.content: In the age of three-minute YouTube videos and flashing Instagram stories, 6 Underground is siren-loud in a bid to deafen us long enough to make away with our attention spans. Like a child riding out a sugar rush, it guarantees a sensory overload - and a drilling migraine.The opening of Michael Bay's 2019 action thriller presents us with not one, but six impossibly witty, dexterous and specialized agents led by Gray (Ryan Reynolds), who go on to act as nameless Robin Hoods in a world controlled by soulless, cackling dictators.The opening car chase scene introduces us to the protagonists, thrusting us into their speeding Lamborghini as they annihilate the streets of Italy while trying to get away from the black-robed mafia. Pedestrians are arm-flailing bowling pins to them. For a group of self-proclaimed saviors of humanity, that in itself seems like a contradiction.But it takes us about five minutes to realize that we're going to have to work overtime to connect with any of the characters. Those familiar with Ryan Reynolds' work will perhaps relate to Gray, as he is basically playing himself.How is it possible to engage the audience if the main characters are as disposable as tissues? It's not. They are nameless even within their own circle, choosing to exist as numbers instead, dumping each other's lifeless bodies into the river without shedding a tear. The unnecessarily gory scenes, featuring smashed noses, a gelatinous eye dangling from a squishy optic nerve and harmoniously snapping bones, do little to drive the story forward. If anything, they seem to be a desperate embodiment of the belief that we simply can't look away from a car crash.The movie seems to follow in the footsteps of Zack Snyder's 2011 Sucker Punch. It knits the plot into a video game. There is no concrete goal that the characters are working towards. No single aim to justify their morally-dubious behaviour. Instead, we are gifted with countless villains, popping up at the same time. Again, 6 Underground seems to have adapted the materialistic approach. The more one-dimensional, cartoon-ish criminals, the better.What could save the film in the eyes of a selected few would be the explosive visuals and eye-catching cinematography. Like a beautifully designed video game providing surface-level engagement. Stupefying our senses.All in all, maybe skipping certain parts, like the story intervals interrupting an action-packed video game, would make it more bearable. Letting your thoughts race and hover somewhere above the television screen. Then again, I can't imagine a three-minute YouTube video failing to divert your attention from the flashing screen while 6 Underground is on.
I think Michael Bay doesn't know how films work. Meanwhile Ryan Reynolds doesn't know how humor worked in Dead Pool 1 and why it doesn't work in DP2.
Just.. bad.....Just a bad film. The editing was bad and confusing and the plot holes are bigger than the massive black hole in the centre of the galaxy..

This film opens with a 20 minute car scene before you have any idea what's really happening or who's who or why you care. Tons of very tight close-ups of the people in the car and then wide shots of the cars tearing through the streets. I started to get sooo bored with that. Car chases work best when you know who's involved and what's at stake. The whole movie played like that - favoring action shots over story. If you LOVE car chases for the visual spectacle, you might love this though.

reviews.review_title: Except the worse cuts, liked the movie.
reviews.content: It's a Friday night movie guys, come on! I don't understand the hate this movie is getting.
It's a great movie. It's like an updated upgraded Bad Boys with a benevolent Ryan Reynolds twist. If you like Ryan Reynolds and Michael Bay movies then look no further. It was tons of fun to watch.

reviews.review_title: One of the best action movies I've seen in a long time
reviews.content: This movie alone was worth my monthly subscription to Netflix. I absolutely LOVE this movie. It reminds me of a mix between Mission Impossible and Italian Job. The action and dialogue work perfectly for a FUN movie. You gotta go into the movie with the mindset of suspending belief and just having fun. Those people who don't like Fast & Furious type of action will NOT like this. The production quality and editing was 10/10. I've NEVER seen action scenes so explicit and detailed as are shown in this movie at a mind-bogglingly high quantity. I just kept thinking how much  money did they spend on this movie!!? I was constantly rewinding scenes to observe and appreciate the intricate detail and special effect that was poured into it. The first 15 minute car chase scene alone had more detail and special effects than most great action movies do for the entire film. This movie was a fun experience!!

reviews.review_title: The definition of a mindless action film
reviews.content: Bad: Continuity errors, plot holes, a generic action plotGood: REALLY good CGI scenes, tonnes of action, explosionsThese hitmen work for a billionaire, yet the cars that they drive have no bulletproof armor plating, and they themselves don't even have bulletproof vests... so this billionaire either cares very little about his crew, OR that's just another plot hole amoungst the dozens of other plot holes in this movie.Another plot hole is that they don't use an EMP Generator in the movie... that would have solved a huge problem for the group, but apparently, a billionaire can't afford an EMP or something.Overall, it's a mindless action movie, that will deliver an overdose of explosions and pretty ladies, if that's what you're looking for. 7/10

reviews.review_title: An action movie which delivers on the action, but lacks a cohesive plot and character development.
reviews.content: A good action movie which lacks a cohesive plot and character development.The movie opens with Ryan Reynold's character jumping out of a plane, which is going down. Then, it cuts back to four months prior to a car chase with gunfire and killing.
