There's not a real story here - the main character of One (Reynold's) doesn't explain why he's in a car chase with other people.For the entirety of the movie, you kind of get what they characters are doing and why, but there's no real character development; just a titbit of background and the rest open-fire.The real adventure nuts might enjoy it, as it's a pure adrenaline rush of a movie, and while I enjoyed it, I need depth to the story as well as fleshed out characters, which you think that a movie such as this goes for two hours and eight minutes could afford.Because of the lack of character development, I didn't feel much empathy for the characters.Some of the soundtrack choices are a bit predictable and felt that they shouldn't be there, but, instead, replaced by something else.It was kind of funny, but kind of not.The way that this movie was edited, too, left something to be desired; it was all over the place in the narrative!I like Ryan Reynolds and that is why I decided to watch this film, as well as after reading the synopsis. However, I wouldn't say that the action started after he faked his own death, though, as the synopsis would lead you to believe, but before.Would I watch it again? Eh. It was good and action-packed, but I don't know if it's worth watching again, in all honesty.

reviews.review_title: Big produced action movie without much substance
reviews.content: In the first ten minutes, you will know its Michael Bay production - impaled bodies, exploding heads, flying teeth (all in slow-mo, of course) worth of $150 million budget. Unfortunately, the core of the story is something we have all seen before: special teams kills bad guys and we all go home happy. Ryan Reynolds is doing the same things he lately does and at this point it is quite boring. The end result is a sporadically entertaining yet predominantly overblown action movie highly recommend just to fans of such films, because "6 Underground" has more clichés, action scenes and special effects than this film really needs.Rating: 6

Started writing this review an hour into this film!!! What an absolute waste of time, complete turkey. Didn't think I would be able to sit through the full thing.This is the worst big budget film I have ever seen!!!!Poorly edited, is the shaky camera style still a thing?What was Reynolds thinking doing this?Shockingly bad writing and just a mess all round.

Well, I am known for being very critical about movies, and I usually give low ratings unless I am suitably entertained. So, sorry for all those folk who gave 1 and 2 star ratings, this is a really good movie, plenty of action, never a dull moment. Yes, some scenes are ridiculous, but that is movies for you. From the very start, this film was fast paced, quite brutal in fact. There is a hell of a lot going on; and to all those who complained about the slow motion scenes, no, they really really work. If these scenes had not been in slo mo it would have been far too quick and the impact of the stunts would have gone unnoticed. There are some excellent stunts in this movie, they really put a lot of effort into the production of this film. I will be watching this again, because there is so much going on, I reckon I have missed somethings. I give it a 9 star rating instead of a 10 only because a few moments were silly; i.e. Bullets don't just cause a dent on the metal of a car, they go straight through, and would injure or kill anyone inside the car. But if you put the silliness aside, this is a really good movie to watch. Go for it!

reviews.review_title: The best looking movie on Netflix
reviews.content:
6 UndergroundStraight to Netflix for this Michael Bay/Ryan Reynolds action fest.
We the audience are the lucky ones.
It's a movie we probably wouldn't pay to see but one that's a welcome free treat just before Christmas.
Anyone criticising this movie for its obviously poorly written script, silly plot and general lack of coherence are missing the point.
This is Michael Bay on some kind of drugs.
It's Bayhem cranked up to eleven.
The opening car chase involving a gorgeous green Alfa Romeo Giulia Quadrifoglio is evidence of this and it's pure car porn.
Bay has truly been let off the leash.
Netflix must have given him a big bunch of cash and told him to go do some crazy sh**!Six untraceable agents operate off the grid. They're ghosts having faked their own deaths.
Burying their pasts so they can change the future.
A mishmash of Mission Impossible, The Expendables and The Losers.
It's pure popcorn fun. Not to be taken seriously.
This film is like a 2hr 7 minute long MTV music video.
It's glitzy and stylised but with no real substance.
Littered with mistakes and lack of continuity. Bay has spent more time focusing on the crash bangs and wallops and forgot small details like when a vehicle gets damaged only to be magically unscathed in the next shot.
But let us turn a blind eye as this is pure eye candy.
Bringing me on to the movies greatest strength.
6 Underground looks absolutely stunning.
A UHD Dolby Vision presentation, this is the best looking movie available on Netflix.
The Dolby Vision High Dynamic Range compliments Michael Bays style of film direction.
Colours pop and blacks are inky. If you own a 4K TV with Dolby Vision compatibility then prepare to have your socks blown off!
Detail is razor sharp. Every pore,wrinkle and facial hair is visible on Ryan Reynolds face.
Car paintwork shimmers and glistens.
Beautiful people look even more beautiful.
Sunsets and neon lights are squintingly bright.
This film boasts many specular highlights that will showcase the talents of a good TV or HDR projector.
Each scene fizzes with visual splendour.
If this film looks this radiant on Netflix imagine how good it's going to be on 4K Blu-ray with absolutely no compression.In terms of audio quality,
6 Underground is offered with Dolby Atmos object based audio.
This yet again is demo worthy.
Remember people this is streaming content but it is still mightily impressive.
Bass is deep with gunfire and explosions giving the most macho of subwoofers a thorough workout.
Surround sound effects are steered masterfully around the room.
The Alfa Romeo's sonorous 2.9 litre turbo V6 is bellowed through each speaker during the opening car chase.
Enough to give a petrol head an orgasm.
Music pounds the senses with a rather long listed soundtrack.
Like I said this could have been a feature length MTV video.
Height channels are constantly fed something to have you staring up at your ceiling. A certain scene as a helicopter flys overhead was very impressive.So to sum up, 6 Underground is a mediocre movie in terms of storytelling.
For the most part there is no story. But as a visually engaging piece of entertainment, Michael Bay has done what he always does.
He's given us eye candy.
A 2hr long TV demo reel.
You can just see a leading TV manufacturer using this film to showcase their latest model.
Take your brain out and enjoy.

reviews.review_title: It's a Bay movie, have fun!
reviews.content: It was meant to be entertaining, not some crazy high end story that you'll remember for the rest of your life. That's Michael Bay for you, so have fun with it!

6 Underground (2019, Michael Bay)
Holy Michael Bay Batman! Between this film and 'The Irishman' it becomes apparent that in order to lure big name directorial talent to their banner Netflix allows film makers an exceptional amount of latitude to tell the story they want to. They give it to Cuaron and we get this sprawling black and white Mexican family drama 'Roma'. They give it to Scorsese and we get the 3 and half hour gangster epic 'The Irishman'. So what happens when you give that to Michael Bay? You get '6 Underground'. His visual euphoria and tools are so distinctive it is impossible not to know in the first 30 seconds of this film that you are watching nothing other than a Bay movie. He even channels his inner John Woo with some slow motion birds. After three minutes I texted a friend and said something to the effect of I feel like Michael Bay just ejaculated in my eye. He is that off the rails with his style in '6 Underground'. Lense flairs, quick edits, swooping pans, exploding cars every where. Everything is designed to illustrate form over function. Oh yeah there is an actual story here I guess. Ryan Reynolds heads a covert unaffiliated team of operatives who are starting to right some of the wrongs governments can't. Reynolds is mega quadzillionaire that got a bug up his ass one day and turned Dudley Do Right meets Deadpool. He faked his own death and now operates in complete anonymity off the grid. He has cobbled together five other specialists who share his cause and his fake death fate hence the title. The rest of the story really bares little consequence as this is all just an excuse to blow up, destroy and shoot stuff in new and invigorating ways. We do it in cool vehicles, with cool weapons and wind up with cool effects all shot in Bay's signature full on jazz hands style. I will say the inundation of sheer visual stimuli is a bit much and the script is beyond clunky, but this is destined to be a guilty pleasure cheese fest of the highest order. Sure it doesn't have many redeeming qualities or much in the way of brains but sometimes that is exactly how we want our action spectacles served. I genuinely struggle how to grade this. In the end I feel I must grade it as trash, but it is extremely slick trash, and hey, at the very least it has Ryan Reynolds in it!
Eric's Grade: D+

reviews.review_title: You like Michael Bay? You like this.
reviews.content: It's a Michael Bay action movie. You know what you get. I liked it and if you're reading this then I'm sure you'll like it too.

This is a great film if you are an action movie lover. The story is good. The best thing is of course it's action. Michael Bay did a good job with all the action shots. Some humorous are also here. Definitely worth a watch.

If you are ready to ignore the nonsense plot, geography crap etc then you can actually have great fun with this movie.And it features the longest, wildest and just crazy car chase scene I have ever seen...

This movie start and end with BANG!!!!!Action scenes were choreographed with lot of thought and you will definitely enjoy them. But when it comes to story, its pretty straightforward and there is hardly any depth to characters. Movie also has some damn good songs :P. If you are just looking to spent some good time and dont want to watch any dark or slow burn moves, watch it, its worth your time :)

reviews.review_title: The Michael Bay you expect with some Ryan Reynolds humor added
reviews.content: 6 Underground doesn't lie to the consumer. We are promised an action packed Michael Bay adventure with a bit of star power and that is what we get. Ryan Reynolds is brilliant as the protagonist billionare. I am starting to think my man has no acting range, but then again, I don't mind given that the niche he fills is so novel. A good film for straight to Netflix.

From the very first minute you will wonder how big the budget is, obviously there are many useless showoff things throughout the movie.
After watching this movie I realized that there are only 2 underground i.e. Four and seven because all other characters were just wasteful. Number 6,the driver 😂😂, I prefer them to call Baby Driver for his replacement. Throughout the movie only two characters did really good action scenes 4&7 that's why I titled it 2 underground.
But I liked some parts of this movie but the problem Michael Bay's film creates is a lot of chaos which makes your mind disturbed. Whatever the movie was good and bad both. The story and action was not so impressive. So I don't think you should waste your important time but if you are totally free you can go for it.

reviews.review_title: All that's wrong with films today
reviews.content:
What a terrible film
A pop video crossed with a car advert crossed with a computer game written by AI
And I quite like Ryan Reynolds but even his quirky charm couldn't save this turkey

reviews.review_title: It's ok. But it felt like this was the draft...
reviews.content: Could've been much better, a lot of inconsistencies, a few examples:1. they lose a driver and talk about needing a replacement so they pick a sniper.2. They speak about a code that you have to follow when you're a ghost; everyone breaks the code. (Family visits, leave behind those that fall behind)3. It's all over the place, I love that it's taking place all over the world but it doesn't tie in nicely.4. Attack on the boat happens during day time and suddenly turns into nighttime5. Music is a hit and miss, it's not hard to get it right but they never tune the mood with the music properly.6. Villain is an amazing actor but was underused and poorly written7. We get backstories on all the characters but they feel irrelevant8. Bombs are placed in a lot of places but no one seems to notice and how did they do that so fast?9. Fastest Civil uprising I've ever seen in a movie. Someone shouts revolution and 15 minutes laters they have banners and marches through the streets?10. What kind of a safe house is a boat full of guests that can just come and go as they please, no one has security checks?11. It's their second mission and they talk about how they were the best of the best but their plans and execution is really lacking and fails12. Ryan didn't even think they'd make it as far as getting on the boat yet the plan was to stage a coup?A lot of other stuff...But I kind of enjoyed the movie, just felt like a Netflix movie again...
Not bad at all. Some great action scenes and the effects in the movie are top quality. Some bits unrealistic but hey it's an action film. If you're a fan of action then give it a watch.

reviews.review_title: Explosive! Edgy and Super Cool - Bay Style.
reviews.content: Tired of Dramas? Sit Back - Get some popcorn - and chill with this explosive action flick - Michael Bay style.

reviews.review_title: Plan 9 from out of space in 2019
reviews.content: Edwards directing of Plan 9 Grom out of Space had less cinematic sequence errors, less plot confusion and less than this film. And Plan 9 has held the worst directed Hollywood film for decades. Move over Ed... M Day has made history for a more confusing badly directed crap

I had to give a slightly higher review due to all the people review bombing this because they either dislike Michael Bay or were expecting a Oscar sweeping Best Picture. It's a fun movie that looks sleek and has everything you want in a big popcorn action flick. For the people nitpicking, try and grow up and the people who said they couldn't follow it, they must have never seen a "Motion" picture, me, my wife and my senior mother had no problems following it whatsoever. So unless my senior mother is sharper than 50% of the viewing audience I smell a rat. It's a fun movie to kick back, relaxe and enjoy.

Thank you Michael Bay for another action packed movie. I hoped for a Bay movie and I got it. Watch it in a home theater though. Not on your phone or iPad. The sound of the cars, helicopters, explosions and music will fly all around you. You have to experience this movie. Not just watch it. Loved the editing to. And the acting. And everything actually. Can't wait for his next movie.
Action, funny, intertainment for Friday night! Just sit, watch It, and relax.... do not listen the hate...

reviews.review_title: Legit 1/10 how does Michael Bay get employed?
reviews.content:
This movie is absolutely atrocious. I am honestly baffled how Bay manages to get funding for his movies. This had the worst editing of any movie i have ever seen. The green car in the begining constantly changed from new to damaged in the span of merely seconds. The music is completely unfitting. There is blatant advertising for Captain Morgan and other brands with second long shots just showing a brand. Furthermore, the dialogue is so terrible that it had to be purposely bad.
This movie has no redeeming qualities, just overdone explosions that have been boring since the first Transformers.
There are not many movies deserving of a 1/10, but this is certainly one of them.

Over the top Bourne style (ish) action movie that isn't scared to show death. Biggest complaint I've seen is innocent death. Wake up people, bond isn't real, Hollywood car chases that never hit anyone? Just wouldn't happen!!
It's crazy, a little gory, probably controversial and maybe has a little 'hidden' political message, or something...
... But it's Ryan Reynolds. It has humour. It's tongue in cheek. And it's great!!!

reviews.review_title: I also agree that this is the most Michael Bay movie that Michael Bay ever Michael Bayed
reviews.content: Anything you expect from his movies is in this and then some. I knew nothing about this movie going into it, and I was like man these guys really like Michael Bay's work and lolz low and behold it was him the whole time. Every now and then one of his films huts the spot. So what if the story is secondary to all of the madness.

reviews.review_title: Over the top action for the sake of action, I fell asleep half way
reviews.content: There are good action comedies, heck even Bay has made a couple...this was not one of them. You can see what Bay is after and Reynolds is joking your ears off so you REALLY get the "comedy" part... but it's just not funny. It's like Bad Boys 2, way way too long and way too silly to keep you interested. You've seen this movie a thousand times, you just can't remember the names...and you won't remember this one either.

reviews.review_title: Watch if you love action to different level
reviews.content: Michael Bay, as usual, delivered a hard core action packed movie this time again. Its a team of six whom world forgot but they want to do something great. Like always the team sets up things into correct hands and save the country. (This time it was not the universe).Anyways, story is plain and nothing new but what hooked me up was the action. I knew Michael would not disappoint and his totem worked again. Loads of action with new styles and ways. Seriously i think like how can someone think of such great moves and techniques.7 stars from my side for the Direction and Action.
It was a good action movie .. story bit weak.. too complicated at times.. but very very watchable .. 👍👍👍
I watched this movie only because Ryan Reynolds is in it. The story and the editing of the movie is confusing and a mess. Michael Bay isn't my favourite film director but this isn't his wort movie.

reviews.review_title: Save yourself the torture of watching this film
reviews.content:
Maybe not the dumbest movie I've ever seen (Netflix's Secret Obsession ranks first), but this is a close 2nd. Lost a few IQ points watching this. Save yours and skip it.
Note to the actors:
Really, Ryan Reynolds? You're better than this. So is Melanie Laurent. You got a big paycheck to shoot some guns and kill lots of people while looking good doing it. Kudos to you but unfortunately, Michael Bay made a terrible movie for you to star in.

For a film just over 2 hours long there is not a lot to say. It's all car chases, explosions and fun fights.
6 people presumed dead bankrolled by a billionaire try to make the world a better place by taking out evil dictators from around the world.
The story is simple and the action is non stop. It was ok but too much action and not enough storytelling and acting for me.

reviews.review_title: One of 2019's worst movies and I didn't even expect much.
reviews.content:
I felt compelled to write my first review here simply because this movie actually managed to make me mad.Coming in, I did not expect much from this movie. I thought it would at least be a passable, mildly fun action film. That was all I wanted out of it, judging by Michael Bay's filmography. And here's why.Pros:
It's on Netflix so you don't have to leave home I guess? (I'm trying my hardest to find anything good to say about it.)Cons:
Decent stunt work and practical effects ruined by bad editing and directing. You can tell the people behind the scenes gave it their best but sadly the effort and work were squandered by quick cuts, shaky cams and pointless slo-mo. Most of the action scenes would have been intense enough without all the aforementioned editing. It's as if Bay didn't trust the talent behind the stunts and felt the need to edit this way to add tension.Bad acting and poorly written script. Every character is unlikable and stays unlikable throughout the movie. You don't root for anyone or feel that their motivation makes sense.Even Ryan Reynolds doesn't look like he wants to be this movie. Not even one joke landed for me. Not a single chuckle. Plans go wrong not because of unforeseeable circumstances, but because of poor/lack of planning and execution. If the characters don't take a life-and-death situation seriously, why should you? And they are supposedly handpicked because of their skills by a billionaire genius with near limitless funding.Boring plot that is so easy to follow, yet the movie tries its best to confuse you with expositions. It punishes you for paying attention to details and you feel like the more you know about the characters, the more you hate them. Going in with your brain turned off is the least painful way to watch.Again, I would have been more than happy if the film had been just a mindless but fun action flick that you forget exists 5 mins after watching it but I felt as if it went out of its way to infuriate me for no reason.
I could not get past the first five minutes. The camera is just shaking around all over the place. This is wobbly cam heaven. Not for me...

reviews.review_title: Must love action...and even then, still meh
reviews.content: If anyone other than Ryan Reynolds played One, I'd have stopped watching during the first 15 minutes of the longest pointless car chase in the history of long pointless car chases. This movie is way longer than it needs to be. The editing is bad, and the back stories of the characters are incomplete... it makes the whole thing hard to watch.If you REALLY love action and don't care if things make sense...you might dig this film.
I had to turn it off like Transformers: The Last Knight. Another absurd action movie from Bay.

Are we supposed to laugh at people getting hurt and killed as collateral damage during chase scenes? If I could give zero stars I would. I lasted 20 minutes into this utter garbage before switching it off.

This is just an excuse for a string of noisy, staged action sequences, interspersed with pointless exposition and juvenile dialogue. The endless stream of baddies are casually slaughtered. Everything seems to be a joke for these characters but I wasn't laughing. This is worse, much worse than you can possibly imagine.

reviews.review_title: Not every movie needs to be Oscar material
reviews.content: All you need to know is that it's directed by Michael Bay. Don't go in expecting a solid plot or Oscar worthy dialogues. It's fast, at times funny, has some great visuals and it's entertaining enough for a night on the couch. You won't really remember this movie in two years time, but hey, some movies are made to be remembered or become a cult classic, some are meant to simply entertain for a few hours. This one is the latter and it reaches its purpose just fine.

Ignore the negative reviews , this ain't boring at all.
This is a fun, action packed rollercoaster of a movie with stunning visuals , great comedy and lots of feel good thrown in .

reviews.review_title: You better lose yourself in the music, the moment.
reviews.content:
Michael Bay gets to play with his Transformers sound effects box again, in this all action revenge film from the writers behind Deadpool and Zombieland. Car chases, gun fights, far fetched special effects and black humour are blended together to form a smoothly shot - if not always believable - thrill ride.Ryan Reynolds is almost too cool for the James Bond style action here, when your supposed to support his back story that the story builds on. Propping up the bar and trading barbs with the main bad guy - while swigging from a bottle of Aviator Gin (guessing that was in the contract) - sure. Planning all the action and calling the shots, yeah; he's the boss and it's his show.
But then he loses his cool in a car chase or something breaks and you remember he's Van Wilder, rather than James Dyson meets Chuck Norris, which kind of breaks the spell.
Similar to Bad Neighbours Dave Franco (6). Sure, he was good in Now You See Me, yet here his role limits his potential.
Comparatively, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo (3) gets a good mix of action and humour, getting quite a few of the best lines and situations.The flash backs fill in some of the character development and can definitely see there being a sequel

6 underground has great action and great comedi. Also for those who like Micheal Bay or likes action comedy movies this is a no brainer. And for all Ryan Renolds fans this is a really great movie for you all too.

reviews.review_title: Another Michael Bay movie, but with Ryan Reynolds
reviews.content: Michael Bay is a terrible filmmaker. His narratives and editing are all over the place. But his gross sense of humor and thrillingly violent scripts redeem him. Ryan Reynolds' character is not very relatable, but he is funny as always and acts the part well enough. If you don't understand Michael Bay or Ryan Reynolds, this film will horrify you. But if you do and just want to have fun, definitely recommend. Netflix wins again.
Stay away very very very bad movie Netflix movies are so bad and this actors get paid a lot of money for a horrible movie

Who gave his money to produce this? The story was cheap and boring... The cast to good for this flick... Mr. Bay pls you can do better... Just a waste of time and money... Stop doing movies like that...
The story was fine. The action was really well-made. The cast is very charming and delivers the humor very well. But the movie is boring most of the time. The plot is nothing special and predictable.
I stopped watching after 15 mins of a stupid chase scene around Florence.

reviews.review_title: Bay and Reynolds love child movie. But it does have a noticeable running flaw.
reviews.content: So as the title says, this is what a lovechild of Michael Bay and Ryan Reynolds looks like. Lots of over the top action and explosions. It's got every emotion from humor, to sadness, to even some uncomfortable moments. Very much a "Hard R" movie. Obviously it's not for kids, and probably even some adults.I won't go into spoilers but I will say while it is a great action packed movie, the one flaw that seems to run throughout it is a weird pacing/editing issue. I'm no movie critic, I normally would not notice these things. But this movie suffers from this badly.Most movies have a start, middle and and end. The start tends to be an intro to whatever is going on. And it goes from there through its steps. But this has random sections where Ryans character "1" narrates on why the group is who they are. And every time its almost the same thing he said the time before but worded differently. It's as if they kept adding "intros" that should have been at the start, through the whole movie. Just feels weird.And you get into the random editing/pacing. Randomly you will go into a character's back story. And its not like you really realize it sometimes. It will just suddenly say on screen "3 "and some back story plays of 3s character. And its made worse by the movie being all over the place. One second they are in one place talking about something, the next there is a back story, the next they are in a new country talking about something else, then there is a new scene with a "bad guy" (mind you, they don't say where), then its back to some talking about why they are who they are, then them back at another scene. Random sex, random violence, random everything.I am in no way saying this movie is terrible. I gave it a 7 after all. Just saying be prepared for editing that feels like a little kid put it together at times. If you can get past that, it's not bad of a action movie. Also, don't expect any Oscars for this.

reviews.review_title: Great cast, premium action, zone out and enjoy
reviews.content: Firstly I have to admit I'm a Ryan Reynolds fan. He could narrate a documentary about grass growing, and I'd like it. Some people are born entertainers; he is one. Now back to this movie.The action is first class and what we should expect from one of the greatest action directors of our time coupled with a large budget.Anyone who has an issue with the acting is probably taking things a bit seriously and missing the point of this movie. I'd advise them to loosen up their tighty-whities.It's not an emotional roller coaster, it's not Oscar-worthy, but it's worth a watch if you enjoy a well-made film with a rock solid cast and kick-ass action sequences. I gave this 10/10 as I'm reviewing this film within its genre and it hits the mark.Zone out (in) and enjoy.

It's a good action movie and acting was good, but editing between 2 action scenes was made without any thought or logic.You jump from one side of the planet to the other side without any clues about why and how. Also a lot of inconsistencies with the materials, like the car is almost broken during the chase, then the next scene the car is like brand new...Having said that, if you like action movies with some fun in it, you'll like it.

Positive:
insane start scenecrazy, entertaining and varied actionRyan ReynoldsNeutral:
Deadpool-like gags (some may see it as an upgrade, others as ridiculous and cheesy)Negative:
stupid storyexcessive violence (blood fountains, headshots in slow motion, exploding heads)missing personality of rest of the ensemble

The movie is a classic action movie with thousands of special effects.Probably too much action.It's a high budget movie, $150m and indeed the effects are magnificent.But nothing to say wow for.For sure they plan to make other 14 episodes?
Just have fun, Bay at its finest. Beautiful women, guns, fast cars, explosions. :3
This movie is like a breath of fresh air. Probably the best Netflix original so far (which pretty much all sucked).

reviews.review_title: I truly enjoyed this movie from start to finish
reviews.content: Fun action comedy I would like to see sequel to get the rest of the worst in the box .

reviews.review_title: Gee, How About A Story Guys...
reviews.content: Into local music, sound effects, and CGI stuff? If so, this flick is for you. Opening chase runs endlessly. All down hill from there. 150 mil? I want my Netflix bill lowered. Stop producing CRAP like this.

reviews.review_title: Each new film seems to want to up the violence quotient
reviews.content: I guess over the years they've gotten very good at faking it, although all those vehicles destroyed were not faked, I don't think. Other than that the action is pretty spectacular, but the plot needs work, as do the characters.They tried to give each a backstory, but the second woman was pretty anonymous by the end. She didn't get to do much of anything, except treat a gunshot wound in a fast moving car at the beginning. I don't recall if she got a backstory.For a plot, they go after their #1 pick for their sleazebag list and the whole film consists of their efforts to thwart him. What about the guy at the beginning? Or any of the others? For sequels perhaps?I suppose there will be some. Ryan Renolds does a pretty good job with his role, so I expect they'll like him back. Same for most of the others. But they can always be replaced with new "dead" members.

Editing is as terrible as Michael Bay's other films but the casts are fun to watch along with tons of action and explosions. It's an action flick, not an Oscar material, don't expect too much from it.

So my first thought was, Damn, Netflix is making a ton of money to finance this kind of project. And while I admit I can't really tell what's CGI generated, there seems to be enough real cars and stunts here to make me go Wow, cool!So if you're familiar with the tv Mission Impossible, it's basically that gone hipster with an unlimited budget & no constraints on who or how many bad guys to kill. Is it realistic? Meh. Is it a fun movie? Oh yeah.Ryan Reynolds appears to be playing Ryan Reynolds, never heard of the other actors (wait, wasn't that one guy in the Denzel Washington Magnificent Seven?), and this movie sure makes you miss traveling in these quarantine times. It appears to be set up for sequels & stuff, they're probably at it right now. We'll be waiting.
It's the best parts of Archer, Die Hard, Mission Impossible, Deadpool and The Expendables...It's a Bay film...just have fun. It's amazing.

I know what you're thinking: "It can't be that bad, it has action and Ryan Reynolds". Well, you're mistaken.You will need to turn off your brains to ignore how stupid this move is, but at the same time you will need the full strength of your brain to try and follow the so called "plot" with the fast cuts and poor editing.The only thing going for this movie is its body count, so if that's what you're looking for, I would recommend putting the movie on mute and fast forwarding to those parts.

Good action , a lot of filming technique, very extra and high budget , but the story plot made no sense... too fast pace, too messy, hard to follow, this movie is built with money but no content ... would recommend .. if you play this movie in the background and while multi tasking... otherwise .. don't bother wasting ur attention on this movie

Michael Bay is back, and he is back with a vengeance. The explosions are more explosive! The death scenes more gruesome. The one-liners more throwaway. The car chases more chasey! The gun fights more shooty and there is a magnetic weapon which has some fantastically disgusting consequences.Ryan Reynolds is One, a billionaire who has faked his own death and recruited a team to help him set right the wrongs in the world. No names allowed just numbers. Their biggest mission yet is to replace a dictator with his far friendlier brother.Ryan Reynolds is at his wise-cracking best, throwing jokes and abuse around like bullets from a machine gun, but he also has a slight harsh edge to this character as well. Melanie Laurent is Two, an ex-CIA operative, hard as nails and twice and dangerous as anyone else in the film. Manuel Garcia-Rulfo is Three, a hitman with a great tendency to quote films whilst he fights. 'I see dead people' is my favourite, the timing is just perfect. He is an actor that is fast becoming one of my favourite action stars. Ben Hardy is Four, a parkour runner who gets in a whole world of poop during the film. Which is fair enough as everyone else has some kind of military training and he runs up walls really quickly. He is also the character you worry about most of all, a very likeable actor and character. Adria Arjona is Five, a Doctor, and we honestly do not learn much more about her, except she is bliming handy with a scalpel during a high-speed chase. Dave Franco is Six, and his scenes at the wheel of the getaway car are some of the funniest! And Corey Hawkins in new recruit Seven, a sniper with a past. Never leave a man behind!The reviews of this film have not been great, but we absolutely loved it. Shell loves a good death scene, and this has some of the goriest and funniest ones going. The characters interacts really well and are a team you cannot help but like. It is fast, action packed, funny and well-written and acted. Hopefully this is the start of a series of films. A 17 Underground from me.

Ghost avengers coming out of nowhere in anonymity, starting the fire for a revolution against a tyrannic ruler
Unstoppable action, with lots of special effects and spy technology

Okay okay okay. Yes the plot is, let's say...thin. BUT you are watching a Michael Bay Movie sooo you should expect that. Action is entertaining, bayhem is still a thing. The often criticized editing is nothing you need to worry about except you really want to find something negativ. Reynolds is great as always, the rest also fine. The sets are spectacular and something new. Expect a good action film and watch it.
Whatever the movie is missing you wont notice, due to the never ending action scenes. This movie has amazing action scenes. A fun movie.

This movie is a waste of time. This movie has all the elements of a Transformers movie without the Transformers and with a real story. Sure a billionaire decides to spent money to get bad guys. Why? Dumbest plot ever. And of course the prettiest people are former CIA and other operatives who also want nothing more than to risk their lives to get bad guys! OMG, how stupid can it be...well... it is! Yes, there are fast cars, pretty people, and of course without a real story they have to have some gratuitous sex. Dumb, dumb, dumb! This is 2 hours you can spend watching something else that is entertaining. I wish I saw that Michael Bay directed it before I started watching it. It would have explain why the movie was sooo bad.
Deadpool without the mask. Really enjoy the opening scene. You won't be disappointed. Highly recommended.
It's just a very good, very funny, typical Ryan Reynolds movie. I love it.

Good God! With a budget and a cast like this, one would expect that an extremely basic cinematographic concept of CONSISTENCY would be a priority..... many slight inconsistencies have been noticed in mainstream, even award winning films before. Nothing as major as this though, five minutes into the film I rewinded to try and figure out when Franco lost his cap, and if cars can re-grow side mirrors, then eventually kept playing to see the cap magically appeared and then disappeared again and again. The Architect of the Szechenyi Chain Bridge in Budapest committed suicide because he neglected to think of designing the lions with tongues, the least the composer of this ostrosity could do is issue a public apology for ruining possible award winning stunts, special effects, acting and a great story line with his lack of expertise in scene composition. Does a Chef taste his own food?? Did Michael Bay, Ian Bryce, Dana Goldberg, David Ellison, Don Granger watch the movie before deciding to release it? If
I accidentally used a toilet brush to whisk my creme brulee instead of a professionally acceptable kitchen utencil, I would rather serve cheap bread than knowingly serving baked feces...

reviews.review_title: $150 million could have been spent more wisely
reviews.content: Hmm 150 million dollars for a movie with poor editing, poor dialogue, disconnected scenes, hard to follow story, ridiculous things happening left right and centre...Imagine if netflix funded 150 small films with promising new directors. You could easily make 150 good films for the cost of this one bad one.Also, does anyone actually believe that laughing gas is a thing? Nitrous oxide does not make people just fall about laughing like that. It does feel like the story was written by a thirteen-year-old.

reviews.review_title: Brain dead M. Bay movie. More like a music video.
reviews.content:
This movie is mostly brain dead and has been crafted the wrong way. To make a good move you need to first have at a least triumvirate of:
1) Good story -not in this movie
2) Good script / dialogue - not in this movie
3) good characters - not in this movieThen to make a good movie into a great movie add:
4) epic sound track -this movie has Epic Muse sound track!
5) epic IGI special Fx - this movie has epic M Bay bullet time cgi
6) epic cinematography - this move has average cinematography
7) good sets and costumes - this movie has good sets and costumesIn conclusion the movie is more of a music video filled with computer game like CGI bullet time images of headshots, but no other substance.

The editing of this movie is so confusing, makes you dizzy. What a mess.
Movie is ok for entertaiment 6/10
The car must be made of the same steel coursing through my grandads veins. Zero damage even after all the violence of the opening scene

This movie is a mess from start to the final shot of the movie. Every scene is cringe worthy and despite sincere efforts i couldn't find one scene that justifies its huge budget. Its just a compilation of action scenes that urge you to stop caring about the movie. Watch it when you're high and maybe you'll like it. Lastly, the innumerable hip hop tracks are the worst thing about this movie. I beg netflix to not order a sequel to this garbage and pity it for trusting Michael Bay.

reviews.review_title: It's a Bay film...but Bay uncensored...
reviews.content: ...what you think of the film will come down to what you think of Michael Bay films in general. If you don't like his fast paced, quick cuts, slow panning circular shots then avoid this like the plague. If you can't check your expectation for script and character before you press play, then avoid,If, like me, you're a fan of Bay's work then I'd hazard a guess you will love this. One of the best openings of any action film sets the tone and pace which never lets up. The stunts, locations and colour shine throughout he film. The main cast are all likeable with Reynolds his usual charming and watchable rogue. The story and script of the film - as is par for a Bay film - are simply there to take you from one set piece to the next and I appreciate some people want more than that. For me, films can be many different things and if you watch a Bay movie expecting anything other than what you get, that's your fault, not his. It's loud, it's unrealistic, the script (even with some genuinely funny one liners) is bad, the characters are mainly one dimensional, the villain is stereotypical and cliche, but Bay fans e left all that.We watch for the action...and oh my god does he deliver. The second act ends with an infiltration that most over action films would have as their ending. The opening car chase is a second act in pretty much any other film. The 3rd Act is truly something we haven't seen before.Absolutely loved it and hope they make a sequel soon.

Ryan Reynolds was wrong.... THIS is his worst film. It's just pure BAYhem and nothing more really except for a few cool action sequences and some nice camera work. Mostly it is just one big incoherent mess, very fragmented plot that would literally give a normal person ADHD. Absolutely no character development or chemistry to make you care one way or the other about anyone. A bunch of uncalibrated character personalities that waver and jump around much like the story which is very sporadic and stupid. A huge waste of money and talent. Michael Bay only had 1 good film and that's 13 Hours save for maybe The Rock and the first Bad Boys movie. I was so disappointed that I actually stopped watching after 1 hour then went back to finish and wish I hadn't. I can sit through Green Latern with very little difficulty but THIS movie just plain sucks, no redeeming qualities whatsoever. 2/10.

reviews.review_title: The most stupid movie among all the most expensive ones. And the most expensive movie among the most stupid ones.
reviews.content:
Resume: the idea is good. But realization is childish.SPOILERS ahead.Pros:
Overall the underlying idea is great. Kill dictators with own resources, because international community sank in bureaucracy.Very beautiful shots: sunsets, helicopters, skyscrapers.Cons:
Realization of the idea is like the movie has been shot by 13 years old kid.All heroes have the same temper: they shout, they curse.Ridiculous scenes. CIA agent is awaiting the target in Rolls-Royse in the middle of the road. Yes, sure, all agents do that.Mistakes. In the beginning of the movie car crashed by its left side and lost left mirror. But in further shots we see that car has left mirror.Incomplete scenes. On the roof they moved by wire. Number 4 was behind them. And suddenly Number 4 said that bad guys cut the wire and he cannot follow. But we didn't see that bad guys cut the wire! Bad guys even didn't follow good guys.Stupid jokes. Joke about belt and stroking. What?! Yes, sure, this would work in real life.American narrow-minded thinking. They announce revolution under american song. Yes, sure, turgestanians will be motivated with this song.Stupid obstacles. On a yacht chip went our of a phone. What?! What the heck the phone is that chip can easily go out?!And there are a lot of similar mistakes and illogical stuff. E.g. CIA agent blinks while shooting. Really? What about special training?It would work if it had been a movie for teenagers like Transformers. But serious spy movie with R rating must be shot by more mature director.

reviews.review_title: And I'm not even halfway through...
reviews.content: It's action, well done, the quippiness is in overdrive...sit back, have fun, I know I am.

So as I write this I'm at the halfway point of the film. Impressions: "coked-up" to quote a line from the film. Basically it's dreadful. Not unwatchable, but definitely not in the "so bad it's good" category.
There's plenty of action from the get go. There is an overarching plot (somewhere). It has humour, emotion, violence. But no two scenes seem to follow each other coherently. Every third scene is a flashy camera pan that makes you feel dizzy to the point of nausea. Scenes are disjointed and littered with character flashbacks; it feels like films today have to explain everybody's backstory, when the characters aren't remotely interesting and you aren't allowed to organically connect with the relevant characters through good old fashioned dialogue and development. Plus, where's the room for a prequel?
They've gone to town with locations but I've struggled to follow the linearity of the story to appreciate the switch from one city to another, or from one character scene to another. It feels like an expensive TV movie with a budget writer, director and producer. It rips off films like Die Hard, the Fast and the Furious, Mission: Impossible, James Bond and even The Expendables.
By all means watch this film but do not finish the film saying "that was a good film". The films it's taken inspiration from Are good films (yeah even the directors cut version of the Expendables). Maybe watch those first.

reviews.review_title: Funny, Non stop Action, just plain Awesome!
reviews.content:
Ryan Reynolds went all out like an "unmasked" version of him in Deadpool!! The comedy between all characters was continuous but not where you'd expect which kept is fresh.
Violent?? Hell Yeah!! In some areas they put John Wick to shame and that's not easy!!
Its moves quick so pay close attention the first 30 minutes to get a complete understanding of their goal.

The first 15 minutes of this is why Michael Bay is king of action. Fast paced, in beautiful locations, with Ryan Reynolds, Dave Franco (if only briefly) and Sebastian Roche (again briefly). Watch out for the nice little self product placement around 39 minutes in.

First of all I'm a huge Ryan Reynolds fan. The beginning of the movie. The car chase scene, Holds the record for the longest most over the top chase scene filmed. I was starting to get a little bored after 90 cars and SUV's were destroyed. And nothing happens to the main characters. Then the movie goes down hill from that point on. The jokes were not working and everything was to over the top. Why did they spend $150 million on this movie?If they spent a little more time on the script. And a little more time on getting the right chemistry between the actors. This movie could have been so much better. You have to care about characters in the movie. The Chemical Bombs didn't work. Passing out Gas Mask didn't work. The little girl by the pool with no parents didn't work.It was hard to Finnish this movie without getting bored. I was so excited to watch this movie. What a waste of a $150 Million....

I can honestly say this is worst product netflix has ever made. I wouldnt be surprised to find out Michael Bay was in some kind of competition to see how many unecessary cuts, and explosions he could fit in one film. Ryan Reynolds, incredible has he may be could not save this abomination of a movie. If someone you know recommends this movie to you, it would be in your best interest to never speak to them again.

Are we watching the same movie? The acting is great. The movie is full of action. And the story is in my opinion pretty badass. I would recommend to everybody to watch this movie who likes a lot of Michael Bay action, explosions and blood combined with an awesome story.

Only 6??
C'mon! This was frickin' tight!
Full of action, nice comedy bits.
Most films like this one have become mainstream, commercial. Not this one though! I highly recommend it!

Minute one:The movie has a quick start so great.
Minute two: the dialogue is cheesy, so I am already losing interest.
Minute ten: so they are driving and people are chasing them.
Minute Fifteen: so who is this new guy?
Minute twenty: wait...should I rewind it? Did I miss something? Who...what.. are they in the middle of a war?
Minute thrifty: turns tv off *

I am not certain why so many people didn't give this movie a minimum of at least 7 stars. Awesome non-stop action. Good acting, good story, solid bad guys. Great special effects (Magnets). Has a lot of what I like in an action movie.
One of the best movies I've seen for a while now. Netflix really put in some effort for this. Keep it up!

I was caught in a quandary over whether or not I should watch "6 Underground." On the one hand, it is directed by Michael Bay. I'm not a fan of his movies. Most of them are garrish and way over the top. He's the guy that lights all the fireworks at once instead of in a sequence with a nice finale.On the other hand, Ryan Reynolds is in it. I don't know if there is a better actor for inserting comedy into an action movie.The tiebreaker was Netflix. In other words, I'm already paying NF however many dollars a month so I'm watching something."6 Underground" was a blast. It was a cornucopia of awesomeness. Michael Bay reeled it in a tad and Ryan Reynolds did his thing. The action sequences were stylistic, cool, and didn't defy every known law of physics. The one-liners from Reynolds were on point and in steady supply. The CGI and visual effects were stunning. I was particularly impressed by the super slo-mo sequences; they were done right and at the right time. Like an RPG catching a guy in the mouth before exploding, or a mother and her baby being narrowly missed by a car. There were some fantastic shots.The comedy, the action, and the cinematic beauty was all propped up by a good plot. The 6 Underground were none other than six highly skilled folks doing some super-spy stuff for a noble and worthy cause. Reynolds character was the brains and the financier. He was a billionaire who was tired of seeing no real change in the world no matter how much money he spent philanthropically.I know, I know, you're saying to yourself, "Spy movies are a dime a dozen," and you're right. I can't believe I'm raving about it myself, but you owe it to yourself to watch this one. If you like Michael Bay you should watch. Even if you don't like Michael Bay, but you like Ryan Reynolds, you should watch. If you don't like either of them I have one last proposition: this movie is like Mission Impossible but funnier. So, if you like MI, you should watch.

High concept action flick with gorgeous locations and nifty special effects, as was expected from Michael Bay. PS: There's an awesome car chase scene in the beginning.
There's one thing I want to acknowledge. You see Ryan nowadays in all these action comedy movies as compared to those romcoms he used to do earlier. From Deadpool to Hitman's Bodyguard, it's so nice to see how beautifully he performs these roles, and how much he is skilled to fit so aptly in all the roles he do.

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay takes it to the next level
reviews.content: The most hyper-realistic violent action scenes I've seen to date. Combine with a stellar cast and some laugh out loud moments and it adds up to an insanely entertaining movie. Can't believe this didn't get a theatre release. I cranked the volume on my Bose home theatre and thoroughly enjoyed. 10/10 for mindless popcorn entertainment cartoon violence. Oh and Ryan Reynolds. Nuff said.
When you think Michael Bay has already made 30 bad movies, he will not disappoint you: he makes another one. Pointless, boring and completely useless.
It's not bad. You just have to know you're watching a Michael Bay film. The most Michael Bay of them all.

Yes this is what a color revolution does. Usually operated by government officials to remove those not in line with our political values. Reestablish those that will cooperate nicely with us. They used this to get rid of trump. That's another storyline. Point is, this has been done for centuries. In operation now with the reset. Other than government sanctioned units like this very few non government ghosts operating. However we could use a few to counteract our government gangs. Fun movie. Interesting scenarios and the blonde french babe is hot.

reviews.review_title: Great action, great editing, amazing cars pursuits
reviews.content:
So whoever wrote and criticized the editing is like most of the times a slow minded person that should keep watching novellas instead 😉
Great show, incredible actions effects, lots of fun and adrenaline.
No intellectual there, just a good action movie 🤣

This is my first review ever on IMDB. And I only writing it to warn others.In short. DO NOT WATCH IT. This is the worst movie I have ever seen. It doesn't make sense at all. The Dialogues might as well been written by Zuckerbot himself, based at a belief that this is how real humans talk. People doesn't make long sarcastic jokes when being in a high speed car chase and bullets flying. All characters have no regards what so ever to what's happening around them. Like they don't realise that they are about to die at any second. When you watch movie like Bad Boys, they are shouting, cursing in midst of the action. These characters do nothing like this - their behaviour is alien-like.Continuing.The timeline jumps back and forth in a mind-boggling way. A rear view mirror is lost upon a collision with a truck, only to be respawned a second later when the movie is cut to a different camera-view. and that's after the first 10 minuets.Still continuing. There is no real chemistry between the actors nor ANY logical explanation to why the other characters choses to follow Ryan Reynolds lead. Ryan Reynolds character is multi billionaire whose technical inventions are in all modern electronic products, yet in the movie he is completely unknown to the world. Basically, he is a male model version of Elon Musk gone Robin Hood. The Actions scenes are great though. Car chases, fights, shoot-outs are all excellent made. However, somebody please tell me why you would need to hire an acrobat for your super-secret swat team? If the movie didn't try so hard to be serious I would have laughed through it all. But it just becomes so ridiculous when the same Acrobat first need to grab his skateboard and grind a rail to get into position so he can shoot the driver in the chasing car, instead of just stopping and shooting up the car straight away.Anybody rating this movie 6 or higher must have been on drugs when watching it, and I wish I had been too.

reviews.review_title: Action loaded with a dose of comedy.
reviews.content: M.Bay does it again....action packed from the get go! Ryan is ideal for the role and he delivers.I like the cuts in the movie as it balances the pace of the movie.They should do a sequel!!....Maybe a eight or a nine 😉

About ten minutes in I was 100% certain
this was a michael bay pic without even looking it up. He loves doing constant fast cuts but he doesnt have an eye for it so its this rapid shot of aimless disconnected scenes like in the transformers films where you get a headache trying to follow the action. Secondly he really likes extreme sports so of course one of the hit guys thing is parkour and you get these silly shots of him jumping around in slow motion not having any involvement in the action. Lastly every scene is shot in shimmery sunset filter. Even when people are just sitting there doing nothing the camera is spinning around to some stupid brojock music video soundtrack. I actually tried to stick with it despite all that because I like RR but I was also just..so..bored. The good guys are obnoxious jerks, the evil guys are one note and the story is childish. Seriously just go watch Gross Point Blank again or something instead. This is insulting big budget trash.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst flicks amongst all the flicks
reviews.content:
First 10 minutes of the movie made me think the Transformers will join somehow.
Suburban in Itally? No.
Laws of physics completely missing here (Aside from the usual M. Bay explosions).
Reynold humour in this movie was less than mediocre.
All in all, not worth the time. Watching Baywatch would give people more satisfaction than wasting 2 hours on this unless you're into the stuff he puts in his movies.

reviews.review_title: Glad I didn't pay to watch this.
reviews.content: Don't waste your time on this. Just watch bad boys again instead (you'll thank me later).
A fun action movie for everyone :) The car chase scene at the beginning was perfect. I want part 2

An average action film, way to much slo mo and full of mistakes,
Here's one example in the opening scene while escape in a car the driver (dave Franco) has a cap on then it vanishes then it appears then vanishes again several times.
Worth a watch if your not interested in stories of characters as this film has no story and lack of character story.

From start to finish, this movie was so action-packed that for a moment I thought this was the next installment of Mission Impossible or
Fast & the Furious. It had non-stop action, dry humour (as other Ryan Reynolds movies do) and a simple storyline while the acting, directing and production were all terrific. If u want to be entertained, this movie will have and keep ur attention. Don't be misled or discouraged by critics who were obviously expecting the greatest movie ever or a cult classic. Instead expect to be thoroughly entertained for 2 hours.

reviews.review_title: They've must have offered Reynolds a lot of money
reviews.content:
Action movie done wrong!
It's like they knew the formula for a good action movie and proceeded to wipe their butts with it...
Bad casting, bad acting, waste of production budget
Yikes, just yikes

Truely best most original action movie of whole 2019!
Ow man that giulia qv is hot 🔥🔥🔥

Car chases, explosions, fight scenes, planned "jobs" where everything goes wrong, but it all works out for the most part, (the opening scene should let you know what you're in for) and a weak plot as a vehicle for the aforementioned to occur. So if that's your style, this should be right up your alley. Reynolds couldn't even save this one. They also skip the character development in lieu of title cards introducing each character like Suicide Squad.If you want to see a decent Michael Bay movie, watch 'Pain and Gain'. All of Michael Bay's trademarks, but funny and entertaining. One of the only Michael Bay movies I can think of that's has quality. Mark Wahlberg, Rob Cordry, Tony Shaloub, and Dwayne Johnson are all hilarious.

reviews.review_title: A movie that will probably appear in your plane when you have nothing to do but to watch it
reviews.content: There was a point of such an extremism in action that made me think whether this movie is parodying modern action movies or it is just one of them. If it was a parody, then it would been a phenomenal movie (especially when Ryan Reynolds is in it).Unfortunately this is your typical good guys that kill bad guys kind of movie and Ryan Reynolds just can't fit in that character. Everyone fits nicely in their typical-action-cliche roles but Ryan Reynolds is not the type to play someone like a leader of the group. He is quirky and kinda awkward, which is not suitable for a character that tries to stick to the main mission no matter what.Cheesy scenes with typical cliche outcomes. Nothing will surprise you.
Best movie of the year. action film like this are so important to the action panorame
The first 20-minute car chase scene in Italy is one for the books...

No coherent story. Just cgi and action.
This film for teenagers
With no script a never ending car chase with annoying personalities and camera show off. Waste of time. Yes hollywood have money and technology and big ego actors Well done!
So much explosions and sparks, but absolutely empty and pointless.

What a ridiculous movie, how can be that hollywood bet for this kind of films,
you start watching it but suddenly you ask yourself: ¿what is going on? Oh! I see this movie get me asleep because is terrible, that is

reviews.review_title: totally pointless mess with shaky-cam and non-linear narrative
reviews.content: Don't waste your time watching this piece of garbage.

It's a great movie! The sarcasm they throw at each other is funny. The fight/action scenes are thrilling. And you see a group of people who started of as associates to one another, ended up as family members to each other. Good audio/music used in this film too. It's a must watch!

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay has officially lost it...
reviews.content: Where do i begin? From the overly used dutch angles, horrible comedy to the cliche spark explosions and sub par acting. It was really hard to grasp what tone Bay was shooting for. A serious action comedy? It just doesnt mix.Im happy no one really has to pay to watch this.

Exciting, action packed, great stunts & thrills galore, oh and of course Ryan Reynolds' snarky wit! Definitely worth watching! I think there is plenty of story there to make this a franchise! The actors all had great chemistry together. One thing is lacking is more back story on them all. However, that wouldve taken away from the action, so that's the trade. Hence, a part 2 would be more than welcome! Good job Netflix!

reviews.review_title: Just about had enough of Netflix
reviews.content:
Yes Netflix with your insanely awful 'Original' films WTF!!This is by far one of the worst I've seen, from the constant close up clips to the car scene that went on for what felt like a lifetime. I switched it off half way through, as much as I love Ryan Reynolds it just boils down to him having a pretty face basic comedy timing and a sharp wit but he annoyed me so much in this farce he's made me think he is just a sell out who wants money and doesn't give a toss about content or believability.
Bad Netflix bad.
Wow. Straight of the bat. Action. Action. Action. Missed this type of move. I want more!!

I don't understand how can someone could give this movie a 1 star rating. It's a Michael Bay movie! You know exactly what you get from a MB movie. It's not like you press play expecting to see Daniel Day Lewis shooting bad guys every 5 minutes..
Sure, the editing is not great but the cast is good and the plot is decent. A solid 9 stars for the beautiful R rating!
Enjoy it and don't listen to the "critics"

Bay is an easy target when it comes to criticising his movies, they are very shallow and are more interested in special effects than story. They are though, although few would ever admit, a guilty pleasure. To switch off logic and let the amazing visuals wash over you does what his films are suppose to do and that's entertain. They are not suppose to be high brow cerebral films. Each though does feel like a vanity project but this I think was a good story with interesting characters and hit a level of emotion that his films seldom do. So 1st 6 Underground, 2nd The Rock, 3rd The Island. The rest are just silly macho craziness...

reviews.review_title: If You Have Netflix, This One's Not to be Missed
reviews.content: This movie looks like it should have been released in theaters over the summer. It's pretty much top notch in every regard, except maybe for the story. The story was not as tight as it could have been and makes a couple of missteps, but it was very entertaining just the same. If I had to compare it to another movie, it reminded me of a much more violent cross between Mission Impossible and Furious 7. It wasn't as good as either of those movies, but it's still a great time killer. Superlative special effects, excellent driving scenes, and exciting gunplay earns this flick a solid 7.5.

reviews.review_title: You can believe the one line overviews, or rather just watch it and have fun
reviews.content: Have you guys ever seen an action movie? I mean ever. I really do not understand the haters. This is a well made crash-bumm-bang movie with some charm. It looks great, has good characters in it, nice music and good action scenes. What the heck more you expect from an action movie? It is a good one, fun to watch. That is all. Ah yes, I loved to see Doron from Fauda
It didn't show a specific point, story is inappropriate, and it's insulting many ppl and decents I don't recommend it at all don't waste your time

After a quick intro, you then get a 20 minute car chase through Florence with more explosion, carnage and kills than a Rambo movie.The reason behind the 6 is swiftly explained and all that is left is to sit back and enjoy the movie. You won't get Oscar winning acting but you'll get explosions, action and fast editing!Is it loud, yesIs it cheesy, yesIs it fun, hell yes!Your will not be disappointed if you switch your brain off and let the film entertain you I did.

Do you like expensive action scenes with slo-mo focused on blood, peppered with sex scenes, and all the songs by Muse? Are you fine with no plot whatsoever and not so subtle product placement? Then this is for you. I can see a thirteen year old kid enjoying all the guns, destruction, blood, and sexy ladies, but that's all this movie has. No plot, and any "jokes" jjust fall flat.

reviews.review_title: More unwatchable crap with no story and no contents
reviews.content: Was able to watch the first 10 minutes on Netflix and then quickly decided to move on to something else, although the more there seems to be an offer, the less one actually decides to watch. The quality of recent movies is just so bad, that's is almost to hard to describe with words. One word comes to mind though and that is "When". When will producers realise that the world doesn't need this crap anymore, and that it's time to produce some movies worth watching again. Movies with actors that aren't paid quazillions because they're so "special". Movies that actually have a deeper message to share, rather than bullets and exploding/flying cars. Yes, this is called escapism, but to what end? The sheer mindlessness of these productions shows the current generation of producers (not all of them though), which can be labelled as spoiled attention seeking brats that have probably never picked up a single book in their life and got a Porsche from mummy when they turned 16. Ah well, we'll simply have to wait until something good pops up again, but knowing the amount of prequels and sequels currently in production, it seems dark times lie ahead.

*no spoilers* Michael Bay is great at this movie style. I was expecting less quality I have to admit, but I had great fun. Effects are awesome, sound mix is powerful and the musical score is great. The story works well and the acting is descent on the better side of good. Some pretty faces and bodies help with the overall sense of enjoyment. I was entertatined, well done!

This is what your subscribers want more of - quality films with amazing photography, incredible action, and a story that would've worked well as a theatrical release - right here on our own 4K home screens. Kudos to everyone involved, even Michael Bay, who appears to have found his mojo again...welcome back, dude!

reviews.review_title: Wow!! It's awful, like deadpool gone wrong!
reviews.content: I think If you love deadpool like me, leave this one on the shelf. I got half hour in and turned it off.

I could have spent these two hours of my life way, way better.I was feeling like watching some action, so picked this up without checking who directed it. A few minutes into the movie, I was sure this was Michael Bay. It is just what you would expect from a MB movie. The story sucks. The characters are one dimensional and comically overtheatrical. Humor is... well, you see it was meant to be humor, but for some reason it does not make you laugh. It is full of action, and yet somehow boring to death.Well, I have nobody else to blame but myself. I should have checked the director first.

reviews.review_title: Please bro, just enjoy the movie.
reviews.content:
It's just an action movie, not a Oscar promise.
Grab your beer and your nachos and enjoy a good action movie in your home theater, just that, a good movie.
Better than any of the 30 fast and furious movies 😪 hahahahaha
Oh and a lot better than the last Tarantino's movie.😴

I mean let's face it Michael Bay films aren't known for their deep thought provoking storylines, but this is just terrible.The idea isn't horrendous and given some better editing there may have been an ok film here. Unfortunately this is Bay at his worst, a disjointed story made worse by rapid editing.I love Ryan Reynolds and Bay's early films (Bad Boys, The Rock, Armageddon etc.), but sadly even Ryan's wit can't save this mess of a film.

I'm sure only action junkies or teen boys would like it but it's crazy dumb, we couldn't even finish watching it so maybe it got better? I doubt it, you'd have to enjoy the chaotic flow and cinematography, and as a Ryan Reynolds fan, dare I say boring and been there done that characters. Sorry but I'd avoid if you want an interesting movie with more than jokes, slow mo, and gunshot.

I managed to watch all of it as the action sequences were very will done. Well it looked expensive, anyway.
Some good one-liners in the Ryan Reynolds way but I think they were milking him for it.
But, it didn't flow and the characters were shallow. I just didn't care. I was basically happy for it to move onto the next action bit (which didn't take long) and see the sequence play out.
Some nice ideas, poorly strung together.

This is not a movie you are going to remember a year from now. Except perhaps for the neon green Alfa which sadly doesn't transform even a little bit. Having said that if you can manage to turn your brain off for the duration there is a ton of enjoyable, and very Bayish over the top action scenes.It's hilarious watching Ryan Reynolds SO wanting to be Deadpool and having to stop himself in multiple scenes. Because he's NOT Deadpool the bad guys just have to miss a lot, but thats pretty normal stuff in this kind of everyone-has-machine-guns-but-only-the-good-guys-can-hit kind of movie.All in all a stocking stuffer for Netflix, a payday for Ryan and the crew, and some mindless fun to while away the COVID lockdown.

reviews.review_title: can we take a moment here...
reviews.content: If you know Bay then you shouldn't be expecting some deep John Le Carre character arc. What he has done is one upped himself in the effects and stunt department. Yes the editing is a bit nuts. But the technical achievements in this movie are quite breathtaking. Just because something has a huge budget doesn't mean people didn't work there ass off trying to create something exciting and new and it is at the end of the day very entertaining. The CGI combined with the real parkour footage is particularly impressive. The opening car chase alone must of taking months to prepare and shoot. My hat goes off to the stunt guys. Its worth watching for that alone not to mention the locations are really quite exquisite. And Reynolds is on form as always.

What is the point of this movie? I think the idea may have been just to keep the 6 actors in job for a couple of months. Riddled with a idiotic childish comedy that just destroys the idea of it being funny. It tries to hard to be like Rush Hour thats for sure.Do not waste your time, other than a few nice explosions and car drifts its not worth wasting your eyes on. Typical Michael Bay B-Grade film targeting 12 to 16 year olds.

reviews.review_title: Bayhem delivers another huge action movie that never stops.
reviews.content: 6 Underground (5 out of 5 stars).6 Underground delivers the action genre to a whole new level and it all starts within the first couple of minutes. The opening long car chase which is crazy, insane, and a big set piece all together. Fast cars, explosions, helicopter, and bloody and gore with an eye ball is all in the opening sequence. Which sets the tone on how the rest of the 2 hour movie would be. Michael Bay direction does it again in his Bayhem style of fast editing, humor, action, and explosions. The plot may be simple after the movie jumps around with the time frame. From flashing back towards One (Ryan Reynolds) explaining his motive to hunt notorious criminals and bad Presidents. Flashing back to when he recruits the others to his team on faking their deaths and becoming ghosts. It is kind of like the A Team. A dysfunctional team traveling around the globe with a mission on extraction, termination, or trying to set up a plan. But it always ends up in a bloody shoot out and being chased.The plot is thin but about a team stopping criminals that are causing trouble to lots of people. The vigilante squad does things there own way. No government. No law.The movie is action packed throughout with a lot of set pieces. The opening car chase is a long 20 minute action packed. Kind of cheesy. But very entertaining. Every other scene there is more action to follow. Characters running and jumping on skyscrapers. Intense fight sequences. And a big climatic fight in a yacht with lots of bad guys and bullets. And a lot of destruction. It is a fun and exciting movie which is best to leave your brain and thoughts on logic out.The cast ensemble is great. Ryan Reynolds is a lot of fun. Melanie Laurent, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo, Ben Hardy, Adria Arjona, Dave Franco, and Corey Hawkins are all great with their characters. It is a perfect ensemble. Which this film can be a start of a franchise.If you enjoy Michael Bay's movies than this is a movie for you. Or if you are looking for an action packed movie. This will satisfy for sure. The movie is big, loud, and action packed. I loved everything about it for being an action fan.

Bad. In the first 20 minutes you get a commercial for Red Bull, Alfa Romeo and Captian Morgan, 100 explosions, 20 cars being smashed 50 dudes killed... all while somebody is doing surgery in the back seat of the car. There is dumb and the there's this.Weak story, weak acting, neon colored cars.

Bay never has been a good storyteller and besides "the Island" or Pain and Gain he even never tried to be.
He makes virtual roller-coasters and he is a master in this.

It baffles me why people would give this anything less than a five just because its not an Oscar worthy movie, its not meant to be! It's Michael Bay!.... Its basically Transformers without the robots, meant for teanagers who love cool car chases, massive explosions, guns, blood splatter, scantuilly clad ladies and Ryan Reynolds sense of sarcastic humour, yes it's got some dubious editing which at times makes little sense but....who gives a crap, enjoy it!... Its a lot of fun!!.... And I'd definitely watch a sequel.
If you know what you're getting yourself into, you will have a great time with non-stop R-rated action.

reviews.review_title: Just plain fun............turn up the volume and enjoy the ride
reviews.content: Entertaining...........fun..........great characters.......good story. One of those films you mark to watch again just for the entertainment value. No underlying ridiculous plots or messages..........just 6 bad-a$$es going after the dictator with some incredible camera work and special effects.............

I don't know who thought this would be a good movie to do. So many unnecessary Michael Bay explosions, stupid writing, mostly bad jokes made for 11 year olds and probably the worst editing I've seen in a high budget movie.Do not recommend watching even though it's free on Netflix.

reviews.review_title: Awesome roller coaster of a ride.
reviews.content: You just have to see this. The stunts are unbelievable. Ignore the storyline just let yourself be swept along with the action. Stylish with jaw dropping cinematography. It out Bond's Bond. Immensely entertaining. Phew!...I am quite breathless after watching that! ..
Michael Bay has no clue how to direct or represent, women

I loved the concept of the story. The first half an hour was a complete waste of time. One main problem is the weak attempts at humour that destroyed most of the story. Unlike many films the conclusion picked up a bit but did not redeem what was mostly a waste of time. The acting seemed wooden. They would deliver a line, in the hope it would come across funny, but really it seemed more like a rehearsal and the director should have told them to be more convincing. Very weak direction.This may have had a "Whiskey Cavalier" feel about it, however "Whiskey Cavalier" nailed it. This didn't. I would sooner have a second series of "Whiskey Cavalier" than a second "^ Underground." Sometimes the wrong franchises get renewed.If this is to be the start of more stories as is implied, there is a need to go back to the drawing board.

reviews.review_title: Action, Action, Action and that's it
reviews.content: 6 Underground is an action thriller movie directed by Michael Bay and stars Ryan Reynolds, Melanie Laurent, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo, Corey Hawkins, Adria Arjona, Ben Hardy, Lior Raz and Peyman Maadi.For me the movie is a huge disappointment although I have had high hopes from the movie considering the movie is been directed by Michael Bay.The plot of the movie is like any other action movie with a 0half cooked script. Director was focusing more on action scenes and it seems that they were keen to cash on their action scenes as it is filled with car chases, bullets flying in air, electronic foot tapping music and that's it.Direction of the movie is average, screenplay of the movie is so fast paced as sometimes you will get confused as what is happening in the movie. Action scenes are superb and deserves an applause. Cinematography is amazingly beautiful and climax is predictable and director has left a scope for it's sequels.Overall if you are a hardcore action lover then this is for you and if you are also looking for an interesting plot along with action then you will be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: a good movie for brain-dead people
reviews.content: A good example of primitively stupid movie based exclusively on special effects. Not recommended for people with functioning brain.

reviews.review_title: Fun action movie, nothing more and nothing less
reviews.content: This movie is not your quality movie revolving around an advanced plot or complex characters. It does bring a lot of action and fun to the table and I would recommend this movie to anyone that asks, because it's in my opinion 2 hours of entertainment worth watching. It does disappoint in some aspects, but it surely makes up for it in mindless action sequences and witty dialogue.I was entertained throughout the whole experience10/10 here
Pretty good action flick. Had Deadpool vibes...humor mixed with action. Will it win an Oscar. No...but it's sure entertaining.
