I'm not necessarily a Michael Bay fan but might have to look into the membership fees for such. Ryan Reynolds looked like he had as much fun making this as I did watching it. The girls, the cars, the scenery, the action, and the girls were definitely a wonderful way to finish out a tough work week. NETFLIX, take note, always release an action film on a Friday after giving us small snippets to get us excited for the movie. This worked extremely well and actually cured my rough week.
This film is completely all over the place, the acting is terrible & Ryan Reynolds is his usual over the top self. I cant even be bothered to write any more it was so bad!

reviews.review_title: Probably entertaining... if you're a teenager...
reviews.content:
... or high, or both.
Boring, pointless, childish: practically Michael Bay at it's "best".
Great film to switch off and get lost with. Great explosions fast paced film.

Well I know that it is Michael Bay, and you should expect Michael Bay, but... that was waay too much. Crazy jumps from scene to scene, the evil guy so evil that his evilness is just ridiculous. If you want to enjoy this movie just completely turn off your brain. In the plus side Ryan Ranolds keeps playing Deadpool and it's still working

reviews.review_title: Continuity errors spoil it from the start.
reviews.content:
Wow, just wow, how can a film that cost 150 million have so many continuity errors in it at the start. That first car chase scene with the green Alfa Romeo is awful.
The drivers cap appears and disappears about as often as the wing mirrors on the car. Myself and my wife were laughing out loud at how bad it was, totally distracting you from the plot...
Also, if you hit a motorbike and driver at speed you are going to sustain a lot of damage, unless you are in this indestructible car. Elon musk would love to make a car this tough!!!!

reviews.review_title: Classic Reynolds with over the top Baysims.
reviews.content: A real edge of the seat film with some amazing action scenes, the first 1/4 of the film felt like one long car chase. The way you find out about the characters is a bit odd but seems to work well for this film.Some seriously daredevil stuntwork and quite a few giggles and stunning cimematography make this one of my instant favourites.
Weak story, horrible dialogue and hard to follow. Even the violence and all the sex scenes couldn't hold your attention

Probably the first Netflix original movie I have ever actually enjoyed let alone made it through to the end. EXACTLY what you would expect when you put Michael Bay and Ryan Reynolds together, not gonna win an Oscar but is definitely worth the watch. Highly entertaining with a good amount of laughs if you like the Ryan Reynolds style humor.

reviews.review_title: A stupid, ridiculous, nonsense film. Watch it.
reviews.content:
If you want a film that makes you think, avoid this. If you want to be moved then avoid this. If you want a great amount of back story and want to get to know the core characters then avoid this.
If you want something to watch to entertain with pure nonsense, to laugh at the unnecessary slow-mo violence, the cheesiness and corniness of some fairly dodgy editting and a daft way to pass two hours then this is the film for you.
It's exactly what I was expecting it to be. I can't imagine anyone watching it expecting it to be anything different so can't see why it's getting so many bad reviews.

I never liked Michael Bay's movies, but this one really shocked me (at least on a Michael Bay level). Aside from the boring first half-hour chase sequence, the film was actually really entertaining and thrilling. This is Michael Bay at his very best.That said, this is still a Michael Bay film. So if you come in expecting a well written action film with well developed characters, you are going in for a disappointment.

Fun. Occasionally funny. Loud. Excitable. Not complaining. It was a fun use of 128 minutes where I didn't have to think and could just enjoy the explosions and a little eye candy. Would recommend if you're into that sort of thing.
How much of a cocaine binge was the editor on when he was cutting this film? It is an absolute mess. Nonsense plot with pointless throwaway scenes.

Way to many over the top scenes.
It's like you've let a 6 year old boy make an action film.
Less is sometimes more, don't bother

Too fast, too ads style. Too music video style. Tons of advertising. Yes I know Ferrari, Alfa Romeo, Lamborghini, Lavazza Coffee, Maserati, Chopard gave a lot of money but there are subtle way to advertise a brand. And, GOD, you cannot enjoy a single framing because it's the hell too fast. Come on it's supposed to be a movie not a music video or piece of advertising. Slapstick dialogues. Superficial characters. I was thinking to give it 4 but it deserves 3. Amen.

If you like mindless, senseless violence & car chases along with nauseating dialogue, then you will love this America good, everyone else bad film. The cast is NATO in film, which includes an Asian appears briefly. The film starts with an assassination, then leads to the cast killing 100's of civilians on the way & destroying historical symbols of Italy. Reminds me of Iraq actually. The disturbing part of this film is it shows what America & Americans are like & why they are hated across the world. The good guy narrative of the USA, taking out a brutal dictator who gasses his own people while at the same time using US supplied jets spraying the gas is realistic indeed. The good guys want to place a democratic leader instead of some brutal dictator, does not sounds like US allies like Saudi Arabia & others US supported dictators world wide. The films ends with a replay of Qaddafi being beaten to death & like Qaddafi rectum being penetrated all because of American kindness. Good guys indeed these 6 psychopaths who murder even the innocent kitchen staff on a yacht. They make Kill Bills Viper squad look like choir boys. Still the film represents US morals and delusions beyond belief. So if your into propaganda films? This is for you!

reviews.review_title: Trying only gets you so far
reviews.content: This movie tried to be more than it was. One liners and overused action sequences, and camera angles does not carry a movie for me. The actors are great but script and the directing seemed overly predictable to make it minimally entertaining to me. Would classify it as an unimaginative movie.

There is nothing here. No plot, character building, or entertainment value to be had. Even the action sequences are lame. I'd rather watch all the Transformers movies than this garbage one more time. It did make me smile a couple of times, so there's that.

reviews.review_title: How can this not have a higher score?
reviews.content: This was pure, creative and very well-made entertainment all the way through! After the first long car chase scene (filled with action, humor and creative shots) I thought the rest of the film wouldn't be able to live up to the same standard. It did. All the way through.This is a great mix of gore (without being too much), action, humor and an interesting plot. Loved all the characters! Shoutout as well to the human aid camp scenes. This is not at all a realistic movie, but those scenes felt real indeed, showing the true violence of a war-torn country.In short: loved every second of it!

I don't understand people rating this movie below five stars. No this isn't the movie that is going to win Canne Movie Festival. But it's fun and action packed movie.
Car chase scene was intense and better than ronin or fast&furious.

reviews.review_title: Please stop letting Bay make movies
reviews.content: Things blowing up with slow motion cutting into every scene and about 10 songs within the first 5 mins to fill the void for lack of dialogue. This thing is a serious train wreck. I feel bad for Deadpool. Netflix just took $150 Mil and flushed it down a toilet
Just enjoy the movie, even though the plot is quite messed up but overall this is a good movie

Fast, jagged, stylish, amusing, and most importantly, fun. I'm not a huge Michael Bay guy and, in fact, I've denigrated him most times he's come up in conversation, however I thought I'd give this movie a quick peek regardless and I'm pleased I took the time. It's like a Tony Scott movie (Ridley's brother, kids) in many ways but it's all turned up to eleven which is saying something if you're even marginally familiar with Tony Scott stuff. If you're in the mood for anything heavily cerebral but think you'd prefer some mindless escapism of the highest order, give it a look. Unless you're one of those movie-watchers-pretending-to-be-an-actual-critic types, then you should just go pretend to watch and enjoy 'The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie' for the twentieth time just so you can engage in some highbrow and studious dinner dialogue with your oh-so-charming and intellectual colleagues who pretend to like it too.

reviews.review_title: It's a long commercial for a product you don't want to buy
reviews.content:
Let's count the truly terrible elements:
1. The dialogue
2. The opening sequence
3. Disorganized and poor plot they tried to hide behind unnecessary and confusing time jumps
4. The directing - makes you wonder if Michael Bay has ever made a movie before
5. The characters - developed like 1 dimensional caricatures of people.
6. The shots - sooo unnecessary they distract from what little story their is.Not even Ryan Reynolds can save this catastrophe of a film.
There are so many good cast and production team working on this film, but sadly they're working for stupid movie.

I didn't know about Michael Bay's style before, but I got the gist from the trailer and from my husband and, as it was a Saturday evening and we needed an entertaining and action-full movie, and we also love Reynolds's humor, we went for this one.
The movie really was full of action and tension, keeping you at the edge of the seat most of the time. Add to that a lot of gory scenes and some quality dry humor, and you have the recipe for deconnecting.
I was annoyed by just one fact: during the car chase in Florence, at one moment, the car enters Piazza del Campo in Siena (!), and then it's Florence again - really amazing how such an important detail could be missed..
You know when you watch a terrible movie and despite you are sleepy you get online to give the movie one star. This is the one!
What do you expect from the Bay? Decent viewing nothing spectacular but plenty of high octane action and a few decent laughs. One of the better Netflix films I've seen.

reviews.review_title: How to satisfy an action junkie
reviews.content:
Here's The Lowedown on "6 Underground" (R - 2019 - Netflix)Genre: Action/Gun
My Score: 7.5Cast=7 Acting=5 Plot=9 Ending=8 Story=4
Violent=10 Pace=9 F/X=9 Gun=7 Intense=7Meet a new kind of action hero. Six untraceable agents, totally off the grid. They've buried their pasts so they can change the future."Never underestimate the power of a very nice suit." This is just what the doctor ordered. How do you satisfy an action junkie? Just get Michael Bay to do a movie. To be honest...the story blew chucks and that hurt the acting. But I love it when there is an action movie with a team...lots of dialogue and great chemistry makes for some fun scenes. This is probably one of my favorite Netflix films...well worth a watch.
The story might have worked if it wasn't for the totally gone mad directing. Oh Ryan, why did you take part in such a waste of money?

reviews.review_title: Cinematographically one of the best Netflix has to offer this year,, Plot wise not convinced at all
reviews.content:
I've heard that Netflix has spent 150 million dollar on this , and they have the right to do so , and it is clear where the money went ..
The movie started with a lot of explosions and car crashes and an amazing visual effects .. but what so clearly the movie lacked is the strong plot, I mean gosh !! the movie is like two hours long yet it was a bit all over the place ,, has some weird unnecessary flashbacks and as i said it just focused on the explosions ..Gotta admit though ,, they had a bit of Ryan Reynolds humor but over these long two hours it would look barely noticeable .. they could have just used it to their benefit and could have covered the holes in the story but guess it didn't work.
... Anyway ,, I've recently watched the trailer of "Free Guy" and I think it would give us the Reynolds image we love.The other cast members were okay,, they were engaging, intense and at some points funny ,Manuel Garcia-Rulfo was really good with his spontaneous humor , and they did everything they could.,. but again the screenplay wasn't helpful.As for the set, the movie was apparently shot in Dubai , the country name is Turgistan or something like that ,, people are speaking Turkish with Arabic letters all over ,, It was a bit confusing for me when they talk about Turgistan and you can see "Aldar Headquarters building" or "Shiek Zaied Mosque" ,, If you don't know these landmarks then you wouldn't have an issue with that.So final say, it is a good Friday Netflix movie, it's not Bad,, but I wouldn't be sure that I would pay 8 dollars to watch it on the big screen,, I think that's why Netflix was the safest bet... so watch it on Netflix next weekend.

reviews.review_title: It's a Michael Bay action movie with Ryan Reynolds. Enjoy it for what it is a great action movie
reviews.content: Short but sweet review.The bad: the beginning is pretty confusing as the flashbacks are not fully understood and go on for a bit long. The stunt doubles are clear to see on 2 (maybe more but I only noticed 2) occasions. It probably could of been 20 minutes shorter.The good: it's a Michael Bay action movie starring Ryan Reynolds. It does exactly what it says on the tin. Fantastic action scenes, Great deaths, awesome soundtrack and it's a Michael Bay action movie starring Ryan Reynolds.People getting all uppity about it need to behave. IT'S A MICHAEL BAY ACTION MOVIE STARRING RYAN REYNOLDS.

reviews.review_title: Written by 14 year olds for 14 year olds
reviews.content: Wow for the locations and some of the stunts. Horrible for the characters, editing and incredibly juvenile dialog. Each killing of an innocent bystander requires someone to make a doofus joke to show how hardcore yet lighthearted they are. Pandering at its worst.
Snazzy photography, flash cars and popes jokes, don't make a good film. Very lame.

Unmistakably Ryan Reynolds and Unmistakably Michael Bay. An enjoyable action movie, don't expect a thrilling storyline just take it for what it is. Action, action, more action and some comedy thrown in for good measure.

reviews.review_title: If I have to see one more scene of a team walking towards the camera...
reviews.content: This movie is about mysterious people who apparently had no ties to anyone or anything and thusly were fine with agreeing to "die" in order to do vigilante type stuff when approached by a mysterious billionaire (RR) who refers to himself and the rest of the team by numbers in order to not get attached in case one of them dies during a mission. Who are these people? Who is the billionaire? Why don't they ask for more of an explanation as to how RR found them and what exactly this organization is that he started? They are all fine with being told they are gonna kill "bad" people and in the process will pry die themselves...okaaaay...whut?I love Ryan Reynolds but I gotta say this movie kind of made me feel like I'm getting a little fed up with his constant snark in every thing he's in. I realize this is just a movie but it takes you out of movies when they are doing stuff the entire time that is just not anywhere near realistic. The constant cracking of jokes gets a little annoying. Also I'm sick of movies where pampered spoiled movie stars portray military members. These stars would be the first ones to run and hide under the nearest chair if any threat presented itself yet they think they can do justice to our military in these roles despite their complete lack of understanding of how the military works. It just seems akin to stolen valor to some extent. Don't portray military members if you're not gonna bother to at least try to lend some credibility to the role.This is disjointed, confusing and we aren't given enough information about these people in order for us to get invested in them. I was ready to turn it off after about 20 minutes but my husband wanted to watch it so...This seemed lazy for being an extremely expensive project and it was just way too over the top. My stars are for Ryan because I love him in spite of him becoming one note. I would give this a pass because it's confusing, ridiculous and more like watching the product of a bunch of people sitting around trying to outdo one another with a complete lack of consideration for any of the film being even remotely close to reality rather than the result of a good production.

reviews.review_title: Certainly has the smell of Michael Bay...
reviews.content: They make a left turn and the chat vehicles go flying?!Ooo... right across the nose.That's some Saw $h!t.That is bogus super fast typing.He's lucky that wall is sturdy. Perhaps he was a structural engineer sniper?What the hell was 4 supposed to be doing?Why is 4 the one who needs saving both times?

reviews.review_title: Only watch if your not a critic!
reviews.content: Wow interesting reading of the reviews, are all the 1 and 2 star reviews judging the film? Or that they dont like Bay? If you dont like this type of film stick to miss Marple!!!! Its interesting how many people's judgement is made on that they did not understand the first ten minutes!! Simple truth is if you like action films it is worth watching.

reviews.review_title: Fast paced incredible action & surprisingly witty. Hope there's a sequel
reviews.content: I wasn't sure about this one but Ryan Reynolds & the other actors were all great. Michael Bay is an action guru. I really liked the fast paced action & wit. hope they do a sequel because this was fun to watch!
Does not make any sense. WTF. Where is the story? Please quit.
If you like car chases, big explosions, and bad storylines this is the movie for you.
An exercise in Michael Bay being let loose with no supervision. The blatant lack of thought in regards to story telling and continuity makes it unwatchable. Dont waste your time

From the producer of Armageddon, Bad Boys and Pearl Harbor ... What the hell happened to this person? It just can't be the same person
Watched for 10 min... 4 of them just opposite the camera I had to watch at a human eye.... They killed absolutely not necessary 10s of innocent people happen to be near the chase.... The computer effects were amateurish ... The mix of scenes from Florence and Sienna as it was 1 city... was neglible.. compared to everything else...

reviews.review_title: Bang bang pretty people unoriginal pointlessness
reviews.content:
Nothing original to be seen in this disjointed by the numbers copy cat tosh.
Everyone reprises every prepubescent action role ever. Watch if you're an unsofisticated early teen.
It's a good mix of action and comedy. the first 15 minutes will blow your mind - special effects like no other
Con? Everything else. The movie it self had some whack cuts and chronological orders. It was meh to say the most. I did laugh at different Time points tho! There's that :)

reviews.review_title: Piece of trash that makes your brain cells die
reviews.content: Outrageously disturbing piece of trash. Stupid sitcom jokes, editing is just as bad as it gets. And why the hell they even spent money for this crap. Feel like my IQ level dropped after watching it.

reviews.review_title: Great Action with Major hidden plot
reviews.content: Yes it has a lot of violence, Yes there is a lot of explosions, and yet they are trying to do good. Did they go about it the right way... in this world that the movie portrayed it was probably the only way. Hope their is more like this quality stunts, and plots on Netflix

reviews.review_title: Some good action, but overall underwhelming
reviews.content: I had high expectations with Ryan Reynolds and Michael Bay action, but ultimately this does not hold up to modern action movie standards that have better plots/execution.

Have been chosen not only for their skill, but for a unique desire to delete their pasts to change the future. Have been chosen not only for their skill, but for a unique desire to delete their pasts to change the future.Insert clown emoji.
What more can I say..! A really good fun film. I was thoroughly entertained for the whole 2 and a bit hours

Mindless fun with beautiful people, a high body count and gruesome deaths. Spectacular OTT action sequences. Oddly old fashioned in its schmaltzy back stories and racial stereotypes. A beautiful woman goes to Asia and immediately wears chopsticks in her hair? Really? In 2019??

reviews.review_title: What more could you possibly want
reviews.content:
Ryan Reynolds gone full Ryan Reynolds. Well, its mostly about Ryan Reynolds so if you are not a Ryan Reynolds fan, then you are one of the bad reviewers.
I must admit, I got a bit confused in the beginning with past and present crisscrossing but the action scenes and awesome humour in between took care of that. Its brilliantly directed, has brilliant action with outstanding gloriously hilarious humour. Watch out for more Michael Bay + Ryan Reynolds collaborations in the future. Its one of those movies YOU HAVE TO WATCH

I took two stars off for horrible editing and one bad actor but this movie is FUN! Turn the brain off and appreciate the good morals behind the story. Nice to see a movie not WOKE as much either. Just pure popcorn. Suspend all belief in reality and enjoy humor, action, music, and noise! I wish Netflix allowed a sequel on this one.

6 undergrounde was definitely the best action movie. All the actors are very good performers. The full story of the action was great. Car's were used but still needed heavy cars. The personal identity of all the characters was supposed to show aspects of his private life. And I'm still curious to find out what happened to them and how they met. Hopefully more episodes of this movie will come out and there will be plenty to see. Best of luck for the Next Project.
Wow the editing was one of the worst I have seen this year. Completely ruined what have could be a fun action movie.

reviews.review_title: Don't overthink it, just enjoy it
reviews.content: An absolute blast of fun that makes very little sense in terms of real-world logic (see bright green getaway car) but luckily this is a movie so it doesn't have to.Great banter, brutal kills, epic chases, just the right amount of tension and a few surprise moments.Well worth a watch, just don't pretend it's trying to win an Oscar or anything.

It's just bad, just bad. Elements of Ronin, paired with Transformers pointless explosions.
Ryan Reynolds should only play Deadpool movies...

I had high hopes for this movie following Reynold's successful Deadpool franchise attempt. Unfortunately, he's back to making crap. If this movie worked as hard at a plot as it did trying to lay the groundwork for a franchise, it might have been worth watching.

reviews.review_title: See this movie, you'll thank me afterwards.
reviews.content: Take 1 part Fast and Furious, 1 part Mission Impossible and 1 part Deadpool then add a ton of Red Bull and chug that down and you have 6 Underground and that's just the 1st 10 minutes. Oh yeah Ryan Reynolds is in it so yeah, there's that.

reviews.review_title: Netflix is going to go broke.
reviews.content: It's not bad, but it's far from good. It's as if they just needed a film like this under their belt. How Netflix has no quality control over these massively over budgeted films/series is astounding.
Just visual effect and nothing else.you can watch the whole movie in fast forward.

Fun movie, great action, great special effects, great cast led by Ryan Reynolds. Never be nominated for anything but great it is definitely fun. You get to see the world with lots of breaking glass and a body count into the thousands just what a mindless action pic is meant to be.

OK. So a perfect 10 is a bit on the strong side. Its probably a 7.5 on IMDB. This is my first review on IMDB although I've used this service for years. It used to be reliable. Not sure what is going on. I love action movies, especially great action movies. Last week I tried to watch the "IMDB 7.5 rated John Wick 3" and the fight scenes which make up 80% of that movie were totally and completely ridiculous. If there were 10 bad guys they would line up and take turns fighting john wick one by one. Tag team. And even then they'd stand there waiting to be hit. That movie is so bad, I tried twice and could only make it half way through (after paying for it!). So how in the world can that be a 7.5 and a movie of this quality be a 6.2? I don't get it. In any event, enough about that movie....This movie, 6 Underground was great. From start to finish. High quality in every category. Audio, Video, acting, story line, you name it. Special effects were outstanding. Everything in this movie was believable. An important litmus test for me at least. Special effects were amazing. Edge of your seat story.This movie is so good I am now getting very suspicious about where these bad reviews are coming from. Do reviewers have it our for Netflix or something? Crazy.You like action movies? Watch this movie. Outstanding. And if you like it, review it. Seems like we need some balance here.-Matt

reviews.review_title: The excellent trailer flattered to deceive...
reviews.content:
The opening sequence is an absolute powerhouse. Visually stunning, dynamically enthralling. The scenery is beautiful & the way it fits into the chase is an object lesson in cinematography. Sadly that sets the tone for the rest of the film.
Stunning scenery & locations.
Stunning stunts & action scenes.
And errrr. that's about it :-(
Sadly this film lacks a few important details.... such as direction and a cohesive storyline. No. Actually make that ANY storyline other than some phoned-in dialogue to enable Michael Bay to indulge in his love of big showy set-pieces with lots of explosions and lots.of slow motion.... I.mean, what the heck did writers Paul Wernick & Rhett Reese actually do to earn their place on the end credits? I actually felt sorry for Ryan Reynolds, forced to squeeze 'Deadpool' sass into an Armani suit. Talking of which, I assume the unrelenting barrage of product placement of high-end goods and toys for the 1%ers was the necessary evil to pay for the pyrotechnics? Reynolds turns in a decent performance, as does Ben Hardy & Mélanie Laurent. Dave Franco owns the scene he's in. Unfortunately he doesn't make it past the first set-piece. Which is a shame. Sadly everyone else is absolutely forgettable. I mean, the film has been over for 10 mins and apart from the aforementioned, I'm having genuine difficulty remembering any of the other actors lines or performances..One last comment "Spoiler Alert!!" What was that rubbish with the magnets on the boat all about??? It made the invisible Aston Martin in the excecrable 'Die Another Day' seem reasonable & rational...So disappointed & so annoyed that I lost an evening to this dross but I WILL give it two stars, if only for the opening chase sequence.

Everything in this movie is all over the place.The storytelling is all confusing, (not the most important thing in an action movie but still relevant) the action scenes are a editing mess giving me a headache after the first 15 minutes or so and to sum up the attempt at comedy is a complete failure. Definitely not my type of movie.

It has everything. Explosions. Short cuts. Car chase. parkour. Airplanes. Boats. Collisions . Crashes. Guns. Bad guys. Amazing cinematography. Speed light editing. Original Camera angles. Magnificent directing. Storyline with flashbacks to character building.
This movie should have been released into IMAX ....a real treat for action movie lovers.
Whomever rates this below 10 doesn't know how to enjoy the finest things in life

reviews.review_title: There are better 'bad' movies to watch.
reviews.content: I had to turn it off after 30 mins. Reynolds struggles to continue his brand of humour effectively outside of Deadpool and some of his more well know movies. The supporting cast is DIRE and the script lacks anything of any real substance for that opening slot. Michael Bay can retire at Netflix and just blow stuff up. I think cinema is safe with films like this coming out on digital platforms.At least Snakes on Plane was a laugh!

This surely ranks in the upper echelons of utter crap produced by Hollywood. Raging drug addled (I assume) Americans go around the world killing people because they like it.Endorsing wars they created and abysmally lost, killing foreigners because they have been brainwashed to think are bad and their sociopaths are good, this will be lost in the pit of diarrhea that is Hollywood.
More than your run of the mill action movie, and a level of violence and gore to rival John Wick. Entertaining, and a must see for Ryan Reynolds fans.

reviews.review_title: Boilerplate plot, superficial characterizations -- but still watchable in a pinch
reviews.content: I like Ryan Reynolds (hard not to), and wish he could get himself into better fare and better scripts because he's capable of it. There are the smash hit Deadpool movies of course, which he's perfectly suited to, but also see his nice work in Woman in Gold (2015) and The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017) which show more of his range. Anyway -- "6 Underground" is very much in the same genre as the later Fast and Furious franchise output, and neither much better nor much worse than any of those. Six agents fake their own deaths and make up a Mission-Impossible-type team of anonymous vigilantes who can operate outside the law and take down the worst baddies out there. In this case, it's the standard-issue evil dictator of "Turgistan".The plot is just a thin device to connect together three or four major action segments. The first and maybe best is an extended car-chase scene through Florence (and the sets are the real thing). Well done, but why do the police and bad guys seem to have an endless supply of cars and cycles to reappear anywhere and everywhere behind them? Since this is a Michael Bay film, don't bother asking. He likes to blow things up and fire lots of guns, so that's what's going to happen.It's technically well done and injects just enough human interest through the past lives of the 6 to make it all watchable, but I can't see this spawning a franchise.

I love action movies, but this was garbage. The camera work and editing try way too hard to be an action movie... 30 camera angles in 5 seconds with flashing lights leaves you with a massive headache in the first 5-10 minutes. Everyone in the room watching it, literally had to look away it was so intense and dizzy causing. The "comedy" and over the top unbelievable action feels like an uneducated teenager wrote and directed it or like a bunch of people in a writing room just kept trying to top each other by adding more and more stunts. It's bad... really bad. I guess my dad would like it, but that doesn't say much.

reviews.review_title: Exactly what you would expect from Michael Bay.
reviews.content: The first scene with the 'Day-glo Green' Alfa Romeo has some pretty stylistic cinematography and action sequences, despite the obvious continuity errors. Inevitably it's a Michael Bay film and it doesn't extend much outside of his normal aesthetic comfort zone, brashness, sweeping camera moves and lacks of unique story development or cohesion for that matter. Ryan Reynolds' charm couldn't even redeem this from being just another 'brainless' outing.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to anyone else but me!
reviews.content: Watch this movie! It has everything you've ever wanted! Humor, Justice, Action and just all around Goodness!! How I wish the world was really like this! Don't miss this movie and don't listen to the naysayers!! So very glad I watched it! And will watch again!!!! Loved it!! Thank you all involved!!!

Loved this movie!
The opening sequence was breathtaking and one of the best opening scenes I've seen.
The movie had great characters, great action & great special effects and deserves to be a huge hit.
Interesting story line where for once there are no constraints on the 'good guys' and they can do whatever is needed to get the 'bad guys'Thoroughly enjoyable.Highly recommended!

I didn't see Bay as the director before watching this, but I figured it out pretty quickly.The opening scene is an excellent display of special effects and destruction, one that I'll watch over again in the coming years, it's that good.The movie itself is a popcorn flick. Quick scenes, quick transitions, and cool-guy dialogue abounds; nothing wrong with that, it never tries to be anything else.You've seen every scene in this movie before, somewhere or other. The Losers (2010) came to mind almost immediately.I frankly lost the exact story for a bit about a half-hour in, but it's not a complicated plot; you'll find it again. My confusion - without giving it away - was due to the way it was written, and then edited together, and not because of cannabis at all, I'm certain.I'll be adding this to my pile of re-watchable action movies.Firm 7.

As per the other reviews, just pointless nonsense. Sparks galore, cars shooting 50ft in the air when they crash? Storyline that makes no sense really. Turned it off halfway through. Some people seem to like it. They must be a bit more skilled than me at the suspension of disbelief.
I'm 40 mins in. If this review is still up now, my opinion hasn't changed but this is a mess. Complete mess. It's funny though.

reviews.review_title: I mean it's a Michael Bay film...
reviews.content: It was a fun movie that didn't try and be anything it wasn't. Ryan Reynolds was his usual self and the supporting cast played well off him and each other. The action was over the top and cars exploded just cause it's cool to watch. I got exactly what I expected and that was a good thing. Some people just love to hate Bay films because it's the cool thing to do or whatever. I personally liked the movie. It's not gonna go in my top 10 of anything but I would definitely watch it again.
What is the film even about? Load of random scenes cut together. 3 stars for cast and crew only.

Michael Bay, Ryan Reynolds, Melanie Laurent just to name a few, surely are much better than this mindless, CGI wreck of an incomprehensible so-called action movie. What a waste of good money and talents to create a CGI-laden movie with a farce of a script? You won't feel any hint of sympathy with any of the main cast even when they showcased a weak attempt to draw your emotions to Reynolds's character in saving some harmless poor kids from fire bombs. This movie can be trashed along with another casualty, Gemini Man. Don't waste your money buying this movie; just download it off a torrent site.
Brilliant far fetched action hero movie with a lot of laughs and amazing stunts. Would've loved to have seen this on the big screen.

reviews.review_title: Just don't think and watch a fun movie
reviews.content: Dont expect a deep plot. It's just a fun movie with explosions. I found the parkour stuff fun and exiting to watch. Only a little bit tired of Renolds playing a sarcastic dude. The other actors where fun to watch If there will be a part two of tree I don't mind. I would watch it, just for a lazy Sunday afternoon movie.

What a stinker!
Ryan is making a Deadpool parody of himself in every movie. Crappy acting.

Great action movie but awful script.Can't stand this.
But it reminds me one big country politics - to find some "Turgistan", make it's "dictator" public enemy and replace him with "democtrat".

What the eff is wrong with people these days? Can someone, somewhere answer that simple question? I know there was a time that films were made to entertain without the need to psychoanalysis every single frame and line, films you could just ENJOY, do you remember that word? This is an amazing, fast paced totally unbelievable piece of magic, if you don't like it fair enough, but, your life will be emptier without this kind of pure escapism.

reviews.review_title: Just a Fun Fun Action Movie.
reviews.content: Elon Musk Meets X-Force with Dead Pool Vibes. All the bad reviews come from Michael Bay Haters and people that just can't enjoy a fun action movie. It might have some flaws but not enough to warrant all these 1 and 2 star reviews. Don't over think it, it's just fun.Looking forward to part Two!

reviews.review_title: Th tad me cancelling Netflix - utter garbage and only cost 150 million
reviews.content: Worst film made since the beginning of film invention , how do these things get passed to be made ,not gonna waste my time in a review only gonna say Ryan Reynolds stick to wearing masks just like all the d listers do now

Let's be realistic - its a Michael Bay movie. And we all know what to expect from a Michael Bay movie. And if you don't, then that's your fault, because he's made enough big movies that you should know better by now.The difference with this movie is it seemed like Netflix was like "hey Michael, you know all those limitations studios kept putting on you and your movies? Well, we're not going to do that, so have at it!" And have at it he did. I've seen exploding and crashing cars, but never have I seen flying bodies horrifically and brutally flung from those exploding cars. And it was awesome. Plus, it was funny, Ryan Reynolds is always nice to look at, the rest of the cast was great too, and it keeps you on the edge of your seat.Yes, the editing was a little confusing, with all the interjected back stories as they rushed to build connections with you and the characters. And yes, at times this got really annoying. And yes, a lot of the scenes were just purely ridiculous and over the top. But I don't go into a Michael Bay movie expecting amazing story telling, and if you did that that's on you because by now you should know better.There was also a very clear and obvious hint that they are setting this up to be the first of many 6-Underground movies (just like the never dying Fast and the Furious franchise) - and I for one hope this is true because I am definitely ready for more!

Words can not convey just how bad this film is. A steaming pile of ****
Only giving the film 1 star as zero is not an option.

This movie is not going to a win any awards-it's not an incredible plot or screenplay or whatever. But I'm someone who plays on their phone while watching movies, especially if they get boring. And not a single point during this film did I feel the need to pick it up. It's engaging and fun, and that's what I want in a movie. 10/10 to combat some of these unnecessary negative reviews.

reviews.review_title: Any review below 5 stars is a snowflake in fetal position
reviews.content: This movie is Deadpool jokes , with big explosions, gory violence and lots of fun. You like action?? Splatter?? Heads being blown off?? Awesome car chases?? Hell ya!! First 20 minutes is non stop action! Any wuss would rate this below 6 or 5. Their tears make me laugh

reviews.review_title: If you like an action film you'll love this
reviews.content: Ryan Reynolds plays "1". He's a billionaire and philanthropist and after witnessing civilians in a refugee camp being massacred in Turgistan, by an evil dictator, he decides to right the world of its wrongs by faking his own death and going after bad people, including the Turgistan dictator.He starts recruiting an elite group to join him, including a hitman, a spy, a CIA agent, a soldier and a free running young thief, who also have to"ghost" themselves. Each of the group are given a number as their name so as not to reveal their true identities to each other.There is a little bit of back story about each of the group, but there is no explanation as to how the group are trained in weaponary, combat and tech skills, particularly 1, who as a billionaire inventor, would not have had those skills.The film focuses on the rescue of the Dictator's brother who is the good brother and wants to make Turgistan a better place for its people, by encouraging a revolution. He's currently under house arrest in a palatial pent house in Hong Kong, surrounded by his brother's henchmen.There are a few holes in the plot, but a few tongue in cheek moments, which were amusing. I enjoyed the film.

No buildings were destroyed in the making of this movie. 6 Underground is a CGI (computer generated image) extravaganza, designed to make the viewer feel as though things are being destroyed but without doing anything more than creating an illusion using sophisticated computer technology--just as in video games. In effect, this creation is the movie equivalent of a video game, the object of which is to ¨kill the bad guys¨.The same old ¨we are good and they are evil¨ premise underlying most Hollywood war movies is used here. Taking propaganda to a whole new level, however, we are ¨taught¨ in this film that coups and regime change are good things, and that when a group of foreigners decides to wage a coup, it´s just part of the natural stream of events that the dictator being deposed should be fed to the angry masses whom he oppressed.Sound familiar? This is the story of Libya, where Muammar Gaddafi was deposed and ultimately sodomized by bayonet and executed by an angry mob. The references to Sarin gas are obviously intended to rehydrate memories of claims that, in Syria, President Bashir al-Assad poisoned his own people. (That regime change is still a work in progress, according to the makers of this mess.)Sad to see that the Caustic Incompetence Agency (CIA) has now infiltrated Netflix. Could be because former President Barack Obama is on their board. He was one of the primary perpetrators of the 2011 Libyan coup. He also armed rebels in Syria with the intention of overthrowing their ¨evil¨ dictator. Sure, the rebels were former Al Qaeda affiliates, but let´s not quibble over details!When one thinks through what is being promoted here, it becomes clear that the warriors for justice are in effect themselves terrorists. They have self-ghosted themselves (pretended that they died) so that they can kill anyone they want anywhere they want for whatever reason they want. So what if thousands or even millions of entirely innocent people are killed, maimed, terrorized, left bereft and transformed into refugees along the way. All that matter are the killers´ own intentions! This is profound self-deception on a truly sociopathic level.Unfortunately, the very paradigm of propaganda woven into this movie has been used to resplendent effect in wrecking large swaths of the Middle East in the 21st century, where thousands of buildings and persons were in fact destroyed.

reviews.review_title: If you make your fortune by developing a super magnet, does that mean you're a magnet magnate?
reviews.content: I'll give this movie 3 stars for some good action sequences with interesting camera angles and excellent effects. Also, there are some very good scenic shots. Otherwise, this movie is terrible. It has a thin plot with huge holes, shallow characters, bad dialogue, and terrible nonsensical editing.

The opening car chase was too long and we didn't know the characters or why they were there or any details at all. Left us not caring.
I turned the channel.
Great action Movie! The special affects are off the charts - especially in the car chase senes.
Ray do great job and the dubbing artist are fab,comic timing is excellent man.the abusing they used are quite change that looked awesome.

reviews.review_title: It's not great, but not bad either
reviews.content: Basically it's tons of product placement with cheesy dialogs and good cgi action. I don't know if i would want to see a sequel of this ...
This movie is just terrible. The editing is awful and it's a complete waste of time to watch.
Well for 38 mins was enough for this so called movie.

So, fifteen minutes into the car chase that, near as I can tell, occupies this entire movie, after about twenty different sports cars have been blown up, and body parts thrown all across the screen on the backstreets of Florence, Italy, I found myself wondering 'Wait, are there seriously no Black people in this entire movie?'At this juncture, the core cast had been introduced in a pretty typical, late-90's style shoot'em up montage, replete with 'banter' so flat even Ryan Reynolds seems checked out, and being similarly uncaptured by the action, I came to this website, to look at the cast list, and as far as I can tell, it is 2019, and this movie doesn't capture on film anyone darker than a latte. Which was inconceivable, and then I saw that Michael Bay was directing - which accounted both for why a car rolling over into a curbside gelato cart warranted an explosion, and why this film is so pale.Add in the 'good billionaire' narrative they establish - a thing that does not exist - and I turned it off and found something better to do with my time; which is what drew the 1 star rating. Any movie I just cannot be bothered to even finish gets 1 star. This was a miserable affair, and I am sort of baffled as to why Reynolds took the job, he's been on such a roll.

reviews.review_title: Action, laughs, excitement that's this movie
reviews.content: If you want a show that is action packed full of excitement then this is your movie. For me I could NOT find one moment of wanting to shut it off or change channels.I truly enjoyed the show and already have plans to rewatch the movie and join those to push for another movie. You want excitement, action, and thrills then watch the movie.
Michael Bay please stop making movies. Ryan stop taking roles with a all over the place plot pointless scene changes/settings. Corny jokes.So many areas dragged on for no reason.

reviews.review_title: Action packed and laugh out loud moments
reviews.content:
Absolutely loved this movie
My husband and I laughed all the way through. It's a non stop action movie with plenty of 1 liners
Ryan Reyanlds was on form the entire time
I really hope they make a sequel
This movie is what would happen if the doodles in a 12 year old boys homework journal were given $150,000,000

Its a typical Michael bay action flick filled with explosions and story that's over the top. Not sure what all the hate is on this movie, just sit back in your living room and enjoy it for what it is.

This movie was hard to watch. if u have an eye for detail don't watch this. stuff that irritates me is when ur car gets crashed and in the next scene its brand new shiny yellow again without bruises and with a sidemirror that 3 seconds before crashed of the car. jokes are not good, no emotional connection with story or people is there. i shut this whole thing down after 15 min. If your drunk and with friends i should recommend it, otherwise please dont waste your time.

While this movie had some very nice action scenes, has a typical blockbuster script, ... the whole movie was wasted due to serious script flow issues, had no cohesion what so ever, .. no to mention the hasty development of some very interesting points of the story. Too bad for Netflix.. this could be a blockbuster, as money spent were good enough for an action film

reviews.review_title: Awful Action Scenes, Comedy of a film.
reviews.content: Currently 18 minutes in and I have to say these are some of the absolute worst action scenes I ever had the displeasure of sitting through. 2 minutes in we see a mass of car parts collide and super over the top sparks fly from the wreckage, so fake its laughable. At 5 minutes we see the green car collide with a truck and the left wing mirror explode off, then for the next 5 minutes we clearly see in VERY obvious shots the wing mirror in tact and perfectly attached to the car, they almost make a point of zooming in on it at times. 10 minutes in another mass of fake sparks fly for no reason whatsoever, then they mess around with an eyeball for a few minutes which is ironic because I want to remove my eyes also. 18 minutes in we see a bad guy get hit with a noob tube, it strikes him on the tip of the nose and whizzes past but somehow he shakes his head and blood sprays from his mouth, I could almost hear the director yell 'now' before the fake blood was spit out like he's Triple H. Next we see them kick the front car window out like its a piece of paper and then they all bury James Francos less successful brother. Now we see a flashback of a Jon Jones wannabe and how he's upset because some of his squad gets killed in the army, I have never ever seen that in film before... yawn. Ryan and "7" spy on a funeral for giggles then deadpool narrates how theyre ghosts, ohhhhh scary. Now blake lively's husband shows his big magnet party trick and they plan to go and kill a guy because it sounds like fun. Ryan rescues a kid from Chernobyl 2.0 then sleeps with a random woman because he can. A fat guy dances in front of some hookers then him and all his friends get shot in the head by boris becker. Boris has sex with martina and then we see agent smith and his buddys throw 4 guys off a roof and one guy does a few spinning starfish manoeuvres before splatting on the ground. Parkour in russia next because why not. One guy falls and wakes up in the movie Saw only Ryan Reynolds is jigsaw. Not making this up. He was playing a prank though and laughs as parkour kid now has to change his pants. They all now suddenly cant stop saying the word 'snatch' but brad pitt is nowhere in sight. They need to rescue some guy so they all decide to put masks on and throw laughing gas at people because thats the best method apparently. A chinese guy says 'no parrie here' then they shoot him because they wanted a party. Jon Jones covers them with sniper fire but accidentally shoots his own guy but its ok folks because masks can absorb 50 cal bullets. Jon boy now shoots a water tank and everybody goes for a swim, michael phelps would be proud. Parkour kid almost dies but doesnt for some reason. They exchange real names then go to a power genrator and pretend to be english while talking about masturbation. Nope, still not making this up. A revolution starts because of one video which makes big bad guy flee in his range rover and run people down like skittles at a bowling alley. He heads to his yacht but numbered kids were expecting this and begin shooting up the place then magnet boy makes everyone stick to the wall like spiderman. Boom goes the dynamite as part of the yacht explodes, baldy bad boy tries to escape but ryan and his crew miraculously just happen to catch him on the choppa, aaaaoooo. They throw him out and the citizens attack him and probably chop him up into little keepsake pieces. Cue cheesy dialouge about death and living, bla bla bla. Jon jones throws a gun in the ocean and laughs because he's polluted the water and he hates greta thunberg, and then the film ends. No seriously, thats it. What an awesome comedy.

Its Bay meets Reynolds and you will want more. People want an original story but afraid to give it a chance. THERE'S GONNA BE EXPLOSIONS AND THEIRS GONNA BE BAD HUMOR but its a fun time and you dont realize it till after it's done how long it is cause it keeps you engulfed in it.
I enjoyed watching this movie, there wasn't much deep conversations which I found great.

reviews.review_title: Awesome Netflix movie. Possibly their best to date?
reviews.content:
Great casting, and I have to say great acting and effects throughout.
Reynolds plays his usual wisecracking merc, but this time he's got money, not superpowers, which is why the team refer to him as Bruce Wayne a few times throughout.It's a military style, black ops, coup d'etat style movie, with really likeable characters "1-7" but we do learn their names.It's a team of misfits put together by Reynolds aka #1.
Then there's a driver.
Hitman.
Dr.
Ex CIA Spook.
A free runner whose half monkey.
And finally, and in this group of "6" we have #7 who is an ex Delta sniper.
Add action scenes and one-liners,this is the result. A truly enjoyable movie from start to finish.

I was expecting a good action movie but after watching it I was totally disappointed.
There is no plot at all, the director tries to be original and modern but without any result. Next time Netflix should spend their money better, big productions don't mean good results.

reviews.review_title: Action porn for those who like it. Spoiler: Michael Bay movie
reviews.content: This is one preposterous movie. I love Ryan Reynolds but these fast cutting scenes just hurt my eyes. And this crazy script? By Odin! And the car scenes in the beginning...when they hit stuff it looks as if someone shot fireworks for the sparks! That's too much. I stopped at the 54 minute mark and went looking for something else to watch.
Not an oscar winner but it tries too hard to be funny. Explosions and special effects are awesome and as long as you have low expectations it's worth watching if you have nothing better to do.

I kept waiting for the music clip to end and for the actual movie to begin until I realized this isn't really a movie, there's no story, just a bunch of scenery and action clips stitched together and punctuated with laconic pretentious punchlines. It's really admirable how much money can be spent to produce something visually stunning but with no actual content. Here's a crazy idea, next time spend more money hiring a decent writer and director and save some on VFX, stunts and cars.

You don't want expect from Michael Bay to pull off a Scorsese ! You want Bayhem and there's tons of it. Was there a possibility to be better ? Of course! Could have been a lot better. But would I loose any sleep over it ? Nope ! It's a fun escape, designed that way. At times it seems shallow and over the top but that was the point ! Yacht magnet action sequencing was very very good!Want some no brainer fun ? 6 Underground it is !!

reviews.review_title: 9/10 A perfect entertaining action packed movie! Ignore the haters! They are just a bunch of marvel fan boys!
reviews.content: The level of entertaining is maximum! The action scenes are crazy awesome! There are so much violence, blood and gore! The movie is what as you want from a Michael Bay movie but this time being R rated and not a PG 12 crap! I have seen here so many clowns who rate this movie with 1 and 2 thinking they are now some smart ones! Hey, losers, it is an action movie who wants to be entertaining, not an oscar worthy! For goodness sake! I bet all those clowns giving this low ratings are marvel wussies fans, this movie being better than almost all marvel childish craps!
Just because it is from Michael Bay does not mean that the film is bad !!! The action scenes are breathtaking and the cinematography is beautiful, this film was much better than I thought !!!

reviews.review_title: Don't go if you don't have the stomach for it
reviews.content:
I've put the alert to see this movie but I didn't have had the stomach to fully watch the first mission before I quit.
Don't do the same mistake as me, this is not only for 16+ (I'm 37).

reviews.review_title: A film that couldn't decide quite what it wanted to be...
reviews.content: ...before settling on being a hot flashy mess.I sat through the whole film, but was really ready to give up about 30 until the end. I convinced myself to see it through til the end, but gained nothing from doing so.An action film? Undoubtedly. A comedy? In parts - jarringly so. Confusing at times, predictable in it's ending, plot holes galore, characters I didn't care about. Even Ryan Reynolds couldn't save this film!

There is nothing good about this movie.
Bad cinematography.
Bad acting.
It all makes no sense. Shock VS humor, humor VS forced drama. However a bottle of wine made more sense

reviews.review_title: A Ton of Fun, Explosions, Body Parts and Blood
reviews.content: If you are looking for a deep, philosophical drama about the vagaries of man...look elsewhere. If you enjoy a thrill a minute ride, Michael Bay style, this is the movie for you. This movie has more blood in it than a Dracula film and revels in it the way the Deadpool movies do.Ryan Reynolds is a billionaire who puts together a team of former operatives from around the world with various talents. Melanie laurent, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo, Ben Hardy, Aria Arjona, Danve Franco and Corey Hawkins make up the rest of the team. They do a really nice job of giving each character dimension and depth that is usually missing from these team up movies. The team all fake their deaths so they can go underground, hence the title. They go after high end criminals with all the glee of a pack of dogs on a three-legged cat, a sort of bada$$ A Team. The profanity flies fast as do the exploding and mutilated body parts. Some of the deaths are over the top and I found myself yelling "oh" and then laughing my tail off every time a body was torn to shreds. I found it fascinating how they filmed some of the scenes because they look so darn real.As is typical in these types of movies, the police are nowhere in sight despite these people destroying most of the city with their driving and machine guns. Apparently, the police are social distancing. The plot is kind of weak, but the action is so fast and furious you won't notice it. The banter between the crew is well written and delivered with perfect timing. The film reminded me of Reynolds other films (Deadpool and Hitman's Bodyguard) as well as Shoot 'em Up.Itsa fun two hours as long as you don't try to analyze it too much.

reviews.review_title: Confusing edits but as a great finish
reviews.content: The cuts were poorly executed during some scenes that didn't make sense but the comedy and storyline made up for it.Ben Hardy really sold his performance and did a great job.

reviews.review_title: Really good, but a few changes would not hurt
reviews.content: Michael Bay did make a great movie I think. It's unique in it's action and in the violence, but I think sometimes Michael Bay movies will have a little too much going on at once. Towards the end of the movie he should have slowed it down a bit more so you could appreciate everything that was going on. Other than this critique I did enjoy this movie.

It's a Michael Bay film, just enjoy it. If you'd like to critique an art film watch some Polanski or Aronofsky.
This had the greatest 20 minute car chase I've seen in a while, and it's right out of the gate.

This is precisely what wrong with 98% of American films today. Their either all action with no plot like this film, or it's infantile superhero trash. This is the former: All the lead people are impossibly good looking and supposed to have "best of the best" skills. Worst of all, thete is zero plot. I even have a name for this: "The John Wick Syndrome". It is all of the above. Boring, boring boring the best films today come out of China, Taiwan, Korea, some Japanese and Scandinavian countries. Especially the Danish and Swedish films. They don't have any comic book superhero trash. Instead, they are thoughtful, clever, sexy and overall better than Hollywood pablum. Sure, there are exceptions, but they are few and far between. Michael Bay is action action action enough already boring. Skip this baby pablum.

6 Underground is what happens when Michael Bay and Ryan Reynolds have a secret love child, then abort it, then keep the remains and use them to reenact the solitary confinement scene from The Great Escape in the bathroom of a Denny's.

The movie had potential but the editing was confusing, and action scenes became "noise". Characters seemed inconsistent and as much as I love Ryan, he was poorly directed. This was a concoction of action in a blender. I expected better.

reviews.review_title: yet another netflop parody of an action flilm
reviews.content: Cheezy dialogs, genertic plot. the Ghost squad of faked deaths yadda yadda yadda.

reviews.review_title: Hard to say how this film'll end up as a finished article
reviews.content:
Probably the wankiest* film of the year so far. Which is saying something, since it's almost halfway through December already. (13-12-2019 at time of writing)
*(Originally, somewhat pessimistically rated a 1 out of 10 by me, probably a bit
too hastily, methinks now)I apologise to director(s), producer(s), cast and crew for improperly and unfairly impugning this film, given I've only seen the trailer; it just might turn out to be a work of comedy genius though, like the latest Baywatch film, or a cult classic like Idiocracy perhaps. Anyway, I think if it does go on and become popularly acclaimed in the public's imagination, then it's perfectly justified to score it an eight out of ten, notwithstanding the fact it's jumping the gun I know, and
pre-empting the finished product quite massively. (I'll leave the original comment however, just for context if nothing else, and put in brackets what the original rating was as well). Good luck with the endeavour though, it looks very worthwhile, if only just from a casual observer's point of view and perspective.

reviews.review_title: When action movies were action movies
reviews.content: I get it. You see yourself as an intellectual with a high standard when it comes to what you watch. But hey, this isn't an entry for Cannes, and Michael Bay isn't pretending otherwise. Car chases: check, guns: check, blood: check, tits and ass: check, Ryan Reynolds one-liners: check. Leave your pseudo-intellectualism at the door and just enjoy the movie for what it is. A film to entertain and not to make you think about whatever social injustice you believe has been done to you.

reviews.review_title: Michael bay film - so good action - terrible plot
reviews.content: The movie is quite a chore to get through, even though I like Ryan, this is just an awfully boring film.

What an awful mess. Cheesy, dumb dialogue, choppy editing. Horribly predictable attempts at being interesting, sentimental, humorous, edgy.This felt like the result of an uncool aging filmmaker trying desperately to be cool and relevant and failing miserably. Too many stupid scenes to mention... too much stupid dialogue to point out in a single review.One Star was for the occasional humorous line by Ryan Reynolds. The other star was for the eyeball scene at the very beginning of the movie, which was actually funny.The film warrants no more stars, and I'm being generous by not considering deductions for the many flaws, which would have the final rating at negative -3,782 stars.

2+ Hours of explosions, aerial location shots, slow-mo scenes and product placements.The plot is extremely thin and the '6 Underground' premise is pointless and has nothing to do with (or any impact to) what happens in the movie.I could write more but it really isn't worth the effort.
Engaging cast but can't save a terrible boring film - don't waste your time.

Good movie, Good story
Maybe a little messy on the cuts here and there but overall pretty decent.IDK if the movie would deserve a sequel
(Wich is already confirmed wont happen) but they could give it a try.I personally just like the idea about 6 People faking thier death to fight for good, the story overall is also really good since its not a typical Hollywood style movie. The story telling maybe a little bit thin but good enough to understand whats happening.I personally liked it but thats just my opinion ;)

I mean I don't know what I expected from a Michael Bay movie. I should have known that it would be ridiculous action, gratuitous shots of scantily clad women, and awkward shot angles. Even the plot is just dumb. Government's won't do "what is necessary" so this rogue team is administering their own "justice." It's such an oversimplification of reality... As if the forceful deposition of a tyrant works if executed by this rogue team, not a government, because they don't have to deal with the red tape. The US HAS organized coups in the past, and it ends up worse for the people in that nation. What was supposed to be a cool, empowering movie was nothing more than a convoluted mess of explosions, bodies flying, and Ryan Reynolds' one liners. Don't waste your two hours.

reviews.review_title: 2 stars for the CGI special effects. There is nothing else but CGI special effects. Incredibly boring.
reviews.content: Incredibly boring. Why? Although the trailer looked flashy and out of control and wild, this movie is a dud. Dead on arrival.The only "good" thing about this movie are the CGI generated special effect stunts and chases. Quite impressive. 2 stars for that.The bad: It's an empty shell. Cardboard characters. No story. No suspense. No thrill. Nothing. I feel totally numb watching it. Started pondering about the meaning of life...
Difficult movie to get into due to Michael Bays typical style. There were some good action sequences and some funny moments, but it was all a bit too cheesy.

reviews.review_title: I don't know why I didn't watch this sooner other than I don't use Netflix as much as I used to
reviews.content: Usual style of Micheal Bay lots of explosions, unnecessary violence that isn't justified, and very high budget but that's ok with me cause the entertainment value overrules! The cast is perfect throughout they definitely keep everything worth worth watching and I think the editing is impressive. It's unfortunate Michael Bay's films are appreciated more despite the obvious reasons in my opinion he makes really slick cinematography happen and super exciting chain of events!

It's entertaining, suspenseful, comedy and action From the beginning to the end. This was a job well-done from the actors, story and to the filming
Great job how the film was shot in many different countries and they way they made it together is just spectacular. I have no words to explain and describe how amazing this movie was. Thank you as it's been a long time since I enjoyed an action movie

Why we watch Action Movies ? For entertainment. I am just a movie lover ... And this movie had everything for entertaining everyone. Yeah violence was bit like Deadpool. But in the end that depends on your taste. But it was truely an Action Packed Entertainer with some really cool graphics and Car destruction scenes.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this film. The plot could have been much better but they decided to fill this movie with unnecessary action that made no sense.Also what's wrong with all these fake locations , it was obvious that alot of scenes were filmed in Abu Dhabi !!
Succession of cliches dont waste your time watching it

What utter rubbish.
Rubbish plot
Rubbish continuity
Impossibly instantaneous/absurd changes from one situation to another
Unnecessary overload of conscience numbing violence - begets the very thing the main protagonist claims he's trying to rid the world of.
The basic idea has something too it, and had the potential to be a genuinely clever, fun and entertaining film.
But alas this was not too be.
Unfortunately the makers have sold out to bargain basement crap to smear all over our screens.
Your time could be so much better spent.
Six untraceable agents, totally off the grid. They've buried their pasts so they can change the future. This is one of exhilarating movie that I've ever seen!

Shaded scenes...Slow motion action scenes, walking scenes, talking scenes, everything - exaggerated slow motion....Explosions every 5 mins...This was a reincarnation of Transformers but with people. Michael Bay needs to change his formula because it is old and boring now.

No story, no dialogues, nothing makes sense... even after 50minutes you have actually no clue wtf is even happening...
Avoid this crap.
Nothing but car chases, fighting, killing and one liners. Terrible movie.

Actually kinda miss these movies from the its friday night lets go to blockbuster heres the latest movie , hey whats that one - oh its a hollywood a-lister i'm between franchises or massive movies i need to work i'll do a b movie.Sometimes those movies were watchable , some were even good - this ones not too bad , the stories full of ( and then theres an explosion) and pretty empty on ( hey why'd he do this ?) if you roll with it , you can pass it up as a no thinking action movie

Only not giving it a 10 due to some of the too quick cuts between scenes that at first left me a little lost but once things came together didn't really bother me and a plot decision made within the first act of the movie (won't spoil) .... Also maybe I'm just a sucker for an action movie that can pull off some heart and you know, Ryan Reynolds.
Pretty cool opening scene but after that complete garbage. This was so bad. Apparently Netflix approves a budget of 150 mio USD for a script that could have been written by a 6 year old.
This ain't your old uncle's Netflix. I'm just glad it wasn't endless scenes of chaotic transforming robots. Better than expendables by far... like Oceans 11 meets mission impossible.

I love action flics; Ryan Reynold's cliched humor not so much. Beyond that minor point, how much action and cgi is too much? 6 Underground answers that question. Action movies don't have much of a plot but this one has none. The whole movie relies too much on fast camera shots, cgi, and comedic cliched relief.
What I really don't like is the romanticization of black ops and high tech warfare. It's seems so easy to make the rich and powerful the villain and then take them down with high tech and specialized crews. It's just an overused formula in Hollywood. Overkill takes on a special meaning here.
Worth watching. Action sequences are really good and just a fun movie.

reviews.review_title: If you like action movies where you don't have to think too much
reviews.content: Good action, right amount of comedy, well shot. If you like the fast and the furious then you will like this. Just remember to not over think it, just enjoy the ride.

I just watched about 20 minutes ish of this why are they driving around what is going on why do they cut like 10 times a second please pull back the camera michael where are the cars what why is there random music i have no clue what the hell is happening please tell me is this some sort of fever dream? am i hallucinating what, what. what

This movie made me contemplate my own existence. It was that good. Everything in this movie made so much sense. All the decisions that went into this masterpiece, were just, wow. I dare say that this film is a miracle. I feel blessed to have even witnessed it.
Just enjoy this for what it is. Full on action, killing all over the place, in your face product placement and some funny bits. Perfect for a bit of mindless entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Very Enjoyable Chewing Gum for the Brian
reviews.content: Having read all of the reviews here, I'm somewhat surprised at the amount of negative opinions. As many here are have stated, "it's a Michael Bay movie"I loved it.

reviews.review_title: Definitely, Micheal Bay at his best (whatever that means to you)
reviews.content:
It is an old school Bay, sorta of. Back when he was an upcoming director, when people talked about his movies and not about him.
I'll give Bay the credit he's owed. Action is his name, explosions are his game. That long car chase in the beginning says it all and I am hooked.
I'm a man who loves a story, but knowing that Bay is behind the wheel means I'm not going to get a good one. It also means I know what I am getting: action (and a series of great camera shots, which Bay has been greatly overdoing ever since icons like Spielberg and Cameron said he's so good at).
In place of story we do get Ryan Reynolds who has this odd charm to him that really really works and makes everything so much more humorous. He's very good for the slow moments in this speed tunnel that should be filled with a little more narrative depth instead of the superficial everyone loves heroes movie click bait.
It's Micheal Bay so I'll give it to him. Whatever we all like about Bay he gives it to us for Netflix. It's a perfect action movie cause it's Reynolds doing what he does well and Bay doing exactly what we expect of him.

Movie showing fake country fake topography fake cities, lots of running here and there lots of women shown in bikini's seducing men and unnecessary prolonged action stunts is the original movie plot. Seriously a ridiculous actions women used to luring men and doing long and boring stunts is what this movie is all about. Such a childish and funny approach, total trash and utter rubbish, and is highly not recommended and don't waste your two hours do something better.

Just sit back and relax on your sofa and enjoy this entertaining action blockbuster with many elements taken from other Ryan Reynolds Movies, the newer F&F and basically every other Michael Bay movie.
This movie just wants to entertain you.

I spent a lot of the first hour thoroughly confused. The movie jumps around quite a bit and the basic premise doesn't seem immediately apparent if you have not read a write-up on this movie ahead of time (I did not).But... it has Ryan Reynolds and he is always fun to watch. It has bad-ass, beautiful women toting guns and not afraid to use them. It has lots (and I do mean LOTS) of car chases so that's fun. And just a ton of action going on in general on yachts, with expensive cars and beautiful locales.So all in all, not a bad way to spend an evening watching this movie. Not Oscar-worthy, but for me it doesn't have to be. It did what I came for it to do, entertain me.

What everyone else is saying is true, the most Michael Bay movie ever made. The story is stupid and nonsensical at moments, the dialogue...I mean you should know what kind of garbage to expect. 5 stars because the cinematography, the action, and the actors. Entertaining afternoon watch if you can take your brain out of the equation. The big shame is just feeling the enormous potential that is wasted here. If he cut out 30% of the stylized shots and nonsensical action moments, and invested In good storytelling, dialogue, and character development, this movie could have been an 8 or 9.

reviews.review_title: If you have an attention span of 2seconds per frame
