I'm a big fan of action movies. And this movie is full of craziness , comedy and actions. It's really enjoyable. Main hero of this movie reminds me to ironman. Because he is brilliant inventor of cool things and he is also a Crazy Billionaire like Iron man.

Deadpool without the swords and tight costume. It's fast, full of action, full of witty dialogue and really well done. There are negatives as well but if you watch this film and want to start picking holes without just thinking yes. It was a great film. You're wrong.

Early in the movie I thought I was watching a re-enactment of Black Hawk Down. Great effects. Fast paced movie, chases, comic turns, great scenery. The actors selected as the group of 'ghosts' have great chemistry. Watch it at least once.

reviews.review_title: Would You Like Some Explosions With Your Laughs?
reviews.content: This is like Call of Duty with a nice dash of Comedy Central. It's fast-paced, energetic action and humorous (you know Ryan Reynolds brings big, often ad-libbed laughs to anything he does, but he is also a great dramatic actor as well) and even moments of humanity. The acting chops from everyone here is on point. And to add to it all are fascinating locations, awesome cars, glamorous moments (like a Bond film) and adventure. Don't forget Micheal Bay explosions! A top-notch, entertaining watch. You must check it out!

reviews.review_title: This a full arab spring movie and very political and full of propaganda.
reviews.content: Okay, an Arab spring film is said to have taken place in an anti-Turkish anti-Muslim Turgistan, but it looks more like an Arab country maybe dubai. Probably a film shot in Italy, especially when the name of the yacht part of the name of KISMET. Not there is middle asia like Özbekistan or Kazakistan. Maybe next spring Turk spring?

reviews.review_title: Would of been fun with a plot
reviews.content:
This film started good, the plane stunts at the beginning were excellent, it's beautifully shot, no expense spared. There's some funny Ryan Reynolds dialogue.
The bad: the other 6 are lame, budget actors due to Reynolds fee, the plot is very thin so much so you forget what the films about, a lot of noise and chopping of scenes make it confusing. Overall should of been better.
It's a very interesting movie with lighthearted comedy and crazy action along the way. Definitely worth the watch and would watch again.

reviews.review_title: Now THAT'S how to make a movie!
reviews.content: Well done! Non friggin stop action! When's part II?
I had to create an IMDb account just to say the movie is amazing! well balanced cast.. it would be an insult if there is no sequel.

reviews.review_title: Like watching 100 commercials w little plot
reviews.content:
Michael Bay should stick to glossy slow motion commercials as this film is by far his worst ever.
Sad as it's just an endless slow mo super fast cuts with terrible cliche music - and he just has no idea how to create any depth of characters or flow and stop moving the bloody camera. It almost gives you a headache. always with great dp work and pretty people but 2 hours of it is annoyingly painful.Sad to see Ryan Reynolds acting wasted and the supporting team. Kudos to vfx team but writers should be fired. Wanna be fast furious.A 3 for great shots and car chase scenes.

I don't really care what critics say I usually watch movies and judge them for myself. I found this movie fun and entertaining, fast cars big explosions and lots of dead bad guys lol. Just watch it and judge for yourself.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely loved it! Michael bay style!
reviews.content: I was looking for the movie as it was supported with Dolby Atmos and vision. As my tv n soundbar supported it, the output is cool.The songs are good, the action sequence are amazing, the storyline is amazing and non stop drama.The Deadpool actor performed pretty well, in fact each character has been amazing. All actors do resonate with their roles. Their action speaks louder than words.The action sequesnce including Parkour has been amazing, the VFX is cool and never boring. I saw this actin sequence many times on tv.Yup, sometimes it could feel some extra spicey or unbelievable moments, but overall satisfying. Thanks.

I love this film with Ryan Reynolds senate it had not a fun action some great kills in was relevant to the day. If you like movies about espionage in overthrowing of governments the love this one to must see

reviews.review_title: nice camera shame about the story
reviews.content: Cinematography is awesome, the acting is great but the story is messed up. The action is impressive and there is lots of it but the story is all over the place and nowhere, it hop skips and jumps and might mean something to somebody but doesn't really add up to something credible... and then it ends with no real substance... the story really does suck... which is such a shame as the movie is good.... but the acting, the action and the camera play almost make it enjoyable... but don't try making sense of it, you'll be disappointed.
It's a mess ..another worst movie to add to Netflix portfolio..such a shame to dumb all the money on this low quality context .

It starts with ryan telling a story how he died and everyone thought he was dead
Then it jumps to a car chasing scene
Excuse me ? Who are these people ?

I understand, it's supposed to be a movie to watch in total relax, having left your brain someplace else.
But it's not. This movie is just irritating and infuriating. With or without a brain.
When watching a movie still need to follow a story that makes a bit of sense, otherwise I'd watch .
Come on, next time Netflix please give this money to charity instead. For the Amazon forest, for example.

I didn't finish this, but I could see where it was going. I guess if I don't finish a movie, that means it could not be a 7 star rating. So I give it a 6.I must mention. The first scene was an adrenaline rush I rarely see in movies. Non stop edge of your seat action. The actors sort of ruined everything. Reynolds is an annoying character. But the action was seamless smooth and on point. I would watch it again, but it just gets kind of dull. Becomes a vigilante picture / spy thriller. I don't know. Not my thing if it's not well done. That being said, I could watch any comedy movie and get a kick out of it.You decide6 stars

Normally I never really write a negative review. Heck, I barely write anytype of review. But Michael Bay production really got to me this time.Really. I mean really. What was the point. Except show pointless violence. Impossible incoherent sequences only CGI can produce.I do hope they never produce a sequel to this awfully made movie.Worth ignoring it.

reviews.review_title: Action fueled escape from the mundane
reviews.content:
I'm stunned by the raft of moaning about this movie. It says it all the the synopsis , 'billionaire puts a vigilante team together to kill bad guys'. What you expecting? Shakespeare?
It's an insane riot of action from the beginning to the end. Sure it may not have presented the perfect blend of all things that make an Oscar movie, but I loved every second. And I don't think it was ever made to win an Oscar. It's pure crazy action all the way through interspersed with typical Ryan Reynolds quips. Great Friday evening movie when you just want to kick back. I'm watching it again right now

reviews.review_title: Great movie action movie...I want more!!
reviews.content: Wow! Just Wow! It's pure action, it's fun, just sit back and enjoy....the bad reviews just didn't get it! Very entertaining and hope there will be a sequel.

The movies starts no where, no story, just throwing bunch of people into action and a very boring one with Ryan just acting his role as Deadpool character, he doesn't seem to able to shake it off. The locations which are featured in the movie looks like a cheap attempt for tourism advertising.

reviews.review_title: Have Netflix lost their moral compass
reviews.content: Have Netflix lost their moral compass? I wonder. This is a celebration of the extremes in an "action thriller" with more innocent victims of collateral damage than there are characters in many films - more violence, more gore and, of course, more action. But then, in its last ten minutes the film crosses a moral line. Although the gore is less in evidence, that's not the issue. Suffice to say that I believe the scene does not belong in a movie targeted at a mainstream audience.So in all honesty I'd recommend skipping this film altogether. But you could get a pretty good flavour for the action and car chase side of things by watching the first twenty minutes - which is basically a homage to The Italian Job... Or you could go on to about forty five minutes in, by which time you'll have seen all the main characters (from several angles), had your righteous indignation stirred and you should be in a position to predict the remainder of the plot with reasonable ease. You may also have noticed the pace of the movie beginning to stutter and the continuity becoming a little disjointed as we wait for the next action sequence.Other reviewers have suggested that it's OK to enjoy the whole film if you maybe disengage your brain first. I'm not so sure that is OK, because some people's brains may not disengage so effectively. The formulaic building of (righteous) indignation is taken as justification for an orgy of grisly revenge - but what if the taste for revenge is not so righteous?The action sequences are good though, and Ryan Reynolds is good. In fact most of the cast throw themselves into the project with gusto. But it's just not quite enough to make up for the downsides.The director here (who I'm not going to name) apparently has a bit of a reputation for this kind of movie. But I'd suggest that it's time his wings should be clipped. Maybe this should be his last of this type. 4/10
Fun action scenes with lots of cars crashing and flipping. Everything you'd expect from a Bay movie.

reviews.review_title: this is the first time i write a review after 20 minutes of film
reviews.content:
Did i write film? sorry, i meant to write "HDRish, over-digitized smartphone lookalike shots with editing that looks like they were made by an anxious teenager.
why TF cant you make an action flick without huge amount of gore and slime? dont you trust the script? do you really think so little of your viewers that you must do over every-thing? fu$% this, hollywood. in action and in comedy , bring back story telling and leave out all the fake blood, body parts and fart&boobs content. if people wanna watch those, trust them, they will find them.

Ok I'll keep it short guys, total waste of time, below par acting, direction was (directionless) opening car chase scene was so badly filmed "sometimes car is damaged" and right next scene it was like a brand new car (what are we blind?) Dialogues were arghhhhgh u guys know what I mean 😉 so don't waste your time and go watch something else instead.

reviews.review_title: The good, the bad, the verdict and sometimes the ugly review
reviews.content:
*The bad*
Easy script: no surprising twists or crazy red-herrings.Some action scenes might seem a bit long at times.*The good*
The main 7 characters really have distinct personalities and are normal humans with flaws. No superhero, super charismatic, invincible with high moral values here (although they're all quite good looking)If you like Ryan Reynolds' type of humour in Deadpool, Blade 3... you'll enjoy the unexpected comments, hilarious stupid moments and sometimes the 'WTF' behaviours!If you like action scenes: amazing car chases more realistic than in Fast and Furious, terrific parkour stunts giving you vertigo and some good fighting scenesStunts: "was it CGI or did they kill someone for real?" hahaha Well the budget was estimated at $150M last time I checkedRealistic: 15 rating. If someone was to get too near an explosion you might see human bitsSome mysteries surrounding the main character which should lead to a sequel(s)*The ugly*
Yes I put a 9 because, for that 'specific' type of movie, it's very good.*Verdict*
Feel like being entertained by an easy-script movie where you don't have to think much, can see well realised fast pace action scenes, have a good laugh and all of this on top of big budget special effects and beautiful sceneries from Italy, Hungary, Hong Kong, Uzbekistan and UAE...? Sit down, relax and enjoy 6 Underground!

This was a really great action comedy flick. Ryan Reynolds is outstanding as usual. I highly recommend this one if you like action. It will definitely make you laugh as well! Theres definitely an opening for a future installment, so I am hoping they'll leep going with it. Its worth a full 10 in my opinion.

They definitely had the budget. What a waste of 2 hours.Ryan Reynolds might as well been wearing a red tight jumpsuit. It was a reprise of the Deadpool character without the great script. Just overzealous sarcasm without the payoff.Watch at your own risk

reviews.review_title: So im like 15mins in... what on earth
reviews.content: This is like a really low budget computer game style film with really bad 1 liners, female badass over the top like characters for no reason, they seem to over react at everything and under react at crazy things?! the consistency was all over the pace the car was damaged the car was undamaged the car was damaged , the dialog and characters acting was horrible and the cgi effects and cutting away and stuff was off putting. I kinda liked the concept of it the way they introduce the characters but again it was very 2010 computer game style "borderlands" type.

Oh it's a good thing that Ryan Reynolds is pretty. I don't know why Hollywood feels the need to keep casting him in these movies where he plays Deadpool in every single thing he does. Oh, and with obvious product placement of his Aviator gin.I'm ok with popcorn movies. I fully realize that you leave reality at the door. The thing is, you have to have some sort of feasible working plot for us to just sit thru 90 minutes of constant guns and vehicles killing people. Otherwise, it's just a glorified snuff film. This movie starts off with a car chase in Florence and doesn't slow down once.Supposedly the 'plot' is about some billionaire that NOONE has ever heard of (really?) that decides on his own to 'make the world a better place' by killing the bad people. Anyone with half a brain knows the world doesn't work that way. There is ALWAYS someone waiting in the wings that is worse.There was a point in the movie where some sort or organization was mentioned but that was it. The unheard of billionaire supposedly had a whole list of bad guys that he wants to take out but we just saw a single one.I get that there are hard core action fans out there that don't mind plot holes that a Sherman tank could drive thru. I know that if there wasn't a market for these, Michael Bay would be out of a job. It's sad though that there is a market for this because I miss movies with actual believable plots.
This movie came out of nowhere and I'm happy it did. Best action movie I've seen in a long time.

reviews.review_title: Angel Has Fallen copulates with Baby Driver
reviews.content: This movie lacks substance, yet it's not terrible, more of an adolescent popcorn movie. It tries to be subversive yet it's tedious as a social commentary (it doesn't dare to imply that the problem is at home like Fight Club does). It's unfortunate that Ryan Reynold's presence so heavily lends from Deadpool that it quietly threatens to dilute the Deadpool franchise. All the actors were given two dimensional characters with snappy but bland comebacks. It's no where near as bad as Angel has fallen, and not quite as stylised as Baby Driver. but there is something in this choppy, sloppy movie to keep the adrenaline pumped. In the first few minutes where a wing mirror reappears seems to be a little indicator that you have to suspend your disbelief with this movie, I suspect they kept the goof deliberately to give you a heads up; begging you to "please don't take this seriously". The movie is not trash; but it's forgettable. In the right mood it's fun, just daft machismo. In another setting it's awful... but you respect it for knowing it's awful and, that's the guilty pleasure.

reviews.review_title: Netflix a byword for fake acting, cliche lines
reviews.content: Fake acting throughout. For tense scenes, real acting is forcing yourself to stay strong in tense situations. In this movie, everyone is just forcing themselves to be panicky & out of control and stumble.... For the "bad guys", real acting is forcing yourself to be nice. In this movie, actors force themselves to be not nice.Cliche lines throughout.Cliche cinematography. Hero angles used constantly for no reason.

What worked:
Visuals and action sequences: I must say the action sequences are fabulous, entertaining and enjoyable, and the movie has many of them, some better than the other. But overall great entertainer as Michael Bay movies. Some of the sequences were commendable.
What did not work:
Editing, screenplay and direction: the movie failed majority in these areas and that's what let this movie viewing experience down. Editing was out of place, and bad at times. The narrative could have been harnessed and garnished if only the movie was well written and executed.
Final verdict : watch it for the explosion, action sequences. Lots of them. And it's not disastrous as some of us are saying.

Dave Franco had at result being killed off in the early part of the film, at least he didnt embarrass himself like the rest of the cast who continued to make fools of themselves in this worthless film. I gave it a 1 for the soundtrack.

Everyone nit picks about eeeeverything these days it's obnoxious. This movie is Michael Bay. Absolutely insane action and a good enough plot to back it up. If you can't keep up with the action then it's you, not the movie. Plus it's Ryan Reynolds at his best. Enough said.

Don't read the critics reviews because if you did , you won't watch over half of the movies out there , It's a netflix movie , a movie you'd watch at home while on couch relaxing after a long day of work , It's Action packed and full fun scenes , the movie isn't made to compete with block busters or Oscar winning films but I can see that it qualifies to have a sequel as it has its own style of Michael Bay , so If you like Action movies that movie is a good pick but if you are looking for movies with story and extreme acting skills , you're probably looking at the wrong genre of movies .

reviews.review_title: It's a Bay film, glad to see it

Give me a break, more than half those movies are terrible. Plus, you don't know what boring disaster your walking into until your trapped by the Oscar movie which your significant other is totally into and now you can't leave the movie. At least with Bay, I know what I'm getting, I'm looking forward to it and I DO NOT feel like 2 hours of my life has been waisted. On top of that, it's a good movie and it's FUN. It's what movies used to actually be like, enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: a big budget action movie done horribly wrong
reviews.content: Oh man where do i start .. the scenes and the effects too over the top down right headache inducing .. story about 7 guys who go about playing god and staging coup detat .. movie so divorced from reality hell lot of plot holes ... even worse than the marvel super hero garbage .. ryan reynolds would do better than sign up to work in michael bay movie .. michael bay destroyed us with transformers now he is back with this crap .. i wonder who produce such movies .. rather you give the money to charity and call it a day .

None of the wit and charm of Deadpool which Reynolds and the two writers are responsible for. So that lays the blame at Bay's feet. He just doesn't care about anything except flashy locations and flash bombs. The action is so over the top that it physically beats all suspension of disbelief out of the viewer. I guess if you make robot movies for too long you lose touch with your humanity. Reynolds should know better. What a waste of 150 mill and 2 hrs of my time.

Classic Michael Bay: ghastly cinematography, downright asinine script, some moments of fun... and explosions. All the explosions. Because when you don't have a story, you blow stuff up.Ryan Reynolds is the only reason why this film isn't an insta Razzie Award winner.

reviews.review_title: Good premise ruined by Bad editing.
reviews.content: 6 Underground surprised me in 2 ways. One is how interesting it was at first. The other way is how it got ruined in the end. Even though I almost liked it, I can definitely see why people hated this movie.The camerawork is very kinetic and frantic. There are some really good shots here and there and it wasn't as shaky as people were making it out to be.The story, shockingly, got me interested. People said that it was stupid, but to be honest, it felt like a good set-up with interesting ideas and routes that it could take. We have a dictator who rules with an iron fist, is a terrorist and uses gas attacks, 7 people who attempt to change all of that, one of which is affected by the dictator's actions, a democratic brother, and a plan to have him replace the dictator. Piece all of that together and we could have gotten an interesting story mixed with realistic action and a pretty stable tone.The action is also really good, despite the absence of logic in some situations. The highlight being the opening car chase, the Hong Kong sequence, and the final fight scene.The CGI is also really well done to the point where at times, I didn't even notice it.The characters are also somewhat interesting, more particularly, 1 (Ryan Reynolds), 2 (The girl from Inglorious Basterds), 4 (Ben Hardy)....actually scratch that. All the character in the main team are interesting. I just wished they had expanded on 2's (The spy), 4's (Parkour guy), 5's (The doctor), and 6's (The Driver) backstories a bit so that they tie into the main situation a bit better.Sadly there is one element that is so bad that it just ruined ALL of the good elements that I had explained above: The Editing. It is all over the place, not only showing a lot of continuity errors, but also ruining the flow of the story, upsetting the pacing, and sometimes even ruining the tone. As such, I felt like the film would have done a lot better if some of the shots were cut out and if the film ran in chronological order.The comedy also felt out of place with some jokes coming after incredibly serious moments.Lastly, I also kind of liked Dave Franco as the Driver so I was shocked and disappointed to see him killed off so early. They could have done more with his character.Overall, this is yet another Michael Bay film with a good premise, a good trailer, and a LOT of promise, that sadly get ruined due to the trashy editing.

6 Underground is brought to us by director Michael Bay and is one of the most insane films I have seen in 2019. It's an over the top action thriller from Netflix l, starring Ryan Reynolds and written by the guys who wrote Deadpool. Needless to say a lot of this film is heavily influenced by Deadpool, from Ryan Reynolds' dialogue to the structure of the film.6 Underground is not a good film. It makes so many bizarre choices from a writing, acting, directing and editing standpoint that it's really something to behold. And I loved every minute of it! This is Michael Bay fully unleashed in a violent comedy film that doesn't really know what it wants to be.The editing in this film is filled with quick cuts and don't flow together, the cinematography is a combination of close ups (too close for comfort) and Dutch angles. It can be very nauseating, but what do you expect from Michael Bay at this point? Plot, Character and story take a backseat to display insane action and I couldn't get enough of it.This is Michael Bays Best pure action film in a long time. It's technically not a good movie, far from it, but it is absurdly entertaining with insane decisions, writing and story whose structure feels very familiar to Deadpool. It's overall a blast if you want to watch some schlock, but if that's not what you're looking for I can't really recommend.
I could not understand what was going on half of the time. So badly edited it looked like it skips scenes constantly
Brainless and enjoyble movie!Don't expect a deep drama and boaring movie that takes ages to something happen. You can just sit and have some fun for 2 hrs.

reviews.review_title: Every Bay cliche wrapped up in one entertaining flick!
reviews.content:
This is totally a comedy IMDB. I seriously think Michael Bay trolled us all by making his version of a satire movie. Like if Michael Bay made Scary Movie movie, it would be this.
From it's serious over the topness in every stylistic frame to the over dramatic score, this movie is entertaining as heck.A perfect Michael Bay drinking game movie cuz there's so many sunsets, helicopters, explosions, and beautiful women. Great movie whilst bake too.Don't take it too seriously and y'all will have fun.

Yes it's far-fetched and over the top, but what do you want from a film?
Suspend disbelief for a couple of hours and enjoy yourself. Explosions and gory shootouts aplenty, this is entertaining nonsense with a reasonable storyline that, despite it's constant flashbacks and recaps, isn't overly complicated.
I liked it. Cool cast, impossibly good looking, and big budget special effects make for a solid 8.
If you like your films intelligent and thoughtful, you won't like this. But if you want to get a few mates round and have a good night in watching baddies get knocked off one by one, then you could do a lot worse.
Actors and actresses me know if you need anything else from me please let me know if you need anything

reviews.review_title: A solid 8 easily best action film of 2019 for me.
reviews.content: Seriously people need to chill out and look at the movie in the context of what it is:let-your-brain-rest-while-you-enjoy-the-showIts an action film so when you compare it to what has come and gone its really well put together and I love the intentional/unintentional Easter eggs in the movie like the scene where Ryan Renolds character has some how sneaked into the car and is laying out of view then springs and the infamous words are spoken "who do you think you are, Batman?!" I felt this was a nod to Bruce Wayne's character...in fact if you ignored all the other characters you could be fooled into thinking this movie was some kind of precursor to the Batman anthology.For the whole part however its really well balanced for me each character is somewhat intelligent and the movie does take itself slightly seriously (even if at one point I cringed and thought wtf is this a live action Team America?...) and I like how each of the characters fit really well into the overall storyline.It's not some cerebral piece of cinema art and it doesn't try to be but what is for the most part a fun enjoyable movie to share with friends!
I don't get all the negative reviews. This is a great movie with plenty of action, a few laughs and a great cast. Watch it if you like action movies it won't disappoint

I don't know why I watched till the end . Bemused, I reckon was it a comedy, surely not or an action film, maybe it wanted to be.
I'm a fan of Ryan Reynolds even though he's still the same character as 2 guys a girl and a pizza place but his quirkiness didn't show in this movie. A bit more effort from the director in actually deciding what type of film it was would have helped. I gave it a low rating as it was watchable but like a mid week made for TV movie type of film. I hope Netflix didn't pay over the odds for this as it was seriously not a big time movie and I'm glad I don't see it at the cinema.

If you want to learn how to do cool slow-mo shots this is your tutorial set. Way too many slow -motion shots, stunts, things blowing up, script was awful and not cohesive, I even couldn't follow the story line (is there even one??!!! why the F did he leave that woman in Italy, who's kid is that at the end, why did he leave him). I felt like I genuinely wasted time watching this that I had to create an IMDB account to rate it 1. And FYI I love Ryan and I think Deadpool is the greatest movie ever, I'm judging the producer and screenwriter I guess, but certainly not Ryan he delivered whatever awfulness they wrote beautifully.

Action scenes were okay, storyline was cliche, acting was okay, dialogue between characters was quite bad especially the humour. In a nutshell, it's a very average but action packed movie hence why I gave it a 7 cos there's a lot of stuff that got blown up.

Incoherent in a way one rarely sees these days.
Beautiful people, some solid set pieces & unintelligible editing. It's a Michael Bay film through and through.

I know it's Michael Bay.. I know it wasn't supposed to be deep.. I know it was supposed to be Friday night relax kinda thing.. but dear god it's sooo bad. It's messy, stupid and confusing to the point it hurts your brain.

Phew! Bay is finally back dropping from his transformers fever. I enjoyed his movies before the whole transformers franchise went crazy. I would say just ignore the bad reviews. If you like watching a weekend action movie and just have fun, this has gotta be it. It reminds me of the time, when bay made the island and bad boys 2.
Enjoyable take on a classic action trope. Think Kingsman meets Transformers
Don't mind the storyline and just enjoy the over the top action.

Orange filters and shaky cameras- simply horrible
Couldn't even get past 5 mins.

reviews.review_title: Bayham is alive and well on Netflix
reviews.content: After more than 20 years in the industry and failing to show one ounce of restraint in his career, it's fair to say we all know what to expect from a Michael Bay movie.Staying true to form, Bay may now find himself away from the big screen and streaming directly into people's living rooms across the world thanks to Netflix but that doesn't mean that his loud, over the top, flaw ridden and daftly fun action thriller 6 Underground skimps on the Bayism's in any way, shape or form.The type of hyper, over-edited and insanely plotted film that gets critics cringing in their seats, Underground is as far away from "pure" cinema as you'd ever get but despite all his failings as a director, Bay should be commended for sticking to his guns and if there's one thing Bay is capable of doing, its delivering a turn your brain off fun ride that is often full of set-pieces and show pieces that put many other action films to shame.Kicking off with a seemingly never ending car chase through Florence, that is filled with an abundance of miracle car repairs and continuity errors but also some hold your breath action beats, Underground very quickly showcases to the viewer what they're in for should they stick around and if the extended opening stanza is too much to bare, reach for that off remote as soon as you can, as what is to follow is very much of the same over the top and kinetic nature.In many ways, Underground is one of the most straight up silly and unfiltered features to come out this year, there's no message found lying underneath the surface, no statements being made and no adherence to common decency (just witness the amount of slow-mo deaths or bodies being flung around like no tomorrow); it feels almost as if Bay's effort is from a time warp of body- filled 80's and 90's actioner's that ensured they focused on spectacle first and then if they had time, to anything else in between.Rounding up a decent cast that is headlined by Ryan "Deadpool persona" Reynolds as the mysterious billionaire One, Bay decides fairly early on that backstory, character motivations and plot sense will come second to everything else as One and a rag-tag group of partners in crime look to take justice into their own hands as they dispatch "bad guys" across the globe.With this mantra in mind, Underground never lets up for a single second as we are whisked to and fro from Hong Kong kidnappings, unnecessary parkour vignettes, Las Vegas assassinations and misuses of magnets and should you be willing to get past the whole daftness of everything you are witnessing, get use to the 40 edits per minute and abundance of lens flair delights, Underground becomes the perfect type of film Netflix need's to support around their increasingly high end dramatic efforts.Final Say -Losing none of his lunatic tendencies, the small screen release of 6 Underground has done nothing to stop Bay's quest to blow up objects, shake his camera and deliver a brainless bouts of fun like only the best of them can. Far from high-class, 6 Underground is exactly what it promises to be should you be willing to go along for the ride.3 swimming pools out of 5

It's the type of film, that when it slows down and tries to have .... a story .... you sort of realise it's, well, shortcomings.The first 20 minutes are typical gratuitous explosions and death for this type of film, but unlike most things like this that blow up everything and kill thousands ( you never see), this film at least shows you a lot of the bystanders deaths straight on.Stylised violence is such a bore.Another good Netflix film to put on when you can't sleep (low volume), and ten minutes later.... peaceful slumber. It's nice to switch up the film to fall asleep to since 90 percent of them Netflix makes are the comedy/teen type.Netflix is very good at making that type of film, that is what the three is for.That and the like-ability (all be it, the same as every film he is in ) of Reynolds. It wears thin, fast, but you can't help but like him... at least while your still awake.In short, typical fare, good to put on, roll over and fall asleep to on a night you can't ... . enough said

reviews.review_title: EDITING RUINS IT! It's 6/10 for a reason!!!
reviews.content: How can a car get shot up with like 30 bullets, the side mirrors knocked off, and severely scratched up, only to have the very next scene show a completely brand new car?!?!?!? I understand the concept of turning your brain off for a couple of hours, but you have to be BRAIN DEAD to not notice all the editing mistakes. I rolled my eyes so many times during the first scene(car chase). Not only that, the script is weak, no real plot even after 40 minutes in. Just a stupid movie. I'd rather watch elephant poop dry! By next week, it will be a 5/10.

reviews.review_title: Bay makes another unwatchable mess (I had to watch this over four sittings)
reviews.content:
I could have liked this film but for it being edited by an eight year old with ADHD. I swear if you blinked twice in a row you'd miss twenty seven scenes.I didn't realise this was directed by Michael Bay until I started watching it, then I knew within a few minutes. An absolute mess, which is a shame because there's some good stuff in there, it's just hidden amongst two hours of unwatchable motion sickness.If somebody could remove Bay from the filmmaking process once his directing duties are fulfilled, he could possibly make a decent film or two.I do wonder if anybody's brain operates at a speed capable of processing an action scene in a Michael Bay film in real time? It seems unlikely.
I will say, I gave it four stars because some of the jokes hit home and I really did like the ship/magnet scenes, very cool idea and almost executed well. Almost.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies of all time
reviews.content: C'mon Hollywood aren't you tired of stereotypical films about an Middle Eastern, or for that matter- Asian dictator who is overthrown only by a handful of Americans? I wish that the film offered something new. It started something promising with the action seens and fell onto the same path that others have threaded hundreds of times before. I wish that the writer were a little bit more careful with stereotyping in an age of political correctness. Better yet, who not deal with the subject of a real evil, like Boka Haram, as you had shown in bits and pieces rather than simply creating an imaginary evil based on a life-like model? This is lazy writing. Not original in any way whatsoever. Definitely making this as one of worst films of all time. If you want to save time skip the actions scenes and move to a film that is actually worth watching.

Transformers 1 was amazing. After that movie his movies lost a lot of their qualities.Only catching good pictures full of action makes not a good movie. The stories are bad and for me his movies are not nice. I am always giving him a chance but it does not becoming better.This movie is bad.So his name is no more Michael Bay. In my List his name became Michael BYE!

Title says it all really. My major complaint was the continuity in the opening sequence. It was breathtakingly awesome with amazing stunts, one-liners, gorgeous scenery, gorgeous actors, fast paced & thrilling BUT did nobody on set or in the editing suite notice the driver's cap? It was on then it was off then it was on then it was off, on, off, on, off until that was all I could see on the screen, totally distracted me.

reviews.review_title: Only watch if you're a huge Ryan Reynolds fan. B-movie writing at best.
reviews.content: This got boring fast. I loved Ryan Reynolds and the rest was purely indulgent drivel.

reviews.review_title: All over the place, only explosions and guns. No story
reviews.content:
The movie is so bad it made me come here, make an account and write a review.
This movie is nothing more than a waste of time.
No story, not time to implement the plot, not quality acting, nothing. Extremely bad movie in my opinion.

reviews.review_title: Production and action value cant save this stupidity of a movie
reviews.content: The good news: The action scenes are incredible, the production masterful. The bad news: The plot and the writing are completely idiotic and infantile. I wonder sometimes who approves this garbage of writing and ideas at Netflix. Such a lost chance for an actual good action movie.If it would not have been for the technical level and stunt artistery the movie would score between 0-1. I cant even tell if the acting was decent, because to work with such a stupid script must be challenging in itself.Terrible!

The music, action and comedy all blend so well together.
I hope Netflix gives it a chance and makes a second one- like they clearly left open to do so.
If we can have 500 Transformers and Fast and Furious. We can at least get 2 of these gems.
Genuinely liked it and found it entertaining.

I can't understand the number of 1-star reviews that people are leaving here. I can only assume these morons haven't been to the theater in the past 25 years OR they have been victims of head injuries that have affected their brain. These people must have relatives in competing movie studios and are only trying to bring down the rating to benefit their second-cousin's first movie out of film school. To Anyone giving this a ONE STAR I give a few alternate suggestions: Howard the Duck, Costner's Robin Hood, Showgirls, Travolta's Battlefield Earth, Ishtar, Cosby's Leonard Pt. 6, Mac and Me, Glitter, Gigli, and Lindsay Lohan in I Know Who Killed Me. Truly, I probably wouldn't give any of even these horrible movies only a ONE as people have gotten at least a 2 or 3's worth of enjoyment poking fun, parodying or marveling at how bad they are over a glass of wine with an equally inebriated friend.If you were able to sit through the entire movie, say "whoa" at a stunt driver's prowess at any point or be surprised at the CGI effects of the after-blast of a grenade in mouth death then you can't in any way give this movie a ONE.Stop taking out your Bad Day on a movie that, while it will never get an Oscar nom, at least gave a couple hours of escapist entertainment value. Be FAIR in your review scores as collectively they do add up and can unfairly skew a rating. It was a fun and entertaining movie. Only a Blank Screen deserves a 1-star rating as it indicates that no care was given, performances were phoned in and it was grossly miscast. None of these apply. It's OK not to like Michael Bay but the actors do read reviews and these reviews are just outright Wrong!

reviews.review_title: It Was Something to Do When Had Nothing Else To Do
reviews.content: When Ryan gets star billing in action movie, know no other actors in movie. How many foreign people and language, odd choice is all. I would take guess is budget cutting for some elaborate action scenes. Sadly not much of Sexy Dave Franco! Frankly the movie never grabbed me, until end scenes. This was where some cool unseen action scenes prior, worth looking at if fast forward to end. A generous 5/10

reviews.review_title: Was not bad... was not good...
reviews.content: When you see Ryan Reynolds as Deadpool you expect more from him in another action movie. His role in the movie was horrible. It's just another one of those actions films where you are now quite sure what you see when things move fast. Could have had a few twists to make it more interesting. Other then that it's a nice way to spend a few hours.

Ryan Reynolds keeps picking some absolute garbage (green lantern - although I actually liked this) amongst his really cool and funny movies (deadpool). This was a movie that tried too hard to be fast and furious vs all other Michael bay movies.
Pointless and long winded plot with a very forgettable ending.
I hope this isn't a set up to spawn a whole bunch of movies, don't want to see '6 underground 6'

April 2022...THIS IS THE WORST MOVIE I'VE SEEN THIS YEAR! Micheal Bay has big money backers, $150M spent making this funny, bloody film. Like one reviewer said, leave your brain elsewhere and enjoy the action and fun., authentic bloody head shots, knives in the bodies and grenade blowing up a head. Nothing serious here, don't why they even try to insert those scenes. Not worth paying money to see except on monthly n/f subscription. Got time to waste? See this film.

It's his style and with Netflix, he even worked more freely. The violence was amazing really! If you don't like such scenes, just don't watch it...
Oh and I liked the idea of using a historical but today non-existing country for such a content, so he wouldn't actually annoy any nation. Though it technically has Turks in it with a dictator and it's quite ironic. I loved it. Really. The ending and everything. It looks like they may make a second one so the story continues. I hope they do. So stop giving low reviews! :/

Maybe I'm getting old but car chases involving one fancy car and lots of baddies black cars, that last 20 minutes with shooting in crowded streets and cars flipping over right next to people sitting outside at a cafe has been done to death, mostly in Tom Cruise's movies. Then the silly jokes are better, funnier and not as cringe worthy in Deadpool.
It may be a case of "it's not you, it's me (and the other people I watched this with)" here but this was turned off after 15 minutes with not intention of giving it a second chance.

Why always Ryan Reynolds's movies are so good in action with some comedy!!
I love this man definitely

reviews.review_title: Just a load of great, nonsense, Michael Bay fun!
reviews.content: You know what? It isn't Oscar-winning, but suspend your disbelief and enjoy it for what it is - just Michael Bay at his absolute MOST and this is brilliant!A highly enjoyable couple of hours!

reviews.review_title: Checking all the right boxes doesn't make a good movie
reviews.content: The movie checks all the boxes required to make a big action movie, but somehow it's so boring. The opening chase scene in an old renaissance city is a prime example of something really good being knocked off (we've seen this before in better movies). It tries really hard to make top-notch action but it feels like you're being force-fed something you're supposed to like but don't. Almost all the humor falls flat and seems unnecessary... truthfully the movie would be better without it. It tries to recapture Reynolds "action +humor" combo-pack which worked so well in Deadpool, but for whatever reason not here. I guess this review is unfair because I couldn't get through 1/2 of it.

Michael Bay knows how to make action movies but this was not one of them. Yes, the action scenes were awesome with the exception of the opening scene that was too long. Can anybody explain to me what the plot of this movie was because my wife and I got really confused? We understood the basic part of the movie but whoever edited it did a lousy job. This movie went all over the place and really didn't make sense at times. What stinks is that they had a great cast but failed to deliver a good story to go with the action. I would've given this movie 4 stars if it would've made more sense.

reviews.content: Its like they randomly shot various action scenes and then decided at some point they would make a movie out of it
Lack of content & there is no basic storyline, wastage of time.

I don't understand where all the hate is coming from, this movie is absolutely fantastic. From Cast, to filming locations all a 10/10! If you're into action this will definitely blow you off your seat.
I can't wait for a sequel!

Ignore the masses, whining about pointless violence in TV, Movies, and Video Games. They absolutely do NOT have to watch and can STFU.
Moving Along.
Aside from the gun control nuts, and the movie and TV network clowns, losing money from great films and shows going to companies like Netflix and Hulu, etc etc. And the other aforementioned whiners, I doubt you'll hear too much negative about this film.
I had a great time watching it last night. Ryan Reynolds was great. Albeit a bit tamer than his Deadpool alter ego, but that is what you get with a non-deadpool movie.What TO expect:
An in your face, knocked down, tied behind the vehicle, adrenaline pumping, high octane, mega body dropping, hella good time, with a (mostly) great soundtrack and some good (though, occasionally dated,) laughs. And what I'll say about the dated jokes is this. Do you remember all of those kids movies with all of the adult jokes that the children didn't (and weren't meant to) get and we did? It's kind of like that. If it makes you laugh, great. If it even makes you just roll your eyes before the next explosion and carnage sequence starts, still good. If you don't get it. Oh well, you're probably too young. Or it wasn't meant for you. Oh well, no reason for THAT to equal negative points.What to NOT expect:
_A. Heavy Character development. Come on, folks. It's an action flick. You want more character development, wait for the sequel, or a series. While SOME action flicks DO have a certain amount of this, it's not generally something there's a whole lot of time for. Were they supposed to hold out in a building during a shootout and have a lengthy chat, get all teary-eyed about their pasts, or cut away from the action for a bit so we could get to know them better, adding another half hour to the movie? No. That would have completely changed the pace of the film. And I don't think it was meant to be that sort of movie. We DID get to know a bit about a few of them. They did all grow closer over the course of the movie. And while making fun of the lack of character development, a lot of sites are poking at what bits there actually were. Imagine if there were more? I could go in depth, but that would require spoilers. I will say that I think they did well while keeping within restraints for time, tone, theme and pacing._B. Sex and Nudity. While there are some things going on, it's mostly kept off screen. A refreshing deviation from 70s/80s violent action and now. I don't know if there'll be an unrated version, but the one I saw kept that part fairly toned down. Unless you're a nun... or some other easily offended person who will flip out over people kissing or making out or scantily clad people. But, then, if that's the case, the violence is probably not for you either._C. Plot? Well, there IS one. I mean, it's pretty much laid out for you in the trailer, but there's a bit more depth to it than that. What more do you need for an action flick? A group of six people, led by a seventh genius, billionaire inventor, - each with various skills- fake their deaths to become an elite team of untraceable ghosts in order to take down the worst of the worst criminals. Evil figures that the world's governments either can't, or won't, touch. That works for me.Summary: To the haters: Stop whining about the violence. If you don't like violence, don't watch violent movies. Let the rest of us have the entertainment WE like and go watch something else.
If you LIKE Action films, like any of the acting talent in this film, want to have some fun watching some good mindless action, with minimal plot, explosions, chaos, and a few laughs on top of it all: WATCH this movie.

Whether you like Michael Bay as a film director or not, it goes without saying that he has a very distinct style and never lets audiences deter him from that, which is commendable, even though most of his films are misses. From The Island to Pain and Gain, he has made some films that I quite enjoy, but nothing that was ever thought-provoking or broke new ground. 6 Underground is his latest directorial effort and it's just as grand and bombastic as his most ridiculous films. Although better than where his recent Transformers movies have been, this film isn't nearly as good as some of his best. Here's why this movie has plenty of style, but ultimately feels like a headache.Following six agents who have gone off the grid and call themselves ghosts, form a team to save the world. All having unique skillsets, this film does everything it possibly can to utilize them. When this film first gets started, there's no shortage of action. Stating who these people are, 6 Underground begins with an action sequence that lasts a full 20 minutes. After that, we dive into these characters a little deeper as the film makes you wait for the second half, which is entirely about the set pieces. Although not a great movie by any means, there's no shortage of action for the junkies out there.I feel that this movie found its footing in the second half, but the first half of this movie truly gave me a headache. From the quick cuts to the unnecessary excess of camera angles, this movie feels like too much of everything, all the time. There are even cuts within shots in order to give a kinetic look and feel like the movie is moving at a quicker pace. Although it's a neat style for a music video, that's how this entire movie felt. It really does feel like an over-produced music video with exposition breaks in between the action.As far as the cast goes, Ryan Reynolds is as charismatic as ever and everyone from Corey Hawkins to Mélanie Laurent delivers some enjoyable performances. The problem is that these characters are spread out in the field too often to really be working together, so there wasn't enough time for chemistry to form between any of them. The action is the only real saving grace here because there are some terrific set-pieces. Although far too frenetic overall, the action is nearly always practical, which was great to see.In the end, 6 Underground is one of Michael Bays weaker movies, which is a shame, because it also features some of his best action in years. I had a blast watching the third act of this movie, but the rest of it just kind of annoyed me. I've been a defender of his recent movies in 13 Hours or Pain and Gain, but this movie just technically missed the mark and the story was far too messy. For those who just want to see some cool action, I can recommend this one, since it's easily accessible on Netflix, but it's really not worth the two hours. Some nice elements aren't enough to save this bombastic piece of Bayhem.

reviews.review_title: See, this is what happens when you get Michael Bay off the leash
reviews.content: He makes an action movie without the actual movie.This is a set of 20 min action/corky nonsensical dialogue/slow-mo/hot women shots from below in slow-mo scenes repeated like 3 times. I know this is all Bay does, but damn, he really outdone himself this time.Nothing happens, nothing changes. I never thought that action scenes can be so exhausting. I genuinely felt tired. You can't have scenes that are not connected to anything. I appreciate some of the stunts and the action scenes but there need to be a movie behind those scenes. What is the point of disconnected action set pieces? What is the point of all this if there are no characters, no motivations, no real danger, nothing. It's like a 2hr video game cut-scene but worse.The dialogue is mostly bad jokes, memes and random movie quotes.Ryan Reynolds is playing Ryan Reynolds, as always. I mean, at least he's having fun...This would've been passable considering Bay's involvement, but this drags for 2 hours and there is nothing to grab onto. I mean, I can enjoy Bad Boys, I can enjoy Armageddon, I LOVE The Rock for what it is, but this is too much.Michael Bay has achieved the impossible, he made an action film that is such a bore I barely finished it.

The price Netflix are paying some people - and it's my money!I am glad to see many others rating so low on this film. We ain't stupid. We like films. We like action. We like stories. We like characters. We like complex. We like simple. We just don't like this.Simply, as others have pointed out, it's boring despite the action. Why? Because we aren't involved in it. My teenage son and I didn't even finish the stupid tripe (we had 50 minutes to go and we said enough of this rubbish).And what year is this? Doesn't seem like 2020. More like 1950's. No wonder people are jacked off with media - I am generation x, and I have always been jacked off with this type of portrayal.... Michael Bay's ideology of film is rubbish. Always has been. End his career now...

It's a full 24 hours later and I'm still not even sure what the story line was. If you like 30 minute car scene chases which by the way is arguably the worst part of ANY movie, than this one is for you. It starts right out with that. I found myself checking my clock over and over counting the minutes until it was finally over! The ONLY reason I gave it 4 stars was because I had a FEW funny lines in it.

reviews.review_title: Not too much horror and a fun action movie
reviews.content: It wasn't boring like some action movies where everything is just like the last action movie but wasn't supernatural like superhero movies. It was just in the middle and personally I like that it was a bit extravagant because it made it not so ominous and serious but more of a fun action movie

Seems that many are giving this film the Thumbs down. But if it had 007 in the title they would probably give it the thumbs up. I thought it was a very imaginative film with lots of great action. The best car chases I have seen for a very long time. Great dialogue. No sexy stuff. Just good ole wholesome violence, body parts and crashes that kept me on the edge of my seat. I saw it on Netflix and only wish I had seen it at the cinema. I really can't find anything wrong with it. It's a fun flick. I hope there is a sequel.

What is this rubbish !!Turned off after three minutes.Should have known it was going to be rubbish as I can't recall any good Ryan Reynolds films or any to Ryan Reynolds films full stop.Waste of money.

6 Underground is such fun ridiculous ride ! A blockbuster under ultra violent cocaine. It's Michael Bay-hem turned up to 11, with Ryan Reynolds humor and an insane 20 min car chase to open the film. Always as many cuts, shots and product placements but also a lot of humor and self-deprecation. The opening chase/gun scene is easily one of the best I've ever scene, the rest of the movie is a little long. Turn off your brains and enjoy. It was so much fun.

Well I only lasted 20 minutes then I had a headache. Utter rubbish from Netflix... again. More concerned with branding exposure (Red Bull, Alfa Romeo). This is why I would never subscribe to Netflix. Leave it to the big movie studios, it may have been 2 stars on the big screen.

reviews.review_title: This Drama wasn't a Comedy. 1/10 stars
reviews.content: I thought it was great for what it was. All of the negative reviews seem to not understand what the film is. They are basically saying, this drama wasn't a comedy, therefore I hate it. If you expected a Sam Mendes film, then yeah, I'm sure this sucked. If you expected Michael Bay, then yeah, it was awesome.

reviews.review_title: Weak storyline and too much unnecessary gore bloody violence
reviews.content: This is a big budget Hollywood movie for sure but it's just too much unnecessary violent and super weak storyline. Guess it's trying to "promote" Ryan to be the next Tom Cruise to come up with another genre of "Mission Impossible" franchise, but for me it's just not working - too much unnecessary sex and violence

This movie is BIG screen worthy. Arguably the best Netflix has ever produced. Packed with action, excellent acting, punches and punchlines, a shot of romance and many gory scenes and collateral damage. A thrill ride from start to finish!

reviews.review_title: I can already hear the fake hate on this film.
reviews.content: It was a fun, over the top, action film. I enjoyed this romp and would love a sequel. It reminded me of Smoking Aces mixed with Snatch. However this film can be a fun Weekend watch ( there is no reason you can't love Parasite and this). Unless your just that far up your own.

reviews.review_title: I Made It Through the First Chase ...
reviews.content: ... and bailed.Just couldn't take it any more. Story had potential but poorly told and acted. Run from bad guys. Kill all sorts of innocents in the process. Why? To what end? Even the Ryan Reynolds deadpan quips were second rate. Enough. Just couldn't take it any more.

reviews.review_title: Too old for this type of movie
reviews.content: As i am getting old, i am getting tired of this type of movies. Average action movie scenario without central meaning and full of cliches. Although i am a huge fun of ryan reynolds i found this movie a bit out of his league wondering why he even participated in this one. Ok there are some scenes with action worth to watch but there are so many holes in the plot to bare with it. Sorry Ryan..

Well it's a Michael Bay film so I wasn't expecting anything sensible. That's the one way to not be disappointed. The action scenes were cool but the plot was very messy and unrealistic. Lots of loopholes and unexplained scenarios.The tactics used to take down the dictator are far far away from reality. I know for a fact that six people are nowhere close to being enough to take down such a powerful dictator. The acting wasn't very impressive either. Ryan Reynolds pretty much plays himself in every movie.Overall this movie is entertaining mainly because of the action and explosion scenes but as I mentioned earlier it lacks plot and acting.

What a stupid movie I don't understand way some people go to rescue some one or grab them by sending 2 people from the the building front door and then from roof why didn't they all just go together, sorry but even Ryan Reynolds can't carry this story I would give it a 1 if Ryan wasn't init

Hey Netflix, this is really sucks!
Please don't do this anymore.
Disappointed 😩

reviews.review_title: They could make this a silent film
reviews.content: Why not cut out all the dialog just have a movie that has car chases and shooting and things blowing up non stop destruction and death why bother with a plot. Oh an lots of pretty half dress women walking around in all the scene. I was getting dizzy watching all the scene cuts back and forth if you blink you missed at least 5 people getting killed or blow up.

Wow!!!
A Non stop exhilarating Fun Blockbuster of a movie.
Love ever explosive minute of this film!!!!
Definitely an assault on the senses. ( But in a good way)
A must for all Fans that enjoy a good old Action film that doesn't take it self to seriously
Over exagerated, lame pictures and really bad production and filmography

6 Underground huge budget has been invested in it, technically the movie is well done but unfortunately the editing of the movie is a mess, story is basic but we are focusing on the presentation of the action here, it's filled with full of fast action scenes that i couldn't keep my attention on it there wasn't a relaxing moment, the main problem was the presentation of it, the characters were all shining good chemistry between all of them, recommended as we have (Ryan Reynolds) in it, 6/10⭐

The only good thing about this movie is Melanie Laurent. The rest of the acting is pedestrian and just making their money doing a Michael Bay action flick with a plot done a million times. Really not much else to say but just not worth even watching on Netflix.

The movie was OK at best, the plot was difficult to follow and we had to rewind often to see in what year something took place. The blatant product placement did not help in making this movie any better. The over the top blood effects were not to my liking either. The action scenes were good and I had some laughs, thats why I gave this movie a 4/10

The plot was ridiculous. The acting was subpar. It was a less funny Deadpool. But luckily, I didn't watch it for the plot or the acting. This movie should just be called "Michael Bay's Money shot". Ridiculous amounts of violence, explosions, car crashes, Vespa wrecks, exploding heads, falling bodies, impalements, and on and on. If you watch Michael Bay movies hoping for a plot, then you don't understand Cinema. Transformers, Pearl harbor, bad boys and everything else he has touched has made you go "whoa" at least a couple of times when you see a car going airborne or a body exploding. Well, this movie is no different. Turn off your brain and turn on the sorround sound sound. It's candy for the brain.

This movie is just about the action scenes, because there's really nothing else. What was the point? Who were those people and why they chose to do this? Why Turgistan? I have no idea. As for the action scenes, they are Micheal Bay so explosions, quick cuts and confusion. That's about it.
I'm sick of of reading these reviews. No plot. No acting, bad editing. Oh brother. We know Michael Bay already. Are you all new here??? Just sit back and enjoy. It is what it is.

reviews.review_title: Rotten. Proof that Bay should stick to producing
reviews.content:
What a stinker. Reynolds is his likeable self but they rest of the cast are terrible. Franco has as many emotion settings as a inbred red setter. Hardy has never ever been able to act but how can a true englishman have a more fake sounding english accent is beyond belief. Rulfo does nothing wrong, nothing being the word. As for the women, what and who, is classic Bay, no actual need other than eye candy so all you think is why.
So as for storyline, hmmmm, so 'GHOSTS' go around killing bad people with answering to nobody. They achieve this by people believing that they are dead and therefore off the grid. So they drive around in a dayglow green car, have their photo's taken by a reporter etc. After 40 mins in basically nothing has happened and that's how it goes.
So apart from terrible acting, script, cinematography and more assistant directors you have ever heard of, 22 at last count (I kid you not) what do you get? Nada, zip, zilch, nowt, nought, not a lot. If you like this genre of film just go and watch The Losers again.

If you want to feel boiled over rage from the fact that Michael Bay is still allowed near a camera/film set and people are still watching/producing his movies.....
this is for youif you'd like to keep a positive attitude and not ruin yoyr night, skip this movie
First 17 minutes made up my mind:Best action movie I have seen Yet. Loved it, even with the small "mistakes"

Edited mess. Arabesque cuts have turned into jump cuts. The 180° rule for camera placement is broken permanently. Don't get me into the incoherent plotline.It's so bad and such a mess that you have no time to laugh at how bad it is because you are having a seizure from the editing and high volume white noise from hell.This film (or whatever it is) is playing in the background as I'm typing this review... it's wretched even when you are not paying attention to it.Negative -10 stars.
Watched the first 10mins, the green sports cars must have Wolverines self healing powers!!!
4 stars only for the action sequences which also become pointless after sometime.

reviews.review_title: Typically Ryan Reynolds, and a poorer film for it
reviews.content:
He brings his usual wise cracking, sarcastic, quick talking wit to a film that has no idea what it wants to be.
The first half is pure confusion as you don't even know who's who and what's going on. Then it sinks into cheesiness and predictability and showcases a thin plot with so called humour that just ruins it.
If a decent actor had been in Reynolds role, and the first half didn't exist, the movie would have been a blockbuster.

reviews.review_title: Watch it for what it is!
reviews.content: This movie is a Ryan Reynolds flick... Take the humor that it is and just enjoy the action that is: Michael Bay.Great cast, great concept - a little disconnected, but still hits the mark of being easy to follow and fun to watch! It's a summer blockbuster in the comfort of your own home!Technical aspect of this movie, as with most Bay movies, is that the sound was up and down and music was sometimes louder than the cast!

I love this movie, i haven't seen a so good action movie from a long long time!
It's a movie that it is worth the time, cool effects, good humor and full action!
I really don't understand why there are people that rate this movie with 3stars!
BRAVO to Michael Bay and all the actors! you really made my time!
I'm waiting for the next mission :)
BIG Like
Ridiculously over the top. The blood, gore, bodycount, and incessant jokes make Lethal Weapon (of which I'm a fan) look like The Godfather.

reviews.review_title: Either you love it or hate it
reviews.content: I can see why there are so many opposite reviews. Perfect entertaining movie with heaps of action and jokes. The flow is a bit weird but overall it is not that bad.
This film is really bad. Lots of action, no direction. Don't bother watching.

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay went FULL Michael Bay
reviews.content: Have you been looking for a movie where Michael Bay went full Michael Bay?Well look no more, THIS IS IT.Imagine watching a blend between Transformers, Bad Boys, ... this is it.Bad to average acting (I mean Reynold only has his one style so basically it feels like Deadpool is in the movie as well; which adult enough is actually quite fitting), 2h of slow motion, boom boom, boom boom and ... oh yeah boom boom, and in between the boom boom some stuff that is supposed to make a story and ... make the characters a bit deeper?Anyways, if you don't watch this movie you won't be missing out.Gave it 3 stars because it has some cool cinematic shots, but that's pretty much it.

reviews.review_title: So messy and tiresome to watch
reviews.content: The car chase at the very beginning is just too long and so tiresome to watch. The mindless car chase in a city of Italy is very ridiculous and inhumanly to watch. Crash after crash, pedestrians died meaninglessly, so many things along the way ruined and destroyed. It seems to me that the Hollywood movie makers hated Rome, hated Italy so much that they just wanted to use CGI special effects to abuse the city with extreme prejudice. We've already seen such mess in Savage (2012), The Fast and The Furious franchise, Taxi 1-4 franchise made by the French, Dobermann (1997), on and on, I can name a few more. But none of them was as messy and boring like what I just watched in the runaway-train like long and boring car chase of 6 Underground (2019). When the chase ended miraculously, the survivors sat on the deck of a boat, I have already lost the appetite to watch it. MY eyes and brain were both spin and felt dizzy. The crazy screenplay, the directing, the editing, the acting of all the involved, are just mindless and meaningless. This movie is one of the messiest ones I've ever encountered.

Ryan and Michael Bay? great pair as I though!
I LOVE the idea of ghosts. The first mission made me keep my eyes on this film till the very end, I'd say this one is the BEST movie by Netflix ever.
BTW, EMP was genius concept & scenery in film. 150 million budget? NF was nuts!

reviews.review_title: best action movie of the year
reviews.content:
I don't get the people with low ratings... it's an action flick, if you expect profoundness go to a theater play...
This movie has some of the best and sickest action / pursuit scenes ..the type of action and filming is refreshing for this genre..
this is The Expendables meets Mission Impossible meets Fast and furious....
plus it's Michael Bay...
i also love how some of the scenes filming style resembless Michael Mann hyper realistic style..
overall one of the best action movies i have seen this year if not the best...and remember if you expect Shakespeare go to Broadway....

.... I can't tell. First break came after the 19 Minutes opening action scenes set somewhere in Italy. Nothing, really nothing, made sense, or was remotely interesting, fun, suspenseful. It's probably something for my 15 year old son.Then I tried watching after the break. Na, if you like Michael Bay, sure its for you, for the rest of the world - ludicrous script, a shame to those actors and the money spend.I gave up after 35 Minutes.

I mean, what could you expect with a Michael Bay film. It has a lot of loud noises and explosions. It just gets to the point where it feels like everything is made of lighter fluid; just a little spark in this movie will cause an over the top, Hollywood explosion. Michael Bay is known for this style of filmmaking, so I just can't constantly flame him for his directing choices. Aside from its comedic directing, 6 Underground has a lot of issues in the writing department.I said to myself during the movie "This is just Ryan Reynolds being a mortal Deadpool", and after looking up the writers (Paul Wernick and Rhett Reese), I found out that both wrote the Deadpool movies. The dialogue was really off-putting, it's a thriller movie, but nobody takes it serious. The comedic, Deadpool-like dialogue ruined the intensity in so many scenes. I don't know if 6 Underground is supposed to be a comedy, because usually in comedies, there's visual humor and entire scenes dedicated to one joke, but 6 Underground has none of those qualities. And the writers are really talented too, I enjoyed a lot of their movies, but this wasn't it.6 Underground also played it very safe. Really, the only interesting thing that was introduced was how the characters are supposed to be dead. 6 Underground is just very average with its plot, you know, saving the world from evil people/world leaders; I've seen this plot been done a dozen times better. And there is a self awareness in this film, which I do appreciate. The entire cast knows that they're making a dumpster fire, so at least there's that.Overall, 6 Underground is just another mediocre action flick. It plays everything very safely without any innovation. And I do realize that 6 Underground isn't supposed to be getting any Oscars, but today, I guess I just feel critical.

Terrible !
Turned it off after giving it 20 minutes, and I know I'm not alone either.
Avoid save your eyes the pain

reviews.review_title: cut copy paste scenes from original movies; MI + F&F + blood scenes from Quinten Tarantino
reviews.content: Silly movie.....imitation of Mission Impossible , Fast & Furious + other real movies.......send it underground.

It really had a good premise... a billionaire fakes his death to try to take on bad guys secretly, under the radar. But I didn't even make it through the first scene. The first race scene is both ridiculous and somehow boring. It falls into yet another action sequences when you cannot see what is going on. You don't know what is going on... and you really don't care. All the actors do their best but doing surgery on a bullet wound in a car that is racing along? Ugh.

reviews.review_title: "if you had one shot, or one opportunity"
reviews.content: Good for them, because they might have another chance to do something interesting. It feels like they tried too hard to be too original. I've watched car chases, I've watched shootings. Nothing special, except maybe for the Eminem reference. Next time include more Ryan Reynolds, and less bs. If this movie came out 20-25years ago, I would probably have given it an 8, but now...

This movie starts out with 19 minutes of gratuitous gore, that adds no value to its sense of adventure. It features a super cool, already unbelievable car chase, which involves a bright green colored Alfa Romeo, specifically selected for a stealthy op. But I would have bought it, were it sans the gore and a caricaturesque surgery, performed with only a couple of instruments and apparently no disinfectant, in the middle of said car chase, by a 24 year old doctor (literally) that again, adds NOTHING to allow the viewer to immerse in this alternative reality presented by director: Michael Bay.This 24 year old doctor, by the way, is also quite a proficient shooter, a fashionista and apparently a master rock climber; and in case you were wondering, the patient in this car chase, is still shooting and seems mildly annoyed at the inconvenience of being intervened while she's busy. I of course understand this movie attempts to be more like a modern day Batman with a larger team, but is it too much to ask for a movie of this nature to be coherent?On the plus side, Ryan Reynolds commits and like always, does a good job of acting. Also, the locations are beautiful, and the cars are cool.

Michael Bay must have Obsessive Compulsive Disorder! Super fast cutting again! Come on Michael, the human eyes can't digest so many frames, don't you know that? Why? Why things getting worst in each movie you made recently? Can't you make a normal meaningful movie like The Rock? Or all your inspirations have dried up?

reviews.review_title: Exactly what I expected.. but better
reviews.content: It was a Friday night.. I was looking for some action and comedy and this movie delivered. It's a Michael Bay film, meaning I expected a lot of explosions and fast paced cut scenes. As this may be true, it also has Ryan Reynolds and a combination of great actors/actresses that for their roles very well. I enjoyed the movie through and through. I would recommend!
It is a typical Michael Bay movie..you get what you expect .. car chases action and great locations .. popcorn optional. Look out Tom Cruise. Sequal possible ?:)

That sums it up. The movie is fairly endless in action and one liners. However the story line is so chaotic as to be almost senseless. Although the acting in individual scenes is decent, the movie just isn't cohesive. I wanted to like it more but because of how the movie is edited and thrown together, the move just fails. Action sequences, stunt choreography etc are all over the top. As another reviewer said, this is the most Michael Bay movie Michael Bay ever Michael Bayed. So much potential but such a waste. If all you want to do is watch people get shot, get blown among total chaos - then its entertaining.
Just a fun action movie. Every movie doesn't have to be up for awards. Great action. Fun characters.

What a light production....Who are the watchers fir this kind of movies? This is what an average movie-watcher asks from Hollywood?
A big 1 from me because i lost two hours....

It popped up in Netflix recommendations and we took the shot simply out of love for Ryan Reynolds in anything (yes, even GL) and a hankering for chase seen. What we got was an expertly executed wild ride for 127 minutes of movie joy. The chases were ridiculously fast and stretched the laws a physics only a little, not seen since the Italian Job or that Fast & Furious in Brazil. The parkour antics were the stuff an entire movie could have been made of. The dialect was stupid funny Reynolds at his sarcastic good guy peak, and each character developed just enough to beg you to know more while not interfering. The plot was skeletal, justice regardless stuff, and the sniper addition gave it heart. Love, love, love, why is this not a series waaaaaaah
This is not a good movie. Not even for a brain dead action film to watch whilst hungover. Messy cuts, very random music choices, filled with clichés in a bad way.

reviews.review_title: For what it is, it's freakin' superb
reviews.content: I really don't get all the hate. It's a friday night epicness of a pop-corn action movie.I'd rather see 10 more movies like this, than another fast and the furious movie.

Wished they used just one consultant who read some geography or history books instead of paying that much for crashing lots of vehicles. If you don't do so, then don't use real world info crumbs. Can only be watched for the crew.

reviews.review_title: It's good in genre of action...
reviews.content: In my opinion, this film was very similar to what happened in Syria and the rest of the dictators who brutally killed the people of their own country. It's good in genre of action, but it was poor in of content and story.

reviews.review_title: Opening scene sums up how painful next couple of hours going to be
reviews.content: Too much mess..killing more innocent people in the opening scene and all characters are laughing as if its a joke..opening car sequence dragged for over 20 min with pointless killings..torture

Even for a stunt film, this is incredibly stupid.The cut scenes will give you epilepsy. The opening chase scene is 5 minutes too long.Camera work is disorienting in ways that do not help the film.There are holes in the story the size of Texas. Over all, this film is trying to do wayyy tooo much.

The beginning is a relentless barrage of violence and bayhem. I quite liked the action in this film, and it's mainly the characters that can't overcome their one dimensional design. This is a crazy and insane beginning, but it sets the tone for the film. I hadn't been expecting anything from this film and it has dropped with little fanfare to say the least. The characters share chemistry and that budget is definitely high. I must say Bay may have found a new way to finance and create movies. Stylish, violent and strangely coherent.

The expendables is possibly one of the worst and most juvenile movies ever made. Correction "was" one of the most juvenile movies ever made. If you liked that film you'll like this. Lots of people dying in very unpleasant and graphic ways, lots a really bad language and a terrible story line. I'm sure there is a market for this kind of bilge, but as you can probably tell by now, I ain't it! If you've "been out with the lads", and you've all come back very drunk, and there's no football to watch then it may be for you. Just don't try watching it sober, or with an intact IQ above 3.

The greatest movie ever.
I already see this movie twice.
Ryan Reynolds the perfect actor.
I'll wait for the next movie

If you want a couple of hours of action and fun - then you can't go wrong with this movie!!
Don't watch it if you want epic story telling....
It's epic in other ways and I hope there will be a sequel at some point...
