Such a horrible horrible movie, bad acting even from Ryan Reynolds, bad script, and plot, the only thing saving it trying to see what action sequences they come up with next
This is 'how to make a expensive movie look as cheap as possible' tutorial
I think we would all like to know what ADHD producer keeps hiring Michael Bay to direct such incoherent hacked up movies.Could of, should of, been a much much better movie.
Classic Michael Bay trash. Nonsensical flipping cars with sparkle explosions. Absolute junk.

reviews.review_title: Great Action Scenes, but not enough to save the Movie
reviews.content: Finally finished watching it, which was not an easy thing to do. The movie has great Cinematography, almost everything is beautiful and glamorous.And the Action Scenes were superb, the multiple Camera Angles, Bodies flying everywhere, impossible looking Stunts which make you wonder how they were able to pull it off.But then everything else is crap, the Plot, the Characterizations, etc. It made me wonder if the Script was written by a twelve year old, everything is just so "convenient" for the Crew.Some of the humor was good, but most was bad. It's basically like watching one of Luc Besson's bad movies. A big disappointment for me despite all the hype.

reviews.review_title: A Good Action Movie that keeps you underground for 2 Hours.
reviews.content:
Hey guys, wassup.
What else you expect from a Michael Bay movie ?
Fun, Slow Motion shots, explosions, cute girls right.
If you are looking for these things, then this is the right movie for You.
Dialogues, scenes, acting.. this is absolutely the worst trash ever made
This is how you make an action movie. The plot is not difficult to follow. The action scenes are beautiful. The score is fun and really engages you in the film. This is cinematography at its finest.

If you want to turn your brain off and possibly risk a little brain damage, this is a prefect way to edge your way towards a virtual lobotomy. And to think, a small impoverished country somewhere could have new hospitals, schools, and a wind farm for what it cost to make this eye cancer.Beyond the breath taking and ludicrous action scenes, the pedantic plot would have been better utilized in a comic book.

I enjoyed this movie. Over the top...totally. To me it was pretty much a tongue in cheek parody of all over the top seriousness films. But then, I loved Dead Pool, Guardians of the Galaxy and the first Transformers. All hits BTW. Hooray Netflix. Despite the critics panning, folks are going to watch it. Make another one!

reviews.review_title: Nice explosions is all I can say about this
reviews.content: All bang and no trousers. There's a couple of laughs but you don't care about the protagonists or antagonist. Go watch something else on Netflix

Another Hollywood movie that rings weak with the same old plot, and the same lame jokes, all dressed up in a new suit. A dad movie, it's thinks it's good and hilarious, but it's really just a little awkward. Not the worst, but not good either.

reviews.review_title: Even for Bay this is a DISASTER
reviews.content: First 10 minutes are a ridiculous blast followed by a full HOUR of character set up to kill a nameless bad guy that you care more about the any of the protagonists.The film is pure spectacle with a completely incoherent plot and script. Even Ryan Reynolds couldn't save this film from the steaming pile that it is.I've never been more bored in a high octane action flick than this. I bet Bay paid Netflix to add this film to their library just so he could justify the waste of time and money.

This film is like an acid trip, (a good acid trip). The opening scene is epic and worth the 10 star review alone, I'm quite aware it wont be everyone's cup of tea, however it was definitely mine. Sometimes it's just what I need, to turn on a movie and not think for two hours, just sit back and watch the moving pictures 😆.
Ps I love marmite 👌

Yo man. Netflix couples with Michael Bay I really bleeping enjoyed it! Thats the kind of movie I'm was looking for years now and I want more of this. Its just entertainment as we have been grown up with. Two hour movie just flews like 20 minute waiting at the bus stop and you're very happy after it finally appeared.Ey Netflix and Bay Why you guys don't teach these guys from Fast and the Furious how action movies are really made. No offense against FF but since they don't use Honda's with spoon engines its just cgi wanna be action movie garbage.Now the review of the actual movie.There just two simple words needed:MICHAEL BAY.

reviews.review_title: It's an ACTION movie, what do you expect!
reviews.content: Bad Boys meets the Expendables with a touch of Mission Impossible thrown in and Deadpool comedy for good measure. 6 Underground was entertaining, visually appealing and quenched my thirst for an action movie. Is it going to win any Oscars? Probably not, but I wasn't expecting to watch a movie that was going to pull on my heart strings and leave me to figure out what the meaning of life is. It was refreshing to watch something that wasn't a reboot or that required binge watching for a change. My wife who hates action movies enjoyed it. Does she have any idea what happened? No, but Ryan Reynolds was in it so it like him, was perfect. Her words not mine.

It's fun, not award winning but fun.
It's a cross between a Fast & Furious movie (with less individual character development) and a Transformers movie.
The editing could be better but the relationships between the characters develop nicely and the movie is scored well.

A decade after the fall of URSS the Americans were still fighting the Russians, Rocky style. It still happens from time to time.In this one, the political context is pretty much 1987 Arnold in Commando. Europe is the patriarchal 1970s style of movie. No Robocops from 4 different agencies filling up the offenders with bullets. Lucky for me NetFlix has hundreds of other shows and I am not stuck with a f-up Saturday night because there is nothing else on the government-mandated TV stations, neither I can complain about my wasted money on the tickets.

This movie is not going to win an academy for best movie but it was completely a fun movie from to finish. Ryan Reynolds has become a great movie icon in the fashion of Connery, Ford, Cruise and all of the many great action guys. Just enough tongue and cheek.

reviews.review_title: When you care more about stylized editing and direction than telling a story.
reviews.content: Short and simple. If you want to watch a movie while it's being mixed in a blender, then here is go.

In "6 Underground", the action keeps on coming but the lack of story with an unmotivated cast makes for yet another Michael Bay disaster.
.
In this action film, after faking his death, a tech billionaire recruits a team to take down a brutal dictator.
.
Running over two hours, this action disaster proves Michael Bay still isn't done with explosions, over the top action, thinly written characters and zero plot. Anyone who enjoys "6 Underground" should seriously question what they think is "good" in their life. I also hate the fact that Ryan Reynolds is pretty much playing Deadpool in his role. He's capable of doing so much more as an actor. The action took my mind off the story but in the end it's a complete waste.
.

reviews.review_title: Sorry but what was this about?
reviews.content: Really couldn't follow it. Was all over the place and I was not sure what I was watching?? If you have time to waste it's probably a watch, but for me it was sleep inducing!

reviews.review_title: Maybe the Dumbest Action Move Ever
reviews.content: Ryan Reynold is a gorgeous male movie star with some flair for comedy. Deadpool and The Body Guard's Hitman were wonderful showcases for his talent, effortlessly combining mindless violence and smart-alecky diaglogue into nearly flawless box-office popcorn. So here comes witless, Micael Bay loaded with his thirteen-year-old sensibility for narrative that makes no sense, and an alarming propensity for sustained violence, that translates into whole cities being blown up and what has he done? Reynolds here is a screaming $billionaire out to set the world to right again who is also on the verge of a nervous breakdown in this ridiculous, non-stop action movie. Six attractive, ripped, and psychologically damaged people go on a revenge rampage to bring down a deranged dictator of a fictions Middle Eastern country (how original). The absurdities pile up as the film opens with an insanely wild car chase through Florence, Italy. Like the Italians would tolerate anyone driving for twenty minutes in the historic center of their city smashing up cultural monuments, and littering their city with the bodies of dead would-be assassins and the mangled body parts of a year's assemblyline of cars. And this stupid, witless, unfunny, and noisy scene goes on for twenty minutes. It's all downhill afterwards. Granted this is not my genre, but I've seen plenty of action movies with more originality, creativity, and sheerly good storyline than this awful mess. Even a third-promised sequel to Deadpool will be better than this.

Fast paced start decent story and pure entertainment. Ryan Reynolds is one of my favorites and he does a good job again. I'm never expecting ground breaking world changing story from any films I just want myself to be able to keep my attention on the TV all the time and 6 Underground did an excellent job with that. Just sit down and enjoy. That's what movies should be about anyway.

After only 15 minutes in I was hugely disappointed with the pointless cuts, editing mistakes and pointless jumping around.
I'm surprised RR has put his name to this.Poor storyline, poor editing, poor filmographyThis had the potential to be so much better

reviews.review_title: The Car Chase is very inconsistent
reviews.content: The film was brilliant apart from the car chase at the start, where wing mirrors are knocked off but then in the next scene back on the car, the drivers side window gets smashed along with the rear window but are back in the next scenes along with bullet holes that keep disappearing and then coming back. But apart from that definitely well worth watching and I can't wait for number 2

reviews.review_title: If You Want a Oscar Worthy Film,turn Around and Walk Away!
reviews.content: I see a lot of people talking nonsense here.If you want a oscar worthy film then dont look here.This is great movie to relax and enjoy.Filled with sick action scenes and Ryan Reynolds sarcasm that is just him being Deadpool but without scars.I cant believe that some people look so deep in the movie,yes it has some mistakes,but honestly movie is entertaining that you dont even notice..only if you are douchy prick that just wants to look smart after in imdb review section.Its a blokbuster movie that serves its purpos.Relax and enjoy!

Reading those reviews i guess today everyone think they are a film critic.Movie is fantastic action packed with humour where it suits piece of art.It serves its purpose and thats to entertain us.What you guys want?Ryan Reynolds is great as always with his witty humour.The plot could be better,but honestly those 2 hours went by really fast so you could say that maybe its just the right plot.If you want to kill some time and you bored asf,this is the movie for you.
I am so sick of fake stupid meaningless pablum like this pablum. All "action" all beautiful shallow idiots. Skip this crap.

reviews.review_title: What? "The Magnificent Seven"? "Seven Samurais"? In a crazy way?
reviews.content:
Do you really need to introduce these 7 wild turkeys one by one to extend the no-screenplay scenario? Wasting 150m$ and came up with this brainless mess?
Think about it: 150m$ could do so many more meaningful, more humanitarian works, even help building part of the border wall and shake the hand of the lunatic. But Netflix never did things like this, they just hired a guy to direct a motion picture with so many superhero-like cartoon characters and more money in special effect, gunpowder and explosive, cars, and compensations caused by making this pathetic mess. Do we really need Ryan Reynolds to play this billionaire role? Any actor with better voice quality would be and could be a better choice. Jesus, his voice still sounded like a under-developed teenager, so thin and so....like your grasp a guy's throat, the voice coming out of that strained throat would just like the voice coming out of Ryan Reynolds' throat. I can't believe a guy at 43 years old, his voice never changed a bit, just like what we heard in his "Van Wilder: Party Liaison (2002)", still sounded like a Spring Chicken. I heard this actor has become a second copy of Edward Norton, so obnoxiously arrogant that the director of the "Deadpool" 2 or 3, just quit due to this actor's bad attitude. But what I've seen about this guy is a under-developed 2 dimensional B-level 2nd tier actor, his acting in many movies were almost the same, superfluous and shallow, just skin-deep and never showed us some in-depth performances. He's always like the typical branded Ryan Reynolds in almost every movie he signed up. He got a costume and mask in Deadpool to cover up his whole being, but the voice is still as thin as a teenager. Leonardo DiCaprio used to have the same light-wt. thin voice, but I did find his voice finally well-developed to match his age, but RR guy seems to have his voice frozen in time, such a weird voice out of the mouth of 6'2" 43 years old guy is just weird. No matter what role he played, his voice simply made the character he played unrealistic with a comic effect. What a weird hot commodity from Canada.Paul Wernick, Rhett Reese, the two writers who scripted this messy movie, actually wrote a script? It seems that there's no screenplay at all, every scene was developed under one scene finished and made up right away afterwards. A new kind verbal script without any word on paper?Michael Bay, I strongly suggest you better change your present "Director" title and start your video game company or hook up with Disney for some new genre violent cartoons, you might find the new career is what you are really born-to-be. Just give up this "Director" job, will you? Because you're killing it.

reviews.review_title: Expected much more from Michael Bay
reviews.content:
Too many goofs and mistakes and same sound effects of Transformers. All explosions, no matter what's exploding are same cheap fireworks and flares.
Soooo many holes in this boat...

Pure and fantastic entertainment. Ryan Reynolds was at his best, along with the co-star doing Javier. A great show run of pure action scenes, stunts, and mind blowing sequences. The jokes are also funny and the storyline is well grounded. Hope there will be more to come

reviews.review_title: Yeah! F%@# you all; it was great!
reviews.content: Read the bad reviews before watching. People complaining about bad cuts and things moving too fast... blah blah... Well, maybe you need to speed up your brain to follow the story!It was a great Friday night action movie. Sure, the story wasn't deep and didn't provoke any new mind-bending ideas. But hey, if you want a good-guys-win movie, keeping you at the edge of your seat, this is a trigger-happy, fun entertainer that leaves you with a smile on your face!

The intense action movie has been taken into the 21st Century. Why do we keep getting Mission Impossible? Will their be a wheel chair instalment? 6 underground is well acted, intense and the proverbial chase scenes make Bond films look like they are standing still. Just the right amount of Ryan Reynolds humour, smoking hot and capable girls on the team, (yeah so? I like that aspect), and cool locations. I'm figuring this is a Netflix property that will be forgotten like most good things Netflix does. We should be looking at part 2 by now. I hope someone else owns it.

1. Who greenlit this script?
2. How did they get Ryan Reynolds to star in this?

reviews.review_title: One Of The Best Action Movies of 2019. Period.
reviews.content: This was an excellent full action movie (just like the Mission Impossible Movies). Beautiful locations. Excellent acting by everyone. Backdrops, props, staging was spot on. Cinematography, fight sequences and editing was also excellent. Of course w/ Ryan Reynolds, some good humor and comedy. It was also creatively different which was nice.This is the kind of movie you can watch a second time, right after the first time because there is so much going on, so much action. Thank you Netflix for this movie.Thank you for your time.

reviews.review_title: This movie is exactly what you think it is and that's awesome.
reviews.content: This movie is they typical Michael Bay film, with a ton of Pyro, stunts and action. Don't expect a deep plot or a great script but a ton of jokes and action to have a good 2 hours of fun. If you enjoy action movies you'll enjoy this movie. And Melanie Laurent is awesome in this film I would 100% recommended this for every nerfkix subscriber.

reviews.review_title: Forget the story, the Action sequences are next level!
reviews.content: The story isn't even remotely interesting but what works is Ryan Reynolds humour and dialogue delivery. AND MICHAEL Effin' BAY action sequences.There are some insane stunts in there and I am just gobsmacked of how he managed to film of them. This is some next level "stunting" and Action!Keep you brains in a jar, grab some pop corn and enjoy this!

reviews.review_title: Sloppy editing... could have been better..continuity mistakes galore....
reviews.content:
I love "big" action comedies, but I just watched the movie on Netflix, and it's just a poorly made movie.
It's a "Bay" movie so you get all the expected cheesy attempts at playing on our emotions, big shootouts and the big explosions.
You also get is a poorly written script, that does not give the actors anything meaningful to say. The few attempts at comedy are so bad.
What sticks out the most is the poor editing, with so many continuity mistakes in the actions scenes.
This is apparently what you get from Hollywood for 150 million US dollars.
According to Wikipedia, Netflix wants this to be a new action franchise.
A tip: drop the sloppy and disinterested writers, editors and producers and get someone that is actually interested in their job, and it it might actually work.

DEAD good movie with a great POOL scene 😎
Probably the most spectacular action film in decades, The effects & Sequences looked so real it made me think it must have really happened.
Shocked at the negative reviews on here - Hope there's a sequel! Entire Cast was Superb

I actually liked the movie. Great story for me. Would like a sequel. Billionaire lost himself when he became a ghost and at the end of the movie found himself. A country made back to the way it was supposed to be. JUSTICE.Ryan Reynolds never disappoints.

A green car... stupid shooting.. Some clips of stuff. Who knows what this is about. Maybe you need to be pissed up to watch this.. Ah Jamie, Jamie,,, Jamie and his magic torch. Now that made sense....! 😁
Crazy cuts. Crazy and cheesy music changes and ridiculous product shots that made you think you were watching an Estrella commercial. Netflix what the hell were you thinking?

Time is money, so long story short - this movie has everything you'd expect out of a Michael Bay Netflix cooperation: Cool military guys, explosions, product placements, cultural stereotypes, cringeworthy humor, narrative incoherence, shaky cam galore, abysmal editing, ugly color grading from 2007, Ryan Reynolds playing Ryan Reynolds, lots of American democracy, dubious countries named "Turgistan" and magnets, b***h.Film snobs would probably argue that Bay has never been more tasteless and reached a point in his career, where he's basically parodying himself. But this movie isn't for them. It's for teenage boys with an attention span of two seconds. Oh dear, what a crime.

I started to watch, but I just couldn't get past the opening 15 minutes of the most ridiculous car chase I have ever seen! There were so many ridiculous aspects that I had to quit watching. I don't know how people can stomach such inanity!

2 hours long commercial for being cool, sexy and jacked up.Pointless movie, with generic villains, generic heroes, generic action. To a point is quite similar to deadpool 1 screenplay, but in a bad way, since Deadpool is a hit, this one's a miss. ....speaking of which I still miss my 2 hours of life.Don't watch it.

reviews.review_title: Avoid this movie at all costs
reviews.content: If you are a fan of Ryan Reynolds, watch this movie. If you are a fan of Michael Bay. Don't watch this movie. This movie is so confusing and thrown all over the place , you don't know what is happening. The only thing is good, is the action scenes. So my opinion, avoid this movie at all costs.

reviews.review_title: I didn't know what was going on for a lot of moments
reviews.content: It felt like a run-on commercial, The music scenes. Felt like a YouTube video. I'm getting sick of Ryan's acting the same character in almost of his movies. No we don't need brainless stupid explosions with no story. This was so bad. When the movie starts you will take a closer look at the mirror of the car where is being crashed if you give a better look after 3 min you will see the car complete fine!! I spent the entire film thinking "What is happening, why is that happening, and what just happened". It's a complete mess, it jumps from scene to scene and you've no idea where anyone is in relation to anyone.

reviews.review_title: Wow, what an actioner, a VERY RARE 10 from me
reviews.content: What an over-the-top Cmas present of a movie when you combine Michael Bay with Deadpool's Ryan Reynolds AND the two writers of the Deadpool films! This is just exquisite guys, and it's from Netflix! It opens bold like a Fast & Furious actioner. You're meeting the new IMF - these are "ghosts" on an altruistic mission to rid the world of Bad Guys financed by Reynold's "One", a multi-billionaire who puts his money where his morals are. There are action scenes you haven't seen before, like the ultra-magnet scene on the yacht, wow. The violence done to the human body is ultra realistic, too, such scenes would traumatize a younger kid who doesn't understand the concept of CGI/VFX. Fingers crossed that this becomes a franchise series because it's every bit as good as the Mission Impossible and F&F film franchises.

I just got done watching this movie. I waited until the right time and was relaxed and let me tell you was it worth it, Yes! I will say if you love action films and love alot of explosives and car chases, then this movie has it all and the special effects are insane and badass. I think Michael Bay nailed it again.. So don't hesitate and go watch this awesome action movie. I don't think you will be disappointed...

Paint by numbers action flick, riddled with clichès, and bullets. Car chases, parkquor and a scenario that's been done a million times before. Ryan Reynolds is the same smar talking character we've seen in his last dozen movies. As much as I like it, I'm getting tired of it. It wouldn't be a Hollywood movie without grandiose denouncements that are supposed to be inspirational.
Absolute muck turned it off after 10 mins it's trying to be Deadpool meets the fast and the furious

I've been trying to watch this film and just cannot follow the story or become interested. Disorganized chaos. Disconnected timeline. Character relationships confusing. Horrible editing. Dialogue is more like one-liners strung together.
1 star for the explosions and fx.

I couldn't help but think Michael Bay's embarrassment gland shut down decades ago. How do you sit down in an editing room sober and go "wow, this is probably art"?
But it's encouraging to know you can make it in Hollywood with a stoned writer and 70 tons of spare C4.

Was really unsure when I first started watching it. Got a bit lost and didn't quite understand the story line but by the end I was hooked. I think it's pretty well done. A bit of a mix of action and comedy - not a great deal of a story line, but I think if it's given a chance for sequels it would do really well.

reviews.review_title: If I can give 0 I would.
reviews.content: $150,000,000 for this POS? Unbelievable. If I can give 0 I would.
Its a simple action movie with great effects/cgi/stunts and action sequences, just turn off your brain and enjoy...
2 hours of fun, it's obvious that this type of movie is nit some brainer but it very entertaining. Finally Netflix is doing something to keep us paying subscription.

Let's blow everything up all set to loud music, ridiculous chase scenes, 50 fast camera angles where 1 will do and more gore and deaths than the entire Saw series put together. I swear this is how Michael Bay goes about creating a film. I picture him as an excitable 12 year old kid who's parents just let him do whatever he wants. It's hard to believe studios take him seriously yet alone that people like Ryan Reynolds are willing to put their name on the cast list. It's a very rare occasion that i can't find one single good thing to say about a film but this is such an occasion. Save 2 hours of your life, don't punish yourself with Michael Bays madness.

Michael Bay knocked this one out of the park. I would have paid the fortune the theaters want to see it and will to see the sequels if they are at the theater! A must see movie and better than 95% of the movies that have been at the theaters this year!

reviews.review_title: Know what to expect and enjoy it!
reviews.content: This is Michael Bay. 4 minutes in there is a large car explosion. He did not disappoint on his reputation. This is a super fun movie with fun characters, great action, funny jokes, and some nice booties. This is a great movie to watch with the boys or watch when you're bored. Go into with the attitude that it's unrealistic and ridiculous and you'll have a good time.

For a crew of hand selected operators they sure don't avoid killing innocent pedestrian. The message might be that accidentally killing some person on his or her way to class or work is the lesser evil if you can take down a dictator. I hope Michael Bay will be taking a break after this one to gather his thoughts.

We all knew it wasn't wasnt going to be amazing but it had lots of great moments. Although the storyline had its flaws the action blew me away, with great cinematics. It's the definition of an Over the top action film. It wasn't amazing but it was definitely enjoyable for any action lover.

Whoever was in charge of continuity should never be allowed to work in the industry again. One minute the driver has a cap on, the next he didn't, the next he did - totally distracting. So distracting that I couldn't continue watching; and I thought I could watch any Ryan Reynolds movie.
All over the place, confusing, bad editing. Just no real story didn't even finish it!

reviews.review_title: Not the greatest movie ever made but a great message for our times.
reviews.content: The message that TRUE justice wins will ring true with many people.This is not Tolstoy but, it is relevant.Editing, photography, pacing, Special FX all first rate. It is M. Bay after all.It's a message movie and I like the message: Justice will be done.In spite of governmental/big business interests. Someone will fight for the people.It is the message of Robin Hood.Worth a watch and dig below the production skills.It is a M. Bay rocket ride, but...There is something deeper here.

If you started this movie thinking that it would be an Oscar nominee, your disappointment is on you. It's Michael Bay. It's a slow motion birds flying around a speeding car while things explode Michael Bay movie. It's a fast paced physics defying Michael Bay movie.Unlike the last few reruns I've seen, I actually enjoyed the originality of certain parts of the script. Ryan Reynolds was solid, as usual. The supporting actors were solid. Special effects were solid... what more can you ask for? It's not going to make anyone's top 100, but I'm hoping for a sequel nonetheless.

Yeah, it's a bit hard to get in the beginning so you have to roll back a few times to get the gist. The concept is a humanist's dream. But, once you catch on, remember it's directed by Michael Bay and stars Ryan Reynolds. Then just sit back and enjoy the ride! There was an inconceivable amount of "collateral damage" and the action was way, WAY over the top. I loved Reynold's deadpan humor and the interaction between the main characters will seem forced, at first. You just have to go with it...you'll be glad you did. There will be a sequel for sure and there's talk of a "6 Underground" franchise!
All in all, this movie is Bay at his best and Ryan Reynolds is the cherry on top...ENJOY!

For those who gave a low rating: why did you watch it if you didn't like it? This is an action movie, if you don't like action movies go watch Shakespeare or something. Great movie, great action, typical Ryan Reynolds humour. Loved it!

This caught my eye .....to be more accurate it was shoved in my face upon opening Netflix. I had heard nothing about it , no one recommended it. Saw the "Fast & Furious meets, Bad boys and brushes past the Oceans movies" promo and thought I'd have a look.
Started watching it twice before I made it to the end - third times the charm apparently . The opening must be similar what an epileptic feels when looking into a strobe light. It was immediately obvious this was a mega budget flick. Only found out how much (O.M.F.G. are you serious?) after I'd decided to drop my 2c. This movie did one this tremendously well : it left me with the the most enormous - WHY?.
Why squander so much potential (and money)?
Why so much unnecessary, dare I say neurotic editing ?
Why do "Tarentino" type violence and death so badly ?
Why would anyone approve such a weak plot ?
Why so much utterly pointless urban running ?
Why try to nod and wink at so many "cult" movies and movie makers and botch every attempt.?
Why , Why, Why ?? I could go on . Sure, its an endless roller-coaster of "fun", ahum ...., some fatalistically filmed scenes and gorgeous locations and great looking actors.
I'm sure that someone in gazillionare movie land asked many of the same questions upon completion.
Real movies lovers will find this a frustrating, disappointing and anticlimactic screen splurge.

Take the night off. Get your popcorn ready, turn up your surround sound and ENJOY. Ignore those negative blow-hards looking for an Oscar compelling movie. This is an awesome action movie that's fun from the beginning to the end.People need to stop taking things so serious and let your imagination free. I'll tell you what's humorous, these people who literally are nitpicking this movie as if they were expecting some kind of Shakespeare script and an Odyssey of action that flows like a poem of reality. You people need to go get lit.

This movie is obviously made for kids. Any adult will find the unnecessary explosions and cheap action tricks more of an annoyance than entertaining. If it had been made more realistic it would be a much better movie. What is intended to be funny lines and situations is also very childish.

This movie is shockingly bad for its budget. There has to be AT LEAST 60 jump cuts per minute. It's like watching a 2 hour music video, and yes, that includes the trite "story". Even after just a few minutes I was constantly debating with myself if I should just abandon it (curse this complesionist mentality!)Just wow.

reviews.review_title: Not bad for a movie I was able to pull up on Netflix
reviews.content: Yes, disjointed editing and quick frames, but that was no cheap production. Epic action scenes, body count, weapons and vehicles. For a movie that I was able to pull up on Netflix sitting on my couch, an easy 10/10. Not looking to dissect this thing at the Oscar level here. Wish there would be more high-quality action movies like this one out there. Didn't waste a lot of time on a bunch of long-winded character development subplots either which, honestly, was nice, for this kind of flick.

Ok, I am aware this is not a serious movie nor does it claim to be. But all it contains is an offensive amount of over violence, lame dialogue and a stupid, cliche plot.I know RR is known for his childish humour and charm, and it is normally kind of cute. But here it's only over obvious, misplaced and annoying. It gets a 2 because, hey, it's still Ryan Reynolds, but I can't believe I actually watched this to the end. So that's something I guess...There are way better films, with Ryan Reynolds in them (Deadpool for one) to watch. But if you are in to these kind of films, epileptic, with a budget that could end poverty in the very same (fake) country from the movie; sure, go a head.
This movie is 10/10 from start to finish: story, cinematographics and the rest...Fun, light hearted comedy mixed with incredible action, simply the best form of Entertainment. 11/10 actially.
The whole movie looks like a commercial. The actions sequences look fake and confusing. Michael Bay should learn some lessons from Christopher McQuarrie or Chad Stahelski.

reviews.review_title: It was okay, a lot of violence
reviews.content: This was a super good action movie if you like action, but it did have a lot of graphic violence. I would not reccomend this to anyone under 14 because it is super violent, and has some disturbing scenes, like a grenade to the face and so much blood. I like Ryan Reynolds, and besides the violence, the plot was super good.
I gave this a 10 just because the movie deserves a lot more than the current rating but otherwise I give this a 8.

This is everything that is wrong with action-moviemaking and scriptwriting. The opening was just nonsensical. Ten minutes into a movie it's meant to hook you, present a plot, present the characters through their actions and setup a great ride. 6 Underground ten minutes made me bored, yawn, sleepy, uninterested and angry that it was wasting my time. If I were Netflix, I'd be feeling so raw that I'd wasted the amount of money they paid on this trash. Michael Bay should be relegated to making music videos - that's all his creative skills seem to be good for. As for whoever wrote this thing...well...to be able to write such utter garbage and then sell it as a script is nothing short of genius.

Wow, from the get go, the action was pumping in this adrenaline fueled movie. You have to sit and pay attention however, because the characters back stories are thrown in between, so it's not a brain dead action movie. Thoroughly enjoyed it!

Horrendous suicide squad editing. Use of fireworks in every action sequence to amplify gun shots, car crashes. Absolutely terrible script, multiple cringeworthy dialogue moments not to mention farcical parkour gunplay featuring skateboards and grenade launchers. Sometimes less is more.Michael Bay is essentially Uwe Boll but with more cash and worse editing. Ryan Reynolds stuck playing caricatures of Deadpool - endless smart ass comments that after seeing it in every movie featuring Reynolds it is no longer even mildly amusing. It is a shame because he has very occasionally demonstrated he can act. Although not recently and certainly not in this abolute crap. Spend 2 hours doing anything other than watching this.
Tons of action and funny as hell. Exactly what I was hoping for.

Another movie that proves that rich corporations just randomly pushing buttons and get profit just because of the size alone. It's amazing how 150 mil spent brings this forgettable, faceless, snooze of a movie

Imagine every kind of montage you can: origin montage, backstory montage, team up montage. This film is 100% montage. The editing and fast edits made this movie unbearable to watch and I only made it 1/3 of the way through.

Really poor film, just your typical Instagram generation rubbish. This film is 100mph the whole time to make up for the lack of story or anything actually interesting happening. Was difficult to even suspend judgment and just watch it as a basic action movie - the soundtrack was like a top 40 radio and the pace was so frenetic it was just so over the top and shallow.
I could only last 8 minutes.. Chase scenes are sloppy as there are too many sporadic slow-mo action.. Too cheesy.. 20 years ago maybe but DEFINITELY not NOW.

reviews.review_title: Action packed testosterone movie, easy to watch
reviews.content: Mediocre story but action packed to the limit. It is what it is and it is fun!

For a moment I'm can't believe this movie only on netflix
But this is amazing,very entertaining,
So explosive ,classic Michael bay:)
Lots of classic Michael bays sun flats, slow bottom to top shots. And I swear since dead pool all I can see Ryan Reynolds as that character and no one else
Loved it so much I watched it twice! It was really fun to watch.

I watched this movie at 1.5 speed. It still didn't end soon enough. Explosions: check, boobies: check , peepee: hard. Shout out to my boy MB (Mikey Bay) B). This movie is a tax scheme. I'm convinced that Mikey is a computer and not a real human

reviews.review_title: Couldnt get passed the first 10 minutes.
reviews.content: Had potential. But the opening scnene is a car chase through a busy street. And every time the car hit something, massive sparks would fly....that truck just hit a plastic car.....where the hell did all those sparks come from. And i know...its a movie. But come on, stuff lile that is over the top rediculous. And i like cheesy action movies.

reviews.review_title: An armature YouTuber could do better
reviews.content: Total disappointment! weak performance, weak dialogues with a stereotype plot. Hundreds of confusing mistakes like buildings in the dictator country which are collection of actual skyscrapers in Arabian Gulf countries!

reviews.review_title: Lesson in how to destroy a movie with great potential
reviews.content:
I have been looking forward to this for a few days - has great potential and a really cool concept but it was a complete mess. Disjointed, confusing, overly bloody, very high f-word count and totally illogical. I love good action movies but this was just not. I mean, the whole moral is killing the bad guys who do bad...but we will kill loads of civilians in the process? Hmmm.
With the exception of cheesy romcoms, I continue to await a Netflix film which I haven't wanted to turn off. This was two hours of my life I will never get back...

No wonder this is so bad when you look at what they 2 writers have done before. Intelligence is something you don't need to watch this. After an almost 20 minute car chase in the opening one would hope for a good story to follow, but no, it chops and changes back and forth everywhere. Ryan Reynolds is so, so bad, his acting that is. If this is what Netflix is going to be turning out in the future I for one will be cancelling my membership. I guess from other reviewers who thought this film had some merit, all I can say is it takes all kinds. Michael Bay you should be ashamed.

reviews.review_title: Another Ryan Reynolds-driven vehicle that's a thrill ride. Puns intended.
reviews.content: I'm surprised a Michael Bay-Netflix collab delivered something I so thoroughly enjoyed. The Netflix surprise came from the excellent quality of the effects and visuals, the Bay surprise came from a lack of homophobic undertones and mysoginy, but my guess would be that might have something to do with Reynolds' input. The narrative is sometimes chaotic, but I didn't expect Shakespeare and the storyline isn't exactly rocket science. The acting is good, there's that Reynolds touch of humour and some of the action scenes surpass the level of Fast and Furious and Bond-movies alike IMO. Bay's tendency to go overboard on strobe-like filming would be my only issue with this film, which overall by far exceeded my expectations. I just wondered how they recovered the budget and how there's not more buzz around this. Deserved a wide theatre release. JJMO.

This was a regular Michael Bay movie. One liners, slow motion cameras, product placement over saturation, and under developed story line. From the first 15 minutes unrealistic explosions ran rampant. A car lightly taps another BOOOM! The plot was all over the place. Half the movie I couldn't tell if I was in an origin story of a character or in the present. This movie for sure gave me long lasting physical pain. That I sat through all of it disgusts me, and makes me question my mental health. Thank God it was on Netflix, wasting money on this would have ruined my weekend.

Must watch movie for action lovers.. Ryan was so good as always.
Starting 20 minutes of movie is treat for everyone

Impossible to watch, an absolute mess, lousy editing, boring, predictable, stupid.
Cars, guns and explosions --- typical Michael Bay garbage.
Avoid if you are over 25

Hell yeah! This movies brings netflix to the top level of streaming giant. So long Michael Bay haven't brought top-level-octan-action movies like this. Forget the riddicilous transformers franchises, Mr. Bay IS back!Reynolds once again gives his comedic-action senses with deadpool formulas. But in pure action movies like this, he gives the high standard for fun-thrilling action movies as Hobbs&Shaw & Furious franchise did.
The others characthers is also collorful and loveable.So, 10/10 for action genres.Hope this movie brings more profit for netflix hence I can see the sequels an moore.NB: sorry for my english :)
Waste of 150 million dollars and 2 hours of your life.

reviews.review_title: Good old fashioned fun, exactly as advertised!
reviews.content: What is the deal with these reviews by people who can't just enjoy a fun action flick? Are you the same folks who fart in their wine glasses to savor the aroma? Yes, the movie is cheesy. Yes, it's over the top and completely unrealistic. No, there are no Oscar worthy performances. But you know what there is? $hizz blowing up, bad guys turned into minced meat, lots of blood and gunshots, hot chicks, sweeping shots of beautiful places, the usual big action flick stuff. It's not Godfather, but it's a helluva good time.

Michael Bay... Michael Bay... I have been a Bay supporter from the start. Not that I think he's one of greats but when he does something well he does it very well. These things usually outweigh the bad, which is usually the really immature humor.I feel like lately, starting with Transformers 4 Bay has been trying really hard to be Michael Bay. Instead of growing and maturing he is giving the people what he thinks they want.This movies constantly going back only a couple minutes in time over and over was either made by someone who thinks they're cutting edge or someone with ADD that doesn't take their medication, or both.

U think people want an arthouse masterpiece or some mind-captivating experience watching every movie or it sucks. A lot of these people who flood these review boards with nonsensical BS come across as if they failed outta college & now wanna try their hand at becoming ace film critics. So they go way over the top over-analyzing every film & literally dissect them scene by scene. If they don't have the backstory to every single character or have to use their own imaginations at certain points, we have to hear about plot hole galore. Obv films have them & sometimes they do take away from a film. Usually it's only a minor detraction but they act like well, guess I'm gonna dock the film 9 pts & give it a 1. Then either with same movie they'll complain about a movie not being realistic enough as if they can't wrap their head around fiction & fact it's a MOVIE!These kind of movies are pretty straight forward. Whether it's the A-team, the losers, or fast & the furious franchise which surprisingly some people will say things like, the first was good and then it just went down hill for most part. Maybe it's just that they are all good just some are better. But some people wanna just hate on sequels to franchises or they wanna hate in general. It's usually wanting to hate or wanting to try & look smart by concocting some over the top review for a simple action film or pick a genre. Some genres like comedy, horror & action are usually pretty straight forward aside from outliers. Why do some people feel like they are entitled to an absolute Oscar worthy film every movie they turn on or else it sux. My god is that annoying.We can all have opinions. Don't all have to agree to a movies exact rating. But it's clear some people either just wanna be trolls or they think they are on another intellectual level the rest of us cannot understand & they feel the need to show us the depths of their genius. So they dissect a simple film to the point it's all torn apart when all the film was really there for was to provide some quality entertainment for an hour plus.Are we a people losing the ability to just enjoy a regular average movie these days with out saying it sucks. I'm not saying everyone has to think it's great but to watch this movie & come away complaining or acting like it's a hot mess, my God examine your life....hard!
Action, hot cars, stunning women... Guns and explosions... 10/10

I expected nothing going into this and it delivered. I only watched to say to myself that I gave it a watch. Annoying music, stale jokes, overdone quick cuts, flash and sizzle with no meat on the bones. Photography was nice, though. Netflix has officially become the 'straight to..' option over DVDs.

reviews.review_title: GOOD START AND THEN IT GOES HAYWIRE
reviews.content: Just saw this new Michael Bay (directed) movie, 6 Underground. Incredible stunts (CGI or no CGI), amazing locations and overall commendable performance from the leading actors. Plus points stop here.Totally illogical story ; the movie starts with a promise and then the story line goes haywire.Some one must tell Ryan Reynolds that he can never ever become Robert Downey Jr. Ryan Reynolds tries his best with the funny dialogues. Unfortunately, the attempt sucks.

You're on fire with this latest..:-)
Thanks for the funnyness of it all..

Suspending disbelief?
Really? I mean really?
Overkill is an understatement... literally...
Such a budget... so much great stuff.... yet...
Lame...
it's a pity...

The plot and storyline weren't bad to tell you the truth. It was the basically amateurish cinematography from a director that has had blockbuster films that I found disturbing. There were an unusually large number of mistakes right from the start
Horrible. That doesn't come close to describing this mess. I only give it one extra star for Ryan Reynolds being fairly personable. The may be the worst action movie I've ever seen.
This movie is the movie I waited entire this winter it full of amazing scenes and trust me don't care for the silly rivews this movie is absolutely thrilling and fantastic. Just magnificent

You can watch this film on mute and know that this is a Michael Bay film. Epic explosions, gruesome decapitations and endlessly long car chases all in the first minute of the film. As all Bay movies, the film is carried by it's pyrotechnics and visual aesthetics however does deliver some pretty great dialogue, and surprisingly intriguing character arcs. Ryan Reynolds gets a ton of support from his co-stars, which is great to see when he is clearly in a class of his own in this one. Consistent storyline gives this film a pass, but a lack of believability, especially in the delivery of character relationships takes away from the score.

It's been a while since there was a good action comedy movie, but here it is.
6 underground is a good movie to watch when you wanne wind down.
Should be 7 underground including Michael Bay. They spent $150 million and forgot to hire a continuity team. Action is ok but story is weak and editing is terrible.
The movie can be summed up on one line. "It's a Michael Bay movie!". Horrible editing and direction, forced humor, mediocre acting. Wasn't expecting a scorses, but wasn't expecting it to be so bad!

reviews.review_title: It's a late 90's action movie in 4K HDR
reviews.content:
I can't tell if it's a good or a bad movie, I mean, there is a lot of action and I feel like the action covers 80% of the movie. 10% goes to the storyline and the rest of it goes to mediocre jokes and a sentimental ending.
This is a movie that matches any expectation. The little group of 'good' guys will survive against a way larger group of bad guys. You know which two of the 'bad' guys will turn up out of nowhere near the end of a fight and I was most surprised they didn't fight on top of the cranes. But maybe it's because Bond did that already. And how was the group of bad guys, that nearly crawled on the crane able to catch up with Bil eh number four?
Altogether a good movie to watch on the couch but we're glad we didn't waste our money on movie tickets.

It's an a nonstop action flick with funny quips from Ryan Reynolds, hard to hate that. I was surprised how entertaining I found this, nice escape from dreary PC agendas we constantly have thrown at us from Hollywood. Yes, it's a Bay film and you can most definitely tell but he is good at blowing s*it up in creative ways Gotta give him that!

reviews.review_title: Confusing mess and Luc Besson rip off
reviews.content:
And yes, I know it's Bay so exoectations were low. But... He went for the talent of Ryan Reynolds but even he could not save this awfull mess of a movie.
And Michael Bay's constany sucking up to the Chinese is disguisting.

I didn't read any other reviews. Just saw a lower score than expected. I'm guessing they're full of...that would never work, that couldn't happen, blah blah blah. But I'll tell you what this move has, first off Ryan Reynolds...I love him. The supporting cast was great! It had action, blood and guts some explosions, some great humor, a little love and sweetness, a a whole lot of FUN!! I loved they used some Muse songs ta boot! I'm not mad at the 2 hours I spent watching it. Hoping the ending was truly setting us up for at least one more!
Good action movie from the start till the end!!! Next...
Watched this on Netflix with no expectations. If you want good action and funny lines and are willing to turn your brain off for awhile then this movie fits the bill.

reviews.review_title: Plot thin but lots of explosions
reviews.content: I try to be positive so my review will be short. The parkour guy is pretty good.

reviews.review_title: People need to start being less dramatic!
reviews.content: IT IS AN ACTION MOVIE. ppl be acting like it's suppose to be the best movie and having stupid expectations on a michael bay film. ENJOY IT instead of giving it a seriously idiotic 1/10 review when it clearly deserves better.

reviews.review_title: Half of the script is "GO GO GO"
reviews.content: Meh. its just Michael Bay overcompensating for a weak story line as usual. watch if you're bored. "Go Go Go"

Oh my, I had such high hopes for this, but what a horrible movie. The characters are enjoyable enough (and the actors do a good job with what they have to work with), but that's about it. The car chase at the beginning is just plain stupid--it's just the same tired Bay schtick for ten long and repetitive minutes. As with much of the action scenes throughout, it's just not enjoyable to watch. If this film is indicative of Michael Bay's "growth" as a director, he might consider doing a romcom next--maybe that will give him a chance to do something original for a change. Two thumbs and two big toes down on this car wreck of a movie.

Visually this movie is utterly spectacular. The stunts and special effects are amazing, but it still managed to bore me to death. "God's Perfect Idiot" plays Deadpool....again. There's the occasional witty repartee, as to be expected with the Perfect Idiot, but the discordant "plot" does it no favours as it tries to be clever, which it's not. It is a Michael Bay movie after all. This movie cost a bomb, and it continually angers me that these enormous budgets = drawn out, turgid crap. Had it been condensed to 90 minutes, it may have worked, but it just doesn't. Didn't even make it to the end. What it did do however, through the brief inclusion of Lior Raz, made me yearn for Season 3 of Fauda.

Wow, is this movie awful. I love action movies but even I've got to draw the line somewhere! I wish I didn't have to hate on a Ryan Reynolds film but here I am.This was like watching a sexiest white dude throw up every cliche known to sexist white dudes. Sexy cars, a sexy team, sexy masks, sexy women in lingerie, sexy explosions, ass shots, breast shots, several car chases, club music, parkour, a script that has only TERRIBLE one liners... it goes on. If you're a 15yr old boy, or have the mentality of one then enjoy.Otherwise this movie is not enjoyable at all. No substance what so ever.

reviews.review_title: Loved it! Watch it over and over.
reviews.content: It's funny and action packed. Period. One of the better Netflix films. Do not overthink... watch and enjoy.

I enjoyed this movie from start to finish, the script is lame, but the action makes up for it, it's a typical Ryan Reynolds, Deadpool and The Hitman's Bodyguard, but it's watchable, I don't know how people can sit and watch a movie and pick it apart for the inconsistencies, it's entertaining, the race through the streets Italy was fun to watch, so what if the driver didn't always have a hat on from scene to scene, or that the car had damage and it didn't, it was a FUN movie, and for two hours and seven minutes, I actually stayed in my seat. Not a great movie, but a good one, probably paid Ryan's rent for next month.

Humour
Plot
Acting
EditingIt's absolute garbage, probably the worst film I've seen in a long time.

reviews.review_title: The Michael Bay movie I have ever seen!
reviews.content:
I think my title explains all. I can't even say this is a movie or not yet. I fast forward the movie after 30 min because I was not able to stand it.
Also I seriously doubt netflix has some connections with the black mass cult from their recent movie and tv series.
Funny, emotional, action packed film. Hope theres a sequel. Great fun
The stupidest collection of totally senseless violent acts of all time. Everybody who was involved in this film should never be allowed to make a movie again. Everybody!
In my opinion one of the best movies Netflix has released. Ryan, guns, action and the occasional one liners. Give it a chance, it gives you a ride
Not bad!! Enjoyed the action. A lot of the people are saying that this is not what they expected. But to me, I enjoyed the movie.

I lived this movie. After seeing bad movie after bad movie coming out of hollywood, it was nice to actually enjoy a movie. A cross between Mission Impossible and Oceans 11 with excellent kill scenes, comedy, a bit of love and a lot of action.
Not sure what all these bad reviews are. I LOVED IT!!!

reviews.review_title: I have to re-watch The Rock to forget this insipid movie
reviews.content:
After watching the trailer I knew that the movie would have no substance or real story. Then I actually tried watching it. I made it through a half hour then quit.
Michael Bay, what is happening to you? You were the master of cheesy, yet high-quality action. You are living proof, that experience is (apparently) no guarantee for quality. Where are your standards? The Rock, Bad Boys, Armageddon and Transformers (only number 1, not two or three or seventeen) they are all very cheesy movies... but damn, they had class. What is 'class'? Great characters, good-looking action, humor and suspense.
And then you produce the most unwatchable stuff, like Pain & Gain and the other Transformer movies. What is up with that? Are you experiencing a midlife crisis?
I hope you find your way back to quality storytelling, man! Why is it always babes, an helicopters with you? I challenge you to make an action movie with no chopper in slow motion in it. And no hot twenty-something. Could you still do it? Or would it cause writer's block?
Maybe go have a drink with D. Leitch and exchange ideas (mostly listen to what he'd be saying). OK, I'm done yapping...

reviews.review_title: You won't be able to get the time you wasted on this back
reviews.content:
This is the worst movie I saw this year (and I saw "Once Upon a time in Holywood").
The movie goes so many times back and forth from present to past that I'm sure 50% of the audience won't realise when some of the stuff takes place. It's super packed with a ton of scenes that don't add any added value to the story and only annoy.
In the end you will feel that finishing this movie is like finishing a household chore, especially cleaning the toilet.We shouldn't allow Michael Bay to direct movies, and to get rich by publishing this junk.

We have a friend that has two daughters and they were telling us a story about a time when they let their preschool-age daughters paint. On the first day, the mother got everything out, put paper on the floor to prevent spills and sat in the room with them while they painted. She was amazed at how well they painted and how smoothly everything went. So on the next day, the mother set everything up, got them started, but decided to go and do some other things while they were painting. When she came back just a few minutes later to check on them, it was complete chaos in the room; paint was all over the walls, in their hair, all over the table and on the carpet. Even the dog got some paint on him. The mother laughed while telling the story and she ended it by saying "even though it was a mess and didn't make any sense, there was still something beautiful with what they created". I tell you this story to say that in this parable, Michael Bay is the pre-school age little girl, the mother leaving them unattended is Netflix and the nonsensical, yet somewhat beautiful result is 6 UNDERGROUND.
Much better than anticipated. Starts off with a solid car chase and continues to be a well enjoyable action movie. Perfect for Saturday morning afternoon.
This movie made no sense. It contains only ridiculous action without any storyline. The Transformers franchise makes more sense than this one.

Cool action scene opening ... but who are these people? Why am I routing for them? Are they dead? // If so, do we care if they die again? ... Really horrible script. When you start off with a massive action opening - you've missed the point. We are never going to care about your story. Really - read Blake Snyder .. or better yet ...Aristotle Poetics .. If you don't introduce us to our characters -- we will never care about them . I don't care how cool and stylized and Italian your opening action scene is. Seriously, why do Hollywood people still green light this stuff. .. even if a very likable Ryan Reynolds is the star. .. its still not going to work.

reviews.review_title: My overall rating might be 6, but definitely 10/10 for incredible action!
reviews.content: '6 Underground' can't decide whether it wants to be another 'R.I.P.D.', 'Mission Impossible', or James Bond. It also can't decide whether it wants to be a comedy or drama. However, if you can subdue your logic thinking ability, you will have a lot of fun with this film. Just don't take it too seriously.'6 Underground' blends so many genres into one film, so much so that the dramatic - and emotional - moments are not really taken seriously due to the constant humor. Rather view it as an action comedy and you will be satisfied. The action sequences are incredible. The stunning visuals and photography are unique and I'd probably watch this just for these action scenes - and the awesome soundtrack! Every frame is beautifully shot. Fresh from the latest 'Transformers' series entry, director Michael Bay is once again pushing action to the limits, with incredible stunt work. From a collapsing swimming pool on top of a 90-story building to magnetizing an entire yacht, the film offers scenes we've never seen before. The future of action movies has arrived.The film suffers from numerous inconsistencies and lack of character background and development, but as I said, if you don't take it seriously, this is one hell of an action packed thrill ride!

I'm giving this 2 stars because 2 equals the amount of minutes I felt hopeful that it would actually be an okay movie.The plot holes are gaping. The dialogue is horrendous. The character development is so weak that I can barely remember any defining features of any of them. Their "skill sets" and backgrounds are now a mystery to me. Granted, I watched this movie a month ago and I am finally getting around to reviewing it because I have been recovering from the whiplash I received from the amount of choppy, horrid cut scenes in this movie.I love film. I love storytelling. And I know that this was not a storytelling movie. This was a mindless fun film to watch while eating popcorn and pumping my fists in the air while they chased the bad guys. I didn't want this movie to be anything that it's not. I just wanted it to be good at what it was supposed to be. And it wasn't. At all. Please don't watch it. There are other things to entertain yourself with.
Brilliant, brilliant movie. Best of 2019 by far!.Another Michael Bay Masterpiece.

Its hard not to like most Ryan Reynolds film, he has a good charismatic presence in the film and it would have struggled without him.Its very typical Bay, flashy, loud and a bit silly but overall is a fun enough movie with some outstanding pieces (such as the opening car sequence).
Buuuut a movie should be more than some good parts!For some reason when they are located in Vegas they cut in scenes of Abu Dhabi (pretending its Vegas), I have no idea why they would do this?Has franchise written all over it (but hopefully not).
A good enough film, some good laughs and action, with a bit of heart could have been much stronger, it feels a little like Fast and the Furious 7b :)
If you love fast pace action with some one liner's then this is for you. Special effects and stunts galore!

reviews.review_title: I wanted to bail out but I'm glad I didn't
reviews.content: I had a tough time getting into "6 Underground". Director Michael Bay's style of filmmaking has never been my favorite. His action scenes or so big and loud plus his fast cutting style causes my head to spin. But I as I continued to watch, I found myself slowly having a good time. "6 Underground" has some great action (of course) a good cast and a lot of laughs. The last half hour or so of this movie is very exciting. I plan on watching "6 Underground" again soon. I suspect that I will enjoy it even more the second time around.

BOOM BOOOMM BOOOMM
its pretty entertaining even though the story is pretty boring and the script is trying way too hard to be funny, even Ryan Reynolds doesn't really pull it off, to be honest the film A team is more fun and funnier. Here its more of an Alfa Romeo ads made into a movie.

Michael Bay films seem to have a very specific set design and similar formula within his films (especially how most recents). Not having completely high expectations considering this was a straight to Netflix film, but being somewhat intrigued due to enjoying several Michael Bay films and being a fan of Ryan Reynolds, as he was arguably the main attraction for most people, including oneself.As a film, it was obvious what to expect. Car chases, explosions, shootouts, a lot of loud noises, nice scenery in foreign countries, beautiful clothing, attractive women. The plot is quite confusing, with distracting editing, jump scenes from different timelines. As it felt like a mess at times. We barely get to know about much of the characters and the main reason for all its occurrence. Perhaps the writing could have been stronger.The opening 25 minutes or so are intriguing then it somewhat drags on after that. It does get better towards the end but overall, this film is quite underwhelming as a whole.The violence is slick and stylish and reminds of "Wanted" or "Shoot Em' Up". There are some decent amounts or entertainment mainly due to the strong violence, several quality chase scenes and sone solid shoot outs. Though the film doesn't quite live up to its hype. Don't get your expectations too high or you will surely be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Good for what it aims to be
reviews.content: An intense action packed leave your brain at the door movie. Sure, there's some logic flaws and the plot isn't exactly Shakespearian, but it's dammed good fun, and some mighty fine action sequences to boot. Throughly enjoyed it.
This is a good solid action movie. Hollywood probably hates it for it's lack of feminism, but this movie is awesome.
Honestly this movie doesn't make any sense. I wanted to like this, since it is an action movie, but come on there needs to at least be a simple plot for the brain to follow!

reviews.review_title: Dumb Movies Make Dumb People Giggle....
reviews.content: I like Ryan Reynolds but I really couldn't stand him in this part. This part is just not him. As most reviewers will say, this movie is typical Michael Bay, 'style over substance'. To me it was really plot thin, story thin. Lot of action that mostly made no sense. Everything that needed to happen just conveniently happened with mere minimum of difficulty so we get the explosions, blood, and eventual end.But as for movies in the age of people who would vote for a Joe Biden, it probably fits right in. For me, I couldn't stand it. I didn't turn it off however, I did make it to the ending so for me it has to get at least a 2, and that is what I want to give it but it really was better than other movies I give a 2 so I will give it a 4. It was stupid, but mildly entertaining. 4/10.

So incredibly dumb. Terrible dialogue writing. Stupid back story. 90% terrible acting. Lacking any sort of substance. I dont know why ryan Reynolds would do this movie besides a good paycheck. Michael Bay at his absolute worst.

reviews.review_title: A disgrace to the movie industry
reviews.content: It's only noise. No respect for the characters. This movie was made to show of special effects. Once more it's Michael Bay at his worse. Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: The action quite funny, intense and bloody violence! It's not bored! Should watch it!
reviews.content: This film start with a man "One" talking about ghost, the introduction of another five of his teammate, one of his teammate "Six" kill in action, and he recruit another teammate "Seven" scene! As turnout, this film is about an operative "One" and five of his teammate on a mission to take down a tyrant "Rovach" by using Rovach's brother "Murat" as a bait! Entire film full of funny and bloody violence scene! Quite satisfy! Funny scene! Such as, "One" playing a human eyeball in the car, when "Six" playing the music too loud in the car, "One" throw the amplifier out of the car, and "Three" want to knock a guy out, he constantly hitting the guy, but the guy still not pass out! First action scene! The fighting at Italy scene! This scene end with "Six" kill in action! This scene also is the most satisfy one! It's full of car crash scene, drifting scene, explosion scene, bloody violence shooting scene, sharp object stab at the car scene and quite dope parkour scene! Second action scene, "Seven" flashback of he serve at the war scene! This scene full of explosion! Third action scene, "One" flashback he rescuing people at the Turgistan border scene! This scene full of explosion cause by the bomb drop by the jet! Fourth action scene, six of the operatives disguise themselves and killing several guys at the hotel of Las Vegas scene! This scene full of bloody violence! Fifth action scene, the fighting at the Hong Kong scene! This scene full of car crash, explosion, shooting at the pool, bloody shooting and parkour! Last action scene, the fighting at the Turgistan scene! This scene full of explosion, bloody shooting, suck by magnet, grenade explode in a man's mouth and car crash! At the end, six of the operatives and Murat reveal themselves in the chopper, Rovach throw from the chopper into the crowd! The team of six fulfill their mission and back to their normal life! "One" saying "I'm One, but not done"! That's it! A quite entertaining film!

reviews.review_title: NOISE MEET MICHAEL BAY...MICHAEL BAY MEET NOISE...!
reviews.content: Michael Bay's latest is a Netflix premiere affair starring Ryan Reynolds. Reynolds plays a billionaire who fakes his death & enlists different players w/varying skill sets (who have also committed the same extreme act) to combat evildoers in the world (in this film's case a totalitarian leader of some Mideast country (made up of course) & take them down in a needlessly violent fashion. Striking any sort of rational intelligence grazingly, this Bay opus is his typical bag (sexy women, violence ad nauseum, car chases done on an Indy 500 budget) which hopes to fray nerves but merely gave my eyeballs a workout whenever they rolled back inside my head. He definitely has talent (13 Hours/Pain & Gain) but his preponderance to make a film aimed at the lowest common denominator is ultimately heartbreaking. I guess one upside is there are no Autobots in sight. Co-starring Melaine Laurent, Adria Arjona, Dave Franco, Corey Hawkins & Ben Hardy (he played Roger Taylor in Bohemian Rhapsody).

reviews.review_title: Bayhem To The Colossal Maximum: BOOM!
reviews.content: (Flash Review)I had forgot Michael Bay directed this and when it was all over and I looked I said, "Ahhhh yes, that makes total sense." As it was a sensory overload. An excess of action, rapid edits, objects in the camera frame, blood spraying and splattering, guns endlessly firing and people dying graphic deaths. The theme of the movie is there is a lot of evil in the world, how extreme would you go to change things? A pack of highly trained soldier type people take matters into their own hands after erasing themselves from the lives they once knew and are now freed to fulfill their passion of ending tyranny around the globe. The main story is some Middle East dictator is oppressing his people. I forgot the country which is unimportant as maximizing action is the goal of this shoot 'em up. The movie kicks off with an outstanding long opening action scene with entertaining car chases mixed with immature and irreverent humor compared with the professional seriousness of Ronin for example. Later it turns into the current modern action movie template for high energy, over the top, brutal gun and explosion bloodbath. They do poke fun at themselves and at least know their place. To sum it up, it is an energy drink mixed with Nerds mixed with spicy Doritos.

Absolutely awful acting, comedy was rubbish, expected a better film from Ryan Reynolds and they need to get rid of the blonde one (number 4) as he is so plain and rubbish. Wish I could get back the time I spent watching it. I beg there isn't a sequel for everyone's sake.

It beggars belief that it this day and age they should attempt to get away with such an unrealistic offering. It's so full of basic continuity errors that whoever is responsible for them should struggle to get another job. The story is super shallow and it's an insult to think that people will be won over by the stunts alone. After all the hype, I felt really let down.

reviews.review_title: Wow. This has enough action for five Michael Bay films.
reviews.content: Wow. This has enough action for five Michael Bay films. That didn't help this bad action film. Ryan Reynolds, like always does a few good one liners. I wish I could say this will hold you over to Deadpool 3 but it won't.

This movie is bonkers, but it has moments of fun. It's the definition of a "turn your brain off" movie and if you can do that, there's some amusement here. Not surprising really, Ryan Reynolds can make almost anything at least a little fun.
I thoroughly enjoyed it. Lots of action, tongue in cheek banter. Good fighting evil. Ryan Reynolds being snarky. Fun actors to watch. What's not to like?I hope there's another one 😎😊😎

I watched this last name as I noticed it on Netflix. I love action movies and am totally fine with paper thin plots and one dimensional characters. More than happy to just switch my brain off, sit back and watch the action unfold.But this? This was an absolute waste. I'm of the impression that if anyone with some sense could re-edit this into a coherent film. It appears to have been directed by a child with ADHD who was simultaneously being attacked by ants. The camera can't keep still or focused on anything for a few seconds. The story chops all over the place with so much frequency and unpredictability it's like having an entire movie described to you by a 7 year old who tells you the 'cool' bits then remembers about plot, another cool bit, oh some characters and if you ask, maybe some more plot. If you've never had that experience then watch this and...no actually just don't watch this full stop.Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds and he probably could have saved this badly stitched collection of clips had he be on screen for longer than 9 seconds and allowed to say more than 3 sentences together. Ryan Reynolds often sites Green Lantern as the worst movie he ever made, well he can definitely now start siting this diabolical mess instead. And if you want to watch the movie simply "because Ryan Reynolds" then you're better off just sitting through Green Lantern (again).Avoid, avoid, avoid. No wonder it didn't go to cinema. Michael Bay needs to go back to directing school and should not be allowed to direct films without adult supervision again.

reviews.review_title: Don't know what the movie express
reviews.content: Car chasing is intense? But why the chase and characters relationship ? Just thousand ????? Watch for 30 minutes but no interest to know why.....

The only thing that makes this movie bearable is Ryan Reynolds. Without him I would not even have watched this movie.
Michael Bay is only about action and explosions.
If you want to watch a good movie with great dialog and story so watch a movie by Tarantino or Scorsese.
Not suitable for 15 year olds very graphic violence and moderate sexual content. Dont understand ratings nowadays i would rate it as 18 as a responsible parent.

reviews.review_title: To be fair, I only lasted 15 minutes...
reviews.content: Was I really expecting anything more from a Michael Bay movie? The first 15 minutes is pretty much one long action scene with a weird yellow filter that is just one ridiculous car crash/explosion after another, laced with typical Ryan Reynolds quips throughout. After 15 minutes, I was exhausted from boredom rather than excitement and pulled the pin. It wasn't fun, it was just a mess filmed at every camera angle known to man in half second cuts. Maybe there is a plot later in the movie but I couldn't hang around to find it.

reviews.review_title: Best movie in a long time.
reviews.content: This movie is one of my top 10 movies in a long time. Love Ryan Reynolds humor. Him and his cast are all talented. Great action packed movie. The special effects and unique stunts are incredible. This movie should have been in the theater's. It was awesome. Hope that there is a sequel. Anyone saying this movie is lower than a 10. Isnt a die hard movie watcher. There was no sparing the 150 million dollar budget. This will be a movie you can watch over and over again. 10 stars

reviews.review_title: Completely ridiculous braindead plot, but get the popcorn
reviews.content: The storyline would be an embarrassment if written by a 5th grader. It makes no sense at all even on-its-own-terms and no level of disbelief suspension can make it less of an abomination. That aside though it is the most high-octane, rapid-fire collection of escapist scenes imaginable. For that alone it is worth a watch - just forget the story arc.

reviews.review_title: It's funny and there's a lot of smashing and crashing
reviews.content: Why d negative review, is it not dsame movie '6 underground'...the movie is nice,it's action pack...and those stunts 4 pulled,its awesome.

reviews.review_title: 6 Underground is Michael Bay by way of Neveldine and Taylor.
reviews.content: Every single thing about 6 Underground is excessive. There are helicopters in just about every scene. Every scene seems to take place at golden hour. The violence is unspeakably gruesome, and it's constant.

reviews.review_title: No ah no ah it's desired to be 10 starts
reviews.content:
Just watch
And screw every single rate.
Just watch and you gonna be "AWESOME"
NO Spoiler and nothing better than this

I watched this and I can say I'm impressed to some extent

A feel good movie with lots of gratuitous violence and explosions and a bit of plot.Not for those who want a clear plot, but great for those who just want to watch an exciting lot of noise.Some plot issues, but not enough to take away from the overall enjoyment factor. 😄.My rational says about a 6. After an hour or so of this movie I began to have this vague feeling I was watching a Joel Silver/Micheal Mann joint before I had any idea it was Micheal Bay which although a notch above in my estimation is still a product of the flashy editing of the late 80s and 90s. I could sense it just from the feel and pace of this movie and not even Ryan Reynolds charm could elevate this movie above a cliche. The supporting cast isn't very convincing imo and the story more manufactured to bring all these big names together for a project Netflix decided to throw money at. Some of the action sequences are quite good and there is plenty of convincing gore but the dialogue and chemistry and flahy editing all feel empty from beginning to end.
Fast paced and fun!!! Loved the cast and the chemistry they have.
