reviews.review_title: Great casting and a wonderful script
reviews.content: From the beginning to the end, everything was well written and I totally recommend it

This was a weird and difficult watch on some levels.Firstly you've got Ryan Renolds who never fails to be entertaining in anything he does. He's just a funny guy so that's a big plus.And he's joined by some great casting choices here. There were a few likable people in this film, and cast giving good engaging performances.But balance that against the the director, with a track record of meaningless bombast, and a weird and problematic story.They obviously wanted to do a heroes save the world from baddies narrative, and recognised that they could not use the US military as those said heroes, not with their current track record of corruption and evil (collateral damage etc) so they invent an independent crew of mostly American rogue operators roaming the world overturning regimes they decide they don't like.It was really dicey ground in the current climate and I'm not saying it wasn't entertaining in places but some of it was way off.It was deep in the concept of cartoon baddies that can be slaughtered wholesale, brutally and violently, not to mention graphically, all with a cheeky wink. Taken scene by scene with Ryan's witty quips it didn't seem so bad but as an over all arch, it's jut kinda uncomfortable to be served this as a plateful of entertainment.I just don't think this works any more and it getting dumped as a franchise for possible sequels probably indicates that higher up powers also think that.It was impressively crafted on a notably big scale, by people who know what they're doing technically, but a lot of huff and puff for no valid end.

It starts with Florence. They show a shot in Sienna, a completely different city. The David in Uffizi, Palazzo Pitti disguised as Uffizi. Then it's off to Las Vegas. They show shots of The f1 race track and the Ferrari World theme park, which are in Abu Dhabi.How does this get approved?

One would not feel boring till end. However you feel it like a James bond movie or FF ! Choice is yours to decide but never miss. Go and watch. Ray Raynolds is perfect in his Ghost of ghost roll.

reviews.review_title: Action in green neon! And people still complain - oy vey
reviews.content: This is the action film everyone says they want, then gripe about in their reviews. They don't like the color of the car - too green. They don't like the noise - too loud. They don't like "innocents" being killed - It's a movie people!! A full-blown action movie with great humor delivered by none other than Ryan Reynolds himself and a boatload of other really good actors. And the VERY NEON green car was certainly easy to spot in the lengthy car chase at the beginning of the movie.Ben Hardy's action shots blew me away!! That kid can move. I look forward to seeing him in more projects that showcase his physical talents (Parkour).This is a movie to just sit back, suspend all belief, and enjoy the crazy ride - no matter what color the car/boat/plane/crane is.

reviews.review_title: Haters Gonna Hate! Underground 6 is the Best Michael Bay Movie Ever Made, Period ! 1996's The Rock is so OUTDATED !!!!!!!
reviews.content: Yes, Michael Bay is the most hated director ever. But is he the worst director of all-time ? I would put that category to David O. Russell, Brett Ratner, Uwe Boll instead. Michael Bay may not be the greatest movie director ever, but 75% of his movies are mindless entertaining and worth your times to spent.With the latest release of his new movie, I would be confessing that I did not know what to expect to this one. It's a 150$ millions budget Netflix movie that exclusively show at the Netflix, so I really don't know how it's going to be but I hope it's good enough as a Netflix movie.Turned out, this movie is beyond my expectation and it's the biggest comeback ever for Michael Bay that put a lot of his effort into this movie.I dare to says, Underground 6 is the best Michael Bay movie of all-time. Armageddon used to be my fav of his for a long time and it dethroned by this movie, sorry and not sorry, I think it's way better than 1996's The Rock that a lot of people claimed it as his best film ever but that movie doesn't hold up anymore compare to a good plot and interesting storytelling structure that 6 Underground had. Also, this one is more satisfying than Bad Boys 2.Surprisingly, the script of Paul Wernick + Rhett Reese (Deadpool) really match to Bayhem's direction, this is the main reason why Underground 6 succeed where no Michael Bay movies had done before, it knows what it try to be and so very good in both action and comedy that really delivered ! This is a movie was born for Ryan Reynolds to played, once again, his performance own the whole movie and the cast had a lot of chemistry.This is like Fast Five + M:I - Ghost Protocols + The A-Team + The Thomas Crown Affair + G.I. Joe + Grand Theft Auto that match up into one awesome movie, and this could be the new mega action franchise for Michael Bay that will compete to Die Hard + John Wick.Also, this is the perfection action movie of the year that blew the disappointing overrated John Wick 3 out of the water and way more satisfying into the max.Anyway, haters gonna hate it anyway, Because Underground 6 is effing AWESOME and it deserving to releasing in Cinemas too.

The perfect way to describe this movie is just that a "Clip Show"
This movie plays as if it were a TV series and they decided to do a 128 minute clip show of an entire season.

This movie is insultingly bad. It felt comical. Michael Bay has completely gone off the deep end. This is what I'd expect an 8 year old to make if he had a $100mm budget. The movie consists of a lame plot with non stop explosions and shooting. It concerns me this is what cinema has come to.

Wife: I hated it...picked up my iPad because it just went nowhere. I can't even give Ryan R any wraps.
Hubby: Just OK.

Quite astonishingly ignorant - considering the United States' history of military intervention in the East - for Michael Bay to now direct a movie which epitomises what it means to possess a "white saviour complex".Unfortunately, the creation of this film feels like an inadvertent consequence of Trump's America; brazenly rewriting events of the past - so that in the present, we're currently romanticising this concept as if it's glamorous all over again.I cannot stress this enough, "6 Underground" depicting a "kind hearted" billionaire character - our lead protagonist - funding military coups in the Middle East as a "heroic liberator" has to be one of the most unintentionally hysterical jokes ever made in the history of cinema; tone deaf, wrong & in incredibly poor taste.The moral bankruptcy of this feature knows no limitations."Asian dictatorship bad - USA & capitalism good!" honestly feels like an agonizingly painful (borderline offensive) over-simplification of an extremely complex geopolitical issue - an exploration of which would've made for a far more interesting viewing than this: which equates to an adaptation of the imaginings of a Republican's wet dream.It's as if Netflix is just relentlessly paying for the recognisable names of the directors involved in their projects so never stops to consider what they actually intend to produce with all the money that's being thrown at them.

This movie is tons of fun if you place your brain in "slightly comatose " mode. 6 Underground would be a massive hit in 1981 but nowadays people pay attention and are too smart to "play along" with oversights. Characters make stupid decisions, dialogue is unrealistic, acting is average but DAMN there are cool fights, explosions, special effects, and a couple smart ass lines that just kept me all in! Glad I didn't pay extra to see it...soooo >>>Thanks Netflix!

reviews.review_title: Puppies! Crazy action fun with some basic good guys bad guys Shoot 'Em Up stuff
reviews.content: After watching the trailer and hearing hot Adria Arjona shout "Puppies!" I was sold. Of course that was not the only reason; there's Ryan Reynolds' scamp humour, Mélanie Laurent's intense everything, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo's fatalistic (pun intended) charm and of course Michael Bay's wherewithal for this project.If you read the IMDb synopsis it's not enough; you also need to read the IMDb Storyline further down that page, then, here, I add my observations. The group of six hyper-Equalizer characters set out to remove the despicable dictator of a fictitious country, loosely based on Bashar al-Assad, as best as I can determine. The leader of the hero-pack, Reynolds, while on a mission to help the refugee children from that fictitious country, experiences first hand the cruelty of the dictator, and as he leaves the camp with a victim child in his arm, becomes resolute to stop the despot's reign of terror. Background on Reynolds' character: he is a genius inventor, filthy rich but for the most part unknown to the world, he fakes his tragic death to become a ghost, free to do what ghosts can do, haunt people.Of course the "6" all have skillsets and all share the same objective; so, as you can expect, lots of pawns of the dictator, generals and security folks, get neutralized, killed, in the process. The toys, that's movie talk for weapons, the "6" use are special and how they go about delivering the dictator's brother in exile (because he was the good brother) provides plenty of action and great special effects. The "6" intend to replace the dictator with his good guy brother. Then we get more, a lot more, action from "6" as they proceed with the dictator's removal. Chaotic revolution sparked by the "6" in the process.Since I'm on a roll with the spoilers in this review, I'll just add that they are successful with the kidnaping of course, not the assassination; no, the "6" instead deliver the corrupt leader to the refugee camp where his welcome is not the kind you'd call warm.If you like Michael Bay movies and series, you'll love this movie. It was a lot of fun for me.

reviews.review_title: Ryan Reynolds apparently has a new franchise to play with...
reviews.content: And that by no means is a bad thing. Teaming up with Michael Bay guarantees a whole lotta band for your buck and he delivers. Don't go into this movie thinking prize-winning dialogue or mind-altering plot devices. But the cast is very likable and beautiful. The movie is VERY entertaining if your looking for action and witty repartee. And I'm the kinda guy who eats that up.

This movie really give us entertainment.especially slow motion action scenes and best background music,talk between fight .. it's amazing..but story can be more good and it's weak point of movie..and some unnecessary adult scene..

reviews.review_title: A fun action movie, with a lot of explosions, exactly what I expect from Michael Bay
reviews.content: "6 Underground" is the movie that you want to watch when you just want to have fun and completely disconnect your brain. I don't understand critiques: I like films with a structured plot, but sometimes I like also to see shootings, random and completely unrealistic explosions. The story is very basic and a loto of lines about justice will be thrown at you. Ryan Reynolds delivers a funny and entertaining performance.The movie has basically no story. I was expecting car chasings, shootings, explosions in Michael Bay style, and this is what I got. I was actually very surprised about parkour scenes, that were a nice addition to the whole package. Cast was... good, but these movies unfortunately does not let actors to express their true acting skills. Technically speaking is very well made. The opening sequence in Italy is amazing and actually I rewatched a couple more time, only this a couple of time. What an amazing way to begin a movie."6 Underground" wants to be just an action movie. It is not a brainer movie. Watch it if you want just to have a couple of fun hours.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have watched in a very long time
reviews.content: Just as you think it can not get any worse it does. Boring, bad acting, bad writing, action scenes are nonsense, jokes are not funny, villian is cliché. Just no.

That went on for way too long. I couldn't wait for it to end. If they would of packed that all into a shorter film, I'd rate it a little higher. And what was up with that car chase scene? Hey let's take out the bad guys, but don't worry about the ppl we hurt in the process. Almost everything about this movie was overkill. That being said, in actuality, the film wasn't all bad. The action scenes were intense, unrealistic but intense. Cast was pretty good despite Ryan Reynolds playing the same character again. Storyline was decent. Either way I'll pass on part 2.

15 minutes was all I could stand. I kept waiting for some human interaction but it was just a bunch of noise giving me a headache. Cannot comment on acting, story or anything else because the noised overrode everything else. Give this one an F Netflix, what's next.
Don't bother.Starts off great but soon dwindled down to fragmented illogical Americanism.Let' skip this one.

This was definitely interesting. Explosions, several shooting scenes, gore and various ways to die. So much action packed into 2 hours, it's a good film to watch on a friday/Saturday night.
Sometimes you just need a film that shows us people killing people and things blowing up. And this is it.It had some slow mo scenes and it illustrated different ways, in terms of camera angles and so on and it made it interesting.The characters are likeable, plot is relatively easy to understand. To be honest it's what you want an action film to be. I enjoyed it.

It is a simple action movie... Micheal Bay doing what he does best.... Chaos and mass destruction.... Ryan Reynold doing his usual thing.... Good timepass when you don't want to put much brain into a movie... Give it a shot for light movie viewing.

Insert the ONE character that Ryan Reynolds is able to play. Deadpool without a mask on. It's not funny anymore, hasn't been since.. well, Deadpool. Back that up with the Franco brother that can't act and a bunch of no names and here's what you get. Over budget CGI garbage. Netflix please stop making full length feature films just stick to tv series. Watch it only when you are assembling an Ikea furniture and this movie is playing in the background.

reviews.review_title: This is why Netflix should stop making movies.
reviews.content: This can't have been a cheap film to produce but it's still an incoherent bloody mess. I guess all the blatant product placement must have covered a good chunk of the budget however just how do Netflix executives measure one of their efforts as successful? For a theatrical release this is a simple matter of revenue versus budget, if revenue is higher than budget the movie was a success and visa versa. For a straight to Netflix release the success or failure is more difficult to judge. The most obvious metric would be how many people watched the movie, but that is no reflection of quality. People will watch it because in their perception it is free, but if they had to pay to watch how many would do so? If a traditional movie studio produced expensive dros like 6Underground they would go out of business pretty quickly so they would ensure production quality to avoid bankruptcy. It's different for Netflix however. They can continue to produce garbage like this movie and people will watch it because it is free so there is no incentive to produce quality products.
Just sit down and relax. Don't expect anything and there will be no problem

reviews.review_title: Great first few minutes then flops!
reviews.content: After the driver is killed his character is swapped and the high action turns sour, and the movie tries to become ghetto. Before that in Italy it had subtitles when speaking Italian but really needed subtitle more with the ghetto slang than it did with the Italian as most of it made no sense and people started to walk out of the theater including our party.

reviews.review_title: What is it with Ryan Reynolds film choices?
reviews.content: I wonder what is going on inside Ryan Reynolds head. I couldn't manage more than about 30 minutes of this movie before hitting the off switch. Other Netflix movies he's been in - the Hitman Bodyguard series - have been very poorly made. This one is the same. The editing and continuity is patchy. How it got through quality control is surprising but maybe that's it - spot the goofs.What really got me was the endless product placement - Heineken beer, Alfa-Romeo cars for example. I also noticed Aviation Gin (Reynolds has an ongoing interest in promoting that drink).It's all noise and action at the expense of any real depth of story. Oh sorry, there is no story. It's a series of action scenes interspersed with kick-a** sassy dialogue. Or at least what they think has street cred.Makes Guy Ritchie movies look like Shakespeare.
What's all the haters here? It's a thrilling to watch specially the car chase, but the editing of scenes were bad. Side mirror of the car gone then suddenly appeared! Love thr humor of the cast...

reviews.review_title: Great colorful, empty headed popcorn movie
reviews.content: Movie opens with one of the best chase scenes ever filmed. Lots of beautiful slow motion, explosions, blood flying everywhere, jets, whoo! But the plot was non-existent and the 90 minute MTV video thing got old after the first act. My wife got up to do dishes and I started to check emails. Great fun on a slow night but won't win any awards. Ryan Reynolds carried the comedy well though -- he's amazeballs!

Ok so if you're trying to be logical about this movie then you're being so illogical. It's insane, it's crazy, it's stylish with over the top mad actions scenes. In short, It delivers as they have shown in the trailer.
I have thoroughly enjoyed it.
I found myself constantly fast forwarding the movie to see if it got any better... eventually I just had to stop watching it...there's still 53 mins left till the end that I plan to never watch.

reviews.review_title: Critics Don't Seem to Care for It, But You Will!
reviews.content: The most action packed, gory body count producing movie I've seen in a long time. Definitely the most Michael Bay movie ever. A wild ride that moves super fast. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: "6 Underground" is not worth anymore than 6 stars
reviews.content: Co- produced and directed by Michael Bay opens with an almost 20 minute car chase through the streets of an Italian city as it was noted, a Sicilian was executed. And at the same token the numbered definitions of each person described regarding "6 Underground" members upon there attempted escape. It goes as follows # 6 is "The Driver"(Dave Franco), #1 is the billionaire (Ryan Reynolds), #2 is CIA Spook (Mélanie Laurent), #5 is the doctor(Adria Arjona), #4 the Skywalker, who's like a parkour kind of guy (Ben Hardy) and #3 is "The hitman"(Manuel Garcia-Rulfo) until # 6 got himself killed, replacing him with a war veteran (Corey Hawkins) who's served but is suffering PTSD with suicidal thoughts- his main profession is sniper. With more back story of #1 met each of them why each of them are given numbers with no proper identities - just numbers. With the # target is the "dictator of Turgistan, Rovach Almov".

reviews.review_title: A stupid money grab for all involved
reviews.content: THIS REVIEW IS ONLY FOR THE FIRST RIDICULOUS 1/3 OF THE MOVIE. I DIDN'T (COULDN'T) WATCH THE ENTIRE MOVIE.The movie is a caricature of mindless, gratuitous, explosion/chase movies. At least as much as I could stand to watchTwelve year old director Michael Bay has made a silly and poorly crafted mess here. The only reason I can see for this is for people to get paid. The intent is for an over-the-top action fest but it's just not entertaining. It makes Jason Statham movies (which I like) look like Shakespeare. Stupid slo-mo effects that seem to be targeted at teenage boys, and silly dialog that makes you embarrassed for the actors. Reynolds like to do irreverent, but he has hitched his wagon to a bad product this time. The opening chase scene has ridiculous edits that have cars magically appearing and disappearing over and over again. There are mindless stunts that are just an excuse for CGI work. This is just poorly crafted nonsense. I made it through the long and laughable chase and hoped the story would improve. Within minutes I realized it would not, so I stopped wasting my time. I could feel the few remaining IQ points I have being sucked from my brain.This is a stupid movie, but I'm sure everyone got paid so good for them.
150mio $, and they can't even get the damage of the car right, in the beginning of the movie. That says it all🙄🙄

How would you like to play in such a movie? Ryan R had the worst idea of his career. He has made weak films but this film is a champion by far. Michael Bay? Please .... no words. I like Ryan and I liked Michael Bay ... but they changed terribly a lot ... Unfortunately, in the true meaning of the word 'terrible'!
Entertaining movie. Michael Bay original. Visual effects were of the grid. 2 hours really just passed by. Ryan Reynolds funny as usual. Go watch it, you ain't gonna regret it.

The Netflix movie 6 Underground is about an independent/off-the-radar task force trying to topple a dictator. Though light on substance, this turned out to be a crazily entertaining film.If you've seen Michael Bay's Bad Boys movies, you know the director has no qualms about violence, but here he kicks it up to another level. Everything is up at11 out of 10 in this, and Bay makes the most of the R rating. There are some innovative action ideas in this. The movie also looks great. Overall, this is one of those Bay films where he leans into his best qualities and mostly avoids his worse. It doesn't hurt that this is written by Deadpool and Zombieland writers Rett Rheese and Paul Wernick.Also being a Bay film, the plot isn't as strong as the action. It's pretty hard to believe the characters are able to stay off-the-grid as many of them exercise very little discretion throughout the film. Still, the plot is decent, not to mention the characters and villain. Admittedly the movie does lean into the character of Three (Manuel Garcia-Rulfo) either making too many jokes or stupid decisions. Still, he does have his moments.I went into this without a lot of expectations and was surprised. Recommended.

This was fun to watch at the beginning but then it got boring.
Too much slow-motion throughout the movie, and there's an exaggerated amount of firework sparks used in almost every scene that it does not even make sense. It's like new year's eve.

reviews.review_title: Action only people will love,anyone else will hate.
reviews.content: I hovered between 4 & 5 stars because of two top notch action scenes that almost makes the movie watchable for those who are mentally past 15years old. There is a car chase that has potential to be a top 5 of all time but you probably not going to remember it because of really really bad editing, directing and storyline. The movie is Mission Impossible, Expendables with Deadpool comedy and Guy Ritchie's frentic camera shots. If you watch it as a pure comedy, it may be almost doable.I gave it a 4 star because most of the time I barely know what is going on, who is where and forced myself to the end. Definitely one of those movies where I will forgot I watched it by Wednesday(today is Tuesday night).If you just want mindless action...this is it.

A lot of awesome action and gore here. Lots of explosions and car chases, but do we care about these characters at all? Its a bit of a mess, feeling like the story was thrown together after deciding some cool action scenes. All the stuff with magnets though is utterly amazing, and probably the only part of the movie I'll remember.
It's a blood bath, but a cute adultish type, bearable, funny and cool:-)
The movie was filmed in Abu dhabi and they call it tirgestan country as there is no country on earth called tirgestan loooool. Good movie but weird a bit
Besides, everything literaly explodes. Even the "no way that would explode".
Loved. Every. Minute. Non-stop Michael Bay action with RR, a perfect match. Bring on!

The plot isn't terrible. But everything else is an absolute mess. Someone wrote the script, chucked it in a blender, shook it up with some rubble, and taped it back together in whatever order they pulled it out. I like most of these actors, and action films, and yet this is just so, so awful. I will never ever watch this again for enjoyment.

I don't understand how anyone can like this movie when the first half an hour at least before I shut it off is a car chase and cars crashing all over the place. Absolutely ridiculous with very little storyline. SMH!
Managed to watch the first 25 minutes but was so incredibly bad I just had to switch off.

reviews.review_title: Like having smelly, loud acid barfed into your senses
reviews.content: In the first few seconds of the movie, I could tell this was going to be a horrible experience. It is an assault on the senses in the same way every one of Bay's other movies is. Truly, it is evident in the first sequence what kind of poorly writing, garbage movie this is going to be. I genuinely only left it on because I am feuding with a neighbor and was hoping the noise would bother them,The story is as weak and poorly written as any Michael Bay script. Ultra-rich vigilantes are our "good guys" here. It is somehow seen as virtuous that these ultra-rich a-holes get to murder whoever they want, all over the world. Why? Why is it ok to murder foreigners? Because they're rich? What the hell kind of "good guys" is that?I hated every false second of dialogue, offensive lighting, dumb chases, terrible fight choreography, awful, one-note characters, etc... Having said that, it is a typical Michael Bay movie, so if you enjoy his schtick, this is a 10/10 for you. This movie could not be any more "Michael Bay." So enjoy if that is not your thing. If you enjoy story, character arcs, realistic dialogue, then skip this trash.

With this film we have probably Michael Bay's masterpiece. The whole of his art of the short musical film (the music video, of which he was an artisan) is fully expressed. The hysteria, the baroque, the furious, the misogyny, the violence, the vulgarity, the clichés, the blood, the self-indulgent display, and any visual element whose intensity produces a great sensation on the observer, are exploited to produce a masterpiece of the genre, from the first minutes. As such, the first twenty minutes are a symphony of destruction through CGI porn in the beautiful city of Florence, where its settings are exploited. This sequence constitutes a video-clip of about fifteen minutes with moments of tension, humor, drama, violence, blood and gore; a beginning of anthology that constitutes a self-contained short film (this is a good part of the exposition of the six agent characters subterranean title). We'd be curious to know the respective contributions of the three credited editors, each a veteran of editing.Then the film goes more into a flat scenario with explanations about the birth of the team, how it was formed, the background and the career of its members, causing a slowdown. Because it takes the time to give a little flesh, substance and even a story to the members of the underground team. Then it starts again until the sequences of the end. Clearly it is the boss of a film from the Mission: Impossible franchise that is used or mocked (because here is shown what we never see in Bruce Geller's film franchise), but with humor, excess, blood, sex, in short not for all audiences. That's the advantage of Netflix streaming.We are not interested in the villain and the associated plot (like a James Bond or a Mission: Impossible). But we are waiting for the action sequences, crumpled metal sheets, explosions, brutality, which follow and as such the film is a little unbalanced by its first introductory sequence, but makes up for it with some unseen spectacular (the whole part on the boat).The film gives an old-fashioned look to the franchises with crumpled metal sheets and explosions (James Bond, Fast & Furious, Mission: Impossible) thanks to its excesses. Let's hope that a new franchise is born and that there will be a sequel.

Wow. What a mess. After first 15 min I gave up. I'm all for car chases. Give me Ronin any day. But seeing miraculous healing of the Alfa Giulia did it for me. Continuity mess like I've never seen it before. One shot full of bullet hole. Next shot like it drove off a showroom floor. Nothing good could possibly follow.
I rated this movie 3 because of the first 15 minutes, the rest of the movie was literally a chaos. The Plot, performances and dialogues were so weak.
Pointless action and nothing more. Barely could even finish it.

reviews.review_title: Action at all costs isn't enough
reviews.content:
Not as good as I hoped. I only watched this because Ryan Reynolds was in it, but even he couldn't save this movie. A bit too over the top for me. It was confusing at times and incredibly violent. I don't need to see body parts fly in all directions as proof of death - you hit 'em, shot 'em, ran over 'em. I get it, already. There's no need to rub my nose in it!
Why are the bad guys always dumb arses? The worst drivers, the worst marksmen & the worst communicators in the world? The convenience makes the ghost team Teflon.
Some of the stunts were amazing but I would have appreciated more time spent on a storyline without so many unbelievable plot holes instead of wham, bam, thank you ma'am over and over and over. I can only suspend my belief for so long.

An enigmatic billionaire known only as One (Ryan Reynolds) has faked his own death and gone underground to lead a group of similarly off-the-grid mercenaries to do the jobs that governments won't. Their first mission: deposing the vicious dictator of Turgistan and replacing him with his more peaceful brother (Payman Maadi).
It's become common for directors who have made a movie with Netflix to wax lyrical about the near total freedom that's given to them. While that autonomy can mean we get films like The Irishman from Martin Scorsese, it can also lead to films like Michael Bay's 6 Underground which, with a rumoured budget of $150 million, is on a par with 2017's Netflix tentpole Bright. The latter defied the negative reviews and became a massive hit, and the streaming giant will be hoping that their latest expensive gamble pulls off something similar. For this is Bayhem in its purest form, and that's for the worse instead of the better.
The mercs against the world plot (such as there is one), which is explained over and over and over again despite a lengthy opening car-chase sequence and flashbacks designed to catch us up, is laden with potential. If this were a better movie you could easily see it being the start of a franchise, but the problems start early and pile up almost as quickly as the John Wick-esque body count.
This is Michael Bay at his most irresponsible and gory.There's something to be said for the fact that Bay is such a distinctive auteur that you need only watch the first five minutes of 6 Underground - which has some impressive vehicular moments to boot - to know exactly who's behind the camera. It's just frustrating that that unique visual style goes hand in hand with other elements that are now part and parcel of the Bay experience. From the incoherent editing to the objectification of women to the over-excessive and nasty violence, which is at times perpetrated by the characters we're meant to be rooting for, this is Bay at his most irresponsible and gory.As for the people in front of the camera, it should be no surprise that Reynolds - who is working from a screenplay penned by Deadpool writers Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick - gets all the best lines, and he remains fun to watch even though we don't learn much about his character as the movie progresses. The rest of One's team fare less well, falling somewhere between the bare minimum of characterisation and, in the case of Adria Arjona's 'Five', absolutely nothing at all. Thankfully, Corey Hawkins infuses his sniper with decency that the movie sorely needs, and Mélanie Laurent seems to know exactly what movie she's in and acts accordingly.
Ultimately, though, 6 Underground will have you asking a ton of questions about many of its bizarre choices, including but not limited to: Why replace the driver on your team with a sniper? Why are the team taking orders from the billionaire even though he's clearly the worst leader of all time? The film is less concerned with answering these than it is in plunging you into the next heavily stylised action sequence. Such is the Bay way.

We thought the movie was fun and entertaining, action packed suspense, nice cinematography, with an ending that matched our mood, when we had expected the opposite. We liked the team of characters and their actors who played them. And also, we are Michael Bay and Ryan Reynolds and French actress Mélanie Laurent fans.

reviews.review_title: Ryan gets a 4 movie gets a 1
reviews.content: I enjoy Ryan a lot but he made a bad choice on this one. It is a GREAT concept for a movie and I am sure the script read better than the movie turned out. First I really liked the "romance" between 2 and 3 as it develops during the movie well done. Michael Bay over did it in this for sure. He is known for blowing a lot of things up however in this one there is nothing he does not destroy with some sort of explosion. (A car driving thru a new stand and the news stand blows up. What in a news stand blows up? Not the car it keeps going.) As many others have pointed out there are to many cuts from scene to scene making the movie to "flashy".

reviews.review_title: I can't believe what I've watched
reviews.content:
The only reason I wanted to see this movie is because of the scenes shot in Florence.
I couldn't believe what I've been watching...
Than at one point the car passes through Piazza del Campo which is in Siena...
Ok, I'm done.

If you review a Michael Bay film the way you review Nolan, Villeneuve, or Scorsese film - you're doing it all wrong. Leave your brain on your nightstand and crank the sound to 100. This movie is a mindless thrill ride. The cast is enjoyable to watch and might I say, I think I may have cared for a few of them. Overall, Bay is let off the leash and we get to see all the mayhem that results of that. Solid Movie.

reviews.review_title: this should have never been released
reviews.content: Here's me on Saturday evening, not expecting much from netflix. I start this one up, and boy am I in for a disappointment. cheapest of the cheap. firework kind of special effects.

At 10 minutes in, a movie should already have you intrigued. At 22 minutes I stopped the movie because I was not intrigued. I gave the movie a chance because of Michael Bay but I know Netflix cannot produce a highly acclaimed movie and this is another proof even with a great director and a great cast. Only thing Netflix is good at is putting great trailers.
I love comedy action movies, this isn't one. It misses on so many levels. Either make it total fantasy or anchor it in reality. This just doesn't do either.

Love Ryan Reynolds, but he must have drunk way to much Gin before agreeing to this pile of ****.
As a typical Michael Bay movie, There is over the top destruction, and since it starts of with this mindle4ss action before there is any story it becomes irrelevant, and before the opening action sequence was over everybody was on their phones checking social media, or playing games..
Was there really any story in this film, or just a flimsy excuse to move from one pointless actionscene to another?
The action and dialogue by the characters was bad and often made no sense at all.
The worst part of this movie must be the In-your-face-commercials.
We know product placement are in every movie, but did they really have to zoom in on the brandnames? Was I just watching a 2 hour commercial break or a movie? There was no chance you are going to miss the hotel or gin brands...
I wish I could erase this movie from existence and would rather have Green Lantern inserted to and playing constantly in my brain than think of this movie again.

reviews.review_title: If You've Seen A Michael Film, You've Seen Them All...
reviews.content:
Our film follows six rogue agents who have all faked their own deaths and have become 'Ghosts'. Each member of the team has no name, only a number (from 1 - 6). The leader of the group calls himself "One" (played by Ryan Reynolds) and is a mysterious millionaire who decides when enough is enough from bad guys around the globe. When the government can't do anything, the team of 6 will complete the task instead. 6 Underground shows the audience a random mission that has been selected by "One" (Ryan Reynolds). Along the way the film will also give flashbacks and insights about each team member, including how they all met as well as how they were discovered and invited into the elite team.For those who are not aware, this film has been directed and produced by Michael Bay (Best known for his other directional film "The Rock", "Transformers" & "Bad Boys"). The first thing that stands out about 6 Underground is the Michael Bay style which is fairly consistent in the majority of his films. You know what I mean, right? This film is loaded with big explosions, cars flipping in the air, lots of gun fire, airplanes flying and random humour which doesn't always land a solid laugh. Most importantly, every Michael Bay film has solid amounts of product placement, including the lead actor's very own product of "Aviation Gin" (Yes Ryan Reynolds, I did notice it clearly).For some viewers this type of film is exciting and great to play loudly on your home theatre system. For others, this type of film can be pointless. I personally don't have an issue with the film's style and let face it, sometimes you just just feel like watching a brainlessly entertaining film. After all, one of my all time favourite Michael Bay films to this day is "The Rock" (1996).But for me, I did notice a couple of issues that are deeply concerning.The film feels absolutely loaded with content when the reality is it's just a story about a single mission. But because the film begins with no history or back story of it's leading characters, the film tries to develop the characters later in the 1st act of the film. The point in the film where the backstories begin to be introduced feels a little out of place. Honestly I found some stories confusing as to which character it was about. You see, with this type of film, everything is happening extremely quickly which brings me to my second point and something I had a really big issue with- the editing.The editing style of this film is choppy with really fast edit cuts and for me personally, I found many edits cuts in this film seemed out of place, particularly when all 6 team members have all split up and are trying to sneak around and complete an objective. I found myself questioning many times during these edits, "What happened to that person?" or "hang on, how did that happen?" and the list goes on. About halfway through the film I personally accepted the fact that the film has lots of gaps in the story and I had to deal with it.On a positive note, the film's visuals and even its audio track was possibly one of the best I have seen on Netflix in some time (I suggest we thank Michael Bay for that praise point).As for our leading man, yes, we do have some minor jokes here and there which managed to secure a laugh from me. But in regards to the action done by the leading man, actor Ryan Reynolds actually doesn't do much which was slightly surprising to me considering the man's talent and resume in action films.Overall, while 6 Underground displays amazing visuals and audio tracks which is possibly the best I've seen from Netflix in some time (thanks to director Michael Bay!) the film's plot and editing is messy. Even though it seems like the plot should be simple enough as it is a good guys vs bad guys premise, the film also has multiple back stories which are shown far too late in the film. These backstories are trying to give the audience a reason to care but instead they hurt the film. A bigger issue was the film's editing and cuts which made the film feel very choppy throughout. Thankfully, movie lovers who are simply seeking just another over the top action film in "Michael Bay style" will generally be pleased by the crazy action sequences, particularly in the film's opening act alone.4.8/10
Walkden Entertainment

It's very funny and honestly I enjoyed it. I hadn't heard anything about the movie but I saw Ryan Reynolds in it so I threw it on and honestly it's pretty solid. It's absolutely full of clichés and obviously over used tropes.
I mean the movie opens on a 6 minute long car chase. I might be thinking too much into it but it's like Michael Bay listened to everyone talk about him and his movies then made a meta satire of his own work. He even released what should be considered a big screen summer blockbuster on a small screen streaming service in the middle of winter.
It's a funny movie and seeing that it's free on Netflix it's an absolute win. Pop some popcorn grab a beer and watch it on a Friday night. Do yourself a favor and don't take it too seriously and you'll really enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Shut down your brain and enjoy the show
reviews.content:
Sometimes less is more: Many brainless action with more collaterals to justify a "good dead".
Changing one dictator with another, the American way of democracy.

A very entertaining action movie. Quite over the top and silly but that's what I was after anyway. Storyline doesn't make the most sense but the car chases, shoot outs and skyscraper shots are worth it.

reviews.review_title: This is Ryan Reynolds Best Action And Funniest Movie Role Since Deadpool in This Non Stop Action And Comedy Film From Director Michael Bay.
reviews.content: Master Action Filmmaker Michael Bay is Back To Do What He Does Best And Just LIke His Other Action Movies That He Directed He Knows How To Deliver His Signature Slow-Mo Shootouts, Awesome Character Moments, The Mayhem Crazy Action Scenes And Excitement Car Chases, Now in This New Action Comedy Movie Called "6 Underground" Michael Bay Manges To Get Ryan Reynolds Who Plays a Character Name "One" Who's a Tech Billionaire Who Recruits a Team Of international Operatives Which includes "Two"Played By Inglorious Bastards Melanie Laurent, "Six" Played By Dave Franco And "Seven" Played By Corey Hawkins From 2015s Bopic Film "Straight Outta Compton" For An Off The Books Dangerous Mission As They Prepare To Take Down a Brutal Dictator. Now I Have To Say i Really Enjoyed This New Michael Bay Film Because I'm a Huge Fan Of His Other Action Movies From The "Transformers Film Franchises", To "The Rock" With Nicolas Cage And Sean Connery And The Space Disaster Movie "Armageddon" With Bruce Willis And Ben Affleck Now Michael Bay Does it Again Another Cool Over The Top Action Movie That's Completely Gone Bananas And Ryan Reynolds, Melanie Laurent And Corey Hawkins All Have Great Shine Action Moments So Way a Go Michael Bay Try And To Keep Up More Action Movies Because That's What You Movies Known For.

Whilst I appreciate this is a bit of fun and not to be taken seriously, Michael Bay has once again just churned out the same old garbage he has been for many years. The cuts in the film are enough to give you a headache, particularly the opening scene. Poor editing resulted in in scenes seemingly jumps from day time to night time like inception. The dialogue was forced, childish and with no weight or grit.The storyline was convoluted, mashed mess with no sign of a coherent plot until about 40 mins in. Even Ryan Reynolds star power couldn't salvage this mind numbing trash, he is mostly in the film however does nothing but complain the entire time, probably due to the mess that it was. And by the end of the film it looks like he is filming a cologne advert, not great at all. However give it a go it won't cost you anything other than your time, each to there own.

I would have paid it to watch in theater.
The scenes are so great.it has anger,romance,comedy,thriller,horror,drama all in the movie which makes it best.
Ryan Reynolds is the best thing in the movie.

reviews.review_title: Best movie ive watched since more than 10 years maybe!
reviews.content: Best movie ive watched since more than 10 years maybe!
This is movie is what you expect it to be. It's full of action, it's funny and super sexy.The action is like a mix between Fast and Furious and Mission Impossible but funny!

reviews.review_title: It buried its potential into ground...
reviews.content: The Movie starts very well, i was hyped about what is waiting for me in the movie.. but then it went downhill.. a lot..

I had a really tiring and stressful day and I just wanted to get my mind off "real life" for a while and this movie provided the perfect distraction. The action scenes were passable, the fight scenes weren't impressive and the plot was commendable but it didn't live up to my expectations. However, I think the dialogue was hilarious which I appreciate.

Transformers without.... ummmm Transformers. Turned this steaming pile of trash off after 25 mins of explosions, helicopters, jets and zero storyline. It's like someone had eaten the Transformers Franchise, Ryan Reynolds and sneezed out a poor attempt for a film.Could have been superb but Bay has had his Day

reviews.review_title: If you're into Michael Bay Movies, one would enjoy this one
reviews.content: To all those who complain about editing or scene cuts or plot. All those complains are absolutely true but nevertheless it doesn't matter if you wanna enjoy a pure action flick. The plot line isn't new, the character development isn't mature but the set up and movie action looks absolutely fantastic. It's a movie where you leave your brains out before you watch it. It's a Michael bay movie. There's nothing more to be said.

reviews.review_title: The rating is for my man Reynolds and not the movie
reviews.content: The opening scene is a car chase which, I kid you not, lasts about forever (or twenty minutes in movie time). There is an eyeball and I have no idea how that got there. Dave Franco, who goes by the name 6 dies at the end of the first twenty minutes (and he probably breathes a sigh of relief for getting out of this movie). There's an emotional cheesy funeral in which they dump his mortal remains into the ocean like he was trash and he is never mentioned again. The only thing worth watching is, yes goshdarn it I will say it, Ryan Reynolds! He is a man I would go gay for if he would have me (Ryan if you read this call me you beautiful Canadian man). Moving forward this movie makes no sense. There are explosions, girls, guns and cars... (ahhh I see it now). I have a feeling that Ryan got a hefty pay-check for this movie and he was worth every penny.

reviews.review_title: 6 people who are in the shadows... Michael Bay
reviews.content: Six people with different backgrounds and skills come together to carry out a mission that erases their past and changes the future of the world. This mission is nothing but to bring down a brutal dictator.6 Underground is a film in general that carries the theme of a group of private military organizations carrying out dangerous and bloody secret missions. Full of thrilling action. Full of comedy performed by Ryan Reynolds. Carrying out missions with a variety of different action performances becomes a fun thing. The film presents a simple story plot. Carrying a political message in it is not enough to provide anything new in this film. The various conflicts presented are closed with a series of amazing actions. The dialogue looks awful with a lot of jokes and comedy. In the end, the film puts forward stunning, thrilling and entertaining action rather than reinforcing the story's context and plot.6 Underground is a film directed by Michael Bay that is quite fun and entertaining with various actions presented. Both from the car chase scene and the driving stunt at the beginning of the film, the parkour performance and various shooting shootout scenes are quite fun. Simply by showing thrilling action with various adrenaline-pumping scenes, that's where Michael Bay made a film that became an art.

This movie is just all about illogical action that I have never seen before. The plot is illogical and the way it develops is hilarious (in a shocking way). Very disappointed that it turned out to be like that. These are 2 hours gone of my life!

Spoiler alert: this is a Michael Bay film.For anyone still reading, s'prise, this is a Michael Bay film with actual legs. Legs and wheels and guns and bombs and crashes and explosions. A multiple orgasm of explosions. But here's the sweet part of the deal: it has Ryan Reynolds. And Ryan Reynolds is allowed to, nay, implored to, quip sarcastic for the duration. Much like his "Deadpool" persona, except without the super hero crap. This is the saving grace. Or at least, makes it a bearable couple hours of parkour crazy, escapism fluff. "6 Underground" is a really great bad film. There, it had to be said.Of course there's problems a plenty, like some ill advised political interludes, but that's what the fast forward button is for. And if grandpa has fallen asleep on the remote, you can take the time to restock nourishment, which is absolutely necessary. This is a giant tub of popcorn and a supersized vat of soda movie.The plot, such as it is, involves a planned private coup of the oppressed nation of Turgistan, which turns out to be a fictional place (thanks Google Maps). It is also the set up for a tiny but oh so delicious Bern of the unnamed American president: "he can't even spell it". This thing is littered with little Reynolds verbal snipes which come almost as fast as the bullets. Pay attention. Or don't.Everything looks super fantastic, all flashy colours, GoPro angles, boytoy guns and sculpted cleavage. There's slimy bad guys and chiselled good guys, and absolutely no grey areas in between. The storyline is grade school ridiculous, but also, grade school fabulous. As if a Ritalin and energy drink hopped up nine year old, mish-mashed the action sequences in every Bond, Mission Impossible, and Fast and Furious franchise on his laptop. If there's a level above "over the top", this is it. Magnificently insane. Sure to sweep the bestest and mostest explosions categories at the next Oscars. It is that good.Or maybe it's the fever talking. Whatever, this is a cerebral jolt of incoherent, lunatic action fun that hits the spot. Just pummels it.hipCRANK

"6 Underground" is everything people love and hate about Michael Bay, plus the charisma and charm of Ryan Reynolds. Chaotic hyper-violence complimented by frenetic editing, it's everything Michael Bay has become known for, for better or worse. I enjoyed it, might even say I loved it. It's like staring at a plate of cocaine.Michael Bay has built quite a reputation for himself, one that anyone reading this or considering watching this movie probably is familiar with. Well, as you've probably read everywhere else, this film has Bay all over it. All his trademarks are there. It's overblown, it's violent, it's profane, and it is very fun. It's very akin to an "Expendables" or "Fast & Furious" movie, as its themes deal with family and its importance, to go along with the themes of terrorism and violence."6 Underground" was made to be enjoyed in context. It's a straight-forward action thriller that doesn't let up. Michael Bay is catering to his fans here, and in no way trying to reach any other demographics, except for the Ryan Reynolds fans. Reynolds' charm and charisma are definitely on display here, and as you might expect, he plays himself (which is why we love him).The action here is on par with Bay's other works. It may not be his greatest film, but I'd put it in the neighborhood. There are basically three very long action sequences, with some minor acts of violence in between. That may sound disappointing, but it's really not. The opening car chase is practically 20 minutes long, the penthouse shootout/flood/parkour chase was equally as long and crazy, and the final battle aboard the yacht was about 30 minutes long and totally insane. There's enough nasty violence and jarring, bone-crunching action to satisfy, so don't worry.My only problems with the movie were Bay's trademarks, as it turns out. I expected a bare-bones, no-frills story and lots of action, and I got it. I understand Bay's necessity to include nasty violence, as it is an action movie, and although the violence was pretty sadistic and unnecessary at times, I could handle it. But it's his inability to restrain himself in other areas that annoys me. There's way too much profanity here, and I get that Ryan Reynolds loves him some f-word, but come on. And then there were like, three sex scenes (no nudity) that were super unnecessary. The women in this film need to show their strength and empowerment by mercilessly blowing away bad guys in one scene, but are then fine with being completely objectified in different lingerie the next. I'm surprised that this stuff is so prevalent in our overly-PC culture, but our culture is also sex-crazed, so where does that leave us? At Michael Bay's 15 year-old hormonal and classless fantasies, apparently.It's great if you set your expectations from the "logical and rational" setting to the "Michael Bay" setting. This movie is very overblown, and that's coming from someone who's practically a fan of his (he won me over with the "Bad Boys" movies). Try it out, without the kids obviously, and give it a chance.

reviews.review_title: What the heck did I just watch
reviews.content: I don't understand the concept of this movie. I couldn't even finish it. Such a mess. M Bay loves the explosion and this movie is technically a bunch of unnecessary explosions without a story. Just give this men a tv show where he can blow up things old very day. :D

The 1st 10 minutes.Cliches. Over long car chase. Unnecessary swearing. Pointless death if innocent people.But wow, look how cool they all are.It then went worst. And the editing!!!!???? My head hurtsYou can do better Ryan ReynoldsI hope it bombs. It deserves to die a pungent death

Ryan Reynolds does his best to elevate an otherwise bad movie. The idea of the movie has promise but the execution is lacking. It doesn't help that the camera work is atrocious. I'm conviced the cameraman has parkinsons with the amount of shaking going on.

Quirky
Bloody comedy - trying too hard sometimes though
Hard to follow at times
Speech quiet at times - mumbling
Great aesthetics though
Fantastic scene with Run song
Free running and explosions good visually
Movie references & eminem references clever
Reynolds Scotrush accent very good
Overall slow burner but decent.

After watching this movie I came to conclusion that M.Bay is still 15 and working for MTV.
The story? Nonexistent, kill one bad guy and take some 100 innocent people with him. Film looks like a really long commercial. Turgistan? Really? What year are you living in? I give you a hint, Berlin Wall is down for 30 years already. What a waste of time this is, it's a shame!

Half the time I didn't know what was going on. A lot of product placements. A lot of continuity errors- enough to confuse the story. Not enough characters development. Do yourself a favour! Read a book for 2 hrs!

I was looking forward to this movie, but I got disappointed. Two hour of no stop boring action with a story, which could be told i 5 min.How the hell RR could see it was a good idea to star in this movie, is beyond me.I hope they aren't going to make more of these, even though the shallow story could indicate it....worst action movie of the year...

This movie is a brilliant example of how critical a story or plot is to make a movie engaging. Despite incredibly spectacular action sequences, 15 minutes into the movie I found myself reaching for my phone to play Mini Motorways on my iPhone. The car chase was endless and I found myself bored to death. At 27 minutes I gave up on the movie. It just played in the background while I went about doing other stuff. I have to agree Michael Bay should not direct movies. Just action sequences which he does brilliantly. A very dull snooze fest. Minimal substance.

Don't go by the negative reviews here. Don't know what they were looking for. When you watch a Michael Bay film that's what you look for, not for anything else! It's a well made, engaging and seemingly quite expensively made action thriller, so just sit back and enjoy the ride.
Kill Bill meets Deadpool, then Sam Peckinpah stirs. If you're mentally challenged and rate mindless violence and far fetched action ...then this well made but over the top flick is for you! 😁

The movie is full of action right from start till end. It is comic and entertaining. Don't expect some serious shit here it is movie for audience entertainment full of action with touch of comedy. Really enjoyed it. A true entertainer.

I really liked all the action, concept, horror, mess and confusion packed into two hours. Great visual effects, music and sound effects! But all the countless mistakes that go on in this movie, especially in the opening neon green Alfa Romeo chase. The car gets damaged, the mirrors get ripped off and than continue to reappear in later takes, same with the dents and scratches. Reflection in the glasses of the blond chick of a straight road when the road is curvy in all the other takes. Every scene has mistakes in it. Great movie minus all the mistakes!

I really liked the message; the corrupt should be stopped, so the good guys ACTUALLY win. Governments don't run for the people but themselves.
There were some really funny parts, in between all the suspense. Filled with action and gruesome scenes.

Dont waste your time with this movie. It is so bad that even the synopsis they couldnt get right.
What 6 billionaires? There is only one billionaire, the rest of 5 are not.
The usual non-sense of explosions and no coherent story in Michael Bay style. Everything explodes without any trace of logic.
Wacth the car chase scene in Florence, especially the green car. The mirrors and scratches appear and disappear like magic every 2-3 frames.
Michael Bay doesnt care at all for a cohesive script, just throws a bunch of explosions and that's it.

Apparently, there is an endless supply of disposable bad guys chasing the six protagonists of this movie. Note I didn't write "heroes" because a group trying to 'make the world a better place' by killing hundreds of people in the process is an juvenile idea.
The cliché of bad guys never hitting a target while the protagonist is an incredibly accurate shot is used over and over again. Bad guys pop up and then get blown away by the dozens like in a video game. Who cleaned up this mess afterwards?
I really enjoyed the neon green Alfa being chased through the streets of Florence for about 5 minutes. But how many cars were chasing them? As soon as two bad guys crashed they were replaced by another two. Then again. Then again. and then again.
Ryan Reynolds gets off more than a few humorous lines by voicing quotes from other movies. But the senseless violence, including a poison gas attack on a village left me shaking my head. A terrible movie.
Ugh, this idea had so much potential but it really was painful to watch. Great action sequences and exotic locations but there's nothing below the surface. Fail.

Seriously, im gonna write an app that allows viewers to play corporate product placement bingo watching Netflix originals. This one is sure to deliver great coverage on your card.Borderline shameless. Nah, just shameless. I detected some action in the background but couldn't get past the plugs.

The opening car chase scene is by far the best I've ever seen. Crazy action, hilarious Ryan Reynolds, what's not to like?! You can't take Michael Bay movies too serious, just enjoy the visual treat that doesn't rely on CGI like every other movie these days. What a treat it is watching real cars crash and real things explode. While this movie isn't going to win an Oscar, there's nothing wrong with some mindless fun sometimes.

It took 10 minutes to end up watching this chaos. In that time there were at least 20 cars crashed, several people killed and almost all of this picturesque city of Florence destroyed by characters. Do we really need this kind of "action" movies today. At the neurological point of view, there is simply too many stimulus to handle.
It was like Michael Bay have been under influence of MDMA for a whole movie project and the outcome is pretty sad ride.
Target audience for this movie is pretty narrow. Trump may like this movie a lot.

This flick lost me with the never ending chase sequence for at least ten minutes. I will never know if there was actually a movie in there somewhere because after ten minute of ridiculousness, what with all the innocent bystanders getting killed and maimed, I wouldn't give a crap about any of these characters anyway so I moved on.
The first action scene is to long but after that wow. perfekt actors, melanie lourent wow so beutiful and fantastic actor.

Heard the movie was not good and decided to watch. The driving and chasing scenes at the beginning was already eye-catching! Should not too bad. The plot was quite strange and I originally thought all the team are ghosts! But just found that they were without identities only... the fighting In Hong Kong and on the ship are okay, and happy ending to kill your dictator. The left no one behind (no 4) was also good.
Right from the start of the movie, we have adrenaline pumping action and chasing scenes.. Definitely my choice for watching an enjoyable action movie..

Overall, 6 Underground is what I'd call a Friday night film. It's entertaining to watch without it really be anything memorable or groundbreaking. Ryan Reynolds brings his usual wit and humour here, which is always a welcome addition to any film and the remaining cast also play their part. The action is the standout for me, the final third of the film being the best action showcase. But yes, the film does get ridiculous in parts... A bullet through a cigar into someone's head (What's that all about). The script is ok, editing is nothing mind blowing. It's a fun film that I liked in parts but not one I'd go crazy for.Quote - 'Never underestimate the power of a very nice suit' (Great Quote) - OneRating - 2.5/5.
I REALLY don't understand why people are hating this movie so much.. All in all really a solid and interesting piece. Was interesting to watch

With perhaps one notable exception, Ryan Reynolds is one of those actors that can make just about any movie great. I suppose he decided to put that to the test by signing on for a Netflix movie, directed by Michael Bay (the king of overly dramatic and patriotic shot and the slow motion explosion!)
For me, MB is a parody of himself, with a barrage of REALLY dramatic shots that feel like the work of a 2nd year film student.
Bay's work feels very dated, like a shoulder padded jacket from the early 90s.
RR (in my book) is a great talent, whose at home playing a leather clad superhero or a demonically possessed step father. Even he couldn't save a MB movie from itself.
Emmm.....meh? Cheesy, full of action, a bit funny near the end. You won't miss much by not watching it

reviews.review_title: Imagine how many films you cited have made with $150m
reviews.content: This movie was 45 mins too long and so over the top it was boring as I watched it in two parts. Imagine how many better movies they could have made with its budget. Netflix's needs to sack whoever gave this the go ahead.

reviews.review_title: Why are Netflix originals just soooo baaad?
reviews.content: They can manage to get quite a few decent actors, but why are Netflix Original filmmakers so very consistently bad? You'd think there was at least an off chance of them striking gold with a production, but everything they do is just hardcore Hollywood throwback fromage. This is yet another Netflix Original along with Spenser Confidential and Red Notice that features either copy/paste action sequences or cliche hooks and twists. They get decent actors like Mark Wahlberg and Ryan Reynolds and make utterly forgettable films one after the other.

reviews.review_title: It's Michael Bay, what was I expecting
reviews.content: Didn't finished watching this movie, it's impossible. The action is just over the top, the camera effect is overwhelming, and the story....

This movie does what ALOT of movies have tried and failed. To blend extreme bloody violence with hilarious Comedy. And it works, it really does. I couldn't stop laughing. Ryan Reynolds is my New idol.

How many bass hitting songs can we add in this car chase?How many similar slow motion gun scenes can we add in the car chase?You know what throw some "parkour" in the movieDeadpool with out the deadpool.Ryan Reynolds character just shows up at this soldiers house?SUN GLARE, SLOW MOTION, EXPLOSION!, DEATH! MORE SUN GLARE! CLOSE UPS! ... magnets.it's alright it's a Michael bay movie.

reviews.review_title: American Action Movie no more no less
reviews.content: Finally!! Sometimes I just want to watch a good action movie without thinking about all the extra stuff. With action movies overrun with comic book heroes it's great to see something in the old school action genre.

reviews.review_title: Passes the time, but don't make time for it
reviews.content: The action and sex(y) scenes are too adult for kids, but the story is too silly for adults. A film that gets caught in a no-man's land of violent childishness, where Americans decide who's good or bad and go around killing them in elaborate missions. It passes the time if you're bored, but certainly not something to make time for.

Is this a movie? is this a video clip? instead of investing in the meaningless car chases, explosions and killing people in most absurd way, next time try to pay 'screenwriters' a little bit more then you may have at least a story!

Its a Michael Bay action movie, poorly written, acting isn't great, its relentless, loud, brash and full of explosions. However, sometimes that's exactly what you want to see - its not pretending to be something it isn't so leave your brain switched off, don't examine things to closely, kick back, have a drink and chill for a couple of hours , you might just enjoy.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies of the year
reviews.content: Stay away. Don't turn off your brain to enjoy a mocie you don't have to just because Michael Bay did in every movie he makes, and the editing OMG it's so choppy and disconected you'd think it was edited in Saudi Arabia.

reviews.review_title: What a ride but what a shame too.
reviews.content:
I have to say, i enjoyed it but boy was it all over the place.I had virtually no idea what was going on half the time.Terrible shame as if it had a tight story plot then it would have been fantastic.
Each scene was so badly edited that you had no idea who was where and who was dying.
Frustrating to say the least.
If you can switch your brain off and just sit back and enjoy the visuals then go for it.
Why can't we have both great visuals and decent story telling?
"Michael " can we please have both next time?

reviews.review_title: He made the same move again for the 4th time.
reviews.content: The cute Ryan Reynolds action thriller drama with him telling jokes and trying to get panties down in between cuts has been made 4-5 times now. This film isn't the exception. The writing is weak and the cast outside of Melanie Laurent is weak.I'm too lazy to look at IMDB and tell you the countless titles Reynolds has made with basically the exact same story and him playing the same character. He's nice to look at but he won't ever win any awards.Michael Bay made his last good film a decade or more a go. Ryan Reynolds gin is awful too btw. If you can't sleep and need to get some zzz's put this made for TV straight to VHS movie on.Awful...

reviews.review_title: It's a Michael Bay movie with Ryan Reynolds...What were you expecting?
reviews.content: I enjoyed this movie, it's a popcorn flick, Watch the trailer, (it's available for free), basically tells you all you need to know.I find the negative reviews fascinating, " I don't like Michael Bay movies. it's too loud, etc. You could have watched the trailer as I mentioned and realized what it was going to be. I am reviewing this film to counter some of the negative reviews. You will find this move enjoyable if:You don't mind Michael Bay's formula for making movies, loud, fast and utterly preposterous events taking place.You find the schtick of Ryan Reynolds channeling his inner Deadpool in places for a bit of humor during all of the action.You don't mind a story that is made just for these purposes.You won't like this movie if:You were looking for Shakespearean meaning.You were expecting Ryan Reynolds to be a serious threat to the usual action stars in demeanor.I say...ENJOY!

I haven't watched movies in a long while, as easiest way to find out about movies is if they are american, and all american movies seem as if they were written following those "how to write believable characters" or "how to write gripping plot". they all feel as written by the numbers. there's nothing believable or gripping about them. Still, I haven't expected it to have become this bad.characters have no names, they are referred to as the numbers, which is just as well, as they have no character depth, they just have designation, like this one is parkur master, and this one is a cia operative, and this one is a hitman. not that it makes much difference as they all seem to be equally skilled in killing people.Plot revolves around showing product placement. that's mostly it. when they decide to acquire some plot, they pick one extremely tone deaf. super rich amercan decides that government of some country, whose name half of them can't even pronounced is decided to be a dictator, and now the rich american thinks it's his job to topple his government, and bring to power other guy of is own choosing, killing in the process countless innocent civilians.there's no way to swing that sort of plot line in such a way to make you root for the "characters". especially if you happen to be from one of the countries where this sort of things was done. which is easily half of the world population.I remember when bad movies were joy to watch, at least you could laugh at how bad they were. not this one tho. this one is just offensive how bad it is. speechless.

There is really no cliché this movie doesn't use, we start with ridiculous chase sequences using every cliché you can think of before moving to clichéd fights and emotional scenes so heavy handed as to be almost funny. Then you realize there are a few clichés that had been missed when they throw them in.The cast do a decent job but there isn't much for them to work with. There are a couple of OK jokes and the pace stops you from getting completely bored.Take a series of movie trailers and stitch them together and you get this dumb movie.

reviews.review_title: Thanks to Netflix. Better than my expectations.
reviews.content: Ryan Reynolds at his best. This movie is everything i expected from the trailer. Watching it on Netflix finally gave me the satisfaction of having it.. Hilarious dialogues . I was at the edge of my seat till the end of the movie, impressive actions and i didn't have to spend money on cinema ticket. It is safe to say Ryan Reynolds has some standards in signing off the movies. Would definitely watch it again .
Action was awesome but not much of a story. Writing wasn't great either but overall worth watching
Really don't understand the low scores. Some Bay haters out there. This was the best movie I've seen on Netflix. Highly recommended.

In short, the film is a good action one with a good score and fun action comedy but it lacks a good scenario, lacks good acting and indeed lacks a protagonist. Ryan Reynolds just felt like he is the protagonist just to make the movie commercially successful while in fact he is the least one in all six members of the team to have almost any action, actually on the opposite he was hindering a lot of things. Also Ryan isn't acting at all, the same character, the same Ryan but a different film. Just eatch it for fun or don't. You miss anything important I guess. 6.5/10

That was disappointing. And I wasn't expecting much to begin with. I know this is a Bale movie so I knew it was going to be a sequence of action-packed scenes with some underdeveloped dialogue in between and a story line so thin you couldn't even dry your laundry on it. Which would have been fine because that's what I came for, an entertaining lazy watch.
What I didn't expect was badly cut scenes up to a point where they don't make sense any more and you loose track of what is happening. Neither did I expect the bad acting, it's like the actors only read their script the night before shooting a scene and it completely takes away any emotion, any bond you might have with their personage as they remain flat and two-dimensional. Even the typical Ryan Reynolds' humour often seems out of place and he just doesn't seem to have put his heart in it.
This could have been a good action flick, it has the right director and the right lead for it but it turned out a waste of time, money, energy and a basically good action script. Bale, Reynolds and Netflix could, and should, have done better, much much better.
This movie was absolutely awesome! Blood, guts and humour all wrapped up in an amazing cast!
Standard Michael Bay.Overacting. Low, wobbly in and out of focus shots that will make your head spin. Contrast and saturation dialled up.Tedious at best.

Yes, it wasn't perfect, and yes lots of predictability - but worth it with near non-stop action, and great acting. Ryan kicks butt for these types of roles, his humor is infectious. See it, you'll likely like it, a lot.
I love Ryan, but this movie is just joke. Corny and just too much fake action with a touch of dumb comedy.

reviews.review_title: Dont miss this Awsome action movie
reviews.content: One of the best action movie of 2019. Don't understand that why too much degrading on this. Seriously it's not that bad .

Got 2 laughs from that movie (both thx to Manuel Garcia-Rulfo), 2 scenes were quite epic (pool & magnet) but rest of the time i feel embarrassment like how some1 who gives us classics like bad boys & the rock could direct such a mess or how some1 could star in it or wtf im watching this.

reviews.review_title: Netflix spending money on s**t again!
reviews.content: No storyline , shaky cam, cliché dialogue and characters, same bad guy as any cheap action movie. What a waste of Ryan Reynold. Dont waste your time.
From car chases to parkour. It's a straight up action movie. Definitely worth a watch if action is your jam.
It's a fun movie with brilliant action scenes and almost non-stop action. Do not forget the popcorn.

reviews.review_title: Most action packed movie in a while
reviews.content: It's like Crank meets Smokin Aces meets Boondock Saints. It was awesome, way better than a lot of movies that have been coming out over the years. I'm surprised it wasn't a summer blockbuster. Michael Bay just Michael Bayed the crap out of this one.

reviews.review_title: How an action film should be done.
reviews.content: This has got to be one of my favourite action movies. The explosions and action mixed in with some comedy and a great storyline. Ryan Reynolds, Ben Hardy and Dave Franco really stood out to me. However all the parts were played fantastically. The characters are created to perfection. Music was also on point, chosen really well. My only criticism would be the odd mistake of the car not being scratched when it should be etc. Besides that I would also say the explosions were a bit over used. That's the only things that stopped it being a 10. Overall the movie is a must watch and one that I have already watched 3 times in one week. Yes I love it that much, I'm not even usually a huge fan of action. I highly recommend everyone giving it a watch!

reviews.review_title: The Good: Awesome〰📱〰Weapon The Bad: Everything😑Else °AVG°
reviews.content:
This movie had some fun elements. The concept of "Talented band of misfits take down villains," is classic fun and always a crowd-pleaser, if done well.Unfortunately, this movie is not done especially well. The plot isn't cohesive. There's scene. Scene. Another scene. They don't necessarily fit together. It suffers from too many trite, sarcastic lines. Less would have been more.The best comedians opine once they've made intelligent observation, whether they're your CupO'T or not. Disrespectful snark has its place, especially against condescending snobbery, but it only improves the presentation if used sparingly, like truffle oil in a sauce. At this point, however, that trope is now tiresome. So played out, yo. If one pauses to reflect on Hollywood's penchant for toileted up junior-highish, *Dumbed-Down* content, it isn't funny at all.====> rant ===> optional reading ===>
Talk about this crisis, and that crisis: We're in a crisis of disrespect. How many of our crisies would be ameliorated if people started to be decently respectful? Btw, it's easy with friends. The challenge is to disrespectfully disagree with all shades of other human beings. If you feel compelled to sling personal insults and mock others, your are simply a toddler. Hollywood has encouraged a contemptuous and babyish culture, that blindly believes everything they FEEL is more important than facts. By this time, y'all are too much like country-clubified, pearl-clutching old bitties.At the same time, all media (I'm now bringing video games into the woodshed) has encouraged these toddlers to work out their angst with violence and zero regard for life. Sounds awfully disrespectful, right? The specious mantra always is: 'It's of no consequence. People know the difference between real life and fantasy.' Well, isn't that a sweeping statement and over simplification. Can we at least stipulate that the stats in reference to violence and moral decline in our society are a complex issue with a lot of subtleties?In the history of screen entertainment, most action/war films are fine to amazing, though in a long skid, thanks to Mr. Bay and the like. However, there is absolutely zero doubt that saturation of violent content peels many off the edges, degrading their sense of right and empathy. Entertainment doesn't get all the blame; they don't get most of the blame either. But gratuitous disrespect as well as meaningless violence are a corner puzzle piece.=========~> end rant <~=========On the bright side, the weapon they pulled out on the yacht (controlled by the phone) was so cool. The rating went up a point just for that.While the flick has its moments, it ultimately falls flat under the shallow, dumbed-down directing which is, sadly, typical of Mr. Bay. Too much of what Hollywood, in general, puts out is downright insulting.
