It's the cinematic equivalent of junk food.Take a break once in a while and cleanse the pallet with some of the fabulous foreign cinema and shows that Netflix and Prime have available. That way you can stretch your brain a little to recover from the brain shrinking that movies like this cause, at least, that's what I did!IMHO...
🎬6 🤔2 🎭6 ⚡8
Suggested Age 15& up.

It's really bad
Don't watch
This nonsenseNo no never never

reviews.review_title: Micheal Bay has out Micheal Bay'd himself
reviews.content: Dear lord I cannot express how much I hate this film. Ridiculous plot and woeful acting/script.Imagine if you told a 6 year old to think of 'a really cool and action packed' story; that would have far more depth than this does.It's like Bay has only ever had action films described to him without ever seeing one himself. The near constant explosions and slow-mo, and slow-mo explosions, make it hard to keep interest.I suppose if you enjoy trash like the Fast and Furious franchise then this should be for you. Simple film for a simple mind.

reviews.review_title: Pure Michael Bay...that means it's bad by the way.
reviews.content: It's a Michael Bay film for the love of God, it's on the same level of quality as a bag of dead cats and as intelligent as one. I have nothing against movies that just wanna be fun, but Bay strives to make sure everyone either keeps their attention or has a seizure by the end of his cinematic piles of excrement. The narrative is completely incoherent and just serves as a way for Michael Bay to 69 you with explosions and stupidly impossible stunts for two hours. It's practically sinful as a genuine film, but if you're looking for something to watch with friends so you can laugh at it or get drunk and laugh harder, then I guess it's a good recommendation. It certainly made me audibly cackle at points from how dumb it was, so maybe there's still some value there. Bay isn't going away any time soon so saying don't watch this is stupid.

If you're more concerned about insisting on the believability of things then maybe this isn't for you. But classic Michael Bay and straight from the outrage of Bad Boys movies. Good fun, good action and witty dialogue.
Definitely worth a watch.

... of looks over content. This movie may look good, and to some it might be funny (at times), but it has little to no content. I like "over the top" action movies, but not when it is "over the top" to this degree. And not when a group that claims that they are morally superior (indirectly) causes more or less the same amount of damage to/problems for innocent people or more as the bad guy(s) in the movie. In the country where I live, the police are instructed to stop pursuing criminals if the pursuit is likely to cause damage to others. This moral aspect seems to have been forgotten/not even thought of in this movie.And as I believe it even was pointed out in the movie, where did all the bad guys come from in the opening sequence of the movie? How on earth could they be that coordinated on so short notice/without any warning in forehand??? And as others have pointed out: Who on earth would pick a car that was THIS easy to pick out in a crowd as a getaway car in the opening sequence???Visually the fighting sequence at the end looked great. But technically it was just Sci-Fi, and not even credible. The things that happens between the beginning and the end was not much memorable, and messy edited with confusing leaps back and forth in time. The dictators brothers sudden leap from a whining coward to a person able to inspire the military and the countries inhabitants to rebel against the dictator I found far less than believable. The bottom line is that if you are able to turn of your brain before the movie starts, you might like this movie, but if you on the other hand are unable to do that, you might not like this movie.

reviews.review_title: Fun action movie with a heart
reviews.content: Reynolds is basically an Elon Musk style of Deadpool, the intro cuts for each character look very similar to the ones in Suicide Squad, but the stunt scenes, soundtrack, and special effects were good enough to make up for that. It's fun, but it ain't winning any Oscars.

Makes the Transformers movies look like high brow cinema. He has taken all the worst bits of Tarantino's violence and non-linear story telling and mashed them up with as many supermodels in their underwear as he can manage. Then he threw in some extra parkour so he could do even more of his weird angled sunset shots.
Even Reynolds humour can't save it from being perfectly average.

This is the true definition of a Blockbuster. It's loud, action-packed, witty, sexy, and just so much fun! Michael Bay leans into his (well-known & often criticized) persona and foregoes any desire to win academy awards in order to just give us pure mayhem for 2 hours.If you try to pick it apart, you'll find a number of issues. If you just watch it for pure entertainment value, it will be the biggest adrenaline rush you've gotten from a movie in a long time.A sequel would garner groans, but I would welcome it with open arms. I'd watch this dysfunctional team over the Suicide Squad any day!Verdict: Watch.
This movie was a ton of fun. I laughed so hard, lots of action (of course) and just all around silliness mixed with more explosions

Michael bay's 6 underground made on a budget of $150 million dollars is a boring, lifeless piece of mediocrity.
The plot is straightforward a group of people (a billionaire, someone who can climb, someone whose mom doesn't love them and the rest) try to kill some bad guys. The bad guy himself is the most one dimensional villain, he just loves to be evil. The characters are dull and lifeless, you don't feel any attachment to them. The dialogue was dreadful and the flashbacks were hard to distinguish from the present.
The action scenes were alright but there are countless films with better action. Ryan Reynolds was the only decent part of the film and even he wasn't too good.
If you want action go watch James bond or John Wick not this average junk.

reviews.review_title: Aviation Gin ad directed by Michael Bay
reviews.content: Few minutes to the movie and you can see that it's directed by Michael Bay. A lot of action and explosions with unusual camera angles. Story isn't that great but it's fun action movie overall.

The nicest thing I could say is that this film doesn't disappoint for a Michael Bay film, and by that I mean it follows the single most predictable plot line an action thriller could. Its opening scene is far too long, explosions far too flashy, scheme way too easy, and execution far to sloppy. The worst part is that Ryan Reynolds seems unable to do anything other than crack jokes the entire film as if he was still filming Deadpool, which solidly destroys any tension in any scene.

I came into this movie precisely for Ryan Reynolds, I didn't know anything about the rest of the cast and it turned out how I expected this movie to be. It starts very fast paced and full of action and honestly the intro of the movie was the best. The middle and introduction to the characters was boring and did seem to drag, you feel like the movie doubled in time during the middle. Towards the end the action becomes the main attraction to the movie, but just feels like a below average Ryan Reynolds movie. I would recommend if you are a fan of Ryan Reynolds like myself, but if not I would miss it, it did have a lot of action and in gruesome form may I say but story wise it felt over complicated and basic.

Worst opening 4 minutes I've ever seen of a movie. It starts with a car chase and the inconsistency in the filming and continuity is outrageously awful. A lorry has just scraped along the drivers side of the car knocking the wing mirror off and causing untold body damage yet for the remainder of the car chase, that damage has somehow disappeared and the car is in perfect condition. Then Ryan Reynolds is leaning out the window in a slow mo shot, the camera flicks angles to above the bar, Ryan nowhere to be seen, then flicks back and he's still hanging out the car, then flicks to another angle and Ryan has vanished again. It's just really bad film making from a very experienced director. So frustrated at this poor start that I've not gone on to give it a chance unfortunately.

reviews.review_title: What is wrong with you people??
reviews.content: This movie was a fast paced fun ride with everything in it!! Good acting, Fast cars, pretty girls, good soundtrack. The haters are probably too busy writing good reviews for the terrible newer fast and furious movies. If u like a good action movie, Check this one out, U won't be disappointed

Even by Michael Bay's standards this is utter and I persevered until the end but it never improved, in fact it got worse. The basic plot of billionaire fakes own death and recruits a top team of 'ghosts' to right the wrongs of the world without recourse to, justice, legality, geo politics or just plain old morality is Bay working out his world view where 'obvious bad people' are just summarily dealt with, just like the US did in Iraq and Libya regardless of consequences and it stinks because of that.
The film opens with a car chase which is far too long and utterly preposterous to introduce us to the main characters and bond with their witty one liners, a Reynolds trope which is just tiresome now. But we don't bond because it is such a confusing montage in which they miraculously avoid death (apart from one) from multiple bad guys in magically appearing cars (all black of course) while dozens of civilians die as random collateral much like the victims of the US interventions Bay is such a fan of.
After the boredom of the car chase we are led to the nub of the story which is basically a coup to unseat a cartoon bad guy living a life of bling while he oppresses his people in Turgestan (which is a racist trope for so many Muslim countries the US doesn't like) because the shallow billionaire witnessed the dictator gassing his own people in a refugee camp. The dictator is clearly a Saddam/Gaddafi amalgam and the country a mix of Iraq, Syria & Libya which is just lazy, cheap and insulting to the audience. This epiphany has no other relevance and does nothing to explain Reynolds later skills with weapons, how he recruits the others (given that he is dead and his business assets would be unavailable), and his complete lack of emotion about killing people up close - a suited billionaire, really?
The film then lurches from one action trope to another as we get some kind of back story for the other characters but this done so badly, so cheesily, so violently, we just don't care. But the group has bonded and on we go to the coup.
This is so a Hollywood coup that it's embarrassing; we have a reluctant good brother who the group have rescued to install as new leader - no need for democracy, we know best! We have the guilded presidential palace and over the top statues - again Saddam & Gaddafi, we have a luxury yacht which becomes the final battleground, we have a ridiculous James Bond magnetic device which throws the bad guys around the boat and we have the poor oppressed masses rising up at a moments notice because they see the brother on TV speaking to them - how racist could you possibly be? The TV bit by the way is preceded by a moral aside from Reynolds about the power of state TV in controlling the people - erh, Fox News? BBC?
Not surprisingly the team win and the dictator captured to be later dropped into a mass of angry civilians who proceeded to tear him to pieces in an obvious Gaddafi reference. None of the team die, which given the sheer volume of ammunition expended is ludicrous, and in a series of cheesy montages go on to live happily ever after although the Reynolds montage makes no sense. No montages of funerals for the hundreds gratuitously killed by the protagonists though.
Now Michael Bay can make action films where the story drives the action, the violence is largely contained within realistic parameters (given that it's a film) and the characters are somewhat relatable to; Armageddon, Bad Boys, Transformers, 13 Hours even, but this is gratuitous, lazy and frankly racist film making, why Netflix funded it and why Reynolds fronted it is beyond me.
I'm a huge war movie and John wick fan.......this movie takes the cake. New ways to make people Die as far as car chases go. Must see. Humor and intensity.

reviews.review_title: Not a bad movie at all
reviews.content:
Some bad cuts with noticeable dummies but this movie made me laugh made cry made feel exited and didn't made me to stop it and take a break which is very important especially for a 2 ours long movie
its a full action movie maybe even too much action but then i saw that M.B directed that so i was like yeah that make sense some parts was very confusing and pretty bad but all and all its watchable and enjoyable the cast was good(the guy plying the bad dictator is an Israeli actor so that was a nice surprise)
*i like it how this movie portraits what really happens in Syria and no one even cares enough to stop that mad war.
i rate it 7/10

This is the most disjointed, poorly executed drivel I have ever watched. I couldn't even make it through the entire film and left before all respect I have for Reynolds was depleted. From the random cut scenes, poorly timed flash backs and inane dialogue this movie has everything you need to avoid. It is like watching a string of Mountain Dew and Five Gum commercials, with an added dollop of explosions and a soupçon of blood and guts patched into a movie. Avoid at all costs.

Nothing ground breaking here. Solid action scenes and fun music all tied together by an interesting team. It's Classic Michael Bay! If you're a fan of 13 Hours, Armageddon, Bad Boys, and Transformers then you'll enjoy this. The violence is highly stylish and downright enjoyable. It's nice to see when Bay gets an R-rating so his movies can be somewhat realistic. If you're at all an Action fan then check it out. Reynolds holds it together nicely.

reviews.review_title: Oh Ryan, I hope the cash was worth it
reviews.content: This might be the least intelligent action movie I've ever seen. It's awful on a level that makes it seem like it's deliberate but somehow still isn't fun like your standard creature feature/syfy channel nonsense.

reviews.review_title: What in the serious eff was that?
reviews.content:
That was an absolute editing nightmare filled the the lid with product placements and unbelievably bad actors playing the roles of unbelievable bad guys.The 100,000 or so ludicrous-speed cuts may induce an epileptic seizure (an actual warning just before the movie begins). The movie jumps back and forth through past and present without explanation at a furious pace-only stopping momentarily to frame a Lavazza coffee cup or a Heineken beer or any other of the plethora of sponsors. Lots and lots of ad money.I think this movie feels as if you hooked your brain up to a computer and downloaded a lifetime of memories in 5 seconds-but the memories are useless and stupid and there are 2 hours of them.And the completely unnecessary violence? I feel like Michael Bay was told to keep the violence to a minimum and he was all like, "Now I'm totally going to brutally murder 2000 people for literally no reason whatsoever-and I'm going to show EVERYTHING."
Did anyone else scrunch and raise their eyebrows at all the unnecessary innocent casualties caused by the "good guys"?What was the parkour guy there for? I mean, his position on various rooftops is solely so he can parkour down to the ground when he's needed? Why is he always up there to begin with?In all fairness, I imagine this movie might have been much better if the cut was a full 3 hours long before some exec told Bay to cut it down to 2 hours. So he left all the action scenes and removed literally everything else. I have no idea if that's true. But I hope it is, because WTF?It's a heist movie without the planning parts. I have no idea what happened but there were loads of incredibly corny one-liners stacked up like an assembly line of cheese.They spent a lot of money of this, though-mainly on the explosions and dismembered bodies.The ONLY redeeming part of this film is Ryan Reynolds. As usual, he carried the movie as best he could but something tells me he was told to keep to the script more than usual. So it's not your full RR experience.I call it a movie because it's certainly not a film. It's the kind of mindless action you can watch with your loud buddies and miss just as much of the plot as if you watched it alone.I gave it 3 stars only because of Reynolds.Mildly entertaining cuz 'splosions.

Usually I'm very forgiving for these type of action films, but I draw the line when they are so badly filmed they become unwatchable. The camerawork is the worst you'll ever encounter, by quite a stretch, literally making you blink all the time. The assault on your ears is just as bad with extraordinary loud and cut off pieces of music that get rapid fired at you randomly. It is such visual diarrhea that I won't even begin about the terrible, terrible writing. The 2 instead of a 1 star is because I don't want to blame the actors for this. I'm a Ryan Reynolds fan for crying out loud! But this... this is all Michael Bay who, even for his low standards, has vomited out an utter mess. Please don't watch.
Fast cars, cool characters. The plot wasn't put together well. The movie needed either less events or longer duration.

reviews.review_title: I only enjoyed it a little bit
reviews.content: I can't believe they spent 150million dollars on this movie. It definitely could have been better... The story of them being a ghost by faking their own death is actually quite interesting but, the whole movies feels lackluster or too much lightness. I like the dubstep music, sniper guy and parkour guy though. No offense to the other actors, their acting was good. It's the whole movie that could have been better.

reviews.review_title: Editing/cuts/camera angles in this movie gave me an headache
reviews.content:
I'm your average Joe who loves to watch good action movies. Usually I don't dabble in technical terms pertaining to cinema. But, oh God! The cuts, editing, and those camera angles.. it genuinely gave me headache and irritation, and was a major distraction from the story (yeah, the generic one).
Yes, I have watched Bay's movies in the past, but this movie tries hard to be a stylish, spy flick and it falls flat.
Verdict: Even Ryan Reynolds "witty" jokes can't save this film.

reviews.review_title: Fun filled action packed two hours!
reviews.content: I see alot of negative reviews for this film, I sometimes feel that people read too much into a film like this and need to to sit back and enjoy it for what it is, a fun filled action packed two hour bit of escapism!!

Ryan Reynolds is the best, no doubt. The special effects and action shots were very well done.But the editing... wrecked it. Never realized how much difference it makes to start songs at the right time, not cut scene too early, or to just fill in story with content instead of cocaine-fueled action shots.

reviews.review_title: It's Michael Bay. That's all you have to know.
reviews.content: Guns, explosions, car chases, more explosions, people being run over, half-naked girls, action, more car chases, and so on and so on and so on. The usual Bay-suspects. The budget for this movie must have been insane. Seems hardly any expenses were spared to make this flick out-Bond any James Bond movie. The amount of luxury stuff being destroyed is just gratuitous, the technical level is impressive and the action scenes are creative and well crafted. But that's about it.The only surprise is the amount of cursing. It looks like the only thing Bay was missing while producing for the big studios was the R-rating. It fits the movie, so it doesn't feel over the top. What feels too much is the shaky cam videography. At times it's hard to follow what's going on, but then again, that hardly matters in a Bay-Movie. As long as stuff keeps exploding, the target audience won't mind that hardly any scene flows naturally into the next.The only saving grace making this mess watchable is Ryan Reynolds, he never takes the movie serious and as such comes across as the only believeable and mature person in this utter chaos. But even he cannot save the idiotic story line. Whenever the action calms down for a moment, Bay pulls out ludicriously cheap emotion-moments, that border on offensive. The pseudo-politic plot about killing a dictator is incredible stupid and painfully ignorant of the present world situation. The dialogues were written by brain-amputees for brain-amputees. At that point, why even care with a screenplay?But then again, if you know Michael Bay, you know already, if you like it or not.
About all i can say. I didn't know Michael Bay directed this trash but it does make more sense now why I couldn't even get half way thru it.

L am a movie buff. This movie is by far on the top of the mountain of stupidity. I tried to view it from different perspectives e.g. as a comedy, an action thriler, a spoof, a parody a political farce. Nothing worked! It was a torture trying to watch bunch of sissies killing oodles of bad guys just like in a video game and coming out with a few scratches at the end if that!
So, watch your grass in your lawn grow! Now that would be something!

reviews.review_title: Over the top in an annoying way
reviews.content: Everything is over the top in this movie. It can work in a comedy, but here it mostly annoyed me.They used fancy directing techniques, but feels soulless synthetic.They hired cheap discounter music producers, trying a Dust Brothers score giving me a serious 'meh' feeling.

reviews.review_title: A lot of action and worthy of big screen...
reviews.content: Great job to NetFlix. I could have missed this but pleasantly surprised at the quality. Ryan Reynolds did his usual good job (if you like his style) and cast of characters brought great chemistry. Plot and script was above average and I would have even paid to see this at the movies.A lot of action and gun-fighting. Scenes right of Deadpool as far as shock & gore.Looking forward to Netflix bringing more films like this to their service. Keeps me happy to subscribe.

reviews.review_title: The start up and end are horrible
reviews.content: The execution from start to finish is horrible. The movie is thrown together, no smooth transition. The movie goes back and forth to present and past through the entire film and makes it confusing throughout. Action scenes were just ok and typical for Michale Bay. Honestly this movie was trash. This movie was like a child tried to mash his thoughts together into a film with guns and a couple pretty women, oh and save some peoples lives. Stupid pointless movie with no substance. 3 stars for eye candy but that's all.

If they deleted every random object that blew up or caught on fire for no particular reason and then ran the slow-motion shots at regular speed, this movie would only have a 24 minutes run time. The only redeeming quality is Ryan Reynolds' humor. I wasn't aware this was a Michael Bay film before I hit play. It took almost 45 seconds for me to figure that part out when three random cars blew after slamming into each other like they had five lbs of c-4 in the trunk then proceed to flip over each other In the air defying several laws of physics. It was all down hill from there. However there was a great cameo from an Aviation Gin bottle during a scene set in Paris. That was fun.

When I saw the trailer I thought this was going to something cool and maybe a bit different. I was wrong.
I also thought that Michael Bay could direct better action now, having 13hrs in my mind. But no. Its back to fast cutting, extreme unbelievable action scenes, and bad action scenes at that.The movie works if you like over the top, laughable action. Then it works. The whole movie is a mashup of Mission Impossible, Fast & Furious and xXx.
I kept thinking that this must have been a movie the actors decided to do because 1. They had nothing else to do.
2. They needed the money
3. They got to work with Ryan ReynoldsI admit, I watched it simply because of RR, I think hes good and funny.
But after watching 10 minutes, I realized, RR plays the exact same character in every movie. EVERY MOVIE. Just with a different character name.
It got a little bit tiring. Other than him, cant say I've seen the other actors, maybe thats why the chemistry between the actors sucked.
Sadly, this movie is comparable with the new Charlies Angels.
Just the soundtrack alone, all the "cued up" songs is enough to tell you the direction of the film. Ryan Reynolds is getting so predictable now, just so much of it he's not funny.

Whoever put together the car chases, didn't pay attention that when the car is hit it should be showing the damage and it should be showing right one. The first 10 minutes they are driving thru many accidents but the car shows no damage. So stupid and unrealistic

reviews.review_title: Action packed but very dragged (time wise)
reviews.content:
The action scenes... with the car chasing and the shooting are the best I've seen in a while. Very realistic...but it should be a 1.30 hour movie , not two hours ... over dragged and gets tiring...
Overall I enjoyed the movie

I'm now actually angry that Netflix spent some of my hard earned money to produce this. Absolutely shocking! Although, fair play to the post production chaps. They've worked their socks off on this one. Particularly with the ridiculous way that people die. Amazing.

It's not an action and thriller movie; it's only a comedy movie. The entire story is quite good but on paper. Ryan Reynolds's comic timing is the best to watch in this movie. I don't know why, but this movie could have been excellent, but it has not been done.All the actor's performance is fantastic in 6 Underground. There is a slight deficiency in the screenplay, and there are some shortcomings in the direction as well. The music in the whole movie is quite good, and the action of this film is tremendous.If you like watching Ryan Reynolds movies and action movies, then you can watch Netflix 6 Underground.

reviews.review_title: Absurd, terribly edited, poorly written, Uber violent
reviews.content: And so bloody entertaining!! Netflix has proven it has been a MISS globally, losing subscribers left and right, cancelling well respected and written shows and producing some terrible shows and movies. This movie sums up Netflix for 2019. It's terrible!! Pointless and disjointed. The story is barely stitched together . And even plain but sexy Ryan Reynolds can't save it. Oh and I wish the Mexican had been killed in the opening car chase instead of the lesser Franco. One of the most annoying characters in recent history. But sadly I was entertained, maybe it's the headspace o am in at the moment.

I read some reviews beforehand, and decided to dismiss them. I am so glad I did.This was a most enjoyable action movie on steroids. Boring and mundane it certainly wasn't. It gripped from start to finish. The comedic elements and one-liners softened the hard-hitting and near zany and crazy action. It certainly made me chuckle.I feel sorry for those who are always looking for faults and then easily finding them. Of course this film will never win prizes for the script or an acting masterclass. But the direction was clever and as zany as the rest of the film managed to be.In conclusion, leave your brain at home, sit back, and you just might enjoy this terrific action romp...
Just wanted to point out the part where the garbage truck takes out the drivers side mirror, then after driving away from the accident, the mirror magically re-appeared.

The worst movie i have ever seen.
Just bad action..Wow i can't believe how much rubbish this managed to pile up.!.

reviews.review_title: Unwatchable - the editing is literally nauseating
reviews.content:
One half second cut after another. The "editor" must think they were being very clever. I simply think they are of a different species to myself. If anyone was overseeing the editor they must have had a white stick and/or guide dog. On top of that the film is so divorced from reality it may as well have been set in some comic universe. It's like watching a dream in that anything could possibly happen because you've suspended reality.
Only the living dead will make it far into this film.

reviews.review_title: Dead pool+ Bourne + oceans 11 , killed off all the characters before the movie finished
reviews.content: Ryan Reynolds was great although he technically didn't do anything in an action film that he stars in?? All the main characters get killed... otherwise it could have gone on to be a decent series, but now there is no need or point to make a sequel ...

reviews.review_title: Not as smart as it wants to be
reviews.content: Think Fast and Furious 2030 minutes shorter, less emotional bs and this could have been a lot more solid.

This movie is extremely messy, disjointed, and incomprehensible at times, but it has Michael Bay doing what he does best. It's easy to forgive the flaws in 6 Underground when it gives you gorgeous visuals, exhilarating action scenes, sexy women, expensive cars, beautiful locations, and over the top violence. Hollywood should keep giving Michael Bay the biggest budget possible while allowing him to do anything he wants.
Most of the movie keeps going back to the past and to the future so much so that it completely fails to keep the audience engaged.

I really don't understand some of the reviews, this is an action movie, not a heartfelt drama.
If you like action, shooting and Ryan Reynolds then watch it. If you feel like complaining later about how characters were built and that it was lacking more drama then you are basically a Curling fan at a Basketball game.

reviews.review_title: Jack and Jill of action movies.
reviews.content: This "review" doesn't contain spoilers. There's nothing to spoil. This is not a movie. It is a poor excuse for Michael Bay to go around the world. A money scham to write off the taxes. Plotless, pointless series of footage resembling a demo reel of commercials for expensive luxury items. Kind of like Adam Sandler's movies. It is basically Jack & Jill of action movies.

The move was exactly what you expect it to be. It seems like a setup movie where you have a squeal since the first move felt closer to intro of all the characters. I like they fact that they introduced / left ideas for the sequels such as the boxes. My favorite was the start and was a little upset when the driver died when i just started liking the character.

Pure unadulterated high adrenaline ultraviolence. I couldn't sit through it. Will filmmakers ever understand that they are not serving humanity when they put out crap like this. Quite the opposite. We wonder why there's so much violence and malevolence in the world? And we wonder why international polls say that the vast majority of the world considers the states to be the country that is the greatest threat to peace? Hmm...

The movie have some insane scenes and is okay for watching it just once, not something that you will want to watch few times. I was a bit bothered that the alfa side mirrors were smashed but then were appearing as brand new every 20 seconds, it was annoying, wonder if someone else noticed this lol

reviews.review_title: You know it's Michael Bay when ...
reviews.content: Here's my review of 6 underground . So you know how you ask your parents for something as a kid and they won't buy it for you , and then your cool uncle buys it for you . That cool uncle of Hollywood rn is Netflix . Martin Scorcesse makes his movies till the 3 hour mark cause studios won't let him make em any longer , uncle netlflix came and said "whatever you want " and boom ! You have 'the Irishman' which is almost 4 hours long. And 6 underground is Michael Bay freed of his studio shackles by Netlflix . So before I talk about the movie i'd like to about the man , the myth , the legend , Michael Bay himself. Bay has a style and people can't notice said style unless it's distinguishable . Michael Bay is that one kid who could never get enough of GI JOE , and every single one of his movies glorifies the military which can give call of duty a run for it's money. That's not the only thing he can't get enough of , he can't stand women without makeup . All his movies , even if someone's on their deathbed , they're all heavy on lip gloss and makeup . And you can't be a part of a Michael Bay movie unless you look sexy in every shot , even the sweating needs to make you look cool. Now that's attention to detail . Michael Bay started out making ad films and you can see their influence as his movies are a mix of sports car commercials , lingerie ads and high octane stunts from mountain dew commercials followed by heavy product placement . Bay also has this awkward humour which ranges from racial stereotypes to mispronouncing other movie lines . And last but not least his trademark , explosions ! Bay loves blowing stuff up and makes it look cool by using slo mo shots and music . He also loves his neon colours and uses them whenever he can , even when it's a super secure ghost op. And finally ends his movies with inspirational music followed by montage shots and rolls the credits starting with his name right as the music hits the drop.Now 6 underground is pretty much Batman without the costume and a no kill rule recruiting people around the world to put down a dictatorship . The Bruce Wayne like dude is played by Ryan Reynolds and his crew is played by a couple of Nickelodeon sitcom rejects with the exception of Melanie Laurent , the theatre chick from Inglorious bastards. The movie has no cgi , has three explosive set pieces set in the streets of Florence , a highrise in some Dubai like place and a yacht . That's just about it . But Michael Bay is that hormonal teenager who never grew up , he likes his action and his cool shots , his testosterone and adrenaline flowing . Cause "teen" us didn't want drama or romance either , we wanted to see stuff explode and understand one liners and that's just what this movie is , and Michael Bay knows that and so does Ryan Reynolds from all the promotion for this movie , which means that all the Michael bayisms in this movie are completely intentional. All sarcasm apart 6 underground is a bad movie , but a bad - good movie , everyone knows it's bad but it delivers high octane action and that's what we were promised so if you need something to roast on, you have it . so if you know your Bay movies you will have fun picking out all the stupid stuff he does or you just watch it for the action anyway . In the end 6 underground is explosive , blindingly neon , has a lot of slo mo shots , tons of product placement and Linkin park's castle of glass music video summed up into one movie. Seriously though, I never thought I'd type this much for a Michael Bay movie .To quote Steve jobs himself " You just can't ignore the crazy ones ".

The type of movie that you should not watch on a small screen with tiny speakers.
The sound is incredible and contributes a lot.I have watched it a few times now. Did you see the guy that hot a salad bowl in the n*ts?It is a rollercoaster movie. Good effects.

The Big Picture podcast kinda made me wanna see this one because they made it sound incredibly worth seeing even if they also said it's quite terrible. I wouldn't say it's worth a watch, but it's certainly a rarity because of how much of an over-the-top, unapologetically common denominator action flick it is. If you don't like Michael Bay anyway, like me of course, then don't do this to yourself.
Terrible things about 6 Underground:
Soundtrack.
"DIIIG DOOOWN."
Editing.
Direction.
Nonsensical story.
Insanely dumb dialogue.
Attempts at emotional scenes.
Doesn't know how much of a satire it wants to be, or if it wants to be anything at all.
Constant product placement.
These close-ups.
Definitely racist.
Humourless humour.
Title cards.
For sure sexist.
Voice-over.
Annoying time-shifts.
"DIIIIIG DOOOOOWN."
Michael Bay.
Slow motion.
Michael Bay.
Despicable storytelling.
Michael Bay.
Why is Mélanie Laurent in this? She deserves better, but I guess if that helps her finance some films then so be it.
No substance at all.
It is boring.
About two hours too long.
Honestly too many cons to bring up.
Good things about 6 Underground:
It ends.
It's fun to hear people talking about it. I hope Mark Kermode will review it.

All bad action movie stereotypes.
All dialogs are weird. Its like the writers didnt uctually think why the characters are saying what they are saying.
The characters are super weird. Not logical at all.
It's like worst Fast and Furious sequel. And i hate Fast and Furious.

reviews.review_title: Make a world a better place by killing a lot of innocent bystanders...
reviews.content: A group of odd balls coming together to rid the world of scumbags. Great action sequences with a fair amount of humor. For a group of people that wants to make the world a better place, they sure have a lot of collateral damage in the value of human lives that get killed by accident. What I don't understand is why did they cut out that lawyers eye to open his phone when they could have done it at the office and then turn off the locking feature once in, that's pretty sadistic. Lots of explosions, gas attack, and of course innocent bystanders killed they complete their target of the worlds number 1 scumbag.

This is the kind of action movie that's needed from time to time! If you like action based chases, close to perfect violent trauma and the snarky dialogue then this is the movie for you. It has just enough character development to satisfy your understanding. If you read comments and they use words like gross, confused and boring, they need to go back watching Bambi, The Little Mermaid and Frozen because those are the movies more suitable for those kind of viewers. My wife and I enjoyed this sit on the edge of your seat action film. If you like Fast and Furious with a mix of the Italian Job with a little James Bond and Mission Impossible sprinkled in, then you will highly enjoy this movie.

It is a Michael Bay movie, so I did not expect any deep story or emotional piece. But these movie was a mess. Repetitive action scene,a guy jumping from one roof to another ,It does not need to shown in three-four different shots.Editing was crap. It felt like a south indian action film at most. Too much going on the screen.

reviews.review_title: They could have made a really good movie
reviews.content:
The idea was really good! But they made it really hard to follow with too many flashbacks that do not necessarily add to the story.
And I'm still not sure I got the end of the movie when all seemed lost.
I liked how the members of the team add up in terms of skills... Though killing one of the members after 20 min or less was like... What?! What's going on? They could have made it easier.

The movie is entertaining in a lot of different ways, the action and comedy moment are fun to watch. The story has some good plot holes but overall I enjoyed it.According to my rating strategy :
Story : 0.5/2 (Okay), Task Fulfillment : 1/1, Directing, Cinematography and Soundtrack : 1/2 (Good), Cast : 1/2 (Good), Wow Factor : 0/1, Viewer : 1.5/2 (Enjoyed it)

reviews.review_title: Michael Bay back as a teenager?
reviews.content:
I'm actually a big Michael Bay fan. Even though he had some misses for sure as well. But I consider The Rock still as one of the most entertaining action flicks. Transformers (the first one) was kick-ass and I'm actually few of the people that really liked Pearl Harbor. The last Bay I've seen was 13 hours and that movie was seriously good as well.I love his typical eye-candy style. Yes, It's not very realistic, Yes, I's overdone, but men, I just love the visual aspect of his picture perfect lightning, especially in 4K.
Just like in this movie. It's all there again.What I also really enjoyed were the action scenes, especially all the SFX with the bodies. I'm sure they invested a lot of time on that SFX because they applied It to pretty much every action scene. But that's ok, since I haven't seen that much before. I
t made the movie feel more original, which It really needed, because to be honest, most of It was a mess. So I guess this is the part where the positives stop.The storytelling is messy, jumpy and actually half the time I've no idea what happened or how they got where they were. The cutscenes felt as If I went back in time 20 years, but done worse. Like a hyper teenager that still has to learn the fine details of movie making. At least, that's how It felt to me. The cuts were odd at times and just quite annoying and unnecessary.
Dialogues where horrible with very poor one-liners and the actual story was also as generic and whatever as It can be, helped by the poor storytelling.So, yes, It's kind of entertaining. I was annoyed the first 20 minutes, then, when the hyper cuts and poor one-liners stopped and there was finally some time to introduce us to the story I got into It a little more. With actually some epic action sequences that didn't fit with the otherwise quite mediocre and messy movie.So ... a 5 or a 6 is what I end up with. The action scenes and original SFX make it jump to a 6, but men ... this really Is one of Bay's worst achievements.
Continuity is aweful. The flashbacks disrupt, rather than build, the story. The acting is fine but the production is aweful.There's better ways to spend your time than this.
You have to see it! It was a great movie with the best scenes and story's sequence. It had both funny and thrilling. Not waste your time for sure. 👍👍👍

A very interesting idea for a movie. A team of 6 who are thought of as dead form their own "black ops" team. The only problem is, it was filmed poorly. It was edited in what I call the "jittery" style. Lots of jumping around, nothing smooth...there's no time to take in the moment, it's all just go go go. Think of it like Deadpool if you put it on 2x speed. My guess, they tried to cram too much into 2 hrs. My advice is, this should have been a 6 episode limited series, not a 2 hr movie.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: Don't waste your time on it. The plot is a mess. The only good scene is at the beginning of the movie, with a great car chase. This is where the 1 point i gave goes to. The rest is a continuous zero
Super effects, great actors. But, the story could be told better. When it's action-packed and you're wondering wtf am I missing, you miss another bit.
Opening car chase is a thriller ..best I have seen in forever

reviews.review_title: string adrenaline plus bad mouthing : Notices
reviews.content:
I cant understand why some directors like to play with disgusts .Here I analyze in short my notices while I watching the movie
Part1 in the fast and furious scenes : and eye is the matter of an even disgusting discussion lots of strong adrenaline scenes with unnecessary nasty wording and overwhelming stuntmen scenes and car hiking . All characters are very crazy if not paranoid
Part 2 and then : the story gets smoother but with the same nasty wording as like 'they were sailors' Wonderful action in the sky scraper
Nice emotional note with 'number who' with his mother
Part 3 in Turgistan a fictional country that resembles the real story of Turkmenistan's president Berdymukhammedov a very despotic president. This envy's dialogues are very dull cheesy and very rough to be true ( in away 'killing anyone is my business' to paraphrase the song of Mustaine) . I am really worried of the real person was so tough as him.As in result : this is 2 hour movie with a continuous and untiring action with a good story even if the plot details is terrible . Most is credited to the story and the final good result with a brave end 3/10.

reviews.review_title: Finally, a Michael Bay movie that doesn't suck
reviews.content: 6 underground is a highly entertaining movie with hilarious comedy, awesome action with beautifully bloody results, amazing acting (my favorites are Ryan Reynolds and Ben hardy), a great story with interesting themes and ideas, great visuals, and all around a fun time. The villain is the biggest flaw for being weak and generic but the movie is a great watch for a Netflix original. Plus an awesome ending line "I am one, but not done".

I feel obliged to review this movie since it had such potential. Too bad the editing/director butchered it into a collage of broken segments too short to get involved in and completely failed to create a storyline that was coherent. Impossible to get involved in any character except for a very short time, and then the scene  shifted. Too bad, since the actors were excellent and the overall storyline had such potential.

This movie is very entertaining. Ryan Reynolds plays better than in Deadpool ! I highly recommend. However, not for children under 12 cuz there is a lot of blood.. The storyline is very interesting and well done. Not the best but very original and not previsible.

One of the most expensive films by Netflix, you can tell there's no holding back with the money.About this movie there's not much new stuff, just fantasy about people who wants to do something they never got to do until they become ghosts, Reynolds is just-that-persuasive! A people person.Forget about the plot holes and the whys such as why they target that dude and fight with everything they got instead of trying a small casino first, especially on the first mission. The two things I got problem is the camera work is not good....I watched it pretty closely and there are shots that's so shaky and poorly cut that you'll easily miss some interesting elements they put in. I'm sure they can re-cut it so the action scenes would flow. The other problem is the jokes, it's not that funny at any time you watch it, there's no balance between the humour and the violence. I think they over did it.

Lens flares that cover the entire screen, random cuts, pointless dialog, poor continuity and a carbon copy of a Transformers soundtrack. The Michael Bay algorithm was in full swing here. The only thing that made it watchable was Ryan Reynolds and his delightful humor.I didn't get what the characters were about... they were happy to go hurtling through streets, bad guys in tow, causing all kinds of havoc and death without a second thought of the innocent people getting wiped out. But then in the next scene they are portrayed as these morally sound heros willing to risk it all without asking for recognition or reward.On a good note the action was fun to watch despite the mostly unbelievable choreography. I mean at one point a guy, shot and bleeding profusely, jumps over 40 feet from a bridge on to the deck of a boat, lands flat on his face, get ups as if it cured his bullet wound and keeps fighting for another 30 minutes.Anyway it was frustrating to watch but if you like stock standard action films and Ryan Reynolds you will probably enjoy this but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone I know.

I'm not a Michael Bay hater by any means, but this movie needed someone to tell him 'no' on a couple occasions. It 100% fit his all style and no substance stereotype. Lots of consistency errors too, like the blood vanishing from the doctors face and the broken/unbroken Alfa mirror. Overall, the trailer was way better than the movie.

reviews.review_title: Streaming Action, but with Michael Bay
reviews.content: It is typically a Michael Bay movie. What can I say?! The man knows how to do a beautiful sequence plan. In this particular movie, the long lasting plans made the action scenes way more interesting than they should be. Explosions and blodd baths all around the place.Despite, with a not well written script, the movie gives good characters and a cliche motivation for the military-like team. Also, the poor storyline, provides the film to be a little bit repetitive, with the everlasting car explosions and helicopter chase downs. Subsequently, one of the most valuable things of this movie is definitely the engagement of the six characters of the team, especially with "One" (Ryan Reynolds) being the leader and the one who has to deal with all the nonsense of the whole crew. All the six characters perform really well on what they are supposed to give in terms of the story. Therefore, the lack of a proper script and a continuous and concise storyline, does not provide the proper tone this kind of movie should have.Finally, in a overview the script lacks composure and efficiency. Consequently, the exaggerated and sometimes forced action brings a different experience on the new Michael Bay Netflix's movie.

Before watching the movie didn't read the name of the director (which I normally do), later after finishing the one got to know it was Michael Bay. Then everything made sense.No plots, no stories, back and forth cuts from past and present, not much of logical stitching. But fascinating action scenes, superb car chases, full adrenaline rush, typical 3D like cinematography, big noises and destructions everywhere. Doesn't sound like Michael Bay?But full number to the casts. Love Ryan Reynolds - his innocent and naughty expressions are die for. Direct from the Dealpool way of doing things. The other casts are also surprisingly good, all befitted to their respective roles. Go for it. 127 minutes of picturesque mayhem.

First off, I am, generally speaking, a Michael Bay fan. I am not one of those people who leaves a Bay film complaining that there "wasn't a plot." Unlike those people, I know what type of movie I am in for: an action/comedy thin on plot and full of mindless explosions.That being said, this just wasn't one of his best films. I felt like it was Michael Bay: Unhinged, as in, Netflix gave him 150 Million and were just like, "do whatever you want!", well, he decided to go even thinner on the plot and stuff even more explosions in. Now, this is what I was expecting in the movie, so I wasn't disappointed per se, but I do think it might have helped if a producer or a studio stepped into to at least slightly curb Bay going FULL Bay.Reynolds was still good, the cast overall was good. I thought the parkour guy was about 10 years too late to have in a movie. I thought the graphic violence was unnecessary and added nothing to the movie, in fact I think it hurt the movie.Overall, it's a decent popcorn flick that is worth watching as long as you know to expect.

reviews.review_title: Professionals that aren't even in control...except their jokes.
reviews.content: OMG...this movie (I imagine) will just be lapped up by the brainless majority of the world that enjoy overhyped rubbish like twilight, the hangover, Deadpool et all.Opening scene there's no disputing is action packed but you're left dizzy with how it's put together and edited with super close up then the super slo mo CGI moments coupled with the bad Tarantino shots that introduce the team.It's awful. You have the green Alfa that somehow managed to out run a Merc, Maserati and BMW in the tiny back streets of Florence...yeh ok. Also the expensive Mercs are in the chases but it's obvious in the crash scenes they used the peasant ville C180 ones!!! Then you have Reynolds joke after joke after sarcastic joke (a la Deadpool) and I wanted to throw my TV out the window! Sick of all this comedy in action movies now it takes away some of the Integrity. If you're in an action movie generally you're either after vengeance or you're a horrible person. You can't be a comedian too.To sum up: these are professionals yes? At no time were they in control.

Loved it. Tension, fun and action
Perfect mixture including a message.
Hate that 5s life/Death wasn't explained

reviews.review_title: Does exactly what you would expect.
reviews.content: Some of the reviewers here must have gone into this film with really peculiar expectations. This film achieves everything it sets out to.Is the plot a bit weak, sure. Is it going to win any awards, no. Is the acting at times mediocre, yes. Are large parts of it ridiculous and cliched, hell yes.But is it a fun, no brain power required, easy to watch film with some decent and over the top action sequences? In every way, yes.It achieves everything it sets out to do. Be a fun, over the top, waste of a couple of hours.

6 Underground sets the story of several agents faking their deaths to save the world from the bad guys.The script was obviously not the priority of this movie, nor character development (there are all clichéd), there are cheesy dialogues and a ton of references. There's some sort of a message about war and identity, but it only flies around. The actors surely have a lot of fun on this film.The action sequences... well this is Bay. It features car chases, explosions, slow-mo., sound design that can blow your house, and a surprising level of violence. It's enjoyable, despite the fact that it is poorly edited; we know that the film editors wanted that feeling of speed, and they use that style of editing too much, especially on the car chase sequence.6 Underground is an assumed blockbuster that never stops and a good popcorn movie that you can enjoy in your home, but don't look too much at the story.6 Underground's rating: 4.2/10

I like Ryan Reynolds movies. Even not so great movies like green lantern or X-Men Origins: Wolverine Ryan gave it his carisma and it was fun to watch.
But Michael Bay actualy succeed to ruin even Ryan carisma and movie was not funny at all. It was pointless realy badly edited messy action explosion movie.
I actualy enjoy brainless action flicks but this one something was realy off like i tried but i could not enjoy it. I mean for enjoying this film i guess you brain has to be on some far other level than mine are.

I love the movie Piranha 3D. That should give you an idea on how low my bar is. Seriously, it only takes about one funny line and 200 bucks worth of explosions and I'm around a 6/10 with a movie with zero story right out of the gate. Add one Step brothers caliber fart joke and you're at an 8. I'm basically a 5 year old in terms of movies and I gave this a 1/10. The dialog and "jokes" are so bad that they somehow ruined even a 100 million dollar effects budget and the adorable Ryan Reynolds for me. This movie made me hate Ryan Reynolds. How is that possible? Ryan Reynolds could be in the Taliban and I'd still sort of like him. Please watch Bad Boys 2 for the 300th time instead of this. You will thank me.
Usa childlish propaganda, zero suspense or story, manilupative and IQ-low dialogues, terrible humour, hyper-ADHD scene cuts, uninteresting characters.

reviews.review_title: Great fun...Lighten up people it's just a movie that's meant to entertaining , and it delivers
reviews.content:
OMG people, why so serious??
I know everybody's entitled to their opinion which is why I felt inclined to use this as my first review and share my opinion. So here it is.
To all of those who gave this movie a 1, 2 or 3 star rating you are off your rocker!
OK, First of all let's state the obvious. This is intended to be nothing more than an action flick. If I was to base my ratting of this film utilizing a scale that compared it to an acclaimed film then I would go 5. But this film doesn't want to be acclaimed, it wants to entertain!! And it did exactly that, BE ENTERTAINING. That is why I would give this film a solid 7 basing this strictly on an entertainment value rating in the action flick genre. And seriously like other reviewers stated that if the backstory, the depth of the script was a little more succinct and it flowed a little better In certain scenes then this film would be an off the charts action film.
It would seem that everyone who are in this movie are obviously brilliant, independent film makers that are so good with their craft or perhaps a self anointed intellectual film critic that is so self-revered for their " I could have done a better job than Michael Bay" opinion. And yet Michael Bay movie still make lots and lots of money which means a lot of people are going to see them. Hmmmm very interesting.
Sure the script was a little loose, and yes it was a little lacking with the storyline editing BUT HAVE YOU NOT SEEN A MICHAEL BAY FILM?? They are about leaving reality at the theater entrance door. And yes his films are hit and miss but this one, as an action film, is damn close to the bull's-eye .
Michael Bay only wants to entertain us and he achieves that In spades on 6 Underground. Ryan Reynolds is always best playing himself and in this Film it is no different. He is over the top entertaining with his tongue and cheek humor but also hits all the marks as an action star. The supporting cast was brilliantly international and solid in their roles. Yeah yeah, these are not, nor were they ever intended to be, Oscar worthy nominated roles but all of them pulled their weight and were thoroughly entertaining.Now let's talk about the action. The opening car chase scene was freaking amazing. Brilliantly edited completely unbelievable and 100% insanely entertaining, Sure there's a few mistakes, as in the opening chase sequence , watch how many times their getaway car hits things and the mirror gets ripped off and yet you get to see shots of it afterwards with the mirrors completely intact. Who gives a crap?? If you watch a film just to look at the flaws and pick it apart, how is it possible that you can even enjoy any of it?
And if that's why are you like to review films, so you can pick them apart, why the hell are you watching a Michael Bay movie?
And of course there was gun fights, explosions, and chase scenes however it was toned down from a typical "Michael Bay, Transformers-esque blow everything up in every scene" movie. Which made it entertaining enough for my wife to watch it with me, which is seriously saying something about a film like this.
And let's look at the tiny weeny fantasy message in the film. Here is a rag tag group of people who ARE NOT POLITICALLY MOTIVATED that only want to rid the world of really really bad, horrible, despicable people. Who would not want to buy into that?
One other thing that I wanted to comment on was with relation to some reviewers mentioning how many innocent people died in this film. Hellooo.... it was all CGI and it was done in a tone of dark humor. In the movie Fargo look how many people got whacked, hacked and mulched in that brilliant film and they were all innocent. And graphically mauled I might add...
All in all this was a very entertaining film. Leave your brain at the front door and hop on this bullet train of action, fun and frivolity.
And I am truly looking forward to the sequel because you can be sure there will be one.

reviews.review_title: Basically Hollywood wanting show off parkour
reviews.content: Movie is 2 hours long full of stupid slo mo and 20 min worth of parkour in some scenes. Waste of money production and you get lost! I got 90% in the movie of what the plot of the movie was: to kill dictator and give brother the throne. Like wow the first 3 minutes of the street race fight could of lasted for like 2 min and we could get the messege but good god they dragged it onnnn and onnnnnnnn! Just cut to the next scene already! Seriously~ this is just Hollywood wanting to show off parkour and kabooms that legit look cgi. Save your time and watch somthing that has maybe 8 stars.

reviews.review_title: LOVED THE MOVIE. CRITICALLY HILARIOUS TOO
reviews.content: Easily one of my favorite movies from now on. Never laughed so often in a witty, yet action packed movie. Gives you Now You See Me type plot vibe, but of course any movie involving Ryan Reynolds you'll get witty and quirky lines and that's what I absolutely love about this movie! Great plot and idea put into this movie and I'm very impressed with Michael Bay, always a great director too in my opinion.

This is what happens when you give Michael Bay unlimited unquestionable budget.There are films out there with many more gruesome killings but usually with some kind of a semblance of purpose to it, there is almost always a context. But here bystanders and pedestrians were
being killed without any reason at all.
Randomly driving over a bystander you think why did you do this? what is the purpose of this? there is no context there is no no advantage or disadvantage to this it's a complete atrocity.
I found it completely sick hideousWay over the top highly elaborate ways to kill humans.The killing in this film was being done by unnecessary enjoyment.To be honest I just thought it was senseless. I didn't care about the characters at all I didn't care if they lived or died.
They're living off the grid as ghosts but somehow they do get around very very quickly how do they get from one country to another so quickly.
Typical Michael Bay films a crappy storyline crappy dialogue all about massive explosions shiny glossy over the top cool people killing for fun.After about an hour I was bored I was hoping something interesting would happen but it didn't but I kind of dragged through it.I don't think this film has any deeper meaning.
It's just a Michael Bay film.
Don't get me wrong I do like some of Michael best films for example bad boys Armageddon The Rock even some of the transformer films that pretty good I'm good clean fun you like the heroes in those films you want them to succeed save the day you can relate to them you want to relate to them but in this film I wanted the heroes to die immediately

Truth be told this is definitely not what I would consider a great, even good movie. It is good in stone ways but bad in many ways. The casting is pretty do you send, but the story is terrible and cliche as hell. It tries to inject some comedy in the action, but it feels forced. It's a run of the mill action flick, that's it.

reviews.review_title: Epically bad from start to finish
reviews.content: This movie is the reason Hollywood gets a bad name. All the plaudits need to go to the stunt crews. Everyone else should take no positives for their movies. Ryan Reynolds playing the same trying to hard be smart, funny and sarcastic role. Major fail. This movie can be watched at double speed and still annoy you.
Crazy action sequences with cool soundtrack. The car escape scene through the art gallery while "O Fortuna" was playing in the background was pretty amazing.

reviews.review_title: This movie was to bad to watch on a 2nd screen while playing a Videogame.
reviews.content: Man the first ~15 minutes or some so utterly annoying and pretentious I only looked a few times. There was nothing funny about over the top annoying action. Every minute another stupid song you already heard 1000times. Never ending motor sounds ....I had to shut it off because after that the movie suddenly from one second to the other want to get serious because someone died. After that? WTF? No sorry not up for this.

Up until now, I have not seen a movie with Ryan Reynolds that was any good. I still haven't. This was worse than the one about servers in a restaurant. Like they said at the cemetery "I've seen enough." Nothing made sense. What a bad promise unfulfilled.

Very poorly made movie, some completely over the top scenes that just looked like they were forced into the film in an attempt to glamourize it. Failed spectacularly and the result is this disjointed mess of a movie. I've always enjoyed Ryan Reynolds but saving this movie was beyond him. The sooner forgotten about the better

reviews.review_title: I don't mind a Michael bay film but. .
reviews.content: I really wanted this movie to be decent. But the amount of suspension of disbelief required to watch it was to much. Also confusing editing. The acting seemed flat too. But it was worth a watch and i dpubt i will watch it again though

If you are into "author" movies, move on, nothing to see here. I discovered this one by pure accident on NETFLIX. I enjoyed every minute of it, it's well orchestrated, well played, has a great soundtrack, some cool one-liners. Sometimes, one just needs the pursuits, the gunfights, the girls, the good boys vs. The bad boys, some gruesome deaths, and that's pretty it. No need to write a super-scientific abstract about it.

Like Bugs Bunny and other similar cartoons everything is over the top. The crashes, the explosions, the car chases, the characters and the script.
But thats what makes this a good film.
Pure no nonsense escapism.
Sit back and enjoy.

reviews.review_title: Stupid and confusing mess created by Bay making love to himself
reviews.content:
This is an immense ode of Bay to Bay's style. An homage to himself, a big creative ejaculation on a cup given to the viewer. This is porn. A nonsense, disconnected and, sometimes, seemingly random succession of shots in a crazy montage without any storyline. All and each one shot is just a sample of the Bay style, a moment of Bay self-pleasure: high color saturation, car chases, explosions, airplanes and helicopters, more explosions, shots at slow motion, epic backlighting scenes of guys walking to a plane, or from something bathed in sunset light, nice sky shots, hot girls in underwear, more hot girls, schematic script with easy jokes and plain characters, more colorful car chases, blood, and an overall techno video-clip rhythm and stylism. Don't get me wrong, I am fine with all that. If I sit my arse on a Friday night, and play that movie in a relaxing netflixing night, I am totally aware of what it is.
The problem is that the movie is a nonsense. The messy montage, the lack of storyline and the uninteresting characters makes the entire movie hard to watch; in spite of the music, one-liners, gunfights, executions, blood and all sorts of vehicles at high speed, the movie is boring. And this is, precisely, the worst sin of a flick of this type: to be boring.

Already in the first 10 minutes I was like: Is this a joke? The car gets hit by a truck and the left rear-view mirror breaks off. 2 seconds later: no damage, mirror is back on. This is such a big obvious fail you don't need to be a movie expert to see how bad the editing is.

reviews.review_title: An action movie that doesnt let you appreciate action
reviews.content: If you're making an action movie you should make sure you shoot in such a way that people can appreciate action sequences but Michael bay chose to make it jarring to watch. Fast cuts, all close up action sequences gave me headache. The movie has razor thin plot understandably cuz its a Michael Bay film none of the characters were memorable nor were any action sequences. Everything was shot in close up it felt like im watching a zoomed in movie. Ugh total waste of time. Total waste of money by Netflix. Skip it dont watch it.

Absolutely awesome movie! Don't ever listen to the critics they judge way too hard. If you're looking for a movie full of action and original scenes you've never seen before, this is definetly the film for you. So good!! 10\10

It's a Michael Bay film. There's a sky-high body count, jaw-dropping settings and effects, product placement galore and a clear line between who's the good and bad guys.
It also has Ryan Reynolds and some other very likeable, and perfect looking people playing spy/assassin/thieves from central casting. Other than processing the high octane action and suspending an incredible amount of disbelief, this is the least work your brain will ever have to do while watching a film.
It's brilliant and awful. It reinforces a dangerous idea that so long as you're 'right', you can kick off a fight however you want with impunity and utter disregard for any other point of view. The only people who have emotional consequences are the 'good' guys (the soaring emotions of their back and front stories are tears-in-your eyes stuff, but presumably the several hundred bad guys they've just slain didn't have adorable kids, or cute puppies or loving grannies). The final scenes are gratuitous, depicting middle Easterners as barbarians, and the 'good' guys as judge, jury and executioner in the most base way possible.
I know people think that reading too much into a Michael Bay movie is a fool's errand, but if you've ever looked at a road-rager smashing the windows of a car owned by a complete stranger who's just ticked them off a bit, you've also seen a Michael Bay film.
It's an astonishing film, but in terms of a watching diet, it's empty calories.

reviews.review_title: More nausea inducing garbage from Bay
reviews.content: We watched 15 minutes and bounced. Dialogue is horrible, the cuts could cause seizures and the lense flare would make JJ Abrams jealous. Don't bother with this one unless you're using it to torture captives and even that may violate the Geneva Convention.
It is surprising that a movie with so much action could be unbearably boring, but this movie managed to do it. Constant action and quick edits made this nothing more than white noise.
What a steaming pile of dog crap. This movie is to awful to leave a review.

reviews.review_title: Rythym level: shoes in the dryer
reviews.content: If you've ever been to a large music festival where 2 dubstep dj's are in playing on opposing stages, thus movie is like the part when you are walking away from the main stage only to arrive halfway to the next stage and realize that DJ is also playing dubstep and both rhythms are completely off. Completely and utterly jarring. I wish I could watch it for more than 10 minutes because the action is exciting and thrilling but the cuts are so brutal that for me its completely unwatchable... Not just the opening scene either it continues after the chase taking even slower parts in the movie and dicing up the shots for this artificial pacing disconnected from the actual scene.

reviews.review_title: My expectations were low... but... this was something else
reviews.content:
Firstly, we gave this movie a chance due to the seemingly high rating in IMDB. Oh boy were we in for a treat...I don't want to sacrifice any more time on this title - i already spent two hours on this joke. But here are some short remarks.Firstly, i like action movies and i have nothing against Bay or Reynolds. That said, everything was just so off - embarrasing to be honest. The plot was not only generic but also very inconsistent. The movie is full with incredibly blatant incositencies; like the cars being smashed and in the next scene no scratches or anything. In one scene they're fighting on the deck of a yacht in broad daylight. The fighting continues in a new frame but suddenly it's dark outside??
The fight- and chace sceenes were just ridicilous. The Jokes were so forced and cringy that i felt really bad for Ryan.Easily one of the worst action movies i have seen in my life (and i have seen the likes of Megalodon..).If you like bad movies then sure, watch it! If not, Don't bother watching this. Complete and utter waste of time.

I was hoping this would be like a Transformers 1 or 13 hours kind of Michael bay film which I love but it's sadly not. Incoherent, no real characters. But the cast was great however and some action sequences are fun so 🤷‍♂️.

Hey People!This is not a Wes Anderson movie, did you know that? This a Michael Bay showreel about awesome stuntwork! Please handle it right and put it where it belong. A classic action movie in the 21st century. Lay back and enjoy the incredible show.Hi5 for the stunt theam, this was an incredible job guys!

Terrible got 20-30 mins turned it off shots jumping around every 1-5 to seconds. It's like a child is filming started fill dizzy. The editing was awful felt chopped up. Action had little sense. Just awful

I can't fathom how can Michael Bay, the person who brought The Transformers franchise to life on the big screen (guilty for loving those movies btw, most of them at least) have made such an inconsistent mess.
The tone varies from light hearted action to violent and morally divisive choise making and certain scenes are way over the top while others are deep into reality. Even the actors, Ryan Raynolds and Melanie Laurent, seriously? It's like melting Deadpool and Inglorious Bastards together, two tonally very different movies.
Music is off most of the times and plot gets messy toward the end. Some characters are introduced while others completely forgotten/ignored/overly mysterious. Plenty of action though and even bigger body count (in many nasty ways to go;).Overall not a bad movie to spend the evening, but should've chosen a path and sticked to it.

reviews.review_title: Great creative viewpoints in action scenes, fantastic music
reviews.content: Great creative viewpoints in action scenes, fantastic music. This was a really well balanced show, lots of action, a really long car chase it was inventive and fresh. Funny comments, funny characters, great looking girls, such a good watch.

Story was all over the place and hard to follow at times. Very confusing to follow. I love Ryan Reynolds but he wasn't enough to save this film. If you just want lots of action, blood, guts and gore, then this is the movie for you.

Sure, I expected some comedy and full-blown action. But damn, the action was good. Of course, it's Michael Bay... the bad: weird editing, short glimpses of action interleaved one after the other, weird time-jumps. The story is simple so there's nothing to be confused about but it's still weird editing.The good: explosions, car chases, gory deaths, technology, Ryan Reynolds.I usually get bored at action movies because everything feels cliche but in this case, the action was enjoyable in itself and Ryan Reynolds screaming a bunch of crap did help to keep my attention on the screen.Just don't expect an Oscar-worthy story and everything will be well.

This movie have no storyline and understandable plot with confusing cuts and strange character connections.finally mixed up action scences.
Dont waste your time.

This is a great movie critiquing various governments' ineptitude to enact positive change in the world. It is a bit of a pipe dream to believe it could happen, but this is a good story of how it might come about.

reviews.review_title: Unfortunately I can't say I'm impressed.
reviews.content: First case lasted for 20 minutes, it could have lasted two and was more than enough.I failed to care about the characters and It seems they forced the R rating. unnecessary bloody scenes that had no meaning at all.I was looking forward to love this movie, unfortunately there was absolutely nothing that could help that case.Also, I really was looking to see the villain ( star actor in Fauda) to have more meaning, but it was just bad guy for no reason at all.5/10 in my Opinion, it's fine if you have nothing else to watch on a Saturday morning.

Whatever happened to plot and interesting characters? Surely not found in this expensively boring movie. So much effort and money for so little payoff. Makes no sense whatsoever. Lack of continuity with the main characters driving in Florence, then Siena, then Florence. A shameful waste of time, money, scenery and once respected actors. Take the money and run has become all too common. Depressing all around.

If you payed any attention to Michael Bay's career up until now you'd know that he continues to have very little subtlety and making modest pictures was never his intention. Netflix also has a noteriety of producing loads and loads of garbage while masking it as something different. So combining the two makes sense, right? It does and it doesn't and having one of the first things you see (followed by slow motion airplane stunts) is the Red Bull logo you know 2 things immediately: 1, this movie is most likely made for teenagers and 2, this movie will be a glorious waste of money while at the same time making more money than is appropriate for something never planned for anything more than mediocre. I will stand by my first statement, as unpopular as it is, because as teenagers we have our lowest tolerance for anything decent so this movie in all it's excess plays exactly to the kind of child-like anger that fills all of us...plus our need to watch stuff explode over and over and over again. And then just about every 2 minutes comes a new product placement. It's crazy, really, because despite being crammed expensive product down our throats one after another it ends up feeling very cheap, very empty, almost like a 125 minutes commercial: cars, beers, clothes, mega-conglomerates of all kinds it goes on and on! Despite all these issues I wanted to hate the movie but Michael Bay has always been a very entertaining director capable of pushing around piles of large money while not making us feel hateful of the waste but instead entertained. Ryan Reynolds is also very charming and fun to watch, the locations are great, and the stunts and special effects seem impossible. The comedy is there as a way to make it easily digestible and seem familiar, although I laughed out loud at maybe only two or three character reactions. So this movie is fun, not great, but it is the true definition of a "movie" a mindless spectacle that should make you smile if you are still human, all other haters must just be very bitter they did not make any money off this transaction themselves. Netflix, once again, appears to be more in the money side of entertainment so it's questionable whether to even really consider them a production company or not but here they made good on their rights to buy this one and show it to us like the good times we deserve.

reviews.review_title: Ryan Reynolds is so good in every role he plays
reviews.content: When I first saw this I thought it would to much of a futuristic film ; but when I watched it yesterday I realised that ofcourse it's a good movie , Ryan Reynolds is in it and FIVE Adria arjona is so gorgeous. She's so hot she makes me wanna Bust. And Micheal bay what a fkin movie COREY HAWKINS as 7 is awesome , WHAT A MOVIE WHAT A TEAM.
If you like cheese and advertisement you would like this for sure.

Certainly the Michael Bay-est of all Michael Bay films. The "man movie" of 2019 perhaps. Over-sexualized, bloody, and riddled with plot holes. One thing it wasn't: boring. Maybe it's Netflix culture, but the movie dares you not to look away. Something happens in nearly every frame. Reynolds is basically Deadpool out of costume, which I guess is just Ryan Reynolds. The cast is a little confusing, and I don't understand a lot. The movie itself is morally ambiguous, but no one seems to care. It's action packed and hard to lose focus.
It's been a long time I didn't watch that stupid movie. Financing this is a waste, watching even a bigger waste. Sorry to say but I made that mistake.

Six Underground tells the story of six individuals (Reynolds, Laurent, Garcia-Rulfo, Hardy, Arjona and Hawkins) who form a vigilante squad in order to take down some of the world's most corrupt individuals. After a problematic mission in Florence, they do obtain the whereabouts of the dictator of Turgistan (Raz) in order to replace him with his imprisoned brother (Maadi) who is an outspoken critic of the dictator who would likely lead the sovereign nation as a democracy.I was intrigued by the premise of this movie, it is very similar to that of Suicide Squad, Rogue One and the first Guardians of the Galaxy except in a real-life setting. However it does fall into some of the pratfalls of these movies, for example, very thin characterization of its heroes and villains.
