It does make clear who is who and what their basic morality and skill sets are, however that is basically all they are given, the rest of the character is their abiding by the rules mentality, endless amount of pop culture references and maybe some relationship drama. No one in this movie really has a character arc, which is a little problematic because their movie has set up plot threads in the squad's personal lives, and it just seemed like the mission was the main story. The team needed to move on from their lives by dying and leaving all their personal problems in the past, and the movie couldn't even do that correctly. And this drama does not even really factor into the main plot in a way that is relevant. This is where they could have really used the Guardians of the Galaxy style of character building: a group of strangers who are generally incompatible set aside their differences for the good of the nation, however it ends up copying Rogue One and Suicide Squad.Due to its rapid character introduction, the scattershot plot structure and shaky camerawork in its action sequences, it is exhausting to keep track of everything in this movie. Don't get me wrong the set pieces and action sequences when does right are phenomenal, however the trailer does give away the best moments in the movie. There are some really cool set pieces, particularly one on a boat, one on the Duomo and the crane sequence, however they are almost all given away by the trailer and the ones that aren't are shrouded by so much shaky camerawork that it is difficult to tell who is fighting who or who is winning. The parkour scenes are definitely the best filmed and the first car chase in this movie probably looked really cool on a storyboard however a director that cares about fluidity would have made it more engaging by just keeping the camera in focus or by not cutting every two seconds. The film is directed by Michael Bay, and if I didn't know that I would have guessed in about ten minutes.This is really is the movie that will be most associated with Michael Bay. It has all of his signature styles cranked up to eleven. Anything that has been associated with him: explosions, lens flares, military and helicopters, low angles, product placement, bass drops, strobe light effects etc. are all on display, and fans of him will love this movie because of that. People who has a thirst for action will also get a kick out of it as this set piece after set piece of violence with occasional breaks for talking. So if you have run out of Fast and Furious movies or wished the Mission Impossible movies were simpler in their story, this is for you. However a much more satisfying experience, at least for me is to just watch the trailer.
I have no idea what just happened. This was the most horrible movie I've ever watched. WHAT THE F!?!? I seriously feel dumber than when I turned it on.

And along the way they're gonna learn something about inclusivity and find the family they've always wanted. reviews.review_title: Another one of those senseless Netflix action movies
reviews.content: I'm really not sure who likes movies like this. Terrible plot, editing, just waste of your time. Unless you are not valuing your time much.

It begins with a 10 minute action scene. You have no clue of what is happening but you're curious either way. They try to explain with really short flashback scenes and it just wasn't interesting. The comedy is forced by every actor in this movie, including Reynolds who is one of the most hilarious actors in the business but was not funny at all in this movie. The action scenes are really cool. The most Michael Bay movie ever. But it looked like a 2 hour meme movie with terrible memes.

With Michael Bay, you almost definitely know what to expect going into this film. Does it have unnecessary car chases, explosions and objectification of women throughout? Oh yes. And with his dream of a 15 rating and the budget he needed, Bay created something that could be considered entertaining. Could.The second half of the film feels like a solid spy film to throw on in the background and fulfil your boredom for an hour. It isn't offensive to me and has some decent action. However, as you can guess, the first half is quite the opposite. In fact there is no story in the first half, it's mere scatters of introductions and action sequences squished together. How can a film take an hour to establish six characters? In fact how do they manage to mess that up too? They spend so much time slowing down the film for three of the characters, that the rest are all left suffering from the audience not caring enough about them. Bay clearly didn't know which direction he'd like to go and in doing so did all of them, but didn't even finish said directions. For example, as we progress through the second half hour, numbers independently transition on screen to show so-called backstory for these characters. But after 3 they simply forget that this structure existed and threw it out the rest of the film.I should discuss the characters too, as in any ensemble film, they should be the heart of the film. But this film misses the mark here too, due to what I mentioned earlier where they simply passed over half the cast and hope you catch to on their characters. One (Ryan Reynolds) is the well established character who's known as "The Billionaire." Despite this, they seem to only use this for quippy dialogue and plot convenience. He would be much better suited as "The Leader" or a name more related to his expertise of technology, that served as a much more interesting character trait other than being typical Ryan Reynolds. He only seems to be driven by one motivation to save the world and when bringing in the idea of him leaving his family, you'd imagine this would be an inner conflict we'd see develop and or at least be showcased? Not at all, instead he just visits his son as the end and runs off for a sequel I suppose. I don't think it matters about the other characters, they're all just given irrelevant subplots that mean nothing to us. Five suffers the most from this because I don't think she's given anything to work with, instead of being The Doctor, she's just The Woman. Classic Bay.I'm getting exhausted just thinking about this film any longer so to conclude, I believe this film suffers from poor editing and direction, especially from the first hour holding back the potential of the story showcased following this. The pacing and dialogue also fell flat, and characters existing more as objects than personality. Despite all of this, the film has some very good action sequences, the cast clearly give it their all and the soundtrack keeps you in the film. I hope the rumoured sequel does not suffer its predecessor's fate.

reviews.review_title: Just a little helpful movie knowledge
reviews.content: I read so many trivia and reviews that police cars are the wrong color for the location. This isn't a mistake, it's intentional to avoid confusion. It can create a tremendous legal liability issue if legitimate local police cars are used, as those who require emergency assistance have been known to approach actors and stunt drivers in police cars that are identical to local law enforcement vehicles. "Sorry, I'd love to stop the man from shooting at you, but I'm not a police officer!"

I said the movie is action and it does it perfectly

reviews.review_title: I'm just going to say it....
reviews.content: I enjoy Michael Bay movies. He is the king of spectacle. The dude knows action. I have enjoyed all of his movies (except for Transformers: The Last Knight), and I have no shame in that. He delivers what movies once were for people; escapism. Are they cinematic masterpieces? HELL NO. Are they a mindless kick-ass ride? HELL YES!That said, I actually think 6 Underground is one of his better movies in terms of storytelling, yet ironically it is one of my least favorite in terms of the way it was scripted/ formatted.The nonlinear narrative worked well for Deadpool, but I feel it was a disservice to this film. I know it's the same screenwriters with RR, so it makes sense they would try that route again, but it really hurt the flow of the film. Too much. Take any screenwriting class and they warn you about using too many flashbacks or nonlinear narrative. Is that a rule? Of course not, but when it works, it can really work. When it doesn't, epic fail. That's what this felt like to me. It was bordering on tedious, especially when you're "all caught up", but then you aren't really as they insert more flashbacks.The second-half of the movie was handled deftly and I was more engaged are the story became linear, barring a few quick flashbacks. I feel it would have been a much more solid film if it followed the linear path from the beginning, peppering in a few flashbacks here and there.It was still enjoyable because of the Bayhem, but I would have scored it higher if not for the way the story was told. Just my two cents.Love, Peace, and Bananas.

reviews.review_title: Got to be one of the best movie starts......
reviews.content: Puts a nice twist on this type of action movie even if there's a bit of CGI what movie now a days doesn't. But CGI adds to the great stunt work. Great one liners. Cinematography is great.

I didn't make it very far into the movie. It's completely incoherent. It's way over edited. I had a friend tell me it was terrible before I watched it but even with that warning and these reviews on here I couldn't have imagined it would be that bad. Don't even try.

reviews.review_title: Great visual effects lacking an interesting story
reviews.content: This movie starts off great, the first 5 minutes make you think something great is coming, but then you are presented with random fragments of action largely lacking story/relevance and stunning scenes that flash by while you are in fact thinking about something else, maybe your work projects, private family matters, or simlar.Incredibly disappointing, and while the extremely high-end effects makes you want to up the review score, reality comes into play - any movie that fails to keep the viewer focused on the screen is garbage.
It just like if I was there with them I really love the idea of the movie... New idea in in very different and wonderful way.... I love it
This movie the best in a last 5 year for me. Very intense, and with Ryan Reynolds good jokes around. The whole movie was amazing and I will watch again..and again.

A movie that will appeal to the sophomoric folks that are unfamiliar with good movies. I get it. Some people think cgi, explosions, and absurd battles are entertaining. I appreciate a bit more of a story, some character development, and if there's action, bring in an actual sense of danger. When it becomes cartoonish it's just silly.

This is a film you feel you should follow the reviews but the more you watch it the more you start to think it's a re-watchable fun fest. Technically it's the most content filled frame by frame action you will have seen since transformers. The boat scene is exceptionally good which reminds me of Jackie chains armour of god 2.

reviews.review_title: Good action movie but falls a bit short.
reviews.content: Continuity issues aside this film isn't too bad. The acting is good and the idea is a brilliant one. The action sequences are exactly what you would expect from a Michael Bay movie. Some action scenes are hard to keep up with what the fudge is going on. The film tries too hard to be funny and tries to be humorous like deadpool but falls short. Overall if you like good action and a goodish story line this is worth a watch. Enjoy it for what it is and try to ignore the continuity issues (which I won't talk about because of spoilers.)

reviews.review_title: A movie stuck in 2005, made for teenage boys
reviews.content: This was one of the worst movies I have seen this year. Michael Bay at his worst. Over the top action, apalling quips and jokes, horrible editing, no plot. I can see why this was picked up by Netflix, and didn't get a theatrical release.

reviews.review_title: I had way to much fun with this
reviews.content: This movie doesn't need a plot, a story, or characters to care about. This is just action for the sake of action. Seriously though, watch it, but don't look for a story. Watch it knowing its full of blood, guts, guns and death. Grab some snacks, get some beer, and enjoy this fun action film.

The plot was really stupid and cliche. Might as well have been a fast and furious film. There were some good kills in this movie though, which shows that Michael Bay should do more r-rated films. Maybe try a little harder to make something original though next time, Michael.
All those effects, explosions and slow motions and no sense. So many back and forth with no meaning like there is no scenario. It's not like a movie, it's more like a complition of YoutTube video

reviews.review_title: The worst film I've laid my eyes upon
reviews.content: I'm giving it a 1 because they made sure you couldn't rate it a 0. No continuity, no real plot, soundtrack didn't fit the script whatsoever and some very cringeworthy ideas.Not sure why it deserves more than a 1.

reviews.review_title: Based on the reviews didn't expect much, but I actually enjoyed it. Bit of Deadpool/Hitman's Bodyguard stytle.
reviews.content: If you like Deadpool and/or Hitman's Bodyguard you will like this one too probably. The ratings at first made me think it would be a mediocre film, but it is actually really enjoyable as look as you look to the film with 'action comedy' glasses at it instead of 'serious action movie' glasses.
The-Fast-Six + The Horror Of "Storror" + The Ninja Assassin accompanied by the Fruit-Ninja. Worth one time watch!

Let's face it ... Bay has the best eye for the lens every frame looks amazing yet , he knows exactly where to put the camera and the action is REAL ! It's the Seven samurai meets Robin Hood meets oceans 11 and this is what you watch and eat popcorn with ..Have some fun it's about time a movie was fresh and took chances and had every character fleshed out.
If the first 20 mins don't get you then I dunno what will Enjoy !
I disliked this film because the way it is filmed. This way made me headache and I cant stand continuing watching it.
I find that most Netflix original movies fall short but this one is tons of fun. Over the top stunts, good characters, I really liked it. Take it at face value and have a great time.

If you love car chases, shoot-outs, and high body counts, then this is the movie for you. And it just so happens that I do love those things, so I guess this is the movie for me. How can you not love a movie that pretty much kills off the entire population of Italy in the first ten minutes? Plus, the script is funny and Ryan Reynolds is great.

Cliché action movie, overdone and unrealistic as most action movies are nowadays. The story is also cliché: a bunch of outlawed Americans save a country from an evil dictator. The opening car chase in Italy is good but overdone and takes too long... after a while I realized this movie was not worth watching even though I like Ryan Reynolds. The movie makers invented the bad country. The country they named in the movie does not exist in real life - Turgistan. But, it's a clear analogy of one of the 5 stan countries (minus Afghanistan and Pakistan) - Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan. All in all, you will not miss anything if you don't watch this movie.
150.000.000 dollar budget and they didn't spend a single dollar on a storyline or script. Just over two hours of bad acting and explosions. Don't waste your time watching this.
Whoever wrote this movie is a genius! Action comedy. You never know what's coming next!

reviews.review_title: Haven't Enjoyed an Action Movie Like This in a While
reviews.content:
I'm really surprised by the low score and negative review!
It's engaging, funny, stunts are great, the story is good and the cast is solid.
I enjoyed every minute of it.

TURGISTAN = TURKEY ?????????
nonsensical a film. Enough of Islamism.
Not all islamic countries are as you know.
abandon prejudice pleace.
Visiting the turkey and making the analogy of recognition.

Amazing cast, manageable humour, "entertaining" action and the perfect time "killer". Regardless, 6 Underground is what happens when talent meets money and a high level of "disregard". Disregard for how "anything" works, that it almost drifts into the realm of pointless. The dialogue is "so below average", the "romance" is "forced" and the logic (like Hobbs and Shaw) is like air, it's there... But can't be seen.

reviews.review_title: Lots of fun, hoping for a trilogy at least
reviews.content: This movie is getting lots of bad reviews from film critics and it's just not fair. If your in the mood for phantom of the opera you don't go see an action flick. Odds are if your watching a Michael Bay film, you like his films and expect a fast paced shoot-em-up explosion packed brake from reality. 6 underground absolutely delivers with the bonus of Ryan Reynolds' sense of humor. I say if you like action movies you will love it. Sure it won't ever be considered a classic, but that's not what these types of movies are about, it's raw adrenaline with guns, explosions and cars flying through the air with a mildly compelling storyline, a touch of romance and a hint of comradary. Bottom line, I like action movies and I really enjoyed this one and I'm gonna be waiting anxiously for a sequel.Way to go everybody who worked on 6 Undergound ! Loved it and hope there's more to come.

The plot is written by a 6 year old kid who played too much GTA. I watched the first 15 minutes and started thinking "Did Michael Bay direct this?". Apparently I was right. A film directed towards 12 year olds with an unnecessary scenario and forced action scenes.
Hooked from the opening of the film. Loved the way the team clicked perfectly. Plenty of action and always a few lines to make ya laugh. Love this so much. Hope we get more 6 underground.

It's absurd. A billionaire that wants to help the world by gathering insanely attractive people, that also all happen to be weapons/combat experts, to help the world by sloppily killing bad guys. Michael Bay movies have convinced me the man has never popped the hood of an engine or lit a fire in his life, considering everything in the movie blows up to city leveling degrees. (Billionaire wants to save world by taking out bad guys, sooooo those buildings gotta go) I don't know how long the movie was, because I blacked out during the slow motion walk scenes and plan explanation montages. What I'm trying to say is, the movie was long and bad. It's filled with cheesy one liners and product placement like you wouldn't believe. I've never wanted to drive a Ford F-150 while wearing RayBans more in my life. If you can make it to the end...keep a watchful eye out for the parkour kid's boots as he's walking. Then get ready to lose all faith in the film industry.

It's very rare that I cannot finish a movie once started but I just couldn't make it through this incoherent mess with over-the-top action sequences and endless time jumps. Another live action cartoon from Michael Bay with people walking away from disasters that would kill us ordinary folk. Utter nonsense with no redeeming dramatic value.
What a terrible waste of time ..and money....they should give it to the orphans

Keep in mind this a Netflix movie! It was pretty great watching it.
Similar in the production with, "Triple Frontier," on the budget but it is pretty awesome watching Netflix evolve in movies. Give and take, Ryan Reynolds plays the same character with his personality but it was cool to see him take off the Deadpool mask to play another character. Overall good storyline to the movie!

It's Michael Bay. You know what you're getting.
Reynolds is his same old charming, charismatic, and funny self. He is supported by a mostly great cast in this movie.
Story is decent, but the action is aplenty.
🎬

Directors should attempt to make the action scenes at least a TINY bit believable. If you want to mind numbingly waste a couple hours of your life, then go ahead and watch this utter piece of garbage. How this garners a 6.7 is a sad testament to the taste of some people.

Love Ryan Reynolds, but dear God this is a mess. I know it's Michael Bay, but the guy isn't even trying to have any sort of a plot here. It jumps from one frantic action sequence / set piece to the next without any semblance of logic or reason. Makes Transformers look good by comparison and those were terrible. Really wonder how M.B. gets funding for his films when they suck this bad,

reviews.review_title: Ryan is Deadpool without the costume
reviews.content:
Good idea for a movie, liked the idea of 6 ghosts, good car chase scenes, nice looking ladies as always, brilliant city visuals, and the hotel suite wow.
Ryan as always gives us a bit of humor to snap us out of the violence, and sarcasm to gain a chuckle.
It's a decent movie from Netflix I was pleasantly surprised.
I liked this better than the Irishman

Not worthy of a long review. Lots of potential, a nice starting action scene, but the rest just didn't make sense. No flow from scene to scene, a laughably bad script, and Ryan Reynolds just being Ryan Reynolds (please play someone else for once).Michael Bay has to be the one to blame here though. It seems like he just tries to cover up his inability to direct with random explosions, slow motion dives and completely unnecessary gore/shock tactics.The film had such a huge budget - it's a crying shame it was given the Michael Bay to burn.

I love action movies, but this was definitely the worst action movie I have ever seen. Story line has no meaning and the characters are so empty. I am so angry at every piece of this movie that I logged in imdb and wrote a review. I don't do that.

If you like Michael Bay movies This is great. Good story and actors.
I Hope the story Will continue:)

It is so bad that I couldn't watch for more than 20 minutes. All the scenes are so much exaggerated without any plausible reason, the screenplay is terrible with a nonsense timeline running in parallel while a crazy guy is doing drift to catch your attention... And I can't forget to mention the tipical yellow cinematography that you will see in Micheal Bay's.

Really enjoyed this movie, very nice action shots with kind of deadpoollish sense of humor.
The plot is not so elaborate but holds

Michael Bay please stop making movies. This was a total wreck from the start. Your directing is horrible and incoherent. Can you please leave the camera still for more than 2 seconds?
If it wasn't for Ryan Reynolds I wouldn't have even tried watching this. I would give it 0 stars but IMDb won't let me. 👎👎

reviews.review_title: Like Deadpool but not that funny
reviews.content: First minutes are pretty ok and I got hooked with the movie.... the rest of it to forget. It starts with some black-humor as Deadpool but it failed to make it an interesting movie.

Seventeen minutes in and still in the first scene which is a ridiculous car chase that never ends. It has already shown to be void of anything other than crashes and explosions. SEVENTEEN MINUTES!!! Turned it off and am going to watch something with an IQ higher than a jellyfish.
Michael Bay is the problem with Hollywood
Is there a public for movies as stupid as this one. I have difficulties to understand how M. Laurent can play in such a braindead movie.

From the time I watched the first trailer for 6 Underground I wanted to like it. But having watched it I cannot say the movie lived up to the trailer. All credit to the stunt teams, FX crew but after you take the set pieces out of this movie it drags it's feet. Reynolds is almost playing himself the main female lead tries with a very poor script to keep herself looking interested in what's happening around her. Other cast members just go through there paces. All in 6 Underground is a typical Micheal Bay movie a lot of bang for his buck.
No story, full of continuity mistakes and poor acting. I had higher hopes. Waste of 2 hours of my life.

reviews.review_title: Ignore The idiots giving bad reviews!
reviews.content: It's a great movie in spite of the bad reviews. I think the the movie is so fast pace some people's simple minds just can't keep up.The plot is great, the action is great, the editing is great...I personally am ready to see the remaining bad guys on the wall taken out!BRING ON THE NEXT 9!

reviews.review_title: Not sure where the +6 rating came from
reviews.content:
This wasted two hours of my life that I will never get back... will not dwell on my views on the film so I don't waste more time.
This movie doesn't even step up to a No Plot Good Action movie criteria.. just a puzzle of swift scenes that spouls your enjoyment.. I still like Ryan Reynolds and M. Bay despite of this mistake they made by hurting my eyes and ears with the scenes and noise in the movie..The only truth is that it is Under the ground of movie making!!
Such a great action packed show the whole movie. The cast are great together and they make it funny. Netflix movies are great you really can watch a great movie at home!!
It's not even worthy of my time typing this sentence.

Title speaks for itself.Movie didn't pull me in.
Not worth watching.

Continuity? What's that? If you ever watch it, note the wingmirrors on that hideous green car in the first 10 mins of the film. They're there, then they're not. Then they're there again. Then gone again. There, gone. There, gone. And the film just goes downhill from there. A real pity, as the idea and plot were actually quite interesting, and in the hands of a competent director it could have been a good film.

reviews.review_title: Big budget, lots of explosions and banter: A very good Bay, indeed!
reviews.content: If you like Michael Bay, you know what to expect. Lots of action and eye popping stunts.

Simply exciting. Funny.
And definitely worth your time.Watch and thank me later...

reviews.review_title: Makes no sense reynolds is annoying
reviews.content: Story makes no sense and characters aren't great but the action is pretty crazy a fun watch, but I don't like Ryan Reynolds. starts off stronger than it ends

The movie starts with a car chasing in Florence, than the movie cut is mixed up with parts of Siena, another city 50km from florence, and insult to both cities and to the italian culture. This summarises how bad is this movie.

reviews.review_title: What to say-Bay's directing and weird jokes from Deadpool
reviews.content: So forget the story and forget about following what is happening because, THE MOVIE will make it hard for you, trust me. The saddest part is that this movie doesn't pretend to be more than it is and if done a little bit better could be a really nice action movie to watch but this isn't a perfect world. The problem is that the movie keeps a certain awareness level so you need to stay and watch every minute but once you've watched it, you'll be so confused on what happened because it is basically an action movie plain and simple but its made like a puzzle you need to solve. Again, trust me. I'm writing this review right as I've watched the movie and I can't make anything out of it. So if you're a fan of the director or cast - watch it but if you want some easy going movie - DON'T!

reviews.review_title: I need more cowbell.... I meant Ryan Reynolds (not enough Ryan Reynolds!)
reviews.content: I think NETFLIX should have stuck with original title "Ryan Reynolds; THE MOVIE!", it begs the question if one can have just too much Ryan Reynolds and still be entertaining and I know what you are thinking; the Deadpool series has an uncomfortable amount of Ryan Reynolds yet somehow manages to remain entertaining... this film has even more.You see the geniuses over at FOX studios have figured out a way to pepper their movies with just enough away time from Ryan on the screen so you can collect your thoughts and get reinvested in the movie, well NETFLIX doesn't play your rules maaannnnn and if they want all of the Reynolds lines to be jokey than so be it. My guess is that they thought Ryan Reynolds was Dane Cook and I could see how they could get them confused but even Cook couldn't make EVERYTHING funny.How could they squeeze more entertainment into only one film.... who better to explain all the plot points than Morgan Freeman unless of course you have Ryan Reynolds cast; actually I've only watched the first 45 minutes (needed a break) so Freeman could be in the movie I guess. I was going to do a Tom Cruise comparison about screen time but I've run out of steam, watch the movie and good luck.
Some scenes were filmed in Abu Dhabi UAE as "Dagistan" but in one scene they totally forgot to replace UAE flags above the houses. Time: -31:52 to end.

reviews.review_title: Who thought it was a good idea?
reviews.content: Pure action, dead bodies, inconsistencies... poor casting and storytelling, seriously who thought Reynolds fit the play? Hollywood you can do better!!! It took me three times to finish watching this movie.
Where to begin... The movie had potential, the cast is really good, but the movie itself is just a pastiche of things that might look cool. It's like Suicide Squad meets Deadpool.

I think people are sooo jaded with their snarky reviews. Complaining about it being "typical Michael Bay" is like saying Meryl Streep is only about accents or Peter Jackson is only good in Middle Earth. The truth is that these guys are EXCELLENT move makers. Let them do what they excel at doing.I thoroughly enjoyed the action, special effects, relationships and yes, CGI. Particularly liked the old throwback TV/movie/music references and laughed out loud at the Aviation Gin. For the complainers, exactly how much "substance" can you get in a 2 hour movie? I liked this movie far more than I was prepared to and I truly hope this is made into a series of films with the overthrow of endless bad guys. Stop thinking you all are armchair Siskel & Eberts and just enjoy the ride.

I gave this movie a 6 as some of the crash sequences were pretty awesome and unique. Apart from that, there were many flaws and reasons for annoyance in a movie with $150m budget. I'll just mention the disappearing/reappearing hat in the beginning chase scene. Just how is this overlooked?

While I am no prude, the film was pretty much ruined for me by the use of the F word every other sentence. Gratutious use of the word has ruined many a film making effort, this is one more example. Seems every other word was this profanity. Grow up film makers, you can have an honest, action packed film without cussing a blue streak evert 3 minutes.
Love a little R 'n R aka Ryan Reynolds so this was a perfect little movie to watch. Full of action with a little comedy

Interesting plot, hence 2 stars instead of just one. The editing is so bad that it ruins the movie completely. The characters are ridiculously writen. If you like MTV-like cutting, an obscene amount of product placement and an epileptic cameraman, then this is the movie for you.

Twenty Minutes into the movie and I was already thinking is this scene ever going end. It felt like forever. Like Batman and Iron Man, One (Ryan Reynolds) is that rich guy who wants to put away extremely evil people. Only he does this with the help of 5 agents and they are all considered dead totally off the grid. Unfortunately, the characters aren't that memorable or interesting enough with small glimpses of their past. But they Are people who wanna do good in the world. The scenes were fully action packed to the point where u really can't focus ur eyes on one particular fight or shot. It's a little all over the place. One part of the story seemed very much inspired by the Fall of Saddam Hussain. So originality isn't really big in this movie . But one thing is for sure - the. Soundtrack is absolutely perfect. Watching this movie once is enough , rewatchable? Don't think so but if you love action then yes. Towards the end of the movie I liked how it was closed down with a little narration from one, I felt goosies for some reason .

Yet another dumpster fire.
Ryan Renolds plays Wade Wilson, or as he is called here 1. I really do not understand the appeal of Ryan, every caracter he plays is the same. Same as in this movie.
The editing is done sloppy, no story, mediocre acting, slow motion where it is not needed.This movie is a mess, id love to share more but i didnt finish watching because it was utter crap. Save yourself some money and go see something fun.

I finished Green lantern and R. I. P. D but couldn't get through more than 40 minutes of this garbage fire at an abortion clinic of a "film". It seems like excessive cocaine use is once again prolific with the decision makers in Hollywood.
Couldn't even watch 5 minutes without the amount of cringe. Acting is a joke. Another Hollywood forced action movie with a bunch of below-par actors & a trash storyline
It's like Bad Boys and mission impossible had a love child!

reviews.review_title: I almost turned it off... But instead, enjoyed it right to the end.
reviews.content: As you might have gathered elsewhere, this film is very Michael Bay. The opening scene almost felt like a Bond parody and I found myself eye rolling as cars began to inexplicably explode tens of feet into the air and across the screen. Reaching for the control to swtich it off I realised that accompanying the stupidity was an uncharacteristic amount of gore and goofy humour for a Bay film. Intrigued, I continued watching and found myself starting to laugh and enjoy the over the top madness as it became clear that this wasn't a Bond parody, it was Michael Bay parodying himself to some extent with lots of Hollywood references giving it a familiar feel.Some of the cuts are jarring, the whole thing is predictable and it comes with a good helping of cheese. All of which become thoroughly enjoyable when you realise this film doesn't take itself too seriously, and neither should you.
This has all the jokes and comedy of Deadpool plus the action movie errors of any Michael Bay film. Get over the mistakes and errors and just enjoy the movie for the entertainment.

If you enjoy this piece of $¥#* you probably have the same number of brain cells that M.Bay possesses it really is a pile of horse manure not funny not suspenseful not exciting no good pure drivel words cant explain how bad this is.

reviews.review_title: 4 stars for the cast trying to make a film
reviews.content:
Why is michael bay still allowed to make movies?
Why is michael bay still allowed to make movies?
Why is michael bay still allowed to make movies?
Apparently my review was too short.

When movies are created, they typically have a goal. Is the movie going to win awards? Is it strictly a balls to the wall action film that's filled with fun?I don't care what all the arm chair film directors on here say, the movie was fun to watch. There was lots of action, plenty of humor, and a great ending.I didn't spit out my drink when some scene didn't flow right. I just sat back & enjoyed myself. That's why I watch movies. But anyways...Ryan Reynolds was his usual self. Cracking some jokes but kicking ass too. I thought the cast was actually pretty good. The ending was priceless. Who wouldn't want to see a scumbag get dumped in the middle of a town he destroyed with his terrible actions? Good for those people for beating the heck out of him. Now that's what I call justice.There was a nice blend of technology, gun fights, car chases & explosions. Like another reviewer said, it's a good Friday night film.

Story line is very fast.
Action is superv.
Overall is time pass

I felt like I went to a fancy restaurant, with fancy ambiance, fancy staff, fancy cutlery, however the food was disappointing, I kept hoping that it will get better along the way but it didn't. It felt like a restaurant serving food did not feel that food was important, everything else was.

I understand the need for humor in the Deadpool like action scenes, but the forced humor in between is just bad. The not so subtle 20 minute Alfa Romeo commercial killed a cool scene. Got kinda bored after an hour.
You get 4, that could have easily been a 7 movie.
Guys, seriously, don't expect any kind of a major story line. Just lay back, eat your popcorn and enjoy the endless blasts & laughs (TM).
This movie was supposed to be over the top and a fun thrill ride. And it was! It was awesome! Enjoy!
Action packed from start to finish and funny. I will definitely be watching this again and again. I hope they make a sequel.

What we have in this movie?Car chasing (check)Patriotism (check)Guns (check)Betrayal (check)Tyran and bad guys (check)Blood (check)Sex (check)And goodwill wins (check)And Ryan Reynolds.This sum seems like a good combination.But, ENOUGH IS ENOUGH!Building the movie on this won't work anymore. People fed up of this already.

reviews.review_title: Very fun, adrenaline inducing movie, as expected.
reviews.content: I quite liked this movie. The story is a bit confusing as it bounces back and forth between the present and past for each character. Am I the only one who thought Ryan Reynolds girlfriend and The Doctor were the same person? They cast extremely similar looking actresses for those parts. But all in all, a fast paced, explosive movie as one would expect from Michael Bay with plenty of humor one would expect from Reynolds.

reviews.review_title: I would have gave it an 8 but...
reviews.content: The score to this movie is awful. It's like a 14 year old pubescent boy put his top 40 spotify playlist to work. And a lot of the action scenes go on for far too long. Better editing is really what this film needed
Is is a masterpiece of how to turn a ugly stuff into an desirable beauty. I ended up cooking and cleaning while watching it. next time, i'll put some good music or take a book instead.

This isn't highbrow, but there are plenty of films like that out there.This is typical Bay, glossy, quick editing, sassy script with throw away one liners, Charismatic lead and pure fun and action. A fun car chase to start, various set pieces in the middle and ending with a scene on a boat that is magnetising.Plot was simple but sometimes you want that. Turn your brain off and watch Bay having fun.

Only made it to 3 stars as the car chases must have taken a lot of effort - pity they didn't spend the same effort on the script.6 underground? - well the film died in the first 30 minutes and couldn't be revived...

He does it again. Quick edits to make action scenes seem more intense, added with shaky cam to make the scenes difficult to focus on. Explosions wherever he can fit them. A basically non existent story. I gave it 3 stars cause as a Ryan Reynolds fan its nice to see Van Wilder graduated college to become an action hero, and Ron Funches appearing. Why Michael Bay thinks the camera needs to shake during scenes of dialogue or pans and zooms, I just don't get. He has such potential to make actual blockbusters cause his visions are so grand but... another wasted investment from Netflix.

Just imagine Jeff Goldblum staring at a massive pile of Dino poo, that right there is Suicide Squad, now imagine an even bigger pile of Dino poo beyond, that is 6 Underground and boy is it stinking hot.This is everything bad about Michael Bay and much more. I thought it would be bad from seeing the trailers. But like normal bad, not bad bad. Not this bad. Firstly the writing is atrocious. The dialogue is cringeworthy and lazy. The story is simple but at the same time all over the place. The bad guy is...well...who the hell is he? He is so forgettable and one dimensional. He does nothing but have a couple scenes of bad guy talk, looking very constipated and bald. The main protagonists are equally forgettable, they have very little character to them, you can't tell them apart. I didn't care if any of them died, or whether they met their mother, or got the girl. I found myself being a neutral, I wasn't supporting anyone to win because I wasn't given a reason to.This film is so far up its own bum thinking their actors have chemistry that they think it would be great to have them almost improvise comedy one liners at every turn. THERE IS NO CHEMISTRY. Not even a smidge. The "comedy" they try to implement is eye-rolling bad. Ryan Reynolds is Ryan Reynolds, for the 100th time. I mean it works in Deadpool but there's only so many references he can make before it becomes tedious.The editing in this film is the worst I've seen in years. We go between past and present so much in the first act they actually had me confused at one point as to where we were. We're in the past - ok now we're in the present - a couple scenes later... Reynolds "and now you're all caught up" (TITLE) "The Present"...WTF? This and jump cuts every 10 seconds, shaky cam, chase scenes are poorly done, they show the hero do some cool stunt and get away but the next shot there's a bad guy right behind them. Even though there is so much happening on the screen I was still getting bored.One specific complaint I have with the laziness of this story is the revolt scene. So a guy speaks on camera to try and inspire a troubled nation who has been mistreated by a dictator, he literally speaks for no more than 30 seconds and says "we need to start a revolution" at the end. THE VERY NEXT SHOT is of people protesting in the streets with some crappy pop song going on in the background. How did we get to there? This dude says a couple of lines and he's all of a sudden started, what looks like, a full scale civil war. People have torches and weapons and are attacking armed soldiers no more than a minute after we saw them everyone just going about their daily business. Who wrote, directed and then edited this and thought, "oh yes this makes a lot of sense, it definitely doesn't feel like we've cut a million corners just so we move the story along". I honestly started to laugh because it made no sense.I really am tired of Michael Bay. He can't make an actually decent action movie. This is $150 million down the drain. That could have been used for a nice charitable donation this Christmas, or at least used to make a good standard action flick. But instead it feels like a present given to naughty kids to teach them a lesson.In short, you have no reason to watch this movie, its bad at every turn. Nothing from this film has made me feel like I spent the last 2 hours wisely. Best you lot miss this and enjoy Christmas. Now I'm going to drink till my memory of this starts to fade.
Great action, fantastic car chase and a very entertaining movie. Hoping there's a sequel or string of these. Good chemistey between the team members and some funny one liners. I give it a thumbs up.

This is one of the greatest action movies i have seen in years. I don't get what's wrong with the reviews lately , especially the so called "professional" ones.They praise b movies and series and downgrade movies like that.It is noticeable that so much effort was made to make this movie work. The action scenes, stunts, camera movements, act. The scene with the magnets is a visual masterpiece. And overall, every scene is full with details.

reviews.review_title: Action, Adventure, Humor. Typical Ryan Reynolds
reviews.content: I loved this movie. Plenty of action, drama, and suspense with a very diverse cast. I was surprised to see a star actor die in scene one though. Although Ryan Reynolds always brings humor he has a great talent to be serious when needed in most of his movies. I can watch this movie over and over: adventure, humor, action, constant movie, and intrigue for a non-fiction movie. Oh, and the music is pretty cool. It's always in sync with the events in the movie.

reviews.review_title: Quite possibly the most confusing thing I've ever attempted to like
reviews.content: ...and I failed, miserably.I have no idea how something with so many explosions, car chases, sex scenes, and gunfights could possibly manage to be so boring, but here we are. Not even Ryan Reynolds could save it.

Got a couple of hours then go for it despite continuity errors through the 1st act (car chase scenes ) but overall a good explosions,car chases,gunfights and a flimsy storyline but enjoyable
Love it

The action scenes are marvelous. I mean seriousy, the movie is all about crazy action scenes, clever ideas, and a lot of explosions. And it that, it's great.The propaganda is pathetic. I think a lot of people will see it and say "Oh, no, not again". Because we've seen it in movies, we've seen it in real life and let's just say we know enough on this.I have some issues with the character Ryan Reynolds is playing. I think I liked him more in the final part where he revealed himself as a tech genious. I guess he was too serious in the first part, which simply doesn't work for him. Also, I didn't get why Number 4 had a British accent, when a Russian one would work so much better for the character.Finally, the story starts super big and promising, but in the end, it's just one heist. So that disappoints too. But as a whole, the movie is very good visually, it's also very funny, so yeah, I recommend.

Did not enjoy anything about this movie. Like the previous reviews mentioned, bad editing. Ryan Reynold's usual humor was there but not quite. Soundtrack was awful and just a noisy mess of action scene after awful action scene.

reviews.review_title: Terrible music and contradicting plot aside it's fun at least
reviews.content: Turn your brain off Michael Bay is going to drop everything on your face. The characters have some depth if all their moralising is thrown away when they hit and kill pedestrians and blow everything up to get one dictator. Revolution sponsored by a Rum company not as much product placement as many Bay films but it is funny when Studios do movies about Revolutions whilst they sponsor companies. They're are pretty women and Ryan Reynolds is a parody of himself at this point. some plot holes We are ghosts, yet the billionaire that says this is photographed and the doctor has photos and a file pretty terrible ghosts really The story has terrible modern music soundtrack that sounds like everything else in dance and electro hip hop right out of fast and furious I half expected Vin Diesel to pop talking about "We're family" but they have that in the plot which is amusing. It's mindless enjoyable forgettable crap full of slow
It's Bay, a car crashes witch a kiosk and it explotes

reviews.review_title: Ryan Reynolds is the absolute star of the show
reviews.content: I mean at this point it's generally to be expected but Ryan Reynolds is amazing. He is capable of seamlessly mixing intensity, humor, and action without detracting from any of them. This is one of the best movies you will see all year, and it's not just an action movie. It's a comedy, and it also has political tones without bashing any particular side. In fact that it could pretty much be argued that it bashas both sides of the American political spectrum, and at the same time shows the positives that each side has. If you want depth there's plenty to be had, if you're just looking for some mindless action it's got that too. If you're looking for a good laugh well it's Ryan Reynolds so you can't go wrong.

reviews.review_title: Bad script and annoying camera moves
reviews.content: The story itself is stupid, the camera have some problem to stabilize images during the movie. Too many pan and slide camera moves. Another movie with lots of explosions and gun shots. Actors overall are bad. Cheap jokes and an empty dialogs. Really sad to spend my time with this movie. Seems to be another dumb expensive movie that is not able to surprise us with a good story.

reviews.review_title: A slightly entertaining Michael Bay mess!
reviews.content:
On a positive note, the first 30 minutes are really entertaining. The car chase through Florence and the death scenes are fun.
For this period, you actually believe Bay can make a good adult action film with plenty of humour, blood, gore and swearing.
But it's a false sense of security, believe me!
It then just turns into an absolute mess, flicking forward then back, poor character story telling and the usual Bay explosions and film angles. It's all been done and seen before.
I think Bay was given a really good script, he created an ok cast and was then given full creative license to do what he wants and he does, just badly.

Anybody having any high brow ideas forget it.You know what to expect from the outset, so why complain and bemoan this movie really is beyond me.Admittedly it gets a bit jumbled in places, trying to keep the momentum going, it does show, yet we are treated to a big budget Netflix action extravaganza.It was a fun movie, utterly ridiculous and has Ryan Reynolds being his usual self. Rest of the cast perform just as well and we have explosions, gunplay and car chases. I think this covers it all, so why he disappointed?Personally, I do enjoy Mr. Bay's movies, because I know my brain can be parked in the other room and be treated to seeing millions of dollars going up in smoke and CGI...all in the name of entertainment...awesome!If you enjoy no brain action movies and Ryan Reynolds, for any reason you choose, then this is well worth the run time of almost two hours and ten mins.Come on, say it after me........
Michael Baaaaaay.

reviews.review_title: Lol No Story? Add more exploding cars
reviews.content: Michael Bay so yeah I knew what I was getting into but hold up it was so horrid terrible editing and void of a plot. They should have learnt from the F&F / Transformer franchise that people are tired of explosions and roll over cars. But yeah team USA goes to exotic location and kicks ass & wrecks havoc is the gist.
If you like action movies, you'll like this one. Funny and entertaining.
Too many lines. I couldn't stand watching it. The story is not very clear.
Great cast, great action and great production quality. The plot is okay but a bit simple.
Fantastic action. 9 ir 10 but story what there is, is hard to follow 4 or 5. Not sure if it's writers or editors that detract the most.

Very good movie. Comedic points had us laughing while stuck to our seats wondering what was happening next. Great action sequences. Great plot great car chase scenes, you develope relationship with each character
I've never seen such worst editing. The whole movie looks like broken clips from slomo YouTube channel. Storyline is needed up.

reviews.review_title: What is going on? Was I the only one so confused?
reviews.content: I think for everyone Michael Bay movies have always been a mixed bag. When I go into a Michael Bay movie I at least want to see fun action scenes that are well directed, like the Transformers movies. This movie doesn't even give me that, the action is just mediocre. And this whole movie, I honestly had no idea what was going on. The cuts are so choppy and editing is poor. So many time jumps from past to present. I wanted an enjoyable movie that I can go back on and actually watch again, like a Transformers or Bad Boys. But this movie I don't see myself watching again even for entertainment. I guess for some people you can watch this just for fun and I can see that. Overall I was disappointed in this movie because I was hoping Bay would surprise a lot of people.
This was a good movie with the right mix of characters and lead by Ryan Reynolds. Thank you, bring more..

Good film with plenty of action and humour but quite a lot of inconsistent effects such as the dayglo green alfa at the beginning has damage in one scene then no damage in the next, shame really as its a large budget film just kind of let's it down.

I started to watch this while getting my hair done, then went home and finished it out of curiosity.
Honestly, just felt like another one of those Netflix action movies that isn't super low budget but tries too hard to seem like it's part of a huge film franchise. Throw in some attractive stars, explosions, sex, violence, one-liners, and a pinch of a simple plot. There you have it. All the ingredients for your typical Netflix action comedy. To be honest, I shouldn't be surprised since it's a Michael Bay film. This reeks of his usual male gaze action movie stench.
One other little gripe: I'm getting a bit tired of Ryan Reynolds playing the quippy main action guy. He sounds like Deadpool in every film now.Is it a terrible film?
Not really. Just too on brand. Perfect for when you have no clue what to watch though.

reviews.review_title: Kind of dumb,but cool entertaining action scenes
reviews.content:
Yeah,plot is this,its mostly shallow ,but its damn entertaining. I like any movie which keep you engaged without a boring moment. Don't expect much just enjoy the cool action scenes.
The opening car chase scene itself will get you hooked which would make you like the movie all the way through. Sometimes it appears to be disjointed but the quirky funny dialogues make up for it.
It's one of those movies where you have to shut down your brain to enjoy mindless fun.

reviews.review_title: THE HELL DID I JUST WATCH !
reviews.content: I added the two stars just for the stunts and vfx....what bothers the heck out of me that micheal bay have always had all what it takes to make a hell of a movie...starting from transformers and every time....EVERY DAMN TIME...he delivers this piece of trash paced , Trash written , full of non logical explosions CRAPPY MOVIE...and seriously enough with fire sparks !...the movie is poorly edited , the plot doesnt just have holes...the plot is a hole....wouldn't recommend it at all !

I can't say this movie is bad, but more can't say this movie is great.
Fun and entertaining with the Reynold's style.
What we will see is just a lucky, smart, limitless money, and super technology on the 6's side. But a super weak is the only thing I can see on the enemy's side.After all, we can enjoy it as an entertainment show, or I can say a "theme park" genre movie.
Senseless vulgarity, senseless plot (being generous), senseless sex scenes blended with senseless violence, and senseless senselessness. Unrealistic everything. Over the top crap. Pure garbage...

If there are bad people out there in the world, just kill them and everything is getting better. As you mostly are not able to do that alone if it comes up to kill a very important person, create a team to get this job done. - That's all you need to know about the story ;)So this is a typical Michael Bay flick, don't take it so serious. Wild chases, lot of explosions, very bloody shootouts with some hard gore effects, little sexy ass and of course a various number of oneliners from Ryan Reynolds which are misplayed most of the time so it was not really funny to me.The car chase at the beginning is really long and i felt bored after a while, but the movie is getting much better from action perspective in the second half, so switch off your brain and enjoy the attrition warfare.Cheers,
Fletcher

I wanted to love it, but could only make it about 20 minutes in before my cringe factor made me give up.
If you like Bayhem then you may enjoy this, if you can ignore blatant continuity errors then you may have fun, if you can ignore bad writing and things that make no sense then have at it!

Ryan Reynolds holds the movie with his amazing style. I am deducting a star just because of the editers of this movie.
Otherwise a must watch movie if you like action, crime...

I'll leave out the non-existing plot, which has been mentioned enough already. I'm a dialog guy - there might be no effects, but if the dialogs are good I'm in. In this movie the lines are so absurd I don't even know where to start. The jokes aren't funny at all, characters with no depth... The list goes on and on. Anyway, to me the worst by far was the method used to pay for the movie. It's a continuous brand advertising inside of every scene: energetic drinks, alcohol, watches, hotel resorts... it's disgusting and completely irrelevant - those close-ups of the brand labels are so obvious and out of place! I hope this is not the trend that upcoming movies will follow, because it's gonna be the end of good movies as we know them.

reviews.review_title: Wasted Potential for Such an Interesting Premise
reviews.content: Plot writing was terrible and messy. For a dumb flick action movie, this movie is really hard to follow. The main problem is the way they edited the movie. It's definitely feel like watching Guy Ritchie's King Arthur movie all over again. The pacing was terrible. At some point I feel like this movie doesn't know what it wants to be. The dialogue was written terribly. Whoever wrote the script really having a coke out while writing the whole script.The cast performance was good. Ryan Reynolds is Ryan Reynolds. Melanie Laurent definitely the best thing in this movie. As for the others,they also quite good but I was so sad that the movie doesnt explore their chemistry in this movie.The action sequence was good. It's what you expect from Michael Bay. Full of explosion and lot of posing. My favorite will be the Italy car chase scene.Overall, this movie isn't good and it isn't bad either. The movie just waste a lot of potential that we want to see.

reviews.review_title: It's the most Michael Bay movie in the Michael Bay oeuvre
reviews.content: Though I don't have epilepsy I had a seizure watching this movie. To be fair I knew it was going to be awful. Bay movies are perfect when you're too tired to think about a real movie. Also I wanted to test my new surround sound system. I understand it's one of the most successful movies on Netflix. This tells you all you need to know about the mankind.
Wow... Michael Bay managed to create a totally unlikable Ryan Reynolds character. That's quite the feat! I didn't think that was possible.

reviews.review_title: Wanna get high watching a movie? You'll get one here.
reviews.content: Seriously, I don't have any idea what movie is this until I watch it halfway with all the physic defying moment with crash & unlimited explosion, only I realised it was directed by Michael Bay! Grab a large popcorn!

reviews.review_title: There's no depth to the film.
reviews.content: This movie is confusing and I was disappointed. You get a sense of this whilst watching the trailer. Very poor film.

reviews.review_title: Every bit Mission Impossible , but Michael bay style
reviews.content:
This , make no mistake is a Michael Bay film.
This is for the child in you , it's for satiating the unquenching hunger of explosions , car chases and gun fights - all the while having great back ground music.So there you go it's both complement and complaint. While this is a typical Bay film , this is no award winning Nolan movie.There is plenty of fast cars , witty comebacks , automatic gunfire , melee combat and tons of style in this movie. Don't expect compelling story telling or hidden morals in here , because there isn't one.Michael bay makes no mistake - his focus is entertaining the guy in front of the screen and he succeeds in doing that. There are no unnecessary BS.And yeah , I ABSOLUTELY LOVE his choice of background music. Whoa , what a great choice of music.A thoroughly entertaining movie. Don't expect much and you will be ok.

What do you want from an action film? Explosions? Many. Car chases? Got 'em. One liners? Check.It also has zip lines, parkour, boats and some great music choices. The cast seem like they had fun with this one and if you sit back and put your feet up it's an enjoyable watch.

reviews.review_title: Well its a Michael Bay movie, what do u expect
reviews.content: This move is basically just made up of different Heist Missions from the video game GTA 5 played after each other without something clear storywise to connect them all together.To top all of this off Michael Bay tries to make every scene look as cool as possible by having the movie play in Slow Motion every chance it getsThere is def a deeper story there but the movie only scratches on the surface and instead wants to imprese the aduience by what are supposed to be funny one liners and showing cool stunts and blowing up as much as possibleIt feels abit unclear if this movie is just somekind of parody or not because it feels like it at times even tho it doesnt say its a comedy movie on the IMDB PageIf your looking for something cool to have on in the background while youre doing something else then this is the movie youre looking for
This film won't be winning any Oscars but it so fun to watch and looks extremely good is 4k. Watch it, turn your brain of and enjoy.
25mins in and I'm really not sure what's going on.......It's Transformers without the big shiny robots.As an AV showcase, it looks good and my Atmos setup is thanking me for the workout.

reviews.review_title: Award nominations for stunts and hair/make-up
reviews.content: It is a Bay movie, judge it as flashy escapism not high art

reviews.review_title: First i gave it ONE star then in the end i changed till FIVE stars.
reviews.content: In the end the movie is OK. Deserves solid 5. A bit too much deadpool jokes. its already all seen, so jokes are boring, from start till end...

reviews.review_title: You Want Action and Laughs. You Got it!
reviews.content:
I guess this is gonna go down as one of those Marmite films. You'll either love it or hate it!
I personally loved it. And in terms of stunts it was groundbreaking. Kudos to Netflix for making this and boo to all the snobs that slated this film. What did they expect from an action film a heartwarming storyline where the American guy saves the world!? Well tough. An American guy only saved a country this time!!

I dont really understand what problem does people have with Michael Bay. The guy is a good director and makes decent and sometimes great action movies.This one is full of action, all characters play their part and this movie doesnt seem to slow down ever, keeps you in bind.I feel the plot was nice, action was superb, acting was good and direction was really great. All praises from me and i really feel there should be a sequel too.

Really, don't. Do not waste your time.I say that, I got about half an hour in before turning it off. I knew when it was Ryan Reynolds, and a Michael Bay film, it'd be silly, but this is just a mess. That said, in that half an hour I picked up on more continuity errors than we'd had witty one-liners so the cons far outweigh the pros with this one.The first 20 minutes, (not an exaggeration) is pretty much solely a car chase. A very, OTT car chase at that where we, the viewer have little clue who is chasing them and why. But of course, it's Michael Bay so there's just hundreds of seemingly very strategically placed goons to crash into and blow up spectacularly.The story itself makes a bit of sense but the way it's told, it's all over the place. So many flashbacks, and when Dave Franco's character dies, (which honestly, in the first half hour, for an actor of his stature is a bit of a travesty) you've not even got to his back story yet so, what's the point. You've not had time to care about his character.And that's just it. You don't care about the characters. It's not even, 'put it on to catch some good humour and explosions', it's too frustrating a watch to even do that.Avoid.

First I am a fan of Ryan Reynolds action / comedy style in his movies ( deadpool, green lantern...) But in this one it feels like he is trying too hard and missing to be funny.Adding to that, the movie feels like, well, a two hours of a fragrance advertisement, you know music and cool phrases about meaning of life.Too many moments feel like advertisement moments in this movie disturbing the continuity of the narrative.Other type of distributive short clips were like tik Tok videos with a loud music focusing on one actor doing some kind of stunt car chase or jumping from buildings.Maybe the movie is aimed at the tiktok Instagram generation that likes 1 minute clips after another with no link between them.If you are looking for a story or even a consistent narrative please avoid this so called movie.

Michael Bay and Ryan Reynolds pull off a brilliant two hour TV commercial for anything from Alfa Romeo to Bacardi, Red Bull and of course Reynolds' own Aviation Gin. On the plus side, it was free* on Netflix. On the minus side, it felt more like a phoned in caricature of Michael Bay action films and Ryan Reynolds' self aware script delivery.
It's an Xtreme Action film with Ryan Reynolds. That Xplains it all... not even a good one at that. But then, I don't enjoy the genre. I lost interest after an hour.
Disconnecting and confusing? Come on! It's no purpose, straight forward full of sh.t. As You would expect from Bay. Funny and extremely entertaining.

I knew that this movie would have sucked the day i saw the green alpha romeo driving through my town in the morning, forcing me to change (every morning for a month) my route to work. As usual Michael Bay delivers empty movies full of action. The action is good, the ain't anything else though, you could literally watch the movie in a language you don't understand and wouldn't miss anything important, since all that matters are the boom-booms. Nice boom booms Bay, crazy how people is willing to pay you and your huge crew to make these movies! But it works i guess.

I went into this anticipating a decent enough action movie with a few laughs...How did it manage to fall flat?Fast camera, a bit chaotic at times, just enough that the plot dwindles in and out.
No opportunity to get interested in the story.Good job Ryan.
I finished this movie in 6 sittings...it was rather painful. A lot happening but not enough to hold my attention. It looked like it should have been cool but it never quite got there for me.

150Million Dollars.
Was it worth Netflix's money... absolutely no way!This movie is full of carnage and explosions.
The quick edits did my head in!
Seen it all before, entertaining at times though and great scenary,which is my biggest positive.This definitely no great action movie as one review stated, far,far from it.A forgettable movie but worth a watch.

It's a bad bar bad, fast and furious film.. and the fast and the Furious are already bad films...Horrible editing an over use of slow motion and fast cuts. cars being distroyed and then fine in the next scene cringy one liners, terrible story, awful jokes.Ryan Reynolds plays himself very well in this I must say. Everyone else is trying to act like him as well.What's good? The action and the gore is pretty good.Forgettable and pointless.

It's like Transformers without the Transformers, it's like Deadpool with just his mouth and other people doing his dirty work!!! What an awesome film to pop up out of nowhere instead of all the tailored films that show all the best bits for months and just end up dismall!! Entertainment from start to finish, well done Mr Bay, fingers crossed for a sequel.
I know micheal bay has been criticized in the past but I had such a blast with this movie, dont think to much just let it be you will enjoy it. loved it honestly

A sit down and just enjoy the action. The point chase is graphic but brilliant taking I fill action to a new level. The story is good a bit Batman like grabbing his most friends to fight for good.
I look forward to seeing another few like this :-).

A film that should've been good. Relatively good casting, big name director on board and big budget, But poor script let it down.....just became confusing and hard to follow! Typical Micheal bay directing....lots of colour, explosions and sparkles! I lost interest after about an hour......I wanted this film to be good but ended up disappointed!

reviews.review_title: All Filler. All Fluff, and No Substance.
reviews.content: Watched this movie or attempted to, but about an hour in, I was jarred and left disappointed with how much of a hot mess this movie is. The 1st 30 mins of this movie was good especially the chemistry between Reynolds and Franco but that was short lived when Franco's character exited. You have a really talented group of actors in this picture and Corey Hawkins, whose acting is left with mediocrity, and I'm left scratching my heading - asking how did it go so bad. Then I remember that Michael Bay directed this movie. This movie had ingredients of a really fun, fast paced, and character driven movie but all we're left with is overdramatic explosions, car chases, and head scratching deaths. The movie stops and restarts itself with too many interludes of characters' backstory that just become unnecessary word vomit. This is probably the worst Ryan Reynolds movie since Green Lantern and Michael Bay's worst movie since Transformers 2. Again, it's extremely disappointing because this movie had all the makings of a really great movie - story concept, actors, and locations but was poorly executed by a has been director and third rate editing team. When will Bay learn that more is less and that characters are more if you invest 100 percent into them.

Michaels Bays 'cinematic language' is highly recognisable and I like that. He is amazing with scene choreography and visuals he creates in movies, this is visually stunning and filmed extremely well. The plot is ok I suppose. For myself personally Ryan Reynolds ruined it, he's just the same irritating, quick mouth Ryan he always plays. But if you're a fan of Ryan's, you will go nuts over this movie.
Michael Bay please stop Go make TV commercial or something like that.....

reviews.review_title: I've said it before, I'll say it again.
reviews.content: After 40 years of watching movies, I have come to this calculation.In the 80's you got to see a great movie 5 to 6 times a year.In the 90's you got to see a great movie 3 to 4 times a year.In the 00's you got to see a great movie 1 to 2 times a year.in the 10's you were lucky to see a great movie every 2 to 3 years.Now you have to accept, you will probably never see a great movie again.So in conclusion of these findings, it is time to be more productive with these wasted hours. Buy yourself a telescope and have a look at the Universe, and see if you can solve that mystery or count the blades of grass in your garden, whatever floats your boat. Good luck.

If you take all of the worst camera angles and colors from Transformers and Bad Boys, add in some Go-Pro parkour scenes, and insert Muse into every blank space, you've got 6 Underground. There are redeeming factors: there are lots of other movie Easter eggs and references, and Ryan Reynolds saves some otherwise tough-sell scenes with his humor, but this was otherwise a parody and I can't tell if it meant to be or not.

reviews.review_title: This Is the Kind of Garbage Scorsese Was Talking Aboutlopment, n
reviews.content:
When Martin Scorsese said the Marvel Universe films were "closer to theme parks than they are to movies as I've known and loved them throughout my life, and that in the end, I don't think they're cinema," this is the type of nonsense he might haver had in mind. Viewers are "treated" to a mindless, wild, crash filled, shoot-em-up in the city of Florence, Italy, somehow managing to drive their car all over town, including into a third floor chamber and all around a major museum, somehow never going near stairs.
The camera work throughout the film is music video or first person shooter unnecessary. Lots of stunts but character development. Just bullets,bombs, crashes, a bit of sex, blood, executions, explosions, zoom, bang, pow.
I sincerely hope the producers paid the city of Florence at least $10 million for the time this film shoot disrupted their city.
An incredibly waste of time and money.

I couldn't make it past the first ten minutes. The action and violence is over the top even for Michael Bay. The "dialogue" is eye-rollingly terrible. Maybe the plot is decent but I will never know. Still, Reynolds finds a way to be semi-amusing in spite of it all.

It was surprisingly entertaining first watch. I didn't know it was a Bay movie, wouldn't have watched if i knew.
But we had fun and was happy we saw it.
But when you start to think about it..
you realize it's quite a stupid movie. But I don't think they are looking for an Oscar here so don't think too much and enjoy. :)

reviews.review_title: It is a glorious action movie
reviews.content: Michael Bay has a style of movie making that is both great and far more complex than people give him credit for, you cannot critique a thriller for being thrilling or a comedy for being funny. His movies are unqiue and his own style, it is a Michael Bay movie, so do not watch it expecting anything else.What I will say though is that this movie is also a step in a beautifully entertaining direction, it is hilariously scripted, action packed and is an emotionally driven film that leads on to the potential for a whole series of films that topple even the great fast and furious franchise. Due to the varied perspective that Michael Bay has applied to this film it shows an exciting and up to date use of modern technology and cinematography to create an exhilarating piece of movie art.
Netflix originals getting better by the day. Ryan great performance

reviews.review_title: Great and looking forward for more!
reviews.content:
Great smashing effects, good action with some funny sarcasm and nice cinematography.
A competitor for the Mission Impossible films.
Looking forward to see a sequel.

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie I've Seen This Year
reviews.content: Don't waste your time it's AWFUL.GARBAGE

reviews.review_title: Just does not make any sense
reviews.content:
I just don't understand this movie. Bad acting, bad lines, tons of cliches. The most pathetic part was that magnetic submarine stuff. When did 1 have the chance to make them? How is that those magnets picked up bad people but not good people? Was it a bad people magnet? And why did those magnets work only where we had the camera? So how's that first the magnets worked on the deck, then our heroes went down to the kitchen where things were absolutely calm, cool and collected, then switched on the magnets again and jee, the magnets now affected the kitchen.
Hmmm.
Don't watch this movie above IQ 50.

I'm extremely positive when it comes to movies. I'm totally okay with turning my brain off and enjoying a fun, mindless action movie. This movie is different. It's long, boring, and devoid of substance or anything unique or interesting. God this movie is boring. The characters have absolutely nothing to them, the plot is generic and the action is forgettable. I do not recommend this film unless you're a fan of some of Bay's other lesser films.

reviews.review_title: More than I expected. A fun film.
reviews.content: I was expecting the same old rehash of action flicks, and it was. However, it added something unique to the mix that made it interesting while both predictable and unpredictable at the same time. It kept me zoned in and it's been a long time since a movie had that effect on me. The beginning was a little confusing with the flashbacks, but it pieced together nicely. If you want to be entertained, this is a good movie to watch. If you want to see a film about the "struggle of stepping out of the house," then this is not for you.

reviews.review_title: Its michael bay vision of action movies
reviews.content: To be honest the action scenes were brilliant non stop to thumbs up but I was expecting alot from Ryan Reynolds and his crew during the movie

reviews.review_title: Its Michael Bay what else do you expect
reviews.content: Another Michael Bay movie added to this world. 150 mill production budget still doesnt top Netflixs The Crown. Explosions body dismemberment car chases this one has it all in the Bay film lore. Michael hands the keys over to top notch special FX team just like always. Car chase scene pops almost Italian Job quality. A guys movie so if your Netflix and chilling make sure to watch your movie 1st before this one. For action this is Reynolds most relaxed role. Hes basically riding shotgun in an alpha ramero as Dave Franco drives them through the streets of Italy. Great cinematography with high end camera work. They almost get the cast right Reynolds needing to be the odd man out. Payday needless to say for Reynolds 20 million for a few months of work for the Big Red streaming machine. Other stars to follow suit maybe they get Dwayne Johnson to cave but his freight will command minimum 40 million just to start a conversation. Another home dinger for Netflix
Turned it on for Ryan Reynolds. Turned it off because of the senseless violence and endless chase scenes. Ridiculous excess on every level. A disappointment.

Don't watch for the plot, watch to be entertained. Watch to appreciate the stunt work and beautifully choreographed fight scenes. It's not a Spielberg or Scorsese film, so don't pretend like you are watching for the acting and deep thought-provoking moments. It's fun, fast, and furious. Enjoy it for what it is.

Michael Bay is a Awesome Director, and bring's ton's of Action and Explosive film making. So sit back and just enjoy what the film is for, Fun fun and more fun and you have a great cast. We have Ryan Reynolds. What else is there to say? That the movie is awesome
People leaving this 2 and 3 out og 10 act like they expected this to be the next inception

As with any movie, it should follow some kind of rules or logic. Each movie can provide it's own. But this one makes no sense on any level. It's just a super cut of stunts. It shouldn't even act like it has a plot.
The 2 stars is because the movie is pretty even though parts of that don't even make sense (spies wearing bright colors).
Liked it. Good non stop action film. Ryan Reynolds is always fun to watch!

reviews.review_title: It's a Bay movie what did you expect!!
reviews.content: I feel sorry for people who watch a movie knowing full well the content, director, actors and genre but complain about it. It puts me in mind of the highbrow critics who called Arnies "acting" in Terminator wooden. You go to watch movies like transformer's, bad boys and 6 underground for pure action, corny one liners and high speed car chases and nothing else. If you judge this movie for what it is it is fantastic and delivers on all fronts. If you go to critic acting chops and story line then why bother? It's like watching porn and complaining about the nudity. Pure filthy unadulterated sexy action and because I watched it wanting a good action movie I loved it. If I watched it like the douchebags expecting citizen Kane then I to would have been unimpressed. As an action movies it's a 10. I suspect many of those posting here are the ones who watch TV shows before the watershed pen tightly gripped in hand, sweat beading down their forehead with a semi just waiting for someone to use foul language or show a bit of it so they can exclaim " Martha they did it!! I am going to write the strongest of strongly worded letters to the broadcaster".

Also, Ryan Reynold's narration is too reminiscent of his Deadpool character. I doubt he can shed that anytime soon. All his jokes in this film are far inferior.
One of the five stars I give it is for the pretty awesome computer graphics.
