Car racing in Italie is done befor...but this is better best! Nice characters and last but not least nice technology used all over!!

reviews.review_title: Best film ive seen in 2 years
reviews.content: Amazing action! Funny!! Best film ive seen in 2 years! This is what u call a action film

Sit back and enjoy this movie. Action packed.
Full of entertainment and Ryan Reynolds.

If you cloned Michael Bay, and genetically modified the clone to be female, then mated Michael Bay with the new Michelle Bay, and then imbued the baby with extra Michael Bay powers of explosive drama and edge of your pants excitement...
Then that baby would be this movie.
Lost for words really, dont be fooled into giving this any of your time, it simply isn't worth it.Worst film I've seen in years.

Movie is definitely worth a watch is you're an action fan. Outside of the action there is little to attract other viewers. It's a good action film but no real depth to it. Feels devoid of any reasoning beside the very basic plot line. Standard to most Michael Bay films.

reviews.review_title: What you get when you make a movie on drugs
reviews.content:
This is what happens when the editor is on cocaine OD while working and your camera is stuck to the zoomed-in focal length.
If it was a video clip, I wouldn't mind. Then it would also be over after 3 minutes. But this was a full length movie, where no scene lasted more than half second.
Add this to awful acting, stupid lines, bad humour, no story, and you have a very nice 3/10 movie you should get paid to watch.
The point that the billionaire has faked his death has no effect to the story before and after his death (except that he has - SPOILER ALERT - long hair after).PS. In this world, bullets go only in slow motion

reviews.review_title: Just Action, No Plot, Not Thought, & Mostly Damage.
reviews.content: The way this plot rolled out appeared mostly done to include additional special effect scenes in the movie. And that probably the Plot: Think up a lot of incongruous special effects actions scenes and than use whatever plot line one can come up with to attempt to pull it all together. TWO Stars for Action and zero others. It took me a few minutes to identify what offended me the most in 6 Underground: Supposed Good Guys create incredible collateral damage that kills more people and costs more to clean up after than whatever minimal good they actually accomplish. There can be no net good when you add up all those innocent bystanders mutilated, murdered, and monetarily maimed just so action heroes can feel good about themselves. This is a waste of time, money, and Melanie Laurent. I did not really expect much from Bay or Reynolds so in that regard there was not all that much to lose. Skip this turkey if you want any plot at all in a movie.
I loved it from the beginning to the end, it's a movie that you don't take off a second of it
This film is basically an R rated power rangers and transformers combined, full of cheesy lines and shaky cam

Love this movie. To me it is like Avengers meet Jason Bourne because it is a bunch of people who fake their deaths to gain ability of invisibility and anonymity in order to do what needs to be done to make the world a better place

reviews.review_title: This is just one hot mess.
reviews.content: Another, probably more expensive, bomb form Netflix. The opening action scene clocked in at over 20 minutes. At that point, it seemed that the director had no idea how to actually tell a story. Marked by silly, insincere performances, I made it past the one hour mark when I just couldn't waste my time watching another minute.I'm a huge Ryan Reynolds fan and was very much looking forward to this movie based on the previews. What a letdown.

reviews.review_title: It's poor by Michael Bay's standards. That's Saying something.
reviews.content: I did turn my brain off before watching it. I was eager to watch. I love these kinda movies Reynolds make Action Comedy such as Hitman's bodyguard. I always tolerated Michael Bay movies.So believe me when I tell ya, this movie isn't worth a watch. Honestly you can waste your time on a better bad movie than this. As always the heroin pick is fabulous from Bay. Other than that nothing goes for this movie.It doesn't have logic, it's full of loopholes. Typical Bay.It isn't funny, doesn't have good action. Untypical.It has bright colors & good explosions. Typical.It doesn't have momentum, story's confusing. Untypical.Just don't waste your time on this crap. Except for yellow Bugatti & the yellow dress Andraje wears nothing is good in this film.

reviews.review_title: People rating this 1/2 star are you dumb
reviews.content: This film was full of action and the story line wasn't confusing at all, you must stupid as hell to not follow this movie. Waiting for the next one.

Just saw the first 10 mins and switched it off, that bad. "There's a BMW following us". Err.. that's a Lancia... The Alfa looses it's left mirror, but guess what, after 4 seconds it's back again. And so on... Hollywood, is it really that difficult to produce a movie that actually from begin to end is accurate?

reviews.review_title: This movie should be buried 6 ft. Underground!!!
reviews.content: This is hands down the worst movie I have ever seen. Two hours of my life that I'll never get back and I actually felt dumber after watching this trash!!!

reviews.review_title: What You Have Come To Expect From a Michael Bay Film
reviews.content: If you have ever seen any Michael Bay movie, then you should already know what to expect from this one, lots of action and tons of explosions. This movie looked like it was going to be really good. It had an original idea, it had Ryan Reynolds in it, and it was being produced by Netflix. I truly thought that it had a lot going for it. Unfortunately it was directed by Michael Bay, so there were bound to be some flaws.This is by no means a terrible movie, and I would have to say that it is actually one of Michael Bay's better films (Which isn't saying much) But it did have its fair share of problems. Most of the cast, including Ryan Reynolds, played very unlikable characters that were mostly one dimensional, and several of them had backstories that were very quickly glossed over. Much of the dialogue was very poorly written, and there were numerous attempts at humor, most of which fell flat. The movie was also two hours, which is the typical length of a film these days, but it felt like it was never going to end at times. This movie also did not need to be rated R, but Bay decided that it would be a good idea to insert horror movie levels of gore in to the film. You get to see all sorts of things like corpses with blown off heads, and limbs get ripped off of people, as well as much more. This was completely unnecessary, and it could have easily been PG-13, while still being pretty much the same exact film. The editing and pacing also really dragged the film down, as is the case in most Michael Bay films, as it is very choppy and poorly done, causing the movie to be extremely hard to follow at times.There were a few redeeming qualities to the film however. Overall, the acting was fairly good, with a few exceptions. And of course, as you have come to expect from a Michael Bay film, the action set pieces and special effects were superb, and really made the film worth watching. They weren't just the typical action scenes that you would see in a generic film either, some of them were very clever and have not been done before. They made the film a lot more exciting and engaging, so at least it does a good job at keeping the audiences attention. There were a couple jokes that made me smile at times, but like I said previously, most of them fell pretty flat.This is most definitely a popcorn flick that you should watch with a bunch of your friends on the weekend, and that is what it is meant to be. You are supposed to shut off your brain for two hours and have a good time, and if you can do that, then you will really enjoy this movie. There is a scene in the film that is literally meant to set up potential sequels, and I am interested to see what they end up doing with that if they do decide to make a sequel. They just need to improve on some of those things that I pointed out earlier and they may have something similar to the Fast & Furious franchise on their hands.

When your watching a film and you start having an real-life issue. Firstly. You really struggle to see what's happening in their rate Transformers 2 film, secondly how cheap is Ryan Reynolds? Thirdly where do the holes in bagels go? The bagel I was eating had more delusion, majesticness and story about the absence of its core to this awful action packed mess. Honestly it's that poor. I would rather watch all 200 seasons of The Kardashian than ever see this again.

If you like lots of action and effects with a bit of comedy then this is your film. If you like a decent storyline to go with the action however you'll be sorely disappointed. It was watchable but was lacking.

reviews.review_title: The worst sound in an action movie ever
reviews.content:
To the idiot sound crew:
In a car chase, the sound of cars and choppers have the highest priority, not the opera/music sounds. God knows how much Alfa Romeo paid for this useless sponsorship🙈🙈

reviews.review_title: Extremely entertaining but at a cost
reviews.content: If you thought Micheal Bay could never out-Bay himself well think again. 6 Underground is a thrilling, adrenaline pumping, convoluted, insane, abysmal of a film. It will be the most entertaining, action packed, patriotic, and even sexy film you will see all year, but at the same time it is also a corny, degrading, repulsive cringe-fest. Explosions? Yes. Exotic cars? Yes. Beautiful woman, violence and absolute mayhem? YES, YES, YES. This is why I'm so split on this film. I love it and I hate it. The characters are not all terrible but good acting and writing is not a thing in this film. Some characters are redeeming while some (Skateboard Kid) are annoying enough to make you want to bash your head in a wall. The music choices are horrific, the villain is borderline special needs.. and a scene in the film where a revolution begins felt more like the Pepsi commercial that Kendall Jenner was in some years ago. Overall 5/10 - you won't regret watching it that's for sure

reviews.review_title: Great action scenes but poor storyline
reviews.content: There are some great action scenes well filmed and well acted but the storyline is weak badly thought through and no substance. It is a shame as the filming is good quality but if one isn't 17 years old one gets bored.
Some scenes were really cool but I found myself getting a bit confused about the story sometimes. Also did I miss some of the backstories or what?

reviews.review_title: I made an account to review this POS movie.
reviews.content: I feel like this film was made for people with an attention deficit disorder. In the first few minutes I found myself actually hating the movie. I feel like I usually have patience to see films through... But not this one... The car chase scene starts at around 3 minutes and progressively gets worse. By the 12 minute mark I had to turn off the movie. They over used the slow motion feature, and it feels like the dialogues were poorly written. I don't know what else to say other than, skip this movie and watch something else.

reviews.review_title: About the best film I've seen in age's.
reviews.content:
Excellent action from beginning to end.
Michael Bays done it again.
I'll be watching this film again because there's s that much action you can't take it in in just one viewing.
Aweful! Waste of time! Great filmography! Waste of 2 hours!
Hyped to a big standard, no wonder netflix picked it up as no distributer could see a profit. Europe will like it but RR should really be aiming for better paydays with more respect 😎

reviews.review_title: A cheesy action movie for teenage boys
reviews.content: Everything about this movie screams "show me to immature young men." An entertaining movie, but over the top in every way, especially vulgar sexual references, violence, and pop culture references. Great if that's your thing but if you're expecting a serious action movie then look elsewhere.

reviews.review_title: Great movie for a stay-in movie night
reviews.content: To be honest I found this movie really fun! Every character brings something special to the table. For a Netflix movie this is very well done! Would recommend.

We almost made it to the halfway point. Couldn't take anymore. Just goes to show that high speed chases, lots of gross deaths, and a bad script don't hold attention nor do they make for a good film. The screenplay's feeble attempt at compassion fell totally flat. The first, what? I'm guessing 20 minutes is just crash after crash after hanging eyeball, after the grossest possible shootings. For what? Nope, not watching til the end to find out.The idea had potential. The execution was terrible. Even Ryan Reynolds can't save this.Special effects alone does not a movie make. None of these characters are particularly likable or identifiable.Save time. Skip this one.
I can't believe Reynolds associated himself with this heaping pile of garbage.

I wasn't expecting anything special and I wasn't disappointed.
The film is just fun, that's all. Some good action scenes, lots of CGI.
The plot does jump about a bit which was slightly confusing but all in all it was a good distraction after a hard day at work.

reviews.review_title: Movie was one of the best
reviews.content: This movie was one of the best I haven't seen in awhile.

10 minutes into the movie and I am already annoyed with stupid dialogues , jump cuts, unnecessary slow motion sequence in the car chase / shooting.
Also I don't know it's something I feel or Ryan Ronald's cheesy narrations have become so unfunny and overused. He needs to get out of the Deadpool mode at least for some non Deadpool movies. It's like he has made up this persona and always living the character. Not always works dude.
Another thing which seems common in movies lately is that nothing is serious for even a second. Every scene and dialogue has to be a cheesy one liner and it becomes monotonous. Hobbs and Shaw was also like this continues barrage of insults and forced jokes. Directors have forgotten probably that you some funny scenes need a build up . Everything can't be funny just by sarcasm and cheesy dialogues.

Everyone's a movie critic these days eh?The movie is loads of fun. Oh so graphic and oh so Michael Bay. Anyone who is a true fan of Ryan Reynolds will enjoy this.To all the haters out there...your palms are sweaty, knees weak, arms are heavy. There's vomit on your sweater already, moms spaghetti.

reviews.review_title: It's not as bad as they say, trust me
reviews.content: If you're a big fan of action movies or you're just looking for a really well made movie that you don't need to pay attention that much, you should see it. It's really entertaining and I'd say It's worth a watch.
It has a awesome visuals but without pace and depth

The story is good.... but not one that we haven't seen & heard before. That makes it a bit predictable. But, hey....I like action flicks!
Speaking of action! Lotsa action, lotsa risk,really great car chase at the beginning, and likeable characters and the usual fun banter Ryan Reynolds is so good at. Speaking of the car chase, there were a lot of good shots of car crashes and explosions from different angles and perspectives which is awesome. However, I noticed something in the car crashing and explosions that there were numerous scenes that bodies actually flew up and out and away and bounced off of other things including the pavement and in one scene there was even a charred body lying close to one of the characters on the street after a crash. That was a little too much as far as I'm concerned. I think special affects have gotten really goood over the years without the flying burnt bodies and the films have been great. I know we are seing more graffic stuff....but do we have to?

reviews.review_title: Easy watch loads of action no plot
reviews.content:
The worst attempt at an English accent by Ryan
Not many yanks can do it anyway
The usual high action one liner Hollywood movie

It was messy but somehow classy. Bright colours, beautiful, fierce women, loooots of action, stupid, funny jokes, pinch of love and politics - all mixed up just to sit and watch, relax and don't have our minds stuffed with thinking.

The team work with non profit organization to help the food people.
There are our hero who will do anything to save the life of people with risk on their own life.
All the stunts are really new and unbelievable.
The one thing out of many which surprised was the action and stunts.
They are so real ,people really getting hit via car flying getting hurt means it was so logical.loved the work of all the actors.

Both the wife and I loved the movie. OK we admit the flow was a little broken but the story was good as were the action and special effects. I watched action movies a lot worse than this with a higher score . Michael Bay movies are straight in to it .... Open a beer, sit and enjoy 👌

reviews.review_title: I don't understand why people keep letting Michael Bay make movies...
reviews.content: The movie took me the better part of six hours to watch because I kept walking off to do other things. The first third was standard Bay erratic cuts, explosions and discontinuity which made the story hard to follow and made it difficult to figure out any of the character's motivations.The background for the characters was not well fleshed out, the characters didn't develop well, the story was just flat and trite.

reviews.review_title: Michael bay fan but this left me confused.
reviews.content:
Whilst I enjoyed the action sequences and added humour from Reynolds, some scenes left me confused. I felt like sometimes I didn't know what was going on. I'll blame that on the poor editing.
I'll rate it a 7 as it was enjoyable to watch. The actors are great in it and it's also great to see Ben Hardy making his mark.

reviews.review_title: This should be a TV series
reviews.content: I watched this on Netflix thinking it was a TV series and didn't realize that it ran for 2 hours. But with this in mind, I watched the entire thing feeling like this was the best first episode to a shindig I'd ever seen. The characters were lovable and it would've been really cool to see them fleshed out over a season of episodes. I felt their chemistry together was really well cast and everyone suited their roles. There was definitely a lot of chaotic jump cuts in the editing, but I think that worked in their favour as it is an action movie and must have the feel that something is always happening. But it is definitely a film that fails as a standalone, seeing as it gives a feeling after that it is unfinished and that were was no real big picture that satisfied their purpose. The explosions, chaos and action is all there. Now it just needs a solid story, because the characters are established well.

reviews.review_title: If you don't like action movies don't watch it and definitely don't rate it!
reviews.content: Over 2 hours of pure action. Pure fun. It lets you breath only once after the first 20 min. and then it goes nonstop till the end. It's exactly how a top action movie should be. If you try to find truths in it, it's not for you. Just watch something else...

For a Netflix movie, this sits between 7-8/10. Not you typical action movie that we have seen hundreds of times. Good action scenes and too much fun. Might be losing a point on the bad editing and the little confusing script on the character development.
In general the movie is good, Ryan Reynolds is Ryan Reynolds and the rest of the main cast are absolutely great. Worth watching with a full bag of popcorn and loud sound. Now let's hope for a sequel next year or so.

I didn't know this was a Micheal Bay movie when I started it, then it quickly becomes very apparent. The same old camera work, lens flares, grainy tilted flashback scenes with 1 line bad humour and of course, way too long.
The movie has no substance and is just an absolute waste of time. You will spend every other minute looking at Facebook.
Not worth 2 hours of your life.

Amazing scenaries, rapid cutting and tense action-scenes. A really high-level movie. Why on earth drown it with so bad language? Ok, this is not Shakespear but why maltreat the English language with piling up the word "f-ck" over a hundred times during the film? I grant you, it is sometimes connected with poetic "mother". The business should know better.

reviews.review_title: A good example of "money itself can't make good movies"
