reviews.review_title: Fun, but in no way good
reviews.content: This was a very disappointing movie. I was not at all surprised when I got to the end credits and realised Michael Bay had directed it, I should have guessed from the nonsensical explosions.I wish someone would tell that man that just because a car crashes, does not mean it will blow up in an explosion so big it looks like a bomb went off.There are a few decent action set pieces, but the vehicular ones are offset by distractingly bad crash test dummies being behind the wheels, and the fight scenes are usually offset by so many jump cuts it's like watching Taken.The characters are over the top caricatures, there are no plot twists or subplots, just the one main story that is in the movie description - billionaire recruits team to take down dictator.This is a film that, on paper, seemed really interesting. It had a pretty good cast, a director who, love him or hate him, has spent his career making vast amounts of money by giving people high octane thrill rides, and a bonkers budget of 150 million.Which it often seems like they blew 100 million of shooting the opening scene.It had the action, but it needed a bit of drama, some real build up of interpersonal relationships, to really elevate it. As it was, I didn't care when any of them were in danger because I don't know anything about them.What was disappointing about this movie is that it had the potential to be so much more. It just needed two things that the Fast and Furious have in spades - a sense of fun, and also a relatable sense of purpose. At it's heart, that series is all about family. If this film had a tangible, relatable through line like that, it would have been much better.
If you are looking for an easy going on the intellect sort of film filled with fabulous action, cool photography and some very funny moments then this is your film..I loved it .

In a frenzy to fill subscription services with content to sell subscriptions, productions are become more and more rushed, and with I present 6 Underground as exhibit A as proof.A movie with some potential and certainly the budget has been destroyed with clearly rushed production making it an incomprehensible mess. The cuts are all over the place, character development for people who feel like they should be interesting is shoved in where and if they can, and it feels like some of that development probably ended up on the cutting floor as relationships suddenly develop from no where. The actions scenes are pretty fun in places, although the whole premise of kill one bad buy but don't mind sacrificing dozens of innocents makes literally no logical sense what's so ever, nor does the strange lack of authorities intervening while they are effectively blowing up a city for example. But I can accept it's a Bay action movie and so is not exactly one for reality but even so, the cut of this movie is unforgivable and brings the enjoyment factor down several notches as you don't have any idea why your watching what your watching, however spectacular it is. Dear Hollywood, less is more please.

I honestly can't understand the low rating. I think this deserves a 7.8 on IMDb. I only give it a 9 to boost its current rating, and because and I'll never give anything a 10, because art isn't perfect; it's art. I don't cry during movies, but this one coaxed a few drops out of my dry, un-crying, man-eyes. Said emotions were brought about by an element of emotion I had yet not experienced. When we talk about gas attacks on Facebook, debating left and right, who really did what, whether or not it was a conspiracy and if it really even happened, we forget about the people that are affected; those who die from these attacks. My first exposure to this was, believe it or not, the campaign of the new Modern Warfare. My first exposure didn't really sink in until I sat back and watched the horror, rather than just playing a game. A man, who couldn't give two s**** about others was suddenly thrust into a moment of danger, where man and character are harshly tested. Instead of saving his own skin like so many of us would do, he stood in the midst of the chaos, lethal chemicals raining from the sky, handing out gas masks for people he didn't even know. I, for sure, have been guilty of being a "gung-ho" American. In other words, one who doesn't care about other countries or their peoples, but only for his own country and his own people. After seeing this seen, I remembered my Christianity, a faith I hold so dearly, and the hate disappeared. In its place were tears, tears of the most honest sort. I hate to admit I cried during a movie, but my heart has never gone out to those who suffer more than after watching this movie. Will you have the same experience? Probably not. Besides what it did for me, this movie is truly excellent, and it's sad to see that so many think otherwise. This deserves at least a 7.8, if not a solid 8.That all being said, THIS MOVIE HAS SOME KICKA** ACTION SCENES BABY!!!!!

There are people rating the film with 9 and 10, stating is an excellent film (if you leave your brain at the door). The fact that a movie is a typical explosion-action-jokes based flick, does not mean that it has to be totally senseless, with zero point and character development, and zero script. This is more or less the case for 6 underground. 2 hours of pointless action. Avoid.

When there's Ryan Reynolds i know it's going to be a good movie but this one is disappointing, the scenes are so messy and the events are to fast. Aside from them making the Emirati man a bodyguard they glorified the western overly! It's not them who made the world better.
The movie should of just stuck to being funny, as I couldn't take it serious when it tried to be serious.
It was exciting and humorous all in the right ways! I'm a big time action fan and this kept me thoroughly in suspense! It's worth a watch and as always, Ryan Reynolds is fantasic!

This movie i s entertaining From the start to the end. It's packed with great humor, in the dry style, that Ryan is known for. It's packed with brands, and is a bit hard to follow, due to the scenes in past and present. This is a must see, if your in to action, and can close your eyes to all the errors.

reviews.review_title: My very low expectations set way too high
reviews.content: Ever since Suicide Squad the surest sign of a bad movie is sporadically introducing characters with their own titles and cut scenes. Although this does raise the bar for most stuff wrecked for so little storyline. Even then, the death and destruction is no fun at all. Simply the most mediocre movie I've ever seen. Just avoid it altogether. It's not even worth watching to verify how bad it is.

Only missed out on a 10 due to lack of Ryan Reynolds nude scenes. Genuinely though, really enjoyed this. Dead pool style one liners, lots of action. Yeah it's full of cheese but let's not try and turn it into what it isn't. Movies are for entertainment, are you not entertained?
Pathetic display of explosions sponsored by aviation gin and redbull

reviews.review_title: What a fantastic way to tell an amazing story with great action!!!
reviews.content: I see an average of 6.1 on the reviews. In my opinion that does not do this film any justice at all. It provides a lot of action mixed with a lot of comedy and throws in a splash of romance. It is a fun film I'll be watching again more than once
It's not going to make you guilty free to have latin american and black people on the team when you're still making fun of asians in that old fashioned cameo

What on earth were Michael Bay, Paul Wernick and Rhett Reese thinking. This movie has an interesting storyline that is satisfying if not a little too cliché but it fine, and if it wasn't for the constant jump cuts that were so overdone this movie would have even been okay, instead I felt like I wasissing half the story. Jump cuts are okay to use during intense scenes to provide us with constant information about the action. Instead in this movie there are jump cuts in almost every scene and due to this the dialogue didn't make much sense, I had a hard time actually keeping up with what was happening because it didn't make sense. The dialogue was written awfully aswell, the jokes didn't land probably because half the joke was cut away. This felt like watching a really long trailer more than a film and was a waste of such a great actor like Ryan Reynolds. I do not recommend watching this movie.

reviews.review_title: Deadpool tries to go Bond Franchise meets Michael Bay
reviews.content: Look, the Michael Bay action scene cuts are a bit over tge top for me, but i gotta say; if you like Reynolds as Deadpool, and you like movies like Mission impossible/James Bond, you're gonna like this. If you tone down the over the edge action scenes slightly, and make the storyline a bit more believable, thus would be a perfect action movie for me.

reviews.review_title: Put your mind out and watch
reviews.content: Just in 10 minutes of beginning there is a ton of mistakes
This movie is nothing else but 2 hrs advertisement!

Almost turned it off during the WAY TOO LONG opening car scene. Why? Every other shot, Franco had a hat on driving and the next, no hat. Things like that are annoying and show laziness on part of crew and editing.Just saying, it's not that hard, pick one, make a choice, stick with it. Way too blatant. Michael Bay knows better... so I thought

I don't usually review films but I just can't believe this one was actually made and so much money was wasted on such a bad production. This is so offensive to the human race. It is clear that it was targeted for a certain audience that I won't name but come on, they are not animals. I kept watching it because I thought it was a spoof but people kept taking themselves seriously and doing the most inappropriate/unlogical/non-cultural actions. And seriously, using Abu Dhabi as a background for the capital of a Turkic Country, what a cheat. I hope the Emiraties are not too offended. I would advice not to waste time watching it. This will only bring a bad experience, and memory, in your life.
